jobText: TXT/50591333.txt	§Marketing Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Executive§§Advertiser: §Vanguard 86§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Job description:§  §In the role of marketing executive, you will have a cluster of clients whose digital marketing plans you are responsible. Following the overarching strategic plan, you will take responsibility for the implementation of each month’s activities by:§ § § §Ensuring plans are approved by the client§  § § §Time is booked with digital and creative resources to complete§  § § §Drafts are signed-off internally§  § § §Materials are signed off by the client§  § § §All committed assets are delivered on time§  § § §Campaigns reported on accurately and with value-added commentary§  § §Close and valuable relationships with clients are important as we seek to steer their business’s digital marketing towards agreed financial outcomes. As the marketing executive, you will take ultimate responsibility for ensuring all activities are created on time and to the high standards our clients expect. We must question the value our actions deliver to our client’s business and ensure our efforts are directed at growing their business and not superfluous vanity metrics.§  §This role would suit a junior marketer looking to have hands-on experience at almost every facet of the digital marketing mix. Juggling client priorities, deadlines and overcoming complex problems are daily aspects of this role. Only those willing to challenge themselves and deliver tangible results need apply!§  § §  §Experience Required:§ § § §Graduate or 1-2 years in a similar marketing role§  § § §Copywriting for emails, blogs, brochures and/or web pages in English essential§  § § §Experience on marketing platforms such as Marketo, Pardot, HubSpot desired but not essential§  § § §CIM or Marketing Association marketing qualification favourable but not essential§  § § §Knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite 6 preferred but not essential§  § § §Knowledge of HTML & CSS desirable but not essential§  § § §  §Personal attributes:§ § § §Excellent attention to detail§  § § §Good project management skills absolutely essential§  § § §The ability to work well in a team and semi-autonomously§  § § §Proven ability to deliver projects on time and with good communication§  § § §Task orientated and able to juggle multiple priorities§  § § §People person able to forge personable relationships§  § § §  §About Vanguard 86:§  §We are an equal-opportunities employer based in the heart of New Plymouth. As a multi-award winning digital marketing agency we’re always looking to attract the best and the brightest to complement our talented in-house team. We are a HubSpot Platinum agency (the only one in New Zealand) and a Google Partner, who believes in continuous improvement through the supported development of our staff. From paid time to undertake marketing courses to coaching with international specialists in account management and digital marketing, your development pathway can be supported in multiple ways.§  §Several of the perks of working with us include:§ § § §Flexitime hours§  § § §Bi-weekly team lunches§  § § §Working with a team of like-minded individuals who are each passionate about marketing§  § § §Living and working in Taranaki!§  § §Our goal is to attract the brightest marketing talent to Taranaki and offer a cutting-edge digital marketing career in the best region in New Zealand* enabling people to have the best of both worlds; a challenging work environment and a region with outdoor activities to whet any appetite. If you’re looking to take your next step in digital marketing and make a difference to SMEs across New Zealand then apply for this unique role.§  §*Slight bias might be applied.§  §**Applications close 17th October.**§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50595832.txt	§Energy & Environment Segment Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Energy & Environment Segment Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Seequent§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§ §§Energy & Environment Segment Marketing Manager§ § §The Company§ § Seequent is a world leader in the development of geoscience software. We believe a better understanding of the Earth leads to a better world for all. Our employees work across six continents, in 11 locations, spanning the environmental, mining, civil engineering, and energy industries.§ § Our solutions enable customers to connect and communicate data, so they can make better decisions for people and the planet. Our diverse teams include geo-professionals, software engineers, salespeople, and marketing specialists. Our people help customers solve the complex problems of today -- and work towards the bigger solutions of tomorrow.§ § Sound like you?§ § §The Role§ § A Segment Marketing Manager is accountable for the marketing strategy and the execution of this plan in the Environment and Energy Industries. This position will work closely with the Segment Directors, Solution Directors, other Segment and Solution Marketing Managers, Product Owners and Managers and the rest of the marketing team to develop and execute strategic marketing initiatives and§ This role will require a strong strategic marketer who can balance the marketing strategy to support growth of Seequent in industry as well as having a§ strong solution and product marketing focus.§ You will be responsible for building go-to-market plans and taking new products to market as well as the strategy and planning for solution marketing. As the Segment Marketing Manager, you are a primary advocate and the domain expert for your segments, and you ensure the voice of the customer and region is consistently front of mind in everything you do.§ It is imperative that you exhibit collaborative behaviors, working with other Segment and Solution Marketing Managers to align on your respective marketing plans, as it’s the intersection of the vertical market (segment) and the horizontal enabling solution that Seequent desires to ensure we have a multi-dimensional lens to our planning and execution.§ It is also critical that you can influence senior leaders in the business and work as a trusted advisor to the Market Development Team.§ § §Product, Solution and Industry Marketing§Value - work with the Segment and Solution Directors, Solution Marketing Managers, Marketing Team, and Product Managers to define and communicate clear value propositions to new and existing customers based on relevant product and solution positioning§Go-to-market - take responsibility for building and executing the go-to-market plans and marketing strategy in conjunction with the Segment and Solution Directors, aligning to the company’s business plans and the wider Marketing Team.§Marketing strategy and execution§Marketing strategy - You will take direct ownership of the Segment marketing strategy and drive initiatives which enable achievement of commercial targets.This will be achieved by partnering with the Segment and Solution Directors, Other Segment and Solution Marketing Managers, and Product Managers on upcoming release content, understanding key personas and development of commercial targets.§Execution - You will work with the Segment and Solution Directors, Segment & Solution Marketing Managers, and wider marketing team to execute and continuously iterate on an innovative and effective marketing strategy that is closely tied to the Segment commercial strategy. This role also requires an all-rounder, who is experienced in delivering multi-touch, integrated campaigns.§Leadership and collaboration§Leadership - take ownership and drive your assigned projects by collaborating with other people and teams across Seequent.§Stakeholder management & collaboration - build productive relationships with internal and external stakeholders. In particular, the Segment and Solution Marketing team, the Segment and Solution Directors, Product Managers, the wider Marketing team and the regional teams§Customer Focus§User journey - working collaboratively with the Segment and Solution Directors and the wider Marketing and Customer experience team to define each stage of the user journey and work to design an engaging experience which acquires and retains new and existing users.§Customer segmentation - working collaboratively with the Segment and Solution Directors and the wider Marketing and customer experience team to segment users at each stage of the user journey by designing, collecting and analysing relevant user and engagement data.Use this data to deliver effective targeted marketing and sales communications.§Compliance and documentation§Data - marketing data captured is to be documented and stored appropriately in line with local regulations.§Content - ensure that marketing content is correct and meets any statutory requirements.§In order to be successful in this role, you should have:§A suitable tertiary qualification in Business, Marketing, or any other business-related field.§At least 7 years of experience in a mid to senior level marketing position in a fast-paced and dynamic B2B business environment§Strong communication, interpersonal and leadership skills§Sense of urgency and resourcefulness§Can-do attitude§The ability to work independently as well as with others§Inclusion + Diversity§ § In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience.§ If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. Please provide details in your cover letter of any accommodations needed.§ § §How to apply§ § If this sounds like the role for you, apply today with a covering letter and CV.§§§§

jobTitle: Digital Marketer Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50597486.txt	§Digital Marketer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketer§§Advertiser: §QJumpers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§QJumpers is our company; and it is part of us. We want it to be a part of you too!  We’re proud to be a New Zealand owned and operated company with an established history in Software as a service (SaaS). §Culture is REALLY important to us.  We are like a family of like-minded people who love to innovate, succeed……and have fun and a laugh along the way.§We are looking for an experienced Digital Marketing professional to join our awesome team on a 12 month fixed term contract. This newly created role will see you responsible for planning, developing, implementing and continuously improving our digital marketing strategy and communications for both our New Zealand and US businesses. The key goal is to create demos for the sales team.§We are based in Mount Maunganui (we know……it’s tough living near the beach) and we would love you to visit us from time to time - but you can work from home anywhere in New Zealand.§What are some of the things you will you be doing?§  §Implementing a digital strategy to generate quality leads§  §Creating online content to drive traffic and leads§  §Developing and managing email marketing campaigns§  §Organising webinars and events§  §Writing our key messaging and ensuring we are always on brand§  §Measuring and improving conversion rates from our website and all digital platforms§  §Improving SEO rankings and managing adwords§  §Developing and reporting on key marketing metrics§Ideal candidates will have:§ §  §At least 3 years digital marketing experience (ideally for a SaaS company)§  §An exceptional ( “can-do”, positive, proactive) attitude§  §The drive and motivated to be the best version of you §  §A team focus – if QJumpers succeeds, we all succeed§  §A true passion for digital marketing and a belief in how it helps businesses succeed§  §Strong attention to detail§  §Excellent communication skills§  §Experience working in the US preferred§What can we offer§: §  §Competitive base salary with a bonus system to reward success§  §Home office costs if not based in/around Tauranga§  §Opportunity to work with a great bunch of people§  §The chance to be part of an international success story§This is an opportunity to work with a team that is passionate about what they do and where they are going! It’s not going to be an easy ride, but it’s going to be a very rewarding one.§So, if you’re keen to jump on board with us, then please apply online with your CV and Cover Letter today. §When you apply, you’ll get to try out our software first hand!§§§§

jobTitle: Marketing Leader for Pets (Relist) Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50597494.txt	§Marketing Leader for Pets (Relist)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Leader for Pets (Relist)§§Advertiser: §Veterinary Enterprises§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§Veterinary Enterprises Group Ltd is one of New Zealand’s largest vet companies, delivering services that care for pets and farms with 20 clinics situated all around the country.§  §We are seeking a motivated and effective Marketing Leader to drive our campaigns for our Companion Animals (Pets).   Working closely with the Business Development Manager for Pets, and with our clinics, you will help to engage customers and develop strategies and tactics that will continue to educate customers around the health and wellbeing of their pets.§  §You will be based at our combined Head Office and Clinic in Te Awamutu, and get to see how we work with pet owners to help their animals every day.§  §Key responsibilities of the role:§ § §Drive strategic and tactical initiatives for specific business divisions in line with marketing plan§ §Manage all end to end marketing activity including website, campaigns, direct to consumer communications and internal and external brand management§ §Use relevant data and competitive analysis to implement, monitor, adjust and report on campaigns and brand position§ §Develop actionable customer insights§ §Build effective communications channels and assets for the business§ §Manage all digital assets, social media and advertising to pet owners§ §Work closely with other members of the VetEnt team to ensure new service and product development delivers value to customers.§ §What kinds of people would suit this environment?§  §Ideally, you’ll have  5+ years of marketing experience and proven digital and marketing execution skills. You’ll be a self starter, naturally curious and able to question the status quo. Strong communications and relationship building skills are also required as you’ll be supporting a team of vets nationally and having to present your ideas to the management team. You’ll also have:§ § §Proven effective campaign management experience§ §Effective digital marketing skills and experience, with the ability to interpret and act on data monitored, run Google Ads campaigns and manage digital advertising§ §Effective content development and copy writing skills§ §Budgetary management skills§ §Strong stakeholder management skills and experience and ability to sell in your ideas to a wider audience§ §Ideation experience and presentation skills§ §What VetEnt can offer§  §In return you will find our organisation supportive and open to new ideas, and determined to ensure your success.  If you are looking for a challenge, this is a great opportunity to make your mark, and if you are as passionate about the health and well-being of animals as we are, we’d love to hear from you. Check us out at www.vetent.co.nz§  §Apply with your cover letter and CV via SEEK.§  §Applications will close on Monday 5th October at 5pm. §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Ecommerce Trading Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50598188.txt	§Ecommerce Trading Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Ecommerce Trading Manager§§Advertiser: §POSTIE PLUS GROUP LIMITED§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Ecommerce Trading Manager §      §        §Here’s your chance to join leading New Zealand apparel retailer, Postie! The team are on the search for an experienced and analytical eCommerce Trading Manager to manage the implementation of the Postie.co.nz product roadmap and the day-to-day running of the Postie.co.nz website to maximise online sales and eCommerce growth. This is a brilliant time to join the business as the eCommerce arm is on an exciting growth trajectory.§        §Reporting to the Head of eCommerce and Marketing, you’ll be a part of a small, results-driven team, who work hard but have fun doing it. You’ll have the support of the wider eCommerce and Marketing team, and while you’ll be operating at a senior level you won’t hesitate to roll up your sleeves and ‘muck in’.§        §The eCommerce Trading Manager will be working closely with the Social and Digital Marketing Manager as well as with multiple internal business teams, including our eCommerce Fulfilment team and Merchandise team to ensure that potential sales demand is maximized. You’ll also be managing agencies to deliver website projects and ongoing site optimisation, so you’ll need to be great at building and maintaining strong working relationships.§        §Your key responsibilities include:§        §          §Online sales growth.§          §Owning the delivery of the Postie.co.nz roadmap, managing project workflows and timelines with internal teams and third parties to deliver the roadmap.§          §Product ownership of Postie.co.nz, including the day-to-day management, maintaining an optimal level of customer usability, troubleshooting any issues to ensure conversion is maximized.§          §Planning and producing all website content in conjunction with the digital marketing manager and creative team.§          §Managing eCommerce stock to support marketing activity and revenue targets.§          §Producing eDMs and ongoing management of all transactional email.§          §Daily, weekly and monthly sales reporting.§        §        § §        §To succeed in this role you will have:§        §          §Proven 5 years eCommerce trading experience with an understanding of how to drive eCommerce sales in retail or other fast-paced industry.§          §Proven experience in fully managing a website via a CMS and experience in managing website development projects.§          §Experience with email marketing and ESP/ CRM systems.§          §Experience with google analytics and producing business reports.§          §Strong communications skills and the ability to work effectively with multiple stakeholders, across multiple projects.§          §A strong emphasis on team-work and efficiency and a passion for the vision of Postie§        §        §If this role sounds like you then please do not hesitate to apply.  §      §      §      §    §  §§§Here’s your chance to join leading New Zealand apparel retailer, Postie! The team are on the search for an experienced and analytical eCommerce Trading Manager to manage the implementation of the Postie.co.nz product roadmap and the day-to-day running of the Postie.co.nz website to maximise online sales and eCommerce growth. This is a brilliant time to join the business as the eCommerce arm is on an exciting growth trajectory.§ §Reporting to the Head of eCommerce and Marketing, you’ll be a part of a small, results-driven team, who work hard but have fun doing it. You’ll have the support of the wider eCommerce and Marketing team, and while you’ll be operating at a senior level you won’t hesitate to roll up your sleeves and ‘muck in’.§ §The eCommerce Trading Manager will be working closely with the Social and Digital Marketing Manager as well as with multiple internal business teams, including our eCommerce Fulfilment team and Merchandise team to ensure that potential sales demand is maximized. You’ll also be managing agencies to deliver website projects and ongoing site optimisation, so you’ll need to be great at building and maintaining strong working relationships.§ §Your key responsibilities include:§ § §Online sales growth.§ §Owning the delivery of the Postie.co.nz roadmap, managing project workflows and timelines with internal teams and third parties to deliver the roadmap.§ §Product ownership of Postie.co.nz, including the day-to-day management, maintaining an optimal level of customer usability, troubleshooting any issues to ensure conversion is maximized.§ §Planning and producing all website content in conjunction with the digital marketing manager and creative team.§ §Managing eCommerce stock to support marketing activity and revenue targets.§ §Producing eDMs and ongoing management of all transactional email.§ §Daily, weekly and monthly sales reporting.§ § § §To succeed in this role you will have:§ § §Proven 5 years eCommerce trading experience with an understanding of how to drive eCommerce sales in retail or other fast-paced industry.§ §Proven experience in fully managing a website via a CMS and experience in managing website development projects.§ §Experience with email marketing and ESP/ CRM systems.§ §Experience with google analytics and producing business reports.§ §Strong communications skills and the ability to work effectively with multiple stakeholders, across multiple projects.§ §A strong emphasis on team-work and efficiency and a passion for the vision of Postie§ §If this role sounds like you then please do not hesitate to apply.  §§§§

jobText: TXT/50601893.txt	§Digital Brand/ Marketing Manager§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Brand/ Marketing Manager§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§We are an exciting new nutraceuticals brand that is on a mission to empower women to take care of their health & beauty from the inside out. We want to make supplements tasty, convenient and fun – gummy bear supplement that are a part of your daily routine. As a digitally based brand, we are looking for an energetic digital brand manager to increase awareness, drive conversion and loyalty by creating a strong connection with our customers. You’ll play an important role in building our brand’s image through digital marketing and be involved in long-term strategy as well as highly tactical day-to-day execution.§Responsibilities include:§Oversee online sales channels and manage customer service and communications §Develop and execute digital content marketing plan (EDMs, social media)§Manage external creative agencies and ensure all creative assets and communications are on brand§Work with external paid media and PR §Cultivate and manage the community including brand ambassadors, influencers and customers §Stay on top of marketing and industry trends to understand our messaging effectiveness in order to evolve our brand and marketing touchpoints §Winning-factors:§You have 2+ years of marketing or brand experience at a fast-growing consumer-facing company §You have experience with Shopify, Shopify associated apps, email marketing§You are customer obsessed – you understand our customer and how to speak to them §You are able to take initiative and problem-solve independently §You are deadline-driven and adaptable §You have strong intuition and understanding of what makes great creative – design skills including photoshop and illustrator is a bonus§You are highly motivated and hard-working with a "no task is too small" attitude.§You thrive in a fast-paced environment.§You are never satisfied with the status quo, always thinking "how can we do this better?"§You have a demonstrated interest in health, wellness and beauty § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§How many years of project management experience do you have?§Are you experienced with copy writing and content creation?§§§

jobTitle: Brand Specialist Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50602192.txt	§Brand Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Brand Specialist§§Advertiser: §Red Bull Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Brand Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Brand Specialist §      §        §What makes Red Bull a raging success? The answer is simple, it's our people! Their enthusiasm, commitment and unique ideas help make Red Bull the world's leading energy drink.§        §Our Brand Specialist is a guardian of the Red Bull brand, ensuring that the brand is portrayed with impact and to our high standards across the marketplace, while understanding and gathering consumer insights and market research.§        §No days at Red Bull are dull. Working closely with our Brand Manager, this role offers variety and exposure to all aspects of Brand Management, including research, advertising, branding, creative development, new products and packaging initiatives and brand projects.§        §This role will suit someone with high energy and a passion for the World of Red Bull. Using your creativity and innovation you will have all the following attributes:§        §          §Brand marketing skills, knowledge and experience, ideally from within FMCG§          §Effective communicator, both spoken and written.§          §Strong attention to detail with a creative eye §          §Proficient in Microsoft Office§          §Critical thinking, clear understanding of competitor activity and consumer behaviour§          §Able to generate consumer insights and translate them into successful brand initiatives§          §Strong analytical ability and commercial acumen to understand media schedules, financial statements and market trends§          §Effective negotiation and interpersonal skills§          §An entrepreneurial ‘can-do’ attitude facilitated by continuous learning and application of appropriate ‘best practices’§          §Ability to focus and follow through on priorities and deliver high quality results§          §Knowledge of online and offline media landscape is preferred§          §Team player with a solid understanding of team culture and working towards a common goal§          §Creative mind with a practical approach to completing tasks§          §Growth mindset with a willingness to learn§        §        §You will have a tertiary qualification in Marketing, Communications, Business or similar. You will also have at least 2-3 years’ experience in a similar role.§        §To be successful at Red Bull you need to be aligned with our brand values: innovative, witty, professional, contemporary, self-ironic, ingenious and hard-working. In return we offer a competitive salary package, exposure to New Zealand’s unique and exciting playgrounds and the World of Red Bull. You will also become an essential member of our high performing, inspiring and collaborative team.§        §Join us for your next adventure, where you will be able grow your wings and realize your true potential. If this role energizes you apply today to start your journey at Red Bull.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§What makes Red Bull a raging success? The answer is simple, it's our people! Their enthusiasm, commitment and unique ideas help make Red Bull the world's leading energy drink.§ §Our Brand Specialist is a guardian of the Red Bull brand, ensuring that the brand is portrayed with impact and to our high standards across the marketplace, while understanding and gathering consumer insights and market research.§ §No days at Red Bull are dull. Working closely with our Brand Manager, this role offers variety and exposure to all aspects of Brand Management, including research, advertising, branding, creative development, new products and packaging initiatives and brand projects.§ §This role will suit someone with high energy and a passion for the World of Red Bull. Using your creativity and innovation you will have all the following attributes:§ § §Brand marketing skills, knowledge and experience, ideally from within FMCG§ §Effective communicator, both spoken and written.§ §Strong attention to detail with a creative eye § §Proficient in Microsoft Office§ §Critical thinking, clear understanding of competitor activity and consumer behaviour§ §Able to generate consumer insights and translate them into successful brand initiatives§ §Strong analytical ability and commercial acumen to understand media schedules, financial statements and market trends§ §Effective negotiation and interpersonal skills§ §An entrepreneurial ‘can-do’ attitude facilitated by continuous learning and application of appropriate ‘best practices’§ §Ability to focus and follow through on priorities and deliver high quality results§ §Knowledge of online and offline media landscape is preferred§ §Team player with a solid understanding of team culture and working towards a common goal§ §Creative mind with a practical approach to completing tasks§ §Growth mindset with a willingness to learn§ §You will have a tertiary qualification in Marketing, Communications, Business or similar. You will also have at least 2-3 years’ experience in a similar role.§ §To be successful at Red Bull you need to be aligned with our brand values: innovative, witty, professional, contemporary, self-ironic, ingenious and hard-working. In return we offer a competitive salary package, exposure to New Zealand’s unique and exciting playgrounds and the World of Red Bull. You will also become an essential member of our high performing, inspiring and collaborative team.§ §Join us for your next adventure, where you will be able grow your wings and realize your true potential. If this role energizes you apply today to start your journey at Red Bull.§§§§

jobTitle: Digital Marketing Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50602357.txt	§Digital Marketing Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing Coordinator§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Couriers Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Digital Marketing Coordinator §      §        §Who are we?§        §New Zealand Couriers is a fast moving company with a big reputation, challenging targets and a fantastic place to build a career within the Freightways Group of Companies. We've been helping New Zealand businesses get products to their customers for over 55 years. Our dedicated and passionate team of 1,400 people deliver over 33 million parcels a year.§        §Based at our Head Office in Penrose the marketing team exists to create, manage and deliver targeted content to customers, staff and the community to increase brand awareness, generate revenue and develop long-lasting relationships.§        §What is the role and why do we need it?§        §Our marketing team is growing. With an ever increasing focus on digital communications and channels we need to hire an up and coming digital marketing coordinator to play a key role in delivering the digital marketing strategy for the business with a particular focus on customer experience and building the sales funnel.§        §This really is a varied role. You will help build and deliver internal and external marketing campaigns - website and online improvements, project management, market research, content production, data analysis, newsletters and general marketing administration will all be part of your working day.§        §Who would we like to talk to?§        §With a marketing degree or similar you will have at least 18 months experience in a marketing role, ideally with some exposure to digital channels and communication, e-commerce and digital product development. Your current role will have given you exposure to sales and marketing tools such as automation, Email marketing, Adobe and the like. You will be technically smart and passionate about looking for ways to improve the customer journey. Great communication skills are a must.§        §Why should you consider joining us?§        §We are a big company with our people at the heart of what we do. We give our people the freedom to mould and shape their role, and the support to be successful. Opportunities to progress within the company and wider group are real.§        §Please apply with a CV and covering letter to Bob Walker at JOYN.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Who are we?§New Zealand Couriers is a fast moving company with a big reputation, challenging targets and a fantastic place to build a career within the Freightways Group of Companies. We've been helping New Zealand businesses get products to their customers for over 55 years. Our dedicated and passionate team of 1,400 people deliver over 33 million parcels a year.§Based at our Head Office in Penrose the marketing team exists to create, manage and deliver targeted content to customers, staff and the community to increase brand awareness, generate revenue and develop long-lasting relationships.§What is the role and why do we need it?§Our marketing team is growing. With an ever increasing focus on digital communications and channels we need to hire an up and coming digital marketing coordinator to play a key role in delivering the digital marketing strategy for the business with a particular focus on customer experience and building the sales funnel.§This really is a varied role. You will help build and deliver internal and external marketing campaigns - website and online improvements, project management, market research, content production, data analysis, newsletters and general marketing administration will all be part of your working day.§Who would we like to talk to?§With a marketing degree or similar you will have at least 18 months experience in a marketing role, ideally with some exposure to digital channels and communication, e-commerce and digital product development. Your current role will have given you exposure to sales and marketing tools such as automation, Email marketing, Adobe and the like. You will be technically smart and passionate about looking for ways to improve the customer journey. Great communication skills are a must.§Why should you consider joining us?§We are a big company with our people at the heart of what we do. We give our people the freedom to mould and shape their role, and the support to be successful. Opportunities to progress within the company and wider group are real.§Please apply with a CV and covering letter to Bob Walker at JOYN.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Marketing Manager Accommodation Industry Job in Marlborough - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50605157.txt	§Marketing Manager Accommodation Industry§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Manager Accommodation Industry§§Advertiser: §Astro§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§Marketing Manager – Accommodation Industry § § §Work in a beautiful Blenheim location§ §Enjoy a fantastic Company work culture§ §32 hours per week flexible§ §Are you an experienced Marketing Manager who would thrive on creating a superior guest experience for our clients? §  §Contributing to our consistently growing business, you will be a dynamic and multi talented Marketing Manager who will help us to grow our brand awareness in the accommodation industry across New Zealand. With your proven marketing experience, creativity and flair, you will add value to our brand promise of making it easy for our clients to create a superior guest experience. §  §Company§  §We are a third generation New Zealand family owned business who have been leaders in the Hospitality industry for almost 20 years.  We pride ourselves on our strong values of family, respect, honesty, and trust and this is reflected in our dealings with both customers and our team. We provide an environment where people love to come to work and are passionate about what they do. §  §The Role §  §Due to expansion, we are looking for a new and talented team member to help us grow our market share by way of creating and adopting marketing plans to create inbound leads.  In this exciting and varied role, you will be doing all that is required to ensure that our brand becomes the preferred choice in the accommodation industry. You will be able to suggest new ideas to grow the business and thrive on building brand awareness through marketing, social media, mail outs and other activities. You will also be responsible for interacting with current and new customers via the phone and face to face visits.  Picking up the phone occasionally to generate new business will be second nature to you. §  §You will have a minimum two years experience in a similar role, or alternatively be more experienced and would now welcome working flexible hours (32 hours per week with the possibility of increasing in the future.)§  §Duties§ § §Create and maintain structured marketing plan.§ §Present marketing activity to sales team§ §Manage social media platforms§ §Create all brochure content§ §Implement plan to raise brand awareness with designers and architects.§ §Creation of collateral catalogues and similar.§ §Research to identify new leads.§ §Managing marketing requirements/customer contact database§ §Manage mail-outs/newsletters, marketing emails. § §Occasional telemarketing to existing and new clients§ §Build brand awareness in the Accommodation industry across New Zealand.§ §Personal Capabilities§ § §Can demonstrate teamwork, trust, and collaboration§ §Positive can-do attitude and engaging manner.§ §Personal relationship focussed.§ §An ideas person with a creative brain.§ §Excellent communication skills § §Motivated to achieve targets and deadlines.§ §Self disciplined and driven to achieve great results.§ §Excellent personal presentation§ §Skills & Qualifications§ § §2 years minimum experience in a similar role.§ §Proven broad marketing experience§ §Excellent written and spoken English.§ §Creative writing skills§ §Thrive on phone work and possess excellent telephone manner§ §Above all you will love doing all it takes to grow the business!§  §Who Are We?§  §We place Family as one of our core values and as such have a fantastic culture. As an employee, you will be made to feel valued and your hard work acknowledged. If you are the type of person who has the drive and personality to succeed, and also enjoys the comradery of a close-knit office environment, then this is the company for you.§  §Apply§  §If you have the required skills and experience, please email a copy of your CV and cover letter outlining your interest in the role to §careers@astro.net.nz§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Mining Segment Marketing Manager Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50605309.txt	§Mining Segment Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Mining Segment Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Seequent§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§ §§Mining Segment Marketing Manager§ § §The Company§ § Seequent is a world leader in the development of geoscience software. We believe a better understanding of the Earth leads to a better world for all. Our employees work across six continents, in 11 locations, spanning the environmental, mining, civil engineering, and energy industries.§ § Our solutions enable customers to connect and communicate data, so they can make better decisions for people and the planet. Our diverse teams include geo-professionals, software engineers, salespeople, and marketing specialists. Our people help customers solve the complex problems of today -- and work towards the bigger solutions of tomorrow.§ § Sound like you?§ § §The Role§ § A Segment Marketing Manager is accountable for the marketing strategy and the execution of this plan in the mining industry. This position will work closely with the Segment Directors, Solution Directors, other Segment and Solution Marketing Managers, Product Owners and Managers and the rest of the marketing team to develop and execute strategic marketing initiatives and campaigns. This role will require a strong strategic marketer who can balance the marketing strategy to support growth of Seequent in industry as well as having a strong solution and product marketing focus.§ § You will be responsible for building go-to-market plans and taking new products to market as well as the strategy and planning for solution marketing. As the Segment Marketing Manager, you are a primary advocate and the domain expert for your segments, and you ensure the voice of the customer and region is consistently front of mind in everything you do.§ § It is imperative that you exhibit collaborative behaviours, working with other Segment and Solution Marketing Managers to align on your respective marketing plans, as it’s the intersection of the vertical market (segment) and the horizontal enabling solution that Seequent desires to ensure we have a multi-dimensional lens to our planning and execution. It is also critical that you can influence senior leaders in the business and work as a trusted advisor to the Market Development Team.§ § §Product, Solution and Industry Marketing§Value - work with the Segment and Solution Directors, Solution Marketing Managers, Marketing Team, and Product Managers to define and communicate clear value propositions to new and existing customers based on relevant product and solution positioning§Go-to-market - take responsibility for building and executing the go-to-market plans and marketing strategy in conjunction with the Segment and Solution Directors, aligning to the company’s business plans and the wider Marketing Team.§Marketing strategy and execution§Marketing strategy - You will take direct ownership of the Segment marketing strategy and drive initiatives which enable achievement of commercial targets.This will be achieved by partnering with the Segment and Solution Directors, Other Segment and Solution Marketing Managers, and Product Managers on upcoming release content, understanding key personas and development of commercial targets.§Execution - You will work with the Segment and Solution Directors, Segment & Solution Marketing Managers, and wider marketing team to execute and continuously iterate on an innovative and effective marketing strategy that is closely tied to the Segment commercial strategy. This role also requires an all-rounder, who is experienced in delivering multi-touch, integrated campaigns.§Leadership and collaboration§Leadership - take ownership and drive your assigned projects by collaborating with other people and teams across Seequent.§Team focus - collaboration across departments, timezones, products and solutions is paramount. This role requires someone to be passionate about working as a team to deliver best possible outcomes§Values - Champion the company values and incorporate them in all that you do§Customer Focus§User journey - working collaboratively with the Segment and Solution Directors and the wider Marketing and Customer experience team to define each stage of the user journey and work to design an engaging experience which acquires and retains new and existing users.§Customer feedback - use gathered customer feedback to validate or drive change in the Segment marketing strategy or the various user journeys.§Market Research/Intelligence - research current and prospective markets, monitor market trends and identify potential future opportunities.§Compliance and documentation§Data - marketing data captured is to be documented and stored appropriately in line with local regulations.§Content - ensure that marketing content is correct and meets any statutory requirements.§In order to be successful in this role, you should have:§A suitable tertiary qualification in Business, Marketing, or any other business-related field.§At least 7 years of experience in a mid to senior level marketing position in a fast-paced and dynamic B2B business environment§Strong communication, interpersonal and leadership skills§Sense of urgency and resourcefulness§Can-do attitude§The ability to work independently as well as with others§Inclusion + Diversity§ § In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience.§ If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. Please provide details in your cover letter of any accommodations needed.§ § §How to apply§ § If this sounds like the role for you, apply today with a covering letter and CV.§§§§

You will be able to suggest new ideas to grow the business and thrive on building brand awareness through marketing, social media, mail outs and other activities.  You will also be responsible for interacting with current and new customers via the phone and face to face visits.  Picking up the phone occasionally to generate new business will be second nature to you. §  §You will have a minimum two years experience in a similar role, or alternatively be more experienced and would now welcome working flexible hours (32 hours per week with the possibility of increasing in the future.)§  §Duties§ § §Create and maintain structured marketing plan.§ §Present marketing activity to sales team§ §Manage social media platforms§ §Create all brochure content§ §Implement plan to raise brand awareness with designers and architects.§ §Creation of collateral catalogues and similar.§ §Research to identify new leads.§ §Managing marketing requirements/customer contact database§ §Manage mail-outs/newsletters, marketing emails. § §Occasional telemarketing to existing and new clients§ §Build brand awareness in the Accommodation industry across New Zealand.§ §Personal Capabilities§ § §Can demonstrate teamwork, trust, and collaboration§ §Positive can-do attitude and engaging manner.§ §Personal relationship focussed.§ §An ideas person with a creative brain.§ §Excellent communication skills § §Motivated to achieve targets and deadlines.§ §Self disciplined and driven to achieve great results.§ §Excellent personal presentation§ §Skills & Qualifications§ § §2 years minimum experience in a similar role.§ §Proven broad marketing experience§ §Excellent written and spoken English.§ §Creative writing skills§ §Thrive on phone work and possess excellent telephone manner§ §Above all you will love doing all it takes to grow the business!§  §Who Are We?§  §We place Family as one of our core values and as such have a fantastic culture. As an employee, you will be made to feel valued and your hard work acknowledged. If you are the type of person who has the drive and personality to succeed, and also enjoys the comradery of a close-knit office environment, then this is the company for you.§  § §  §Apply§  §If you have the required skills and experience, please email a copy of your CV and cover letter outlining your interest in the role to §careers@astro.net.nz§ §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

If you are organised, motivated and ready to write, apply now!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a writer?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§§§

You will have a passion for marketing and innovation but also a person who can be pedantic about the detail. § §It would also suit someone that has marketing and insurance experience to boot but not essential. § §With face to face customer interaction on the front desk and phones, the role mostly §includes§:§ §Marketing database management§Document creation and innovation§Creating marketing campaigns including analysis of engagement and effectiveness§Creating/sourcing media content for newsletters and social media platforms §Compliance support §Supporting our sales and customer service team with booking appointments and client management§ §This is a role that needs energy, precision, resilience and above all a sense of humour.  So,don't worry if you can't tick all the boxes, having the right attitude is top priority for us, as we like someone willing to grow and learn§ § §Benefits and perks§ §§We keep it simple§ - and operate streamlined process to achieve success§We do teamwork§ - with excellent support from an experienced and supportive team who all learnt on the job§We §do §what we say we are going to §do§We understand family §and needs of flexibility.§And we like to do coffee and cake§ and share a laugh together§This comes with a good remuneration offer for the right team fit§ § §Skills and experience§ § §What we need from you is:§ §Highly developed Microsoft office skills with the ability to create documents, include diagrams and integrate new technology including videos into presentation§Marketing qualification or experience understanding social media platforms and how they work including the creation, proofing, loading of content and analysis§You can connect quickly and make people feel heard and the ability to relate with a variety of people§Willingness to pitch in and help – we're a small team which means we must be flexible and help each other out.§ §So if you are fun to hang out with and make everyone around you feel good about their interactions with you, attach your CV and a short covering note explaining who you are and answer the following question: ''how would you would shine in this role".§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Product Marketing Manager Job in Wellington - SEEK

Potential candidates from any of these locations will be considered for the role. § § § §Objective Planning and Building Solutions is our fastest growing software group in the Objective family, so if you are interested in a fast-paced environment, working as part of a great team, this could be the role for you! § § § §Designing primarily for Local Government and the construction industry we have a range of SaaS and desktop applications that dramatically reduce the time to lodge, manage, assess and process building consents and development applications across Australia and New Zealand.§ § § §If marketing software solutions in a B2B environment is your passion, you are just the person we are looking for. We need someone who can jump in, drive our go-to-market messaging and positioning. This role is critical throughout the software development life-cycle, influencing from inception to release. The position requires a strategic thinker who is not afraid to roll their sleeves up and get into the detail. § § § §You will be working in a close-knit team, sitting side-by-side with the VP, Sales, Customer Success, Product Management and Engineering. You will also be engaging with customers regularly, to understand how they use our solution set. § §This is a pivotal role and key to our success. § § § §What we are looking for:§ § §Minimum 5 years of experience in B2B marketing § §Worked in a Software company before in product marketing function § §Self-starter and comfortable to work autonomously§ §Persuasive presenter and articulate public speaker§ §A strong sense of team spirit§ §Energetic and passionate about internal and external customers§ § § §Your day will look like:§ § §Own the overall product positioning and value messaging, § §Collaborate closely with both Product Management and Sales to drive new opportunities and business growth§ §Produce quarterly and annual marketing strategy, plans and budgets, and then present to the Exec§ §Curate product positioning and messaging in-product, on the website, sales collateral, presentations and customer testimonials§ §Work with group marketing and field marketers on product campaign and event messaging§ § § §A bit about you:§ § §You have strong attention to detail§ §You have great communication skills § §You ooze positivity and energy§ §You are a self-starter and comfortable to work autonomously§ §You like to build and develop relationships across the team§ § § §We have three brand new, beautifully appointed offices in Sydney, Wellington and Palmerston North. Objective is a modern organisation offering flexible working and the option for purchased leave. § §We pride ourselves on innovation, with a culture focused on bringing the very best software solutions to our clients. We are a flexible workplace, and you will find a friendly, diverse bunch of people to work and laugh alongside in an open-plan office. § § § §**Contact Maria Daly in the Talent Team to learn more**§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing manager?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Do you have product management experience within a Software as a Service (SaaS) company?§§§

Click on the 'Apply Now'§ button to start your application process.§  §§§We are looking for a marketing superstar to align the go to market strategy across our three business units, for one of IMNZ’s most prestigious vendor brands – Microsoft.§  §Your ability to see the big picture and execute with high attention to detail, coupled with proven delivery of strategic and tactical marketing plans that achieve objectives and ROI, will be your point of difference. jobTitle: Disruption Sales and Marketing Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50608518.txt	§Disruption Sales and Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Disruption Sales and Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Fonterra Co-operative Group Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§Fonterra is an essential business and we always need people to help keep us moving! Under different Alert Levels your recruitment experience may look and feel a little different, but our Recruitment Team is here to help guide you through the process. Kia kaha, Aotearoa!§ § §Develop and deliver new products and brands§ §Truly innovative and disruptive role with plenty of scale§ §Real opportunity to make tangible change§ §Your Purpose:§ §Internally known as the Sales and Marketing Disruption Marketing Manager, this fast paced and impactful role is responsible for the development of disruptive products and brands. With a global focus, you will explore new concepts outside of Fonterra’s core brands to create initial traction, create concepts that resonate with consumers, then scale the winners, all while working in a cross-functional way.§ §Operating in a start-up-like environment you will be accountable for leading the thought leadership, development and execution of products and brands within accelerated timelines. You will have the opportunity to make a real, tangible difference to the way we interact with consumers in this stimulating role.§ §What you will bring:§ §We are looking for a senior sales or marketing professional with a fire in their belly and a go-getter attitude. Able to hit the ground running, you will have a true disruptive mindset and not be afraid to stand up for what you believe in. You will have previous innovation experience scaling brands or products within a mixture of environments - corporates and agencies or start-ups. Your agile, innovative and entrepreneurial experience to ensure delivery of scale opportunities at an accelerated rate with minimal resource will set you up for success in this exciting position.§ §In addition, you will have:§ § §Tertiary degree in marketing, or related business degree§ §Extensive marketing/brand/sales management experience§ §3+ years’ innovative business experience in the FMCG space § §Proven experience in creation or scaling of products and brands through an innovative approach§ §Excellent communication and stakeholder influencing skills§ §Bring your enthusiasm and drive to this exciting senior position within Fonterra! Apply today!§ §Our Story§ §Proudly New Zealand owned and operated, we are a dairy nutrition co-operative made up of farming families. Collaboration, innovation and passion were the cornerstone of our creation and continue to drive all of us at Fonterra.§ §Our dairy know-how and innovation capability mean we can do amazing things with our milk to enhance people’s lives, creating goodness from our farms to over 140 countries around the world. We are purpose lead, empowering people to create goodness for generations.§ §Sustainable farming is at the heart of our strategy. We are committed to farming in a way that regenerates our farms and the environment.§§§§

jobTitle: Digital Marketing Executive Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50608601.txt	§Digital Marketing Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing Executive§§Advertiser: §St Paul's Collegiate School§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§$60,000 - $68,000 + free lunches & free parking!§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§St Paul's Collegiate School is one of New Zealand’s leading independent day and boarding schools located in Hamilton with a reputation for providing a personalised education which focuses on academic excellence. § §We are looking for a dynamic, enthusiastic, multi-talented team player to assist in content creation, digital marketing, social media, analytics and every function related to growth marketing that will enhance the reputation and raise the profile of St Paul’s Collegiate School.§ §This is a fabulous opportunity to showcase your marketing talents, creativity and ability to work in a fast-paced environment where their people are passionate about what they do.§ §Working closely with the Director of Marketing and as part of a close-knit team, you will develop, implement, track and optimise all digital and social media marketing strategies that support the acquisition and retention of continued and future interest in our school.§ §With strong copywriting skills you will have the ability to create compelling content, engaging with families to tell stories – developing content across written, static and video campaigns, news, social media, and blogs. And as a competent graphic designer, you have a natural eye for design and can confidently navigate the Adobe Creative Suite.§ §This is a full time, permanent opportunity where you’ll also be involved in assisting and attending marketing activities which include information evenings, school open days and our exhibition site at Fieldays.§ §Working at St Paul’s you’ll grow personally and professionally, you will receive a competitive salary (approx. $60,000 - $68,000 per annum) and enjoy working in park-like grounds and get some great benefits including free parking and cooked lunches during term time. § §If you have 3+ years’ experience in a digital marketing role, with graphic design skills and can execute end to end digital marketing campaigns including; email, search, display, video, and social campaigns, you could be the person we are looking for.§ §For further information, view our website for a job description or call Kathryn Conaghan, HR Manager - §07 957 8861§. All applications will be treated as confidential and should be sent via email to §work@stpauls.school.nz§ or by applying through Seek. § §Applications close on Friday, 2 October 2020 at 9.00am §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50608855.txt	§Specialist Customer Communications Copywriter & Delivery- Part Time§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Specialist Customer Communications Copywriter & Delivery- Part Time§§Advertiser: §SKY TV§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§About the role…§  §As the Customer Communications Copywriter & Delivery Specialist, you’ll be responsible for leading the creative design, execution and delivery of our direct to customer and service communications (Direct Mail, Email, SMS and more).§  §As part of the Customer Engagement team, your combined purpose is to deliver sustainable value for our customers and shareholders. This will be achieved through delivering compelling communications that support ARPU optimisation, increased customer retention, driving lower costs to serve, most importantly improving overall customer satisfaction and building brand engagement.§  §This is a part-time, permanent role, approximately .5 FTE or 16-21 hours per week with some flexibility required.§  §What Skills and Experience you’ll need…§ § §Minimum of 8 years’ direct to customer marketing§ §Experience in people leadership§ §Experience in building a full customer lifecycle communications programme§ §Customer centric – ensure that the customer is placed at the heart of every decision and are a disciple of leveraging insights to growth§ §Proven ability to blend creative flair and judgement and the art of storytelling § §The Cherry on the top…§ § §An excellent salary package, including a laptop§ §Free Sky and Free Neon§ §Flexible Working including working from home§ §Criteria for working from home includes;§ § §Must have a fibre internet connection with the ability to connect via Ethernet§ §A quiet area to work taking phone calls§ §A mobile (smartphone)§ §Subsidised Gym Membership at the YMCA§ §Free parking onsite§ §  §A Bit About Us…§  §We’re Sky, an entertainment company that has been connecting New Zealanders to the stories and sport they love for nearly 30 years. We’re proud of what we’ve achieved and are excited about where we’re heading. We’re redefining our boundaries and challenging ourselves to do better. We’re moving fast, listening to our customers, creating solutions and taking calculated risks.   §  §How to Apply§  §Please send your CV and Cover letter to §jobs@sky.co.nz§.  A full role profile can be provided upon request§  § §§§§

Whether managing staff, public or retail parking, Parkable offers world class parking solutions.§Established in 2015, launched to the public in 2016, Parkable now employs c. 25 staff and operates in NZ, Australia and China, with additional global markets coming on-line soon.§We are a fast-growing technology company, experiencing over 500% growth year on year.§We are a great place to work and we look for amazing people, with world class capabilities to continue and accelerate our growth journey.§We want someone with energy, confidence and positivity to join our amazing little marketing team.§The team is dynamic, hardworking and small - we have a CMO, one growth marketing manager, a copy writer and this role.§This role is responsible for working with the growth marketing manager to help Parkable grow.  This could be placing social ads, SEO and SEM, organising an event, creating email nurture campaigns or helping with flyers for activation.§In this role you’ll be working with the growth marketing manager to create the strategy to solve a marketing problem or exploit an opportunity and then rolling up your sleeves to get the job done.  This may require learning a new tool, researching best practice, engaging with the wider Parkable team and testing and refining post launch.§This role is an important part of our small, nimble marketing team. You will have full ownership, full support and mentorship and be empowered to bring your ideas to the table and give it a go!§To be successful in this role you must possess the following experience and attributes:§ §2+yrs marketing experience ideally in a small marketing team or agency§ §Relevant tertiary qualification§ §Experience in B2B, SaaS or digital products marketing§ §Specific experience in lead generation & analytics§ §Solutions & results focused§ §Able to work autonomously, but roll your sleeves up to execute§ §Ability to work at pace, be flexible and positive§ §Uber creative!§This is a junior level role if you have an entrepreneurial spirit and a roll-your-sleeves up attitude Parkable is the place to grow a great career!§You must be located in, and have the legal right to work in New Zealand to be considered§Please apply through this advertisement to ensure your information is captured effectively through our customised CRM and we can in turn manage your application effectively. § §Please allow 5 days for our team to collate, review and respond to all applications.§CONTACT §Rachel Clayton§Partner - Senior Sourcing Specialist§www.customisetalent.com§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Please select the following employment options: §Residency Status:§Please select the locations you are seeking employment? §Please select your experience: §Please enter you mobile phone number? §§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Head of Product Management Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50610191.txt	§Head of Product Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Head of Product Management§§Advertiser: §Tait Communications§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Reporting to the Chief Operations Officer, the Head of Product Management is accountable for managing Tait's global portfolio offering, including Tait products, partner products and service offerings. Tait has a clear product strategy that aligns with market insights from solutions marketing, our technology strategy, our industry vertical business development specialists and the short-to-medium term sales revenue opportunities.§ §About the role§ §The Head of Product Management will lead a Product Management team to ensure that the portfolio evolves in accordance with Tait's strategic direction and the market/customer demands across a range of vertical industry sectors. The role will work closely with solutions and product marketing, global sales, engineering, manufacturing and the logistics teams to ensure that our products are relevant, competitive, and successful in the market.§ §Success measures will be ensuring products and services meet our customers current and future needs and achieving strong and sustained return on investment to the business. Other outputs will be product road maps and monthly KPI product reporting. This leadership role will significantly contribute to the development, implementation and success of Tait's product strategy and the success of the business globally. As such it will be a key member of the Technology Leadership team.§ §About the company§ §Tait Communications is a global leader in designing and delivering radio communications solutions which are the right fit for a variety of industries including public safety agencies, government services, utilities, mining and urban transport providers. Across the world, users of Tait products and services are better able to protect themselves and the public, be more responsive and more productive.§ §While several corporate functions are based in Christchurch, New Zealand, the company prides itself on its international customer base and global support network. The company works with a network of sales offices, dealers, system integrators and consultants that span the globe.§ §Customers the world over turn to Tait for developing products, migrating systems, customising features, configuring networks, training users, supporting engineers and deploying a full suite of installation services. Customers commit to Tait because its people have a proven track record of taking the time to listen, understand and act upon customer requirements.§ §Apply now§ §Applications close Sunday, 11 October 2020.§§§§

advertiser: Te Kaupapa Mahitahi Hauora  Papa o Te Raki Trust
jobText: TXT/50613871.txt	§Communications Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications Officer§§Advertiser: §Te Kaupapa Mahitahi Hauora  Papa o Te Raki Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§MAHITAHI HAUORA§ §Communications Officer§ §1.0FTE§ §We are looking for someone with passion and a background in communications and public relations, to support our communications team. Strong experience in content management, social media and the ability to tell our stories are what we are looking for in this position, along with excellent technical skills ensuring effective and efficient delivery of campaigns across a range of channels. You will have an opportunity to be creative and innovative in your work, while being well supported by our skilled and caring team. § §About Mahitahi Hauora§ §Mahitahi Hauora is a newly formed primary health entity established to transform how primary healthcare is delivered in Northland.  Our organisation operates as a Trust, is not for profit and works to support a primary health care system that sustains equitable self-determined wellbeing and ensures every person in Northland can live a long and healthy life. § §The Position§ §We are looking for a Communications Officer who is experienced in:§ § §Supporting and delivering on a communications strategy§ §Creating and managing content including digital (website, social media, intranet & extranet)§ §Managing our internal and external surveys and newsletters§ §Capturing our stories and developing our organisational profile and presence§ §Building relationships and Stakeholder engagement§ §This role holds lots of variety and will see you working alongside and supporting the Communications Manager in improving the organisation’s profile and creating awareness and engagement through various channels.§ §To be considered for this position you must have:§ § §A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a communications role§ §A relevant tertiary qualification in communications, media studies or marketing§ §Exceptional verbal communication skills, and writing skills across a range of channels including digital§ §Excellent skills in using a range of social media platforms, and other technology§ §Great organisational skills and an ability to establish priorities and meet deadlines§ §Proven interpersonal skills in developing constructive stakeholder relationships§ §A detailed position description and Application for Employment can be downloaded from our website www.mahitahihauora.co.nz. You must have a current NZ work visa and the legal right to work in NZ.§ §If you have the skills for this role and passion to be part of this exciting team, please apply by forwarding your covering letter, CV and Application for Employment to Joanne Mason, HR Assistant at §hr@mahitahihauora.co.nz§.§ §Applications Close: Thursday 8th October 2020§ §PLEASE DO NO APPLY VIA THE SEEK WEBSITE.  APPLICATIONS ONLY RECEIVED BY FOLLOWING THE INSTRUCTIONS ABOVE§§§§

The role has four key functions:§ § § § §Development of the Maori and Pacific Island markets, including§ §liaison with agents, responding to enquiries, promotional and sales events§ §regular liaison with other AIS operations to undertake marketing, promotion, counseling and communications for the Maori and Pacific Island markets.§ §providing all information and assistance to potential students as required.§ §Undertake marketing in New Zealand to the Maori and Pacific Island communities, and promotion to current students.§ §Provide pastoral care to current students.§ §Organise visits from educational groups.§ § § §The role requires a person who is fluent in English with at least one years’ experience in marketing and liaison/counselling in the Maori and Pacific Island markets; somebody who knows how to organise and prioritise and work to deadlines.  We require a person who is flexible, a self-starter, motivated, empathetic and enjoys working in a multi–cultural environment.§ § § §Salary range: $40,000pa to $50,000pa.§ § § §If this sounds like you, please send your CV and cover letter to:§ § § §The HR Manager§ §AIS§ §PO Box 2995§ §Auckland 1140§ § § §email: §recruit@ais.ac.nz§ § § §Applications close on 1st October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Which of the following content management systems (CMS) do you have experience with?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50616165.txt	§Marketing Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Coordinator§§Advertiser: §AdvanceQuip NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§A collaborative, team-focused marketer required to proactively implement internal and external communications and marketing initiatives.§ § §Forward-thinking family owned NZ company § §Reputable heavy machinery and attachments distributor § §Exciting and challenging Marketing opportunity § §Company Profile§  §AdvanceQuip is a reputable and forward-thinking company that continues to enjoy exciting growth. §  §We are the New Zealand distributor for several heavy earthmoving machinery brands and attachments; primarily Case Construction Equipment as well as ASV tracked skid-steer units and have employees and branches located throughout the country. §  §We have built a very solid reputation around honesty, integrity and supplying efficient and flexible service to our customers. §  §Role Profile§  §Reporting to and under the guidance of the General Manager, your key focus will be to develop and execute innovative marketing programs, promotional and customer service strategies§,§ with a focus on growing the business across New Zealand§, §aligning with the company strategy and preserving the AdvanceQuip brand and culture.§  §Other key components of this role include coordinating and executing events, ensuring brand consistency across the business, website front-end development, design, and maintenance.§  §Person Profile§  §If you live and breathe marketing, we want to hear from you. We are looking for a flexible and versatile marketer who will be responsible for AdvanceQuip marketing function. §  §This position has a strong focus on the development, execution, and maintenance of AdvanceQuip social media, print and online advertising, email marketing, web site management as well as marketing collateral§  §You will have excellent writing skills, confident event management skills and a strong ability to produce sales support collateral for multiple business units and market a product to a diverse range of clients. §  §You will enjoy using your initiative and finding ways to get things done.  Your referees will describe you as someone who loves marketing, can plan, and execute campaigns that really work and understands the importance of brand consistency and being a team player. §  §Key Skills and Experience Required§ § §A Tertiary qualification in marketing/communication or business studies is highly preferable but not essential, for the right candidate.§ §A least 2 years’ experience in a marketing role.§ §Experience in a multi-branch heavy machinery wholesale/retail environment is preferable but not essential.§ §Proven success in achieving consistent branding within a national business structure.§ §Skills in the Adobe Creative Suite and MS Office, Publisher & Photoshop, Video Editor or other standard creative packages.§ §Strong communicator, who is commercially aware with the ability to influence and gain buy-in at all levels§ §Remuneration is negotiable and will be commensurate with skills and experience. §  §To be eligible for this position you must currently reside in NZ or Australia and have a legal right to work permanently in this country. §  §If you think you are the right person for this role and would like to apply, in strict confidence, please click on the ‘Apply Now’ button below prior to 5pm Wednesday 14 October 2020.  We look forward to hearing from you.§§§§
