Reporting directly to, and supporting the General Manager (Sales & Marketing), the main objective is to develop and implement all aspects of the company’s marketing requirements and strategies.§        §Their marketing strategy is well proven; however this position will have the autonomy to develop new and exciting strategies whilst being involved in traditional marketing activities.§        §The key responsibilities of the role include:§        §          §Planning and managing the marketing strategy of events and activities for existing and new products§          §The creation of marketing collateral, advertising material and other promotional material§          §Website management including content and site platforms; both internal and external portals§          §Managing social media and monitoring online marketing performance§          §Working closely with the General Manager to co-ordinate the marketing plans for the company and generate a strategy that will have positive results for all divisions§        §        §To be successful you will ideally have:§        §          §Tertiary qualification in Marketing or Business discipline§          §Proven experience in a similar role§          §High business acumen§          §You will be a self-starter with a positive attitude and lots of energy!§        §        §          §Excellent written and verbal communication skills§          §Strong relationship building skills with the ability to relate to a wide range of people§          §Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher & PhotoShop§        §        §This is a pivotal role in their organisation therefore we are looking for someone who has previous experience working in a business/corporate environment who has strong business communication skills with a high level of professionalism.§        §You may be looking to relocate to the fabulous Manawatu which is a great central location to live. Housing costs are reasonable with excellent schools and tertiary institutes including Massey University and UCOL. There are beautiful beaches and rivers nearby and it is a great place to bring up a family. Please check out this website for more information on the region https://www.manawatunz.co.nz/§        §If you want to me part of this highly professional company then act now and apply on-line with a Cover Letter and updated CV or for further information please contact Sarah Wright at Adecco on §06 357 2020§.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Steelfort is a well-established and respected, privately owned company with a diverse range of retail and commercial products. Their head office is based in Palmerston North and the two segments of this company are its range of Outdoor Power Equipment and associated products, and its commercial range of manufactured equipment.§An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Marketing Executive to join this highly successful market leader. Reporting directly to, and supporting the General Manager (Sales & Marketing), the main objective is to develop and implement all aspects of the company’s marketing requirements and strategies.§Their marketing strategy is well proven; however this position will have the autonomy to develop new and exciting strategies whilst being involved in traditional marketing activities.§The key responsibilities of the role include:§Planning and managing the marketing strategy of events and activities for existing and new products§The creation of marketing collateral, advertising material and other promotional material§Website management including content and site platforms; both internal and external portals§Managing social media and monitoring online marketing performance§Working closely with the General Manager to co-ordinate the marketing plans for the company and generate a strategy that will have positive results for all divisions§To be successful you will ideally have:§Tertiary qualification in Marketing or Business discipline§Proven experience in a similar role§High business acumen§You will be a self-starter with a positive attitude and lots of energy!§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§Strong relationship building skills with the ability to relate to a wide range of people§Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher & PhotoShop§This is a pivotal role in their organisation therefore we are looking for someone who has previous experience working in a business/corporate environment who has strong business communication skills with a high level of professionalism.§You may be looking to relocate to the fabulous Manawatu which is a great central location to live. Housing costs are reasonable with excellent schools and tertiary institutes including Massey University and UCOL. There are beautiful beaches and rivers nearby and it is a great place to bring up a family. Please check out this website for more information on the region https://www.manawatunz.co.nz/§If you want to me part of this highly professional company then act now and apply on-line with a Cover Letter and updated CV or for further information please contact Sarah Wright at Adecco on §06 357 2020§.§§§§

jobTitle: Social Media Coordinator Job in Manawatu - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50632000.txt	§Social Media Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Media Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Toyota§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Social Media Coordinator §    §    §      §        §Based at our National Headquarters in Palmerston North, we currently have a full-time position within our marketing department for a Social Media, Photography & Brochure Coordinator. This role will see you take ownership of the creation, coordination and distribution of content across all social media channels to support Toyota New Zealand and Lexus marketing initiatives and campaign launches. Alongside this you will also coordinate our brochures, photography and image sourcing, ensuring that all content is accurate, up to date and in line with vehicle specifications.§        §We pride ourselves on our people so to be successful in the role you will need:§        §          §Passion and enthusiasm for all things social media related§          §1+ years’ experience in communications or brand social media§          §A Marketing or Communications degree (preferred but not essential)§          §Exceptional organisational and coordination skills§          §The ability to build strong relationships §          §An EXCELLENT attitude and the ability to represent the brand in a positive manner§          §Strong attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy§          §To be able to identify and report on social media insights and trends§          §Intermediate computer skills (Word, Excel)§          §Strong written and verbal communications skills§          §Proven experience in copy writing and proof reading§        §        §So who are we?§        §Toyota New Zealand is a wholly owned subsidiary of Toyota Motor Corporation, Japan and in 2020 celebrated 33 years of vehicle market leadership in New Zealand. We constantly strive to deliver customer satisfaction and continually transform ourselves to meet our customer's needs and styles, passion’s and dreams.  From the moment you enter Toyota - you will notice a difference!  We back our people to do extraordinary things and believe that if you can dream it, you can do it!§        §What can we offer?§        §          §Opportunity to work in a global organisation that truly values their people§          §Excellent staff benefits§          §Supportive culture§        §        §If you are you confident that you meet the above then please apply with your cover letter and CV online today telling us why you think you have what it takes to excel in this role!§        §For a confidential discussion please do not hesitate to contact Annette Weatherall on §0800758673§.§        §Screening for this role will begin immediately.  Only applicants with New Zealand Citizenship or New Zealand Permanent Residency should apply.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Based at our National Headquarters in Palmerston North, we currently have a full-time position within our marketing department for a Social Media, Photography & Brochure Coordinator. This role will see you take ownership of the creation, coordination and distribution of content across all social media channels to support Toyota New Zealand and Lexus marketing initiatives and campaign launches. Alongside this you will also coordinate our brochures, photography and image sourcing, ensuring that all content is accurate, up to date and in line with vehicle specifications.§We pride ourselves on our people so to be successful in the role you will need:§  §Passion and enthusiasm for all things social media related§  §1+ years’ experience in communications or brand social media§  §A Marketing or Communications degree (preferred but not essential)§  §Exceptional organisational and coordination skills§  §The ability to build strong relationships §  §An EXCELLENT attitude and the ability to represent the brand in a positive manner§  §Strong attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy§  §To be able to identify and report on social media insights and trends§  §Intermediate computer skills (Word, Excel)§  §Strong written and verbal communications skills§  §Proven experience in copy writing and proof reading§So who are we?§Toyota New Zealand is a wholly owned subsidiary of Toyota Motor Corporation, Japan and in 2020 celebrated 33 years of vehicle market leadership in New Zealand. We constantly strive to deliver customer satisfaction and continually transform ourselves to meet our customer's needs and styles, passion’s and dreams.  From the moment you enter Toyota - you will notice a difference!  We back our people to do extraordinary things and believe that if you can dream it, you can do it!§What can we offer?§  §Opportunity to work in a global organisation that truly values their people§  §Excellent staff benefits§  §Supportive culture§If you are you confident that you meet the above then please apply with your cover letter and CV online today telling us why you think you have what it takes to excel in this role!§For a confidential discussion please do not hesitate to contact Annette Weatherall on §0800758673§.§Screening for this role will begin immediately.  Only applicants with New Zealand Citizenship or New Zealand Permanent Residency should apply.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50632360.txt	§Marketing Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Assistant§§Advertiser: §Citycare§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§Marketing Assistant - Citycare Property§About Citycare§We Discover. We Deliver. We Care.§Citycare is a leading provider of construction, maintenance and management services across New Zealand's built environment. We work around the clock providing services to over two million New Zealanders from 16 locations throughout the country.§Our goal is to be nationally recognised as a market leader for the quality of our service and our ability to deliver solutions that keep our communities running and engaged. Our legacy will be visible in the parks and facilities that we build, manage and maintain.§We know that it's our people that make us great and we are now looking for a Marketing Assistant to join our team in Christchurch and be part of our national growth journey.§About the role§This is a fantastic opportunity to join a team that is passionate about delivering quality solutions for our and customers throughout the country.§Reporting directly to the General Manager Customer Solutions, you will be an integral part of the Citycare Property strategy, marketing and business development team, with specific accountabilities to assist the GM to develop and deliver our strategic priorities through planning and delivering tender submissions, internal and external communications, digital marketing activities and promotional programmes for the sector.§Competitive base salary§A career/leadership development program§A supportive and collaborative environment to help you succeed§Opportunities within a national organisation§About you§You have a relevant tertiary qualification in marketing or communications, with at least 4 years' experience in a similar role§You are outgoing, positive and enthusiastic with a passion for delivering exceptional customer service and innovative solutions§You are an excellent communicator who loves producing eloquent and concise creative copy for tender responses, business proposals, social media and digital marketing campaigns§You are proficient in the latest Adobe Creative Cloud applications§You are digitally savvy with commercial awareness and design flair§If you are equally passionate about connecting people and delivering great service as we are then check out the position description and apply online through our website www.citycare.co.nz/careers§Applications close on Sunday 18th October at 5pm.§All successful applicants will need to pass a pre-employment medical and drug screening test.§Any questions? Please contact Richard Simpson 027 445 0371§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Graphic Designer Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50632589.txt	§Graphic Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graphic Designer§§Advertiser: §The People Place§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Graphic Designer§  § §About Us§  § At Primepac, we are a family run business aiming to be the packaging supplier of choice for SME’s across New Zealand. Our mission is to be indispensable to our customers by providing consistently impeccable service, an unbroken supply chain, and to reward and inspire our team. § With values at the heart of our actions, we focus on dedication, initiative and reliability, and want all our relationships – regardless of if it’s with co-workers, management or clients - to be based on integrity, loyalty, openness and respect. §  § §About the role§  § We are looking for a passionate Graphic Designer to support the Customer Care and Marketing Manager and promote Primepac’s products, service offerings, and brands. We also have a sister company, Thermogard, who you will likely do some work for as well.§ With the majority of your time supporting Primepac initiatives, you will work closely with the existing Marketing Assistant to produce brochures, catalogues, and occasionally web content, with the support of an outsourced agency for some of the more ‘meaty’ projects.§ In this role you will:§ § §Ensure Primepac, and its’ products and services, are promoted effectively online§ §Ensure Primepac is front of mind for when customers make purchasing decisions§ §Produce the bi-annual Primepac catalogue release§ §Analyse results from campaigns and promotions§ §Contribute to decisions for future marketing activity§ §Produce final design solutions (like logos, banners, interfaces)§ §Collaborate with team members to launch projects§ §Take on special design tasks§ § §About you§  § You will be keen to show off your implementation skill and be driven by the desire to learn. Your ability to be proactive, even in a busy environment, will help you always stay ahead of the curve, and your dedication to seeing a job through to the end will ensure everyone has the marketing materials and graphics they need.§ It’s important that you come into the role ready to support the existing creative team. With that in mind, we don’t need you to have any professional or business experience, just a great grasp of the Adobe Creative Suite and keen desire to take ownership of your work!§ The following attributes will also be looked upon favourably:§ § §Tertiary Graphic Design Qualification or recent Marketing qualification§ §Superb written and spoken English§ §Competence in InDesign, Photoshop, Acrobat and Illustrator§ §Able to work under pressure and to tight timelines§ §Proactive attitude and adaptable, quick learner§ §The confidence to ask questions, collaborate cross functionally and push back when necessary§ §Show initiative by identifying and solving potential issues promptly§ §Enjoy working at pace and producing results, even when under pressure§ § If you want to work within a dynamic and motivated office environment where successes are celebrated, click ‘apply now’ to submit your resume and cover letter. § Please note: you must be eligible to work in NZ to be considered for this role.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§Are you experienced with copy writing and content creation?§How many years' experience do you have as a graphic designer?§§§

jobTitle: Communications Manager - Mount Wellington Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50633589.txt	§Communications Manager - Mount Wellington§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications Manager - Mount Wellington§§Advertiser: §T&G Global§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Here at T&G Global we're passionate about growing healthier futures through fresh fruit and vegetables. Our story began over 120 years ago as Turners and Growers, and today our 2,500 people are located in 13 countries, where we grow and partner with passionate growers to market, sell and distribute nutritious fresh produce to consumers and customers in over 60 countries.§Like you, we love our food and we're constantly exploring and investing in innovative ways to build great brands, win in key global markets and lead Aotearoa's fresh produce future - and we'll do this guided by Kaitiakitanga.§It's through our people that we'll deliver our ambitious strategy and bring our purpose to life. We're creating an environment which maximises everyone's ability to thrive and deliver, and we're looking for someone to join our Corporate Affairs team who can embody our mindsets of: grounded, resilient, open and winning; is passionate about taking ownership of their role; and wants to make a positive difference.§About the position§Reporting to the Head of Corporate Affairs, you'll develop and lead the delivery of highly effective internal and external communications which enhance our brand reputation, build strong relationships with key stakeholders, and support the delivery of our global strategy. Responsibilities include:§Develop and implement integrated communications and engagement strategies§Identify and share engaging stories with stakeholders§Drive proactive media engagement, increasing the volume and favourability of our coverage§Identify, mitigate and manage reputational risks§Drive government communication and engagement activities§Provide communications leadership and counsel to senior leaders§Build strong relationships with key internal stakeholders, as well as external partners§Continually enhance and elevate the value the Corporate Affairs team delivers§About you§We're looking for a dynamic communications and public affairs professional who is capable at delivering in a hands-on setting. With experience across both internal and external communications, you'll bring a self-driven, results-focused mindset, as well as a well-developed media network and the confidence to navigate an exciting, complex business.§6+ years' experience in corporate communications, either inhouse or agency§Proven experience in both internal and external communications, from strategy to implementation§Able to think strategically while also delivering operationally§Passionate storyteller, able to tailor messages which resonate with target audiences and develop content across a variety of channels§Digitally-savvy§Strong stakeholder management and influencing skills across internal and external stakeholders§Solid understanding of the NZ media and Government; comfortable and capable dealing with the media§Experienced in issues management, including identifying potential reputational risks, mitigating and managing§Able to work in a fast-paced environment, calm under pressure and can juggle multiple tasks without dropping the ball§Exceptional communication skills, including written, presentation, video and verbal skills§Self-driven team player with attention to detail§Tertiary qualification in communication, journalism, PR, media or related field§If this sounds like the opportunity that you are looking for then apply now!§§§§

jobTitle: Communications Advisor - Mount Wellington Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50633673.txt	§Communications Advisor - Mount Wellington§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications Advisor - Mount Wellington§§Advertiser: §T&G Global§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Here at T&G Global we're passionate about growing healthier futures through fresh fruit and vegetables. Our story began over 120 years ago as Turners and Growers, and today our 2,500 people are located in 13 countries, where we grow and partner with passionate growers to market, sell and distribute nutritious fresh produce to consumers and customers in over 60 countries.§Like you, we love our food and we're constantly exploring and investing in innovative ways to build great brands, win in key global markets and lead Aotearoa's fresh produce future - and we'll do this guided by kaitiakitanga.§It's through our people that we'll deliver our ambitious strategy and bring our purpose to life. We're creating an environment which maximises everyone's ability to thrive and deliver, and we're looking for someone to join our Corporate Affairs team who can embody our mindsets of: grounded, resilient, open and winning; is passionate about taking ownership of their role; and wants to make a positive difference.§About the position§Reporting to the Head of Corporate Affairs, you'll help bring T&G Global to life for our people, growers, customers, stakeholders and communities. You will support the planning, administration and delivery of the internal and external communications strategy, with a particular focus on:§Producing engaging and effective content, including written, video and digital§Taking a lead role in the ongoing evolution of our intranet, including generating and uploading content, driving engagement, site enhancements§Supporting the maintenance and ongoing development of our corporate website so it delivers a great experience§Helping manage our corporate social media channels, including postings, community management and analytics§Supporting our community engagement by helping deliver the Healthy Community pillar of our kaitiakitanga strategy§Monitoring the media and business landscape for opportunities, coverage and potential risks§About you§To be successful in this role you'll have a positive attitude, enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, and have/be:§One to three years communications experience, either inhouse or agency§Passionate storyteller, experienced in digital content production i.e. filming and editing videos§Experience in internal and external communications§Strong written and verbal communication skills§Digitally savvy, with demonstrated social media skills§Willing to pitch in and contribute across different work areas§Dynamic, proactive and enthusiastic, with a lot of initiative and curiosity§Exceptional time management skills to manage multiple projects§Ability to build relationships with a diverse range of stakeholders§If this sounds like you the apply now!§§§§

jobText: TXT/50633882.txt	§Campaign Producer - Digitas Affinity ID§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Campaign Producer - Digitas Affinity ID§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Company Description§  §Digitas Affinity ID is the leading data-driven marketing and customer engagement specialist serving some of New Zealand’s largest organisations. Our track record in delivering business growth for clients is enabled through our fusion of smart thinking, intuition and technology.  With a staff of over 35 technically savvy people and data at the heart of everything we do - we stand well apart from the traditional agency model.§  §Job Description§  §Produce marketing campaigns to meet client requirements.§  §What you will do § § §Use our platform and Salesforce Marketing Cloud to deliver campaigns by email, SMS and social media§ §Experience in HTML email building§ §Experience in SQL§ §Use of AMPscript in SFMC§ §Provide troubleshooting capabilities for client campaigns and solutions§ §Understand the impact of data loading and apply to work in progress§ §Provide well thought-out, concise and timely oral and written communication§ §Build effective relationships with other departments to achieve delivery of solutions for clients§ §Proactively initiate, develop and maintains effective working relationships with team members§ §Demonstrate the ability to cooperate with a variety of people and achieve results§ §About you § § §Existing experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud is ideal§ §Interest in Digital marketing  § §Ability to work under pressure and meet agreed deadlines§ §Flexible and adaptable to changing environments§ §Energy, enthusiasm and a positive can do attitude, with a desire to progress§ §Ability to take ownership of issues § §Strong attention to detail§ §Our offer to you § § §A collaborative, fun and rewarding team culture where collaboration is key § §All the benefits of being part of a global network with a Wholeself program, Learning & Development opportunities, flexible working and an industry leading parental leave policy  § §Confidential 24 hour support via our employee assistance programme.§ §Additional Information§  §Publicis Groupe, believes that our people are our greatest asset. Our people are chosen for their personalities, their ethics and professional qualities without any exclusion, preferential treatment or discrimination. We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer and do not discriminate by reason of age, gender, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, nationality, religion or disability or any other difference. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals and will provide appropriate assistance for candidates with disabilities or special needs throughout the recruitment process upon request. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Assistant Brand Manager - Luxury & Beauty Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50634214.txt	§Assistant Brand Manager - Luxury & Beauty§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Assistant Brand Manager - Luxury & Beauty§§Advertiser: §Cosmax Prestige NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Brand Management§§§§§§This newly created role is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for a Marketing Specialist to work across some of the world’s most prestigious brands in luxury and beauty.§ § §Work on prestigious brands§ §A great opportunity for a Marketing Assistant/Co-ordinator to step up§ §Be part of a growing company with great culture§ §Assist in the development and evolution of brands, championing their causes and celebrating their successes§ § §  §About us:§  §Cosmax is one of the Australasia’s leading independent importers and distributors of prestige fragrances, cosmetics and luxurious goods.§  §Located in St Johns, Auckland, Cosmax Prestige Brands has an enviable brand portfolio consisting of luxurious goods brands such as Montblanc, prestige cosmetics brands Guerlain and Shiseido, designer fragrance brands including Acqua di Parma; Dolce &Gabbana, Rochas, Narciso Rodriguez, Coach and Jimmy Choo.§  § §  §About the Role:§  §We are looking for an experienced Marketing specialist to help develop and implement effective brand-building strategies and digital marketing activities. This newly created role is an opportunity to work across prestigious brands in beauty and luxury goods, specifically Guerlain; Montblanc and other incoming new brands.§  §Your goal will be to increase sales and brand awareness through the management of effective marketing plans and campaigns. Reporting to the NZ Business Manager, you will assist with§ § §Development of brands and marketing strategies for brand awareness§ §Optimising marketing and promotional campaigns with a focus on the digital landscape§ §Production of marketing, promotional and POS materials§ §Analysing brand performance, campaigns, competitors’ activities, and consumer trends to provide recommendations for brand development§ §Tracking budgets, pricing and forecasting, product and range optimisation§ §Presentation and execution of creative ideas for marketing activities pertaining to brand building§ §Liaise with retailers to ensure the plans are articulated according to brand standards and complete submissions for their marketing campaigns§ §Reporting to brand holders/suppliers with appropriate analysis§ § §  §About You:§  §As a creative marketer, you can help develop strategies, plans & execute marketing campaigns.  You are a digital savvy and have a passion for online marketing and social media.   Your confident, positive manner, energetic, and “can do” attitude are a given. You will need to be extremely focused and have an eye for detail, with exemplary Microsoft Suite skills as you will work inside Excel and PowerPoint daily.§  §An analytical mind and research skills are essential to this job. If you are also an excellent communicator and team player, we would like to meet you.§  §Key Experience we are looking for:§ § §Business, Commerce or Marketing degree§ §3-5 years’ Marketing experience (beauty and luxury goods industry preferred but not essential)§ §Strong commercial awareness and acumen – passionate about analysing numbers and being able to understand business financials§ §Strong PowerPoint and Excel skills, along with digital media experience including social media (essential), experience with SAP (desirable)§ §Experience in marketing products across digital and social media (desirable)§ §Excellent interpersonal and top notch written & verbal communication skills§ §Strong organisation and multi-tasking skills§ § §  §This is an excellent opportunity to join a dynamic NZ company with a diverse and exciting portfolio of luxury, beauty and fragrance brands.§  §If you have the skills and creativity we need then please apply in confidence with your current resume by the closing date of Sunday, 4th October 2020.§  §Only applicants with the right to legally live and work in NZ are eligible to apply for this role.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a brand manager?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Have you worked in a role where you were responsible for budget management & forecasting?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Corporate Affairs Partner Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50634894.txt	§Corporate Affairs Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Corporate Affairs Partner§§Advertiser: §The Warehouse Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Public Relations & Corporate Affairs§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Corporate Affairs Partner §      §        §The Warehouse is the brand that began it all. Founded in 1982 by Sir Stephen Tindall, the first ‘red shed’ challenged established retailers and proved popular with customers as a result of its simple style, and wide range of products at bargain prices. The Warehouse Group has since become a Kiwi household name and continued to evolve to a group of brands, with team members and stores nationwide. We proudly continue to live our purpose of ‘Helping Kiwis live better every day”.§        §A role with lots of scope, variety and opportunity to get into the thick of the organisation, we’re seeking a multi-talented communications professional to join our in-house communications team.§        §The Role§        §We’ve continued to transform and have gone agile, and the business at an exciting point in its life story! Reporting to the Corporate Affairs Chapter Lead, this role will see you provide that pivotal support to the business, to help us achieve our business objectives, bring to life the business strategy and drive meaningful engagement.§        §Develop, lead and implement our communications plans and community activities through our corporate and social channels! You’ll use your digital and PR/media nous to craft impactful content and messaging that resonates deeply with our audiences.  Layer that with effective media relations management, taking into account risks and opportunities to communicate our story and messaging. You’ll champion our brand, tell our stories and represent the values of our organisation§        §Take ownership of some incredibly diverse set of cross-functional communications led initiatives and workstreams in our multi-brand, complex and dynamic environment. You’ll influence, collaborate and partner right across the business and can easily engage at all levels and inspire through thoughtful communications and creating experiences that will drive our teams forward through clear, shared values and sense of purpose.§        § §        §About You§        §Working with our highly passionate and talented in-house comms team, all equally adaptable to the full comms mix, we’re looking for a true, well-rounded communications professional with 5+ years’ proven experience in a large corporate environment (and perhaps working agency-side within corporate PR). You can easily turn your hand to the full communications scope. You can make the complex simple and communicate across a diverse audience. A confident writer, with proven experience in media relations and strengths in creating engaging brand and content driven pieces of work will be a great advantage!§        §You partner and build trust quickly - we will rely on your excellent stakeholder and relationship management skills as you hit the ground running in this role working cross-functionally with a range of stakeholders at all levels.§        §Your drive to contribute whilst taking ownership means you work effectively, both independently and collaboratively to deliver your best work. Your innate curiosity drives your need to find the best approaches, coupled with your resilience to adapt quickly to our fast-paced retail environment will put you in great stead.§        § §        §Additional information§        §We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment working with likeminded people within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. The business is at an exciting point in its life story! By empowering our teams and increasing cross-collaboration, we aim to make TWG New Zealand’s best place to work! §      §    §    §twg.co.nz§  §§§The Warehouse is the brand that began it all. Founded in 1982 by Sir Stephen Tindall, the first ‘red shed’ challenged established retailers and proved popular with customers as a result of its simple style, and wide range of products at bargain prices. The Warehouse Group has since become a Kiwi household name and continued to evolve to a group of brands, with team members and stores nationwide. We proudly continue to live our purpose of ‘Helping Kiwis live better every day”.§ §A role with lots of scope, variety and opportunity to get into the thick of the organisation, we’re seeking a multi-talented communications professional to join our in-house communications team.§ §The Role§ §We’ve continued to transform and have gone agile, and the business at an exciting point in its life story! Reporting to the Corporate Affairs Chapter Lead, this role will see you provide that pivotal support to the business, to help us achieve our business objectives, bring to life the business strategy and drive meaningful engagement.§ §Develop, lead and implement our communications plans and community activities through our corporate and social channels! You’ll use your digital and PR/media nous to craft impactful content and messaging that resonates deeply with our audiences.  Layer that with effective media relations management, taking into account risks and opportunities to communicate our story and messaging. You’ll champion our brand, tell our stories and represent the values of our organisation§ §Take ownership of some incredibly diverse set of cross-functional communications led initiatives and workstreams in our multi-brand, complex and dynamic environment. You’ll influence, collaborate and partner right across the business and can easily engage at all levels and inspire through thoughtful communications and creating experiences that will drive our teams forward through clear, shared values and sense of purpose.§ § § §About You§ §Working with our highly passionate and talented in-house comms team, all equally adaptable to the full comms mix, we’re looking for a true, well-rounded communications professional with 5+ years’ proven experience in a large corporate environment (and perhaps working agency-side within corporate PR). You can easily turn your hand to the full communications scope. You can make the complex simple and communicate across a diverse audience. A confident writer, with proven experience in media relations and strengths in creating engaging brand and content driven pieces of work will be a great advantage!§ §You partner and build trust quickly - we will rely on your excellent stakeholder and relationship management skills as you hit the ground running in this role working cross-functionally with a range of stakeholders at all levels.§ §Your drive to contribute whilst taking ownership means you work effectively, both independently and collaboratively to deliver your best work. Your innate curiosity drives your need to find the best approaches, coupled with your resilience to adapt quickly to our fast-paced retail environment will put you in great stead.§ § § §Additional information§ §We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment working with likeminded people within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. The business is at an exciting point in its life story! By empowering our teams and increasing cross-collaboration, we aim to make TWG New Zealand’s best place to work! §§§§

jobTitle: eCommerce Product Owner Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50635621.txt	§eCommerce Product Owner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§eCommerce Product Owner§§Advertiser: §MageBinary Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Product Management & Development§§§§§§About MageBinary§  §At MageBinary we work closely with global retailers and emerging brands delivering Ecommerce sites on Magento and Odoo platforms. We own and develop a range of disruptive SaaS products internally.§  §We are reinventing the way software development teams use Agile to meet business aims. Our customers love this new approach that is based on the future of work and sharing economy principles.§  §We offer our customers a wide range of Ecommerce services from UX and UI design, frontend & backend development, technical planning, integration, payments and security, and provide support services & server infrastructure optimisation.§  §About the role §  §We are looking for an Ecommerce & digital Strategy Consultant and team player, who is passionate about communicating digital visions, ideas and features, acts as primary liaison for our clients and plans, guides and consults our customers on their journey developing their success story with the help of MageBinary’s products & services.§  §We are implementing new ways of working and are looking for someone who is happy to work in a decentralised business as we have a No Boss policy.§  §You will be a critical part of the new way we work with customers as you will be responsible for managing customer expectations by setting monthly roadmaps, grooming the task backlog and managing our priorities and internal roadmap. Your ability to work with business owners and corporate stakeholders using a language they understand will ensure your success in this role.§  §We are looking for someone with a strong Ecommerce, marketing and/or design background who loves building new technology and enjoys driving business development, marketing and customer communication as a Product Owner in a decentralised business and flexible work environment.§  §You will be working closely with the Scrum Master and Agile Strategist and a leading development team who utilise modern web technologies to enable digital outcomes. This role allows you to use the full range of your Ecommerce, design and marketing experience in delivering business outcomes.§  §As our Ecommerce Marketing Strategist, you will:§ § §Act as the primary Liaison to our customers and as Product Owner, Ecommerce and Marketing Strategist, responsible for on time and within budget delivery as well as for the overall customer experience.§ §Own our communication with internal and external stakeholders, including customers, business managers and the development team ensuring goals are clear and the vision is aligned with business objectives.§ §Constantly review and plan roadmaps with our clients and develop and define strategies and tactics for their Ecommerce websites or business systems.§ §Generate great content and content strategy for our clients while managing their involvement and expectations in every step of the delivery process.§ §Develop new strategies, features, plans and guides for new and existing customers to improve their Ecommerce Business performance.§ §Consult our customers helping them to define a vision/path to achieve successful project implementations and develop high value user stories. § §Develop product marketing programs and multimedia collateral to support lead generation. You will play an important part in pre-sales engagement and in contributing to product capability.§ §Have a healthy tension with the Scrum Master prioritizing the backlog and closely collaborate with our internal teams to create digital Ecommerce solutions and services and optimize user experience and landing pages.§ §Own and run the monthly roadmap planning sessions for 10-15 customers and review the story scope and backlog with the customer.§ §Manage the product backlog and work alone side the Scrum Master, development teams and our clients to work out short, mid and long-term backlog refinements and roadmaps.§ §Own and drive our backlog refinement and roadmap meetings with our team and the client to work out innovative and best suitable ideas for our clients. Proactively drive customer interaction informing on service delivery progress, status and backlog refinements on a regular basis.§ §Host our daily stand-up meetings, sprint demos and retrospectives as stand-in.§ §Take ownership of JIRA and Confluence for your business area.§ §Undertake situational reviews based on metrics to improve the efficiency of people, systems and processes and look for ways to improve productivity in the business process.§ §Identify ways of providing our customers with new insights and values, though you are not responsible for sales.§ §Digital Marketing§ § §Plan and execute all digital marketing, including SEO/SEM, marketing database, email and design, build and maintain our social media presence and advertising campaigns.§ §Measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs).§ §Plan, execute, and measure experiments and conversion tests.§ §Instrument conversion points and optimize user funnels.§ §Collaborate with agencies and other vendor partners.§ §Business Performance, Development and Innovation§ § §Define high-level perspective to define goals and create a vision for development projects.§ §As product owner utilize your competitive analysis experience to develop insight into how we can strengthen our product-to-market fit.§ §Identify trends and insights of our operations and optimize spend and performance based on the insights and provide thought leadership and perspective for adoption where appropriate.§ §Utilize strong analytical ability to evaluate end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touch points.§ §Constantly anticipate client needs based on your knowledge, our way of working and your experience.§ §Evaluate emerging technologies and identify areas of opportunity for growth and efficiency in E-commerce, brainstorm new and creative growth strategies for MageBinary and our clients accordingly.§ §Maximise value and effectively deliver the best outcomes across projects.§ §Own the customer interaction process including procedures, SLA and story sizing introduction sessions, ensure that UAT is operated as smooth as possible and translate technical terms, procedures and schemes to our clients.§ §Help to organise internal product development and business operations projects, define strategic project themes and support us in resource planning forecasts.§ §Act as a business leader to make improvements that deliver business values.§ §About you:§  §This is a multifaceted role that would suit someone with a mixture of marketing and product/software development experience who can think strategically and deliver polished Ecommerce Web projects.§ § §BS/MS degree in marketing or a related field.§ §Proven working experience in digital marketing and with Ecommerce or online products.§ §Up-to-date knowledge of the latest trends and best practices in online marketing and measurements.§ §At least two years of web development and E-commerce experience.§ §Strong analytical skills and data-driven thinking – you use data to develop and support decisions.§ §Strong interpersonal skills to liaise with a wide cross-section of company teams.§ §Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal and excellent presentation skills, you are easy to understand.§ §Strong organisational, project management and administrative skills.§ §Confidence in converting technical features into business value propositions.§ §You have experience of Agile gained in a Product Company or Agency environment.§ §You can translate customer requirements into roadmaps, features and user stories.§ §You understand how to facilitate work outcomes in groups of stakeholders with unique or competing objectives.§ §Understanding of Content Management Systems (CMS) and experience with Google Analytics or similar web analytics tools and knowledge of SEO best practices.§ §Experience with marketing software products, particularly targeting product features/benefits to different audiences.§ §Experience with data-driven marketing, user research and in in content marketing.§ §Demonstrable experience leading and managing SEO/SEM, marketing database, email, social media and/or display advertising campaigns.§ §Experience in setting up and optimizing Google Adwords campaigns.§ §Highly creative with experience in identifying target audiences and devising digital campaigns that engage, inform and motivate.§ §Experience in optimizing landing pages and user funnels and with A/B and multivariate experiments.§ §Solid knowledge of website analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, NetInsight, Omniture, WebTrends).§ §Working knowledge of ad serving tools (e.g., DART, Atlas).§ §Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development and constraints.§ §Versed in creating visual content, copywriting and developing compelling and informative copies for online marketing outputs (social media, eDMs, blog posts, website copy etc.).§ §Experience with pricing analysis to support the development of pricing strategies.§ §Experience working with large clients and central government agencies.§ §You love the web and can pick up technical information quickly and have a good understanding of web development and the web industry.§ §You are open to learning about new ways of working and are happy to be accountable for delivering measurable results.§ §You have experience working with Jira and Confluence.§ §Skills and experience required:§ § §You are be able to demonstrate a track record of developing relationships with senior client decision-makers and negotiating outcomes with customers.§ §You have either used Ecommerce applications, have been part of an Ecommerce team, or have experience in the development of Ecommerce services.§ §You have experience in developing software development roadmaps to improve systems with automation.§ §You are experienced in coordinating work within Agile teams and frameworks and in taking ownership of the outcome of your work.§ §You are experienced in managing large-scale projects.§ §You have good empathy, diplomacy, verbal and written communication skills, particularly across disciplines.§ §You work well in a flexible working environment and act responsibly.§ §Bonus points for:§ § §Experience working as Product Owner in an agile framework.§ §Experience introducing Agile to customers who have never experienced Agile previously.§ §Background in the SaaS industry where you have worked with Open Source Software, especially with Magento and Odoo.§ §Previous involvement in Business Modernisation / Digitisation projects.§ §You have some type of Agile certification or PMP / Prince and Agile Experience.§ §You have a technical background and understand code, though you are not necessarily a developer.§ §Professional and personal characteristics:§ § §Your style of work is transparent, reliable and structured and you are always on time.§ §You act with ambition and know how to ask for help.§ §You are proactive and able to use your initiative.§ §You are comfortable working on your own, able to self-start and be self-motivated to achieve mutually agreed company aims.§ §You work well under pressure and adapt well to changing timelines or scopes, are naturally curios and drive towards self-improvement.§ §You are self-directed and take ownership of your role - you have an “I’ve got this” attitude.§ §You thrive in a team-driven, fast-paced work environment — your team can rely on you to pitch in and help them get over the line every time.§ §What we offer:§ § §We have an office in Milford where you don't pay for parking or sit in rush hour traffic to get to work.§ §The beach is within walking distance, and it's easy to pop into the supermarket or mall if you need something.§ §Our office overlooks a lovely aesthetic, and you won't believe it but our back door is the local pub.§ §You get to work on the latest technology with a modern development environment with a forward-thinking team.§ §We have a flexible working environment, work the hours in the day you are most productive or come in after you drop the kids at school.§ §We have a no boss policy; we each play our role in achieving company goals, we operate a flat structure and are exploring decentralised models of work.§ §We donate our time & knowledge to work with causes that matter.§ §You can bring your whole self to work; we have a diverse and inclusive working environment.§ §We invest in your career identity and ensure you enjoy your work.§ §We offer health insurance and financial planning advice.§ §If you are interested in working for MageBinary as Ecommerce Marketing Strategist, please send your application to §apply@magebinary.com§.§  §We are looking forward to receiving your application!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of project management experience do you have?§How many years' experience do you have working in an agile environment?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Have you worked in a role where you had team and or line management responsibility?§§§

jobTitle: Digital Marketer Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50637762.txt	§Digital Marketer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketer§§Advertiser: §Radix Nutrition Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§26 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§§About Us§ § § §Radix Nutrition is focused on a breakthrough concept for personalised nutrition. Focused upon delivering unprecedented levels of nutritional values and ultimate simplicity for the customer from an open and honest brand they can trust.§ §The key to making this possible is our innovative product format. Utilizing state of the art freeze-drying technology, Radix manufactures a finished product that is nutritious, lightweight and shelf stable. Our product can be transported anywhere and prepared within a few minutes using nothing more than water.§ §Radix has successfully worked with private customers, teams and organisations ranging from the everyday person looking for a healthy meal, specialized dietary requirements or through to some of New Zealand's highest performing athletes. Everyone can gain from nutrition.§ § § §Want to learn more about Radix?§ §Please view our website and content to learn more about Radix and our mission.§ §https://www.radixnutrition.com§ §https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mv5rwgC_7W4&t=7s§ §https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mPw-RDRMgx0§ §https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oWAPWt04QGc&t=10s§ § § §About the role§ § § §As a Digital Marketing Specialist, your goal is to drive e-commerce sales across New Zealand, Australia and soon Europe. You will use the Google stack and in addition to social media and other platforms.§ §Your role will be to create, manage and optimise campaigns, continually striving for high performance and new opportunities. You'll report on performance to the rest of the marketing team and develop and test ideas alongside them.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §You'll have proven experience and effectiveness in digital marketing and a highly developed understanding of e-commerce. You'll need to be very familiar with Google Suite and running PPC campaigns.§ §You'll also be effective in using other digital channels such as Facebook & Instagram with a great understanding of how these are used to play a key role in an effective sales funnel.§ § §Effective at driving e-commerce sales with 3+ years of proven experience.§ §Proven experience in creating and optimising advertising across Google marketing platforms, Facebook advertising, and other services.§ §Analytically minded, skilled in reporting, and putting forwards ideas for improvement.§ §Experience with Shopify.§ § § §How to Apply§ § § §Please include a cover letter telling us who you are, what excites you about this role, and why you feel you may be the right fit!§ §You may apply via seek or by sending this information to us directly at careers@radixnutrition.com we will be in touch. § §Good luck and we look forward to hearing from you! § §Sincerely,§ §The Team at Radix.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Which of the following online advertising methods do you have experience with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: ECOYA Digital Manager (Maternity Contract) Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50638410.txt	§ECOYA Digital Manager (Maternity Contract)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§ECOYA Digital Manager (Maternity Contract)§§Advertiser: §Trilogy International Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§ROLE SUMMARY:§ We are looking for an experienced, progressive and passionate digital marketing professional to play a key role in the ECOYA team to drive our online sales and brand awareness.§ You will be expected to support future developments in the digital space such as our, our trade portal, loyalty program development, market place initiatives and other digital projects which will help make a significant “step change” for the brand.§ We are looking for someone who thrives on rolling up their sleeves and working in the detail of the online business, across all digital marketing initiatives, online store admin set up and maintenance, digital marketing budget administration and performance evaluation.  Your analytical and commercial nous and the ability to recommend actions based on insights gained will be very important.§ This is a great opportunity for someone who thrives in an unstructured, fast and entrepreneurial environment, to work with the ECOYA team to continue to grow the brand specifically in Australia and New Zealand as well as overseas markets (UK & IE) where necessary.  The key abilities that we will be looking for include:§ § §A minimum experience of 3 years in the digital marketing space.§ §Experience interacting / managing online platforms such as Shopify (preferred).§ §Experience working with the Google suite - Google Analytics, Search Console, Google My Business – planning and executing SEO, SEM and Google Shopping programs (Merchant Centre, Merchant App).§ §Experience working with social platforms – Facebook (Facebook Business), Instagram and other evolving social platforms.§ §Experience with digital marketing tools – re-marketing, loyalty, subscription (Klaviyo would be an advantage).§ §Experience developing, implementing and monitoring other digital marketing programs – campaigns, EDMs, loyalty, etc.§ §Experience evaluating performance of varied campaigns / initiatives.§ §Experience working with creative driven brands in the online space.  § § The successful candidate will be highly responsive and able to judge and make independent calls to ensure we maximise our impact and protect the brand online. You will instinctively know when to jump on an opportunity and make it happen without delay, so we stay relevant and connected to our consumers.§   § This role is a full-time, 14 month fixed-term maternity cover contract position based in Britomart, Auckland.§ §KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:§ §Online Marketing, Website & Mobile Marketing§ § §Implementation and optimisation of the ECOYA online and mobile sites – ensuring our website is considered a ‘best in class’ experience for our consumers.§ §Management and execution of the online marketing calendar and content plans – in collaboration with the marketing team -§ §Online budget planning, forecasting and management.§ §Management and execution for UX, SEO, & ‘always on’ and digital marketing campaigns. Tracking results and implementing winning strategies based on key learnings.§ §Responsible for monthly sales targets and analytics§ §Be highly motivated, collaborative and organised – working seamlessly with the wider marketing and sales teams to implement online campaigns.§ §Manage, execute and measure success of email campaigns. § §Drive brand equity strategies online across all social and digital channels.§ §Partner with PR/Comms Manager to leverage earned media opportunities e.g. key influencers/bloggers.§ §Develop consumer loyalty and subscription programmes.§ §Be responsible for the monthly reporting dashboard – recommend changes in tactics based on findings.  Tweak the reports to ensure they stay relevant.§ §Be the voice of ECOYA online, communicating our brand personality and values.  You will have excellent online creative and copywriting skills you will be writing content for our site, blogs, EDM and other social content.§ §Grow database and site/mobile visitor audiences and drive engagement across both channels.§ §Bring digital innovation to the forefront for ECOYA.§ §Drive partnerships online, allowing ECOYA  to leverage like for like networks aligned to our brand values.§ § §KEY EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED:§ § §You have 3+ years in a Digital role with e-Commerce sales and consumer branded website responsibilities.§ §Have experience managing sites on Shopify Plus (ideally).§ §You will love all things digital – you get the pace of change and love innovating to enhance the consumer experience.§ §An entrepreneurial, can do and open to learn attitude, a doer and a team player.§ §You have a genuine energy and passion for the  ECOYA brand.§ §You are highly capable in project management – to support strategic project implementations.§ §You are user-experience proficient - you will be highly committed to providing the best customer journey and insist upon navigation that ensures that ecoya.com is simple, easy and profitable.§ §You have great experience using marketing software, social media applications and emerging media platforms.§ §You will be proficient in in the Google suite of applications.§ §You have excellent written and oral communication skills to engage with all areas of the business.§ §You are highly analytical & drive a strong ‘test & learn’ philosophy.§ §You will have the ability to handle multiple projects, work to deadlines, and work well under pressure.§ §You are self-motivated and a good team player.§ §You have a high degree of commercial acumen.§ § § THE TEAM:§ The ECOYA team is a small group of passionate and creative self-starters dedicated to building the brand globally. Our entrepreneurial spirit is something we take great pride in and rolling up our sleeves to get things done is second nature. Based in Auckland, we are committed to refining our proposition and listening to our customers. We work hard and celebrate our successes. § § § §ABOUT US: § Founded in 2004 and known for its collection of luxury fragranced soy wax candles, ECOYA has seen significant growth over the last three years. A growing brand presence and effective new product development have been the driving forces in ECOYA’s growth to date. ECOYA has a broad distribution in over 1200 stores and boutiques throughout Australia and New Zealand, including a strong presence in leading Australian department stores. The brand is also focusing on growing existing and new distributor partnerships in international markets.§ For more information on ECOYA please visit www.ecoya.com§ § §ABOUT TIL - Parent Company – www.tilbrands.com§ Trilogy International Limited is the parent company for popular consumer brands Trilogy Natural Products and ECOYA. Performing strongly in their categories, both at home and internationally, Trilogy Natural Products creates specialty natural skincare, and ECOYA manufactures luxury home fragrance products.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

The Marketing Executive will develop campaigns around limited release beers, including all copy, design, print and collateral, and will manage relationships with external agencies to support in campaign development.§ §The Person§ A strong level of experience in a similar role is going to be important, as it is vital that the brand voice maintains consistency across all platforms. We are really looking for demonstrated experience in the running of a company’s presence, both online and other, and a strong ability in design would be fantastic. With relationship management being an important aspect of the role, we are looking for a candidate comfortable dealing with stakeholders at all levels. Our ideal candidate will have an innate curiosity in and passion for industry changes and trends, as well as a desire to help this brand reach new heights.§ Sound like you? With continued growth in their sights, they are now looking for an experienced marketer to help further develop the already well-known brand.§ §The Role§ Reporting to the General Manager, this role will be Brewery based in Nelson and will be responsible for developing and running all marketing activities. There will be a real focus on digital, with the Marketing Executive looking after the website, all social media activities, SEO and all email marketing, as well as feeding campaign performance stats through to the sales team. The Marketing Executive will develop campaigns around limited release beers, including all copy, design, print and collateral, and will manage relationships with external agencies to support in campaign development.§ §The Person§ A strong level of experience in a similar role is going to be important, as it is vital that the brand voice maintains consistency across all platforms. We are really looking for demonstrated experience in the running of a company’s presence, both online and other, and a strong ability in design would be fantastic. With relationship management being an important aspect of the role, we are looking for a candidate comfortable dealing with stakeholders at all levels. jobTitle: Digital Channel Manager Job in Taranaki - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50638881.txt	§Digital Channel Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Channel Manager§§Advertiser: §Egmont Honey Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Egmont Honey are looking for a Digital Channel Manager to join our ever-growing business. The Digital Channel Manager will form an integral part of the Egmont Sales team. Over the years Egmont Honey has experienced phenomenal growth and is now present in 20+ export markets with a very diverse channel mix. The team oversees a growing list of high-profile Manuka Honey accounts and are on the lookout for a talented individual to help grow the digital arm of the business. This is an exciting opportunity for someone to join a young, entrepreneurial company who have shaken up the Manuka industry, and have aspirations to do even more.§  §Purpose of role:§  §Lead Egmont Honey’s digital business unit:§ § §Drive growth within current digital channels: Amazon, Ecommerce UK & NZ.§ §Identify expansion opportunities: E-comm USA§ §Work with design & creative team create an industry leading Social Media presence.§ §Management of consumer data to inform engagement and retargeting efforts.§ §Key responsibilities:§ § §Account manage digital channels (Amazon), from stock monitoring and planning to sales analysis and reporting.§ §Manage current Egmont owned Ecommerce channels, identify opportunities to launch further.§ §Across relevant channels, Implement CRM to build an engaged database of customers.§ §Own current Social Media channels (Instagram & Facebook), work with design and creative teams to plan and execute content plans across various markets, using the most up-to-date techniques and tools.§ §Working with wider marketing team, ensure a steady stream of content creation used as a customer engagement tool across all channels.§ §Qualifications / Memberships:§ § §Bachelor’s degree required.§ §Experience, competencies & skills:§ § §Previous digital marketing experience, FMCG preferred but not essential. Proven development & execution of digital marketing plans.§ §Excellent oral and written communication skills.§ §Experience and knowledge with Ecommerce CMS, e.g. Shopify or similar, to manage and maintain websites.§ §Demonstrable experience planning, executing and reporting on SEO and PPC campaigns, specifically targeted at both direct response sales.§ §Familiarity with customer-facing CRM, and accompanying copywriting experience.§ §Ability to bring together requirements from multiple markets and stakeholders, to build cohesive and coordinated plans.§ §Remuneration to be discussed with the right candidate.§  §If you are interested in this position and think you could be a good fit, please email §will@egmonthoney.co.nz§ with a CV and cover letter.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Communications Professional - Ngaio Whakawhitiwhiti Kōrero Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50638900.txt	§Communications Professional - Ngaio Whakawhitiwhiti Kōrero§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications Professional - Ngaio Whakawhitiwhiti Kōrero§§Advertiser: §Hospice West Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§The Organisation§ §Hospice West Auckland – He rā hou, he orange ngākau, Living Every Moment.§ § § §We are based in the Waitakere Ranges foothills. Our beautiful rugged coastline, tranquil native bush all lay a foundation for a community of diverse cultures and people that weave together to form the wonderful community that is West Auckland.§ § § §We provide compassionate palliative care for our communities, we are accountable to deliver the very best, we are respectful of all that holds true in life, we look for innovative ways to be in all that we do.§ § § §And together – Whakakotahi, we stand as one.  We are westies helping westies§ § § §The Role§ §As a Communications Professional you can plan, develop and implement strategies that promote our public image, services to our patients, their whānau, stakeholders and our employees. You pull your weight and paddle in rhythm with everyone in the Hospice West Auckland Waka.§ § § §In this role you will:  § § §Plan projects and publicity campaigns§ §Write and edit press releases, in-house communications, articles and annual reports§ §Maintain online information about our organisation and its services§ §Keep important internal and external groups of people and financial donors informed about the organisation and its services§ §Research public opinion by doing market research and analysing findings§ §Tell our stories and speak confidently to groups and people from all walks of life§ §Lead a small fundraising team that, with your communications and management skills, will flourish to ensure we meet our fundraising targets§ § § §The Person § §As a Communications professional you will have/be:§ § §Knowledge of digital channels and print media, and how to use them for publicity§ §The ability to write, using good grammar, for different audiences§ §The ability to survey public opinion§ §Some understanding of the health environment and knowledge of Communications and Fundraising in a Charitable Trust environment§ §Demonstratable experience in managing others§ §able to think creatively, strategically and critically§ §able to simplify complex information§ §expert at networking, communicating, and negotiating with people§ §organised, and good at planning and managing projects§ §able to work well under pressure§ §good at researching and presenting.§ § § §Entry requirements§ §You need to have a diploma or degree in areas such as: Public relations; Communications; Media studies; Business studies; or Journalism§ §Preferred Minimum of 3 years’ experience  § §For us, it is not about the quantity of your experience it’s the quality and calibre of that experience and your commitment to your chosen career.§ § § §Useful experience includes:§Journalism or other writing experience§Project management§Marketing§Event management§Any work involving communications and networking§ § §To Apply§ §Call Janet on §0277023901§ to discuss the role further or for the full story go to go to our careers page at: http://hospicewestauckland.recruitmenthub.co.nz/Current-Opportunities & enter ref code: 5225486. Applications close 25 October 2020.  If this is for you, send us your CV and the story of why this role is for you.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Digital Communication Specialist Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50639169.txt	§Digital Communication Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Communication Specialist§§Advertiser: §Blink PR§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§We're looking for someone to join our enthusiastic team of communicators. § §At Blink Public Relations & Marketing we are passionate about storytelling.§ §Blink is a full-service, integrated public relations and strategic communications consultancy based in the heart of the Bay of Plenty – Tauranga city.§ §We strive to understand what makes people tick and how to create messages and connections that make good things happen.§ §We specialise in integrated PR, marketing and digital solutions founded in thoroughly researched, considered and tested approaches.§ §Our passion is for creative writing and communicating in a way that’s clear, fresh, relevant and looking to the future. This breathes life and authenticity into a client’s dialogue, lifting their voice above the crowd.§ §We are looking for a digital communicator with experience in social media and content creation, with relevant qualifications. You will have a strong ability to connect with individuals and as a natural storyteller through both traditional and digital mediums to assume your clients’ unique “voices” in communications. § §A background in or knowledge of social media and/or work in an agency/consultancy setting is helpful, but not a necessity if you are willing to learn.§ §As an account manager at Blink, you would lead (and assist) a range of clients. You would help create and execute meaningful and captivating ideas.§ §We are open to the role being either full or part time, with flexibility, such as partially working from home.§ §It includes a variety of activities, such as:§ § §Social media strategy development and implementation§ §Social media content creation§ §Multiple account management and monitoring § §Developing content for websites, video and social media channels§ §Media engagement (media planning and relationship building)§ §Content management system (CMS) and search engine optimisation (SEO) management § §Document writing (media releases, blogs, newsletters, strategy documents, advertising copy)§ §You will also be:§ § §Passionate about creative writing and clear communication§ §Forward-thinking and flexible in a fast-moving environment§ §Open-minded and respectful of others§ §Strong in your verbal and written communication skills§ §A logical thinker§ §Able to multitask and manage competing demands§ §A confident independent worker who uses initiative§ §A team player, with a 'can-do' attitude and an ability to have fun§ §Blink has a great team culture, and you will be joining a very experienced and open-minded team.§ §So if you’re looking to progress your career in a way that’s fresh, relevant and looking to the future, then apply today.§ §For more information on who we are and what we do, head to www.blinkpr.co.nz§ §Applications close Friday 9 October 2020. §§§§
