jobText: TXT/50639336.txt	§Senior Communications Advisor (Engagement)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Communications Advisor (Engagement)§§Advertiser: §Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Communications Advisor (Engagement) §      §        §We have a great 12 month fixed-term opportunity for an experienced Senior Communications Advisor to join the Engagement team within the Communications & Public Engagement Team of the COVID-19 AOG Response Group in DPMC. The position is suitable for either a secondment or a fixed term contract.§        §New Zealand is pursuing an ambitious COVID-19 elimination strategy. The global pandemic will continue to pose a risk to NZ's economy and society until either effective treatment or until a vaccine is widely disseminated. DPMC is responsible for coordinating and where necessary leading a robust all-of-government response, and building readiness and resilience across New Zealand.§        §Sitting in the engagement team, this role calls for someone who is passionate about getting the right information to the right people in the right ways at the right time. You'll need to thrive in a fluid and fast paced environment and be able to quickly build strong relationships with stakeholders from all walks of life. You'll need initiative, strategic thinking and above all an uncanny ability to get things done.§        §Key responsibilities:§        §          §Assist the Engagement Manager to build and maintain strong and effective relationships with stakeholders across government, local government and the private sector.§          §Coordinate work across the COVID-19 AOG Response Communications and Engagement team to continually improve our ability to respond to resurgence of Covid19.§          §Anticipate issues that might impact the government's response to COVID-19 and work with internal and external stakeholders to develop communications strategies, plans and products to respond to them.§          §Support work to develop and implement effective communications with iwi/Maori, Pacific peoples, CALD communities and disabilities communities.§          §Support the teams from across the COVID-19 AOG Response Group with their communications needs (both internal and external).§          §Ensure that all communications activities give effect to the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi.§        §        §Key requirements:§        §          §A tertiary qualification in communications or other relevant discipline or equivalent experience.§          §Significant strengths in relationship management and strategic communications.§          §Significant senior experience across communications and engagement including working with campaigns and developing content for the full range of communications channels.§          §Demonstrated ability to think analytically and conceptually.§          §Demonstrated ability to prepare, and guide others to prepare, effective written content.§          §Can assimilate new and complex information and provide advice accordingly.§          §Able to be innovative and creative in working through issues and problems as they arise.§          §Shows an awareness of, and commitment to, the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and able to sustain an environment that promotes diversity and inclusion.§          §Demonstrates a knowledge of the government environment.§        §        §Please apply online. We're looking to fill the position as quickly as possible but can be flexible around start dates. For secondment applicants, there may be flexibility around the term of the position and DPMC may be able to cover salary costs by arrangement with the home agency.§        §The application period closes on §11 October 2020.§        §For further information, please contact §libby.clifford@dpmc.govt.nz§ or 022 698 9783§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§We have a great 12 month fixed-term opportunity for an experienced Senior Communications Advisor to join the Engagement team within the Communications & Public Engagement Team of the COVID-19 AOG Response Group in DPMC. The position is suitable for either a secondment or a fixed term contract.§New Zealand is pursuing an ambitious COVID-19 elimination strategy. The global pandemic will continue to pose a risk to NZ's economy and society until either effective treatment or until a vaccine is widely disseminated. DPMC is responsible for coordinating and where necessary leading a robust all-of-government response, and building readiness and resilience across New Zealand.§Sitting in the engagement team, this role calls for someone who is passionate about getting the right information to the right people in the right ways at the right time. You'll need to thrive in a fluid and fast paced environment and be able to quickly build strong relationships with stakeholders from all walks of life. You'll need initiative, strategic thinking and above all an uncanny ability to get things done.§Key responsibilities:§Assist the Engagement Manager to build and maintain strong and effective relationships with stakeholders across government, local government and the private sector.§Coordinate work across the COVID-19 AOG Response Communications and Engagement team to continually improve our ability to respond to resurgence of Covid19.§Anticipate issues that might impact the government's response to COVID-19 and work with internal and external stakeholders to develop communications strategies, plans and products to respond to them.§Support work to develop and implement effective communications with iwi/Maori, Pacific peoples, CALD communities and disabilities communities.§Support the teams from across the COVID-19 AOG Response Group with their communications needs (both internal and external).§Ensure that all communications activities give effect to the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi.§Key requirements:§A tertiary qualification in communications or other relevant discipline or equivalent experience.§Significant strengths in relationship management and strategic communications.§Significant senior experience across communications and engagement including working with campaigns and developing content for the full range of communications channels.§Demonstrated ability to think analytically and conceptually.§Demonstrated ability to prepare, and guide others to prepare, effective written content.§Can assimilate new and complex information and provide advice accordingly.§Able to be innovative and creative in working through issues and problems as they arise.§Shows an awareness of, and commitment to, the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and able to sustain an environment that promotes diversity and inclusion.§Demonstrates a knowledge of the government environment.§Please apply online. jobTitle: Adviser External Assurance Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50639361.txt	§Adviser External Assurance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Adviser External Assurance§§Advertiser: §Department of Corrections§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Public Relations & Corporate Affairs§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Adviser External Assurance §      §        § §        §          §Research, Investigate, Analyse§          §An exciting opportunity to make a positive difference§          §Wellington§        §        §This is an exciting time to join our organisation as we embark on a journey of transformation in line with our bold organisational strategy Hōkai Rangi: one that builds on the good things that are already happening, learns from doing, and, most importantly, innovates to find new and alternative ways of doing things to achieve better outcomes with Māori and their whānau. §        §Mō te tūnga | §About the role§        §Do you enjoy a fast-paced environment? Do you have strong writing, communication and analytical skills? Then come join our team.§        §If you thrive on variety and enjoy being faced with new challenges every day, we have a great opportunity for you! The External Assurance team respond to requests for information from a diverse range of organisations and people. On any given day you may be interacting with the Privacy Commission, the Children's Commission, the office of the Ombudsman, the Human Rights Commission, or the Health and Disability Commission. In order to respond, as the Adviser, External Assurance, you'll act as a super sleuth, consulting across the Department's multiple sites, digging down, asking questions, joining dots and analysing information from internal and external stakeholders. Having gathered all relevant information, your excellent writing skills come to the fore as you provide an official Department response to correspondence.§        § §Mōu | §About you §        §If you are looking for a role that enables you to work with a wide variety of stakeholders, both internally across our complex organisation and externally, this is the role for you. Bring a collaborative working style, and some experience in writing official correspondence, and build a career in an organisation engaged in making life better for people in our care and for all New Zealanders.§        §Ngā pūkenga me ngā wheako | Skills and experience§        §We're looking for someone who thrives on challenge and variety. If this sounds like you and you have:  §        §          §Well-developed oral and written communication skills§          §An investigative, detective-like personality§          §The ability to encourage and lead cooperative efforts§          §A talent for developing and maintaining a broad range of strategic relationships§          §Interest and skill communicating complex issues to a wide range of stakeholders§          §Strong analytical and problem-solving skills§          §Initiative, self-management and desire to achieve team and organisation objectives.  §        §        §The salary range for this role is $67,740 - $95,632. Appointment will be based on skills and experience relevant to the role.  §        §Corrections embraces diversity and is committed to an inclusive workplace.  We recognise and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and celebrate the collective talent of all employees.§        §Mō mātou | §About us§§        §Ara Poutama Aotearoa is a name that has been gifted to us and is our commitment to improving the oranga and safety of the people in our care, whānau, and that of the communities we serve across the motu.  As a values-led organisation, we use the principles of rangatira (leadership), manaaki (respect), wairua (spirituality), kaitiaki (guardianship) and whānau (relationships) to inform how we work and deliver the outcomes outlined in our strategy - Hōkai Rangi (https://arapoutama.page.link/Eit5).§        §It is an exciting time to join us and we continue to seek out talented individuals who are committed to an inclusive, vibrant workplace. Do you have strong writing, communication and analytical skills? Then come join our team.§If you thrive on variety and enjoy being faced with new challenges every day, we have a great opportunity for you! The External Assurance team respond to requests for information from a diverse range of organisations and people. On any given day you may be interacting with the Privacy Commission, the Children's Commission, the office of the Ombudsman, the Human Rights Commission, or the Health and Disability Commission. In order to respond, as the Adviser, External Assurance, you'll act as a super sleuth, consulting across the Department's multiple sites, digging down, asking questions, joining dots and analysing information from internal and external stakeholders. Having gathered all relevant information, your excellent writing skills come to the fore as you provide an official Department response to correspondence.§ §Mōu | §About you §§If you are looking for a role that enables you to work with a wide variety of stakeholders, both internally across our complex organisation and externally, this is the role for you. We recognise and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals, and that of the collective talent in our whānau.§ §Tono ināianei | Apply Now§To apply, submit your§ tailored CV and a cover letter (PDF)§ describing your motivation for wanting to join Ara Poutama and highlighting your relevant skills, experience and personal qualities essential to this role. §For reporting and transparency, it is important that all applications are submitted through our careers site.  If you want to find out more about a career with us, visit §careers.corrections.govt.nz§ or email our team at §careers@corrections.govt.nz§.§§§§

jobTitle: Communications Advisor (NTH) Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50639870.txt	§Communications Advisor (NTH)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications Advisor (NTH)§§Advertiser: §Te Runanga o Ngai Tahu§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Internal Communications§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Communications Advisor (NTH) §      §      §    §    §      §        §Permanent, Full Time§Ōtautahi / Christchurch§        §Our high-performing, busy team is looking for a passionate communications advisor who has experience providing quality communications, storytelling and engagement advice.§        §Ngāi Tahu is a highly reputable, thriving iwi organisation, striving to enrich the lives of current and future generations. We've got a lot of compelling stories to tell internally and externally, a diverse and interesting audience, and plenty of exciting communications projects coming our way. This role is focused on the commercial arm of our business, Ngāi Tahu Holdings, and its business units following a change in the way we deliver our service across the Group.§        §Reporting to the Manager - Communications & Public Relations, you'll work closely with Ngāi Tahu Holdings to tell stories and create communications for internal and external audiences. This role covers a wide scope, including providing corporate communications advice and support, handling media enquiries, creating and implementing communications plans, coordinating projects, building and managing complex relationships, and writing engaging content for multiple channels.§        §We are looking for a talented and driven individual with:§        §          §3 years' experience in a communications advisory role§          §A bachelor's degree in communications or journalism§          §Experience managing media queries§          §The ability to write high quality, engaging content across multiple platforms§          §Experience in providing timely communications and media advice§          §Exceptional time management skills and ability to meet deadlines in a complex environment§          §Strong written and verbal communication skills§          §Strong attention to detail with the ability to proofread and edit content§          §Excellent collaboration skills in a team environment§          §Familiarity with the Treaty of Waitangi and its application to the work of Te Rūnanga o Ngāi Tahu.§        §        §The successful applicant will have a strong awareness of and affinity for the needs and aspirations of our ultimate stakeholders, Ngāi Tahu whānui. Alongside this, it is important that they have the ability and willingness to learn and engage in te reo Māori, tikanga and our organisation's values.§        §In return we offer:§        §A unique opportunity to work for a thriving iwi organisation. We pride ourselves on being a values-led organisation, investing in the professional development of our employees alongside offering cultural development opportunities.§        §The Office of Te Rūnanga o Ngāi Tahu is a dynamic organisation that exists to ensure that the benefits of the Settlement are enjoyed by Ngāi Tahu whānui now and for future generations §"Mō tātou, ā, mō kā uri ā muri ake nei" (for us and our children after us).§        §Apply now or for confidential enquiries place contact §Jo Gilbert§ at Jo.Gilbert@ngaitahu.iwi.nz §        §Nau mai, haere mai, tauti mai!§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Permanent, Full Time§Ōtautahi / Christchurch§ §Our high-performing, busy team is looking for a passionate communications advisor who has experience providing quality communications, storytelling and engagement advice.§ §Ngāi Tahu is a highly reputable, thriving iwi organisation, striving to enrich the lives of current and future generations. We've got a lot of compelling stories to tell internally and externally, a diverse and interesting audience, and plenty of exciting communications projects coming our way. This role is focused on the commercial arm of our business, Ngāi Tahu Holdings, and its business units following a change in the way we deliver our service across the Group.§ §Reporting to the Manager - Communications & Public Relations, you'll work closely with Ngāi Tahu Holdings to tell stories and create communications for internal and external audiences. This role covers a wide scope, including providing corporate communications advice and support, handling media enquiries, creating and implementing communications plans, coordinating projects, building and managing complex relationships, and writing engaging content for multiple channels.§ §We are looking for a talented and driven individual with:§ § §3 years' experience in a communications advisory role§ §A bachelor's degree in communications or journalism§ §Experience managing media queries§ §The ability to write high quality, engaging content across multiple platforms§ §Experience in providing timely communications and media advice§ §Exceptional time management skills and ability to meet deadlines in a complex environment§ §Strong written and verbal communication skills§ §Strong attention to detail with the ability to proofread and edit content§ §Excellent collaboration skills in a team environment§ §Familiarity with the Treaty of Waitangi and its application to the work of Te Rūnanga o Ngāi Tahu.§ §The successful applicant will have a strong awareness of and affinity for the needs and aspirations of our ultimate stakeholders, Ngāi Tahu whānui. Alongside this, it is important that they have the ability and willingness to learn and engage in te reo Māori, tikanga and our organisation's values.§ §In return we offer:§ §A unique opportunity to work for a thriving iwi organisation. We pride ourselves on being a values-led organisation, investing in the professional development of our employees alongside offering cultural development opportunities.§ §The Office of Te Rūnanga o Ngāi Tahu is a dynamic organisation that exists to ensure that the benefits of the Settlement are enjoyed by Ngāi Tahu whānui now and for future generations §"Mō tātou, ā, mō kā uri ā muri ake nei" (for us and our children after us).§ §Apply now or for confidential enquiries place contact §Jo Gilbert§ at Jo.Gilbert@ngaitahu.iwi.nz § §Nau mai, haere mai, tauti mai!§§§§

jobTitle: Social Media Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50640472.txt	§Social Media Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Media Manager§§Advertiser: §Walter & Wild§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Social Media Manager §      §        §Walter & Wild is a New Zealand Food Manufacturing company with a substantial portfolio of iconic brands including Hubbards, I Love Food Co., Aunt Betty’s, Hansell’s, Vitafresh, Greggs, and Alfa One.§        §Our people are critical to our success.§        §We are looking for an experienced §Social Media Manager§ to help us achieve our vision. This role will be responsible for planning, implementing and optimising the social media strategy for our brands in order to increase brand awareness, engagement and spend efficiency. This role will require someone who understands the full spectrum of digital marketing and can drive the business forward in how we understand and capitalise on the online opportunity.§        §Key responsibilities and accountabilities of this role include, but not limited to:§        §          §Develop the social media strategies for our brands that deliver on the objectives set by the Brand Managers. §          §Develop and manage content creation & copy writing (in partnership with in-house and external providers), ensuring content is on brand, appropriate for the channel and optimises working, non-working media splits.§          §Execute and optimise media across digital platforms with a performance marketing approach.§          §Manage and respond to community posts (Community Management); ensuring a timely response in a tone-of-voice (TOV) that is appropriate for the brand.§          §Regularly review activity against targets and industry benchmarks, driving a culture of continuous improvement.§          §Stay up to date with current technologies and trends in social media, design tools and applications.§          §Analyse market trends and competitor activity to identify opportunities for the business to capitalise on.§        §        §To be successful §in§ this role, you will have the following skills, knowledge and experience:§        §          §3+ years’ experience in strategic digital marketing or similar preferred.   §          §Extensive understanding of social media platforms and systems.§          §Relevant tertiary qualification in Marketing/ Business an advantage. §          §FMCG background with experience in content creation would be an advantage. §          §Creative and innovative thinker with excellent verbal and written communication skills who contributes positively to a cooperative team environment.§          §Ability to build strong working relationships with all key internal and external stakeholders.§          §Highly organised with a strong attention to detail.§          §Service orientated attitude with ability to manage workload & deadlines.§        §        §The Box Ticking Stuff:§        §          §Only applicants with the right to work in New Zealand should apply for this role.§          §In line with company policy, applicants will be required to complete pre-employment drug testing and a Criminal Conviction Check.§        §        § §        §Why Walter & Wild (W&W)?§        §Joining us means joining a global organisation with very exciting growth plans.§        §With a fresh approach, we aspire to be the leading innovator, marketer and creators of food in NZ. Whilst our ambitions are big, we do not want to feel big.§        §At Walter & Wild we believe in being fiercely independent and doing what we feel is right and sometimes that means taking the path less travelled.§        §We celebrate and value what makes us different. Having a variety of people who are passionate, innovative, flexible and who know how to have fun is important to us.§        §Basically, what we are trying to say is that Walter & Wild is an awesome place to work full of equally awesome people.§        §Our Values are important to us. It is what makes us Walter & Wild. We are Kind, Loyal, Accountable, Brave, Challengers, and Playful.§        §Please visit our careers website and apply via the following link: https://walterandwild.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=166§        §Please note, this role is being recruited by W&W internal recruitment team only so please apply directly.§      §      §      §    §  §§§Walter & Wild is a New Zealand Food Manufacturing company with a substantial portfolio of iconic brands including Hubbards, I Love Food Co., Aunt Betty’s, Hansell’s, Vitafresh, Greggs, and Alfa One.§  §Our people are critical to our success.§  §We are looking for an experienced §Social Media Manager§ to help us achieve our vision. This role will be responsible for planning, implementing and optimising the social media strategy for our brands in order to increase brand awareness, engagement and spend efficiency. This role will require someone who understands the full spectrum of digital marketing and can drive the business forward in how we understand and capitalise on the online opportunity.§  §Key responsibilities and accountabilities of this role include, but not limited to:§ § §Develop the social media strategies for our brands that deliver on the objectives set by the Brand Managers. § §Develop and manage content creation & copy writing (in partnership with in-house and external providers), ensuring content is on brand, appropriate for the channel and optimises working, non-working media splits.§ §Execute and optimise media across digital platforms with a performance marketing approach.§ §Manage and respond to community posts (Community Management); ensuring a timely response in a tone-of-voice (TOV) that is appropriate for the brand.§ §Regularly review activity against targets and industry benchmarks, driving a culture of continuous improvement.§ §Stay up to date with current technologies and trends in social media, design tools and applications.§ §Analyse market trends and competitor activity to identify opportunities for the business to capitalise on.§ §To be successful §in§ this role, you will have the following skills, knowledge and experience:§ § §3+ years’ experience in strategic digital marketing or similar preferred.   § §Extensive understanding of social media platforms and systems.§ §Relevant tertiary qualification in Marketing/ Business an advantage. § §FMCG background with experience in content creation would be an advantage. § §Creative and innovative thinker with excellent verbal and written communication skills who contributes positively to a cooperative team environment.§ §Ability to build strong working relationships with all key internal and external stakeholders.§ §Highly organised with a strong attention to detail.§ §Service orientated attitude with ability to manage workload & deadlines.§ §The Box Ticking Stuff:§ § §Only applicants with the right to work in New Zealand should apply for this role.§ §In line with company policy, applicants will be required to complete pre-employment drug testing and a Criminal Conviction Check.§ § §  §Why Walter & Wild (W&W)?§  §Joining us means joining a global organisation with very exciting growth plans.§  §With a fresh approach, we aspire to be the leading innovator, marketer and creators of food in NZ. Whilst our ambitions are big, we do not want to feel big.§  §At Walter & Wild we believe in being fiercely independent and doing what we feel is right and sometimes that means taking the path less travelled.§  §We celebrate and value what makes us different. Having a variety of people who are passionate, innovative, flexible and who know how to have fun is important to us.§  §Basically, what we are trying to say is that Walter & Wild is an awesome place to work full of equally awesome people.§  §Our Values are important to us. It is what makes us Walter & Wild. We are Kind, Loyal, Accountable, Brave, Challengers, and Playful.§  §Please visit our careers website and apply via the following link: https://walterandwild.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=166§  §Please note, this role is being recruited by W&W internal recruitment team only so please apply directly.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§§§

invests; and researching new property opportunities.§        §AMP Capital Shopping Centres (AMPCSC) sits within the Real Estate division of AMP Capital Investors, and provides asset, development, and property management expertise to the shopping centres owned and/ or managed by AMP Capital Investor’s various property funds and private clients.§        § §        §The role:§        §An exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced Digital Marketing Executive to join the team at Botany Town Centre.§        §The role is responsible for supporting the Marketing team in developing, managing, and delivering digital assets, centre communication, retailer communication and executing brand aligned partnerships and events with a focus on driving centre traffic and retail sales.§        §The primary areas of focus will be Digital Marketing, Market Intelligence, Retailer Engagement, Centre Communication and Event Delivery.§        §This person will be responsible for managing all of the digital, social, and digital analytics platforms for the centre, including website, EDM, Facebook and Instagram, and their relevant analytics tools.§        § §        §The person:§        §          §Minimum 3 years’ experience in a digital marketing role§          §Proven experience in producing digital strategies and digital project management§          §Customer focus with can do attitude§          §Flexibility and agility when faced with challenging plans and situations§          §Digital technology and social media strategy skills§          §Ability to deliver key initiatives on time§          §Ability to manage upwards and deal with competing workloads§          §Ability to identify key priorities and develop timelines/ critical paths§          §Manage tasks on time and within budget§          §High attention to detail§          §Ability to establish relationships with key business stakeholders§          §Ability to work under pressure§          §Excellent written and verbal communication skills§          §Team player§        §        §Recruitment agencies: please note that we are not seeking assistance on this role. Should we require assistance we may reach out to our network of preferred agency partners once this ad has expired. Be aware that you are not considered engaged on a role until it has been released by Talent Acquisition through our agency portal. We do not pay recruitment fees on candidate profiles/resumes introduced through any other method.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§AMP Capital is a specialist investment manager with offices in Australia, New Zealand, Japan, China, Hong Kong, India, London, Chicago, New York, California, Ireland and the Middle East.  We are a leading global real estate and infrastructure manager and the combination of our scale, breadth and capability provides access to superior investment opportunities for our clients.§The Real Estate team is responsible for managing AMP Capital’s substantial property business. This includes the investment management of AMP capital’s various property portfolios; the day – to – day management of the office, industrial and shopping centre properties in which AMP Capital invests; and researching new property opportunities.§AMP Capital Shopping Centres (AMPCSC) sits within the Real Estate division of AMP Capital Investors, and provides asset, development, and property management expertise to the shopping centres owned and/ or managed by AMP Capital Investor’s various property funds and private clients.§ §The role:§An exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced Digital Marketing Executive to join the team at Botany Town Centre.§The role is responsible for supporting the Marketing team in developing, managing, and delivering digital assets, centre communication, retailer communication and executing brand aligned partnerships and events with a focus on driving centre traffic and retail sales.§The primary areas of focus will be Digital Marketing, Market Intelligence, Retailer Engagement, Centre Communication and Event Delivery.§This person will be responsible for managing all of the digital, social, and digital analytics platforms for the centre, including website, EDM, Facebook and Instagram, and their relevant analytics tools.§ §The person:§§Minimum 3 years’ experience in a digital marketing role§Proven experience in producing digital strategies and digital project management§Customer focus with can do attitude§Flexibility and agility when faced with challenging plans and situations§Digital technology and social media strategy skills§Ability to deliver key initiatives on time§Ability to manage upwards and deal with competing workloads§Ability to identify key priorities and develop timelines/ critical paths§Manage tasks on time and within budget§High attention to detail§Ability to establish relationships with key business stakeholders§Ability to work under pressure§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§Team player§§Recruitment agencies: please note that we are not seeking assistance on this role. and researching new property opportunities.§AMP Capital Shopping Centres (AMPCSC) sits within the Real Estate division of AMP Capital Investors, and provides asset, development, and property management expertise to the shopping centres owned and/ or managed by AMP Capital Investor’s various property funds and private clients.§ §The role:§An exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced Digital Marketing Executive to join the team at Botany Town Centre.§The role is responsible for supporting the Marketing team in developing, managing, and delivering digital assets, centre communication, retailer communication and executing brand aligned partnerships and events with a focus on driving centre traffic and retail sales.§The primary areas of focus will be Digital Marketing, Market Intelligence, Retailer Engagement, Centre Communication and Event Delivery.§This person will be responsible for managing all of the digital, social, and digital analytics platforms for the centre, including website, EDM, Facebook and Instagram, and their relevant analytics tools.§ §The person:§§Minimum 3 years’ experience in a digital marketing role§Proven experience in producing digital strategies and digital project management§Customer focus with can do attitude§Flexibility and agility when faced with challenging plans and situations§Digital technology and social media strategy skills§Ability to deliver key initiatives on time§Ability to manage upwards and deal with competing workloads§Ability to identify key priorities and develop timelines/ critical paths§Manage tasks on time and within budget§High attention to detail§Ability to establish relationships with key business stakeholders§Ability to work under pressure§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§Team player§§Recruitment agencies: please note that we are not seeking assistance on this role. jobTitle: Marketing Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50640729.txt	§Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Cristal Air International Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§About us§ §At HRV we believe everyone should love the feeling of coming home. In fact, since we started in 2003, we've helped over 500,000 Kiwis love the feeling of coming back to a warm, dry home. We provide whole home solutions that improve both Air & Water quality, with Ventilation, Heating, Cooling & Water Filtration products. Since 2017 we have been part of Vector Limited, so you know you have the backing of one of New Zealand's largest companies.§ §About the role§ §In this role as our Marketing Manager, you'll utilise your marketing, design and influencing skills whilst you implement our marketing strategy across all our brands (HRV, EES, Aircon Direct and HVAC Hero). You will work closely with the sales team, franchisees and product development team to help build the core HRV brand to personalise us as the business that is making Kiwi homes healthier. Other key areas of responsibly are -§ § § §Developing communication and marketing programmes that build brand love and support customer retention & loyalty.§ § § §Identifying and implementing tactical promotion ad incentive opportunities, that drive prospect acquisition.§ § §With no two days being the same, this is a great opportunity to get exposure to a national role. There is lots of flexibility in how we develop our brand and implement our marketing activities for new products and services across the group. The successful candidate will be key to driving our new brand communications platform and new business development.§ §Who we are looking for?§ §You will have a relevant degree in marketing, communications or business, along with a minimum of 5 years' experience in brand marketing. Your strong communication and negotiation skills, coupled with excellent planning and organisation, will see you excel here.§ §With great attention to detail and a creative eye, you're an achievement driven, self-starter who is quick to learn new skills. Your high energy and passion about the impact we have by improving the overall quality of New Zealand homes will help bring these ideas to life.§ §Working on our marketing plan, as a strategic thinker, you also enjoy the execution of those ideas and bringing them to life.§ §You are detail orientated and enjoy project management.§ §Please note, all applicants must have the legal right to work and live in New Zealand. Successful candidates will be required to undergo a pre-employment drug and alcohol test and relevant background checks.§ §To find out more about us, please visit §w§ww.hrv.co§.nz§.§ §NOTE: This is a fixed term role until 30 June 2021.§ § § § § §To apply for this job click Apply Now careers.hrv.co.nz/Vacancies§ §Job code: 5225726 § §Applications close: 25 October 2020§§§§

jobTitle: Product Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50640868.txt	§Product Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Product Manager§§Advertiser: §Synnex New Zealand Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Product Management & Development§§§§§§Founded in 1980, Synnex employs over 11,000 associates worldwide and operates in Taiwan, New Zealand, USA, Canada, China, Japan, Mexico, Philippines, United Kingdom, Australia and more. Synnex is one of the market leaders in New Zealand for IT distributed products such as components, systems, notebooks, peripherals and consumables. We partner with industry leading brands such as Intel, Lenovo, Microsoft, Asus, WD, NETGEAR and more.§ §About the role:§Due to the company's continued growth, an exciting new opportunity exists for a talented individual to join Synnex NZ as a Product Manager on a full time basis, reporting to the Sales and Marketing Manager. If you are an innovator and forward thinking individual that is able to think outside the square and possess a lot of energy and enthusiasm with a proven record of being a high achiever, then we want to speak to you. This is a fantastic opportunity to work with a market leader in supportive and dynamic environment.§ § § §Your main responsibilities include:§ § §Stock planning / strategic forecasting to ensure constant stock availability while keeping inventory turnover ratios healthy§ §To be active and strategic in new product selection§ §Working with vendors to ensure smooth deliveries and providing calculated estimation of arrival dates§ §Initiate ABC analysis, create product portfolios and project future products§ §Working with vendors to ensure valuable information is exchanged so that all products are competitive in the market§ §Setting up pricing strategy for all products to ensure maximum profitability while staying competitive in the market§ §Working with vendors strategically to create marketing promotions, with the goal in mind to create positive stimulation to the competitive market§ §To analyse market trends and create and implement market activity to capitalise on the trends.§ §Achieve product revenue budget§ §Analyse competing products on features and price§ §Controlling inventory level and turnover rate§ §Creating relationships and developing good rapport with all key customers in both Retail and Channel resellers§ §Regular contact with category managers or procurement team of each key reseller in differing levels to ensure seamless execution of their goals§ §Constant dedication to customer relationships, resolving issues in a timely manner, providing suggestions and strategies with resellers to ensure our goals and interests are always aligned§ §Ensure that targets are achieved i.e.; weekly targets, monthly targets, quarterly targets.§ §Deliver product training with the assistance of vendors to ensure that the sales department have the relevant information and knowledge.§ §Facilitating vendor initiatives, either directly through Synnex or indirectly through vendor managed resellers§ §Facilitating indirect claims and promotions from a vendor-reseller perspective§ §Regular meetings / conference calls for strategic discussions as well as information sharing§ §Helping the vendors to communicate to the Synnex sales team regarding product knowledge, promotions, competitive analysis and SPIFs§ §Weekly and monthly reporting to all vendors§ §Initiating and management of all vendor related claims§ § § §Required Skills and Experience:§ § §Minimum of two or more years experience in a similar role, whether it be through another ICT Distributor, Vendor, or Reseller. Dealing with IT products and engaging with IT resellers§ §A degree within an IT field would be highly regarded§ §Ability to read, analyse, and interpret general business periodicals.§ §Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.§ §Medium to strong Excel spreadsheet skills§ §Strong business and marketing acumen.§ §Proven track record in achieving results within a service industry environment.§ §A strong presence and presentation skills with excellent communication and people skills.§ §Ability to consult with clients, identify their needs and provide a tailor-made solution.§ §Confident sales ability and is able to build effective business relationships.§ §Hard working and reliable§ §High level of discipline and professionalism§ §Clear communicator, both oral and written, competent to fluent conversational and written Mandarin would be highly regarded§ §Ability to self-manage§ §Have good understanding of technology (with passion and interest)§ §Excellent time management skills§ §Charisma and have an ability to build rapport with clients§ §Applicants for this position must have NZ residency or citizenship§ §Synnex prides itself on our customer service and relationships. Synnex provides an environment for our employees to grow and develop their skills. This is a fantastic opportunity to work with a market leader in a secure, supportive team and dynamic environment.§ §If you possess a high level of energy and enthusiasm, we want to speak to you! don't hesitate to send us your resume and cover letter today!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a product manager?§Do you have experience managing the development of a product from inception to delivery?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of the product development lifecycle?§Have you worked in a role where you had to identify user needs and form product requirements?§§§

jobTitle: Marketing Manager Accommodation Industry Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50641043.txt	§Marketing Manager Accommodation Industry§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Manager Accommodation Industry§§Advertiser: §Astro§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§Marketing Manager   Accommodation Industry -  Blenheim§ § §Work in Beautiful Blenheim§ §Enjoy a fantastic company work culture§ §32 hours per week flexible§ §Time for a change of location?   Take this rare and special opportunity to live and work in glorious Blenheim. §  §Are you an experienced Marketing Manager who would thrive on creating a superior guest experience for our clients? §  §Contributing to our consistently growing business, you will be a dynamic and multi talented Marketing Manager who will help us to grow our brand awareness in the accommodation industry across New Zealand. With your proven marketing experience, creativity and flair, you will add value to our brand promise of making it easy for our clients to create a superior guest experience. §  §Company§  §We are a third generation New Zealand family owned business who have been leaders in the Hospitality industry for almost 20 years.  We pride ourselves on our strong values of family, respect, honesty, and trust and this is reflected in our dealings with both customers and our team. We provide an environment where people love to come to work and are passionate about what they do. §  § §The Role §  §Due to expansion, we are looking for a new and talented team member to help us grow our market share by way of creating and adopting marketing plans to create inbound leads.  In this exciting and varied role, you will be doing all that is required to ensure that our brand becomes the preferred choice in the accommodation industry. You will be able to suggest new ideas to grow the business and thrive on building brand awareness through marketing, social media, mail outs and other activities. You will also be responsible for interacting with current and new customers via the phone and face to face visits.  Picking up the phone occasionally to generate new business will be second nature to you. §  §You will have a minimum two years experience in a similar role, or alternatively be more experienced and would now welcome working flexible hours (32 hours per week with the possibility of increasing in the future.)§  §Duties§ § §Create and maintain structured marketing plan.§ §Present marketing activity to sales team§ §Manage social media platforms§ §Create all brochure content§ §Implement plan to raise brand awareness with designers and architects.§ §Creation of collateral catalogues and similar.§ §Research to identify new leads.§ §Managing marketing requirements/customer contact database§ §Manage mail-outs/newsletters, marketing emails.§ §Occasional telemarketing to existing and new clients§ §Build brand awareness in the Accommodation industry across New Zealand.§ §Personal Capabilities§ § §Can demonstrate teamwork, trust, and collaboration§ §Positive can-do attitude and engaging manner.§ §Personal relationship focussed.§ §An ideas person with a creative brain.§ §Excellent communication skills§ §Motivated to achieve targets and deadlines.§ §Self disciplined and driven to achieve great results.§ §Excellent personal presentation§ §Skills & Qualifications§ § §2 years minimum experience in a similar role.§ §Proven broad marketing experience§ §Excellent written and spoken English.§ §Creative writing skills§ §Thrive on phone work and possess excellent telephone manner§ §Above all you will love doing all it takes to grow the business!§  §Who Are We?§  §We place Family as one of our core values and as such have a fantastic culture. As an employee, you will be made to feel valued and your hard work acknowledged. If you are the type of person who has the drive and personality to succeed, and also enjoys the comradery of a close-knit office environment, then this is the company for you.§  §Apply§  §If you have the required skills and experience, please email a copy of your CV and cover letter outlining your interest in the role to §careers@astro.net.nz§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Marketing Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50643404.txt	§Marketing Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Coordinator§§Advertiser: §NetYourJob§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§Harcourts Group New Zealand§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§Harcourts Group New Zealand§Auckland, Full Time, Real Estate & Property§Please Quote Reference Number 77314§§Largest real estate group in New Zealand§International brand§Fun & dynamic culture§§About the position§An exciting opportunity to work on a wide range of projects, this role is responsible for supporting Harcourts NZ and its sub-brands in planning and executing their marketing initiatives. The primary focus of the role will be the management, delivery, and measurement of campaigns across NZ. You will work closely with the National Marketing Manager- Brand Experience NZ and be an integral part of a great team. The ideal team member would be strong-willed, fun, and passionate about brand marketing. §What you will do§:§Manage the planning, execution, and implementation of short and long-term marketing plans and campaigns, online and offline§Manage and maintain all channels of campaign delivery, including the website and social platforms§Assist in the planning and manage the delivery of the annual social media strategy focused on Corporate and the Network growth§Work closely with our business partners and the franchise network to guide and implement key initiatives§Compile and analyse data to accurately report impact and outcomes of marketing activities with a focus on lead nurturing§Contribute as a proactive member of Harcourts, by fostering values throughout the organisation to achieve business goals§Work cooperatively and proactively with the National Marketing Manager to accomplish the organisational objectives§Your knowledge and skills§:§3+ years of experience in a marketing coordination or a similar role §Tertiary qualifications in marketing coordination, marketing project management or similar business degree/experience §Solid understanding of the various marketing channels, and their applicability to achieve objectives§Experience in content development, website management and social media management §Online marketing experience across owned, paid and earned channels§Tactical experience in managing integrated marketing campaigns across multimedia channel§Solid understanding of lead generation tactics§Working knowledge of social media platforms, plus understanding of Facebook and Google Ads Manager§Understanding of Search Engine Optimisation, Search Engine Marketing and analytics tools§Working knowledge of HubSpot would be highly regarded§About Us§For many, Harcourts is a name filled with history from its foundations in New Zealand as early as 1888, and yet for others, it is a name synonymous with the future. While remaining true to its New Zealand family roots, Harcourts has quickly grown to become an international real estate leader operating in multiple countries.§In New Zealand, Harcourts is the largest real estate brand and is renowned for its exceptional client service, which is central to both its operating model and its success. §Read more about us at harcourts.co.nz §If this sounds like something you'd be fabulous at, please apply now through the online application form with your CV  and a cover letter.§Applications close: Friday 9th October, 2020.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years experience do you have in a similar marketing coordination role?§Do you hold tertiary qualifications in marketing coordination, marketing project management or a similar business degree?§How would you rate your knowledge of social media platforms, including Facebook and Google Ads Manager on a scale of 1-10?§How many years experience do you have in Marketing Automation or Digital Campaign Management?§What is your salary expectation for this role?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Communications Executive / Specialist Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50645889.txt	§Communications Executive / Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications Executive / Specialist§§Advertiser: §Ngāti Whātua Ōrākei Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Looking for a supportive, welcoming, and fun work environment? Join our team at Ngāti Whātua Ōrākei Trust. §In this role you will be able to showcase your skills managing communications content and activities to drive and develop the way we engage with our whānau and external stakeholders. Your work will contribute to our wider media and communications strategy, meaning you’ll really be making a difference for our people, and will have great variety in what you get to create. §This is a full-time, permanent position, working closely with our Manager - Communications, PR and Media and the wider Trust team. §Key Responsibilities§Support communications activities to ensure our message engages whānau and highlights key matters in a well-articulated and clear way consistent with our voice§Keep our messaging updated on all comms platforms with our tone and style§Develop and implement engaging content plans§Monitor and implement media, communications and external stakeholder strategies§Identify opportunities for positive messages to be promoted§Report on and recommend improvements based on data and best practice§ §About you§Fluency in Te Reo Māori strongly preferred, some proficiency is a must§Understanding of, and conscious of tikanga§Commitment to ongoing learning and growth in both personal and professional capacities§Passionate about making a difference and a positive and inclusive attitude§ Qualifications and Experience §Copywriting skills English and Māori§Communications or related degree§4+ years’ experience in comms/PR/media/marketing§Experienced working in a fast-paced, agile environment§Digitally competent (Microsoft Office, Wordpress, Social Media platforms, CRM, CMS, Google Analytics)§Te Whāinga§The purpose of the Trust is to receive, administer, manage, protect and govern the Trust’s assets to ensure the cultural, commercial and social development of Ngāti Whātua Ōrākei for the benefit of its Members. It is the Trust’s responsibility to demonstrate strong leadership for our hapū and we seek to do this through good governance, transparent decision-making and working together with our subsidiaries Whai Maia Limited and Whai Rawa Limited, on behalf of our people.§The Ngāti Whātua Ōrākei Trust is guided by the vision§Kia rere te kāhu pōkere ki ngā taumata tiketike§Visit us at: www.ngatiwhatuaorakei.com §How to apply§Please submit your interest through Seek, with your proficiency in Te Reo Māori indicated in either your cover letter or resume.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you worked in a role where your duties included proof reading and sub-editing?§§§

jobTitle: Communications and Marketing Advisor Job in Wellington - SEEK
advertiser: New Zealand Council for Educational Research
jobText: TXT/50646010.txt	§Communications and Marketing Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications and Marketing Advisor§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Council for Educational Research§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Ko te manu e kai ana i te miro, nōna te ngahere§Ko te manu e kai ana i te mātauranga, nōna te ao! § §Exciting opportunity to join a leading educational research and development organisation.§ §We are looking for a communications and marketing advisor to join our team. You will be a strong writer, enjoy working in close collaboration with staff across the organisation, and have the skills and experience to help us meet our client needs for research and evaluation-based work, and customer needs for the resources and services we offer.  This role has sole responsibility for communications and marketing, and works across the organisation with senior leadership, research project teams, and business units.§ §NZCER is a vibrant, independent educational research organisation based in Wellington. We have multiple education research, evaluation, and advisory projects on the go at any time. We also provide and support a suite of educational assessments, tools, and services, and have a publishing arm, NZCER Press.§ §We welcome applications from people with:§ § §An interest and understanding of New Zealand education.§ §A record in communications, marketing, public relations and/or journalism.§ §A bachelor’s degree or equivalent qualification in communications and marketing is highly desirable.§ §An up-to-date knowledge and use of social media.§ §Excellent written and oral communication skills, including experience in writing publications.§ §Understanding of the media, including Māori media.§ §Understanding of a broad range of communication channels such as written publications, journals, web-based and social media opportunities.§ §The ability to apply knowledge and understanding of commercial concepts, strategies and practices to the communications and marketing role.§ §Our people are strongly connected to the education sector in Aotearoa New Zealand. We use the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi as the founding document of Aotearoa to help us uphold mana Māori in our work, relationships, and ways of working. We offer te reo Māori classes in-house.§ §To view the job description, please go to: § §https://www.nzcer.org.nz/news/communications-and-marketing-advisor-role§ §Or if you’d like to discuss the position in more detail, please contact Marie Sim, ph §04 802-1462§, or §hr@nzcer.org.nz§ §To apply for this permanent, full time (or part-time, as negotiated) position, please forward a covering letter and detailed curriculum vitae. Your application should be addressed to Marie Sim, HR Advisor: §hr@nzcer.org.nz§ §Closing date for applications is §16 October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50646145.txt	§Programme Manager - Events§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Programme Manager - Events§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Trade & Enterprise§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Programme Manager - Events §        §        §        §          §E te tī e te tā, e aku whakatamarahi ki te rangi, tēnā koutou. Nei rā mātou e mihi atu ki a koutou katoa.§          §At NZTE we use our extensive knowledge and global networks to help New Zealand exporters of all sizes connect to the right partners and investors. By supporting New Zealand businesses, we boost New Zealand's economy and reputation, and help to share what's special about New Zealand with the rest of the world.§          §We are looking for a Programme Manager to join our award-winning team of events experts that deliver world-class business events and experiences across our global network.§          §What you'll be doing§          §You will lead complex projects and programmes of work across the Customer Solutions Group and NZTE to deliver key NZTE objectives. You will be someone who establishes relationships quickly, builds trust and confidence, and thrives in a collaborative environment. jobTitle: Senior Communications & Engagement Advisor Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50646189.txt	§Senior Communications & Engagement Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Communications & Engagement Advisor§§Advertiser: §Vinci Construction Grands Projets§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Public Relations & Corporate Affairs§§§§§§§About us:§The City Rail Link (CRL) Project is a game changer for Auckland and is the largest transport infrastructure project ever undertaken in New Zealand. The CRL is a 3.45km twin tunnel, transforming the dead-end station at Britomart, creating two new stations at Aotea and Karangahape Road and reconnecting to the network at a redeveloped Mt Eden station.§The role:§ This position overview of the Communications and Engagement Advisor is to support the Link Alliance in delivering the Alliance Objectives by planning, designing, delivering and evaluating communications and engagement activity within the Mount Eden community.§Your stakeholder management, excellent communications and community advocacy will be key in this role.§ §Key responsibilities include:§ § §Work closely with the Community Manager to deliver communications for media, political stakeholders and digital channels§ §Use best practice to monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of communications and engagement activity§ §Working within the timeframes and budgets specified by the Community Manager§ §Ensure that CRLL’s statutory obligations regarding communications and engagement are adhered to at all times§ §Managing communications with local stakeholders impacted by construction§ §Any other duties as directed by the Community Manager§ § §About You:§ § §Tertiary-qualified in communications, engagement, PR or a related discipline§ §IAP2 certification preferred§ §7+ years communications and engagement experience, preferably in a complex, technical environment (transport industry preferred)§ §Ability to work autonomously and problem solve to deliver on the Alliance objectives§ §Previous experience leading relationships with diverse stakeholders§ §Highly organised – plans and priorities well and manages time to focus on the most important activities§ § § All successful applicants will be required to pass a pre-employment drug test and medical.§ *Please note we have an in-house recruitment team that manage all our vacancies for the Link Alliance. No candidates presented through an agency will be considered for any of our roles advertised, unless previously arranged. We would strongly encourage all candidates interested in these roles, to apply directly online through the portal provided otherwise your application will not be considered.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Specialist Customer Campaigns Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50646353.txt	§Specialist Customer Campaigns§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Specialist Customer Campaigns§§Advertiser: §SKY TV§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Direct Marketing & CRM§§§§§§About the role…§ §As a §Specialist – Customer Campaigns§ you’ll be responsible for managing some of the key initiatives the Customer Engagement Team deliver. The key areas of focus will include;§ § §Ideation and campaign initiative design (driven through Insights)§ §End to end execution of integrated campaigns across both traditional and digital channels, ensuring campaigns are successfully delivered cost effectively and in-line with customer insight data.§ §Communication and collaboration with stakeholders to ensure content & priorities are aligned with marketing strategies and brand§ §Commercial forecasting, build and management of the operational launch§ §Campaign testing/review and rigorous financial assessment & analysis prior, during and post-campaignManage and coordinate external agency relationships§ §What Skills and Experience you’ll need…§ § §Minimum of 5  years’ customer/commercial management experience§ §Proven commercial, financial, planning and analytical acumen and the ability to articulate this§ §Customer campaign management strategy design and customer base management experience§ §Proven track record of delivering campaigns across multiple channels § §Proven experience in taking complex or technical information and simplifying it into customer friendly content§ §The Cherry on the top…§ § §An excellent salary package, including a laptop§ §Free Sky and Free Neon§ §Flexible Working including working from home§ §Criteria for working from home includes;§ § §Must have a fibre internet connection with the ability to connect via Ethernet§ §A quiet area to work taking phone calls§ §A mobile (smartphone)§ §Subsidised Gym Membership at the YMCA§ §Free parking onsite§ §  §A Bit About Us…§ §We’re Sky, an entertainment company that has been connecting New Zealanders to the stories and sport they love for nearly 30 years. We’re proud of what we’ve achieved and are excited about where we’re heading. We’re redefining our boundaries and challenging ourselves to do better. We’re moving fast, listening to our customers, creating solutions and taking calculated risks.   § §How to Apply§ §Please send your CV and Cover letter to §jobs@sky.co.nz§.  A full role profile can be provided upon request§§§§

jobTitle: Intermediate Graphic Designer Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50646775.txt	§Intermediate Graphic Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate Graphic Designer§§Advertiser: §Cubro Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Brand Management§§§§§§As a leading provider of healthcare solutions, Cubro exists to help New Zealanders to live quality lives. Our core business involves working with Public and Private Hospitals, Aged Care providers, Occupational Therapists, and Physiotherapists.§ §We have big aspirations and are looking for an experienced and multi-talented Graphic Designer to join our tight knit creative team.§ §Based at our HQ in Tauranga, you’ll be in prime position to take full advantage of our golden beaches and enjoy a little more smashed avo on toast.§ §The role§ §In this dynamic, newly created role, you will take responsibility for all digital and print graphics, across a few of our core markets. This will include product photography, packaging, website and social graphics, catalogues, magazine layouts, training videos and more. You will have a good understanding of how different elements work together to present a strong brand story. Experience is the health sector is advantageous.§ §What we're looking for§ §We are looking for a Graphic Design superstar who has a passion for health care and making a difference. You’ll have a proven history of producing high-quality clean design that tells a compelling story. You will be highly organised with a proven track record of managing projects. You will need to work well under pressure and keep projects organised and on track when things get busy. You will be a great communicator ensuring that all parties know how projects are progressing through each step of the process.§ §Using your photography and video editing skills, you will bring superior product photography and video production values to our product training and promotional videos.§ §As a part of our small and focussed team, you will bring a can-do attitude and be passionate about representing and expanding our brand.§ §Your skills§ § §Tertiary qualification in graphic design§ §4+ years graphic design experience§ §Photography and videography skills§ §High level of competence in Adobe Suite§ §Competence with MS Office§ §Driven, adaptable, and delivery focussed§ §An exceptional team player with the ability to lead complex initiatives without direct authority§ §Be a fantastic communicator, both written and verbal§ §Experience in the health sector is desirable§ § § § § §What’s in it for you?§ §You’ll get to be part of an energetic team who have a lot of laughs and enjoy coming to work.§ §We offer heaps of great benefits including competitive remuneration, access to our gym, a free lunch produced by our in-house chef (yes, you heard right), health insurance and a personal development plan which includes ongoing training.§ §Next steps§ §If this sounds like the opportunity you have been waiting for then please click the “Apply” button to submit your CV, covering letter and design portfolio. jobText: TXT/50646795.txt	§E-Commerce Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§E-Commerce Manager§§Advertiser: §Campfire Digital Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§Salary Commensurate with Experience§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §E-Commerce Manager §      §        §Use your digital marketing & e-commerce expertise with a busy FMCG brand.§        § §        §          §Step up to a responsible role in a successful FMCG brand§          §Join a well-resourced digital team, with a test-and-learn ethos§          §Plan, manage and optimise e-commerce activity§        §        § §        §ABOUT THE COMPANY§        § §        §This well-established FMCG brand has seen sales grow in 2020 due to its robust and on-going commitment to digital innovation. They were one of the first in their category to build an e-commerce site, and have seen continued growth in digital sales.§        § §        §With a large, digital-savvy marketing team on board, they are now looking for a new e-commerce manager to take ownership of the most important brand in their portfolio.§        § §        §ABOUT THE ROLE§        § §        §You will be the 2IC to the Head of Digital, so this is a highly responsible role. Your focus is to develop and implement a solid e-commerce strategy to drive the brand’s online growth.§        § §        §The job starts with overseeing the launch of a refreshed e-commerce site. Once the site is done, you’ll continually tweak and improve the UX, collaborating with the internal web development team to ensure on-going developments are optimised for conversion. You’ll set up user funnels for engagement, acquisition, conversion & retention, then drill into the data to plug any gaps.§        § §        §Using your analytical nous, you’ll identify and investigate gaps, trends, new initiatives to be explored, and technical improvements.§        § §        §You will directly line manage an E-Commerce Executive and will also be assisted by in-house digital marketing experts. As the site manager, you will need to understand all of the relevant levers across not only onsite e-commerce optimisation, but also digital marketing (e.g. paid search, SEO, paid social, EDM, remarketing, customer lifecycle, database management / growth).§        § §        §Ultimately, your role is to maximise sales across all of this brand’s digital touchpoints.§        § §        §SKILLS & EXPERIENCE§        § §        §We are looking for an ambitious and results-driven individual who’s looking to take step up in their career.§        § §        §With proven experience in e-commerce website management, you’ll be able to demonstrate the onsite tools, techniques and methodologies you’ve used previously to increase digital sales. You will bring a strong understanding of optimising landing pages and user funnels, and a highly analytical mindset.§        § §        §As this role starts with overseeing a new website build, experience in website project management would be beneficial.§        § §        §          §Proven experience in e-commerce management§          §Demonstrable success in improving sales growth and site optimisation§          §Thorough understanding of optimising landing pages and user funnels§          §Analytical mindset, with a passion for A/B and multivariate testing§          §Strong knowledge of digital marketing channels, including EDM, search, social, remarketing, etc.§          §Excellent project management skills§        §        § §        §HOW TO APPLY§        §Due to the current border restrictions from the New Zealand government, we are only able to work with candidates who are NZ citizens/permanent residents or have eligible working rights for NZ. So we can best help you in your job hunt, please make your work eligibility clear to us in your application.§        § §        §Click §APPLY FOR THIS JOB §or contact the friendly team at Campfire for a confidential chat about the job.§        § §        §Phone:§ +64 (0) §9 320 5752§        §Website:§ www.campfirerecruitment.co.nz§        §Job ID:§ #30115SK§        § §        §Job’s not quite the right fit? Send us your CV (§hello@campfirerecruitment.co.nz§) and we’ll keep you updated with the freshest jobs in digital marketing, e-commerce and digital media.§        § §        §You can also follow us on Facebook & LinkedIn to see our latest jobs.§        § §        §Facebook:§ https://www.facebook.com/CampfireRecruitment/§        §LinkedIn:§ https://www.linkedin.com/company/campfire-digital-recruitment/§        § §        §Campfire Digital Recruitment embraces diversity.
