jobTitle: Senior Marketing and Communications Specialist Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50646838.txt	§Senior Marketing and Communications Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Marketing and Communications Specialist§§Advertiser: §Cubro Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§As a leading provider of healthcare solutions, Cubro exists to help New Zealanders to live quality lives. Our core business involves working with Public and Private Hospitals, Aged Care providers, Occupational Therapists, and Physiotherapists.§ §We have big aspirations and are looking for an experienced marketing and communications specialist to join our tight knit team.§ §Based at our HQ in Tauranga, you’ll be in prime position to take full advantage of our golden beaches and enjoy a little more smashed avo on toast.§ §The role§ §In this dynamic, newly created role, you will take responsibility for driving and delivering our marketing and communications strategies for one of our core markets across New Zealand, including research, advertising and promotions, events, trade shows and brand development.§ §You will have a strong focus on developing multi-channel marketing campaigns that support our strategies for acquisition, retention, and growth across a diverse customer base.§ §Supported by the Head of Marketing and Communications and an energetic team, you’ll help ensure we execute all our campaigns to the highest possible standards.§ §What will your day look like?§ § §Develop and implement marketing plans that drive directly impact business performance§ §Oversee the delivery of nationwide marketing and communications campaigns§ §Develop and implement brand and product marketing strategies§ §Continually optimise customer communications based on feedback and competitor analysis§ §Lead and support strategic and digital production projects, providing both a product lens and customer voice§ §Analyse customer data and insights translating these into marketing actions§ §Help to lead and inspire a passionate team§ §What we are looking for?§ §You’ll have a proven ability to formulate and deliver go-to-market strategies by understanding the situational challenges of diverse national markets. Creative thinking and channel execution are important skills to have, and you will be comfortable working in multi-stakeholder environments.  § §You'll have had at least 7 years exposure to the complete marketing mix, including direct marketing, product marketing and digital production oversight.§ §Ideally, we are looking for someone with previous experience in the health sector.§ §A can-do and humble attitude is vital – although this is a senior role, you must be willing to jump in to help our team execute all areas of the marketing mix.  You will be independently resourceful, yet above all else, you’ll love pursuing team success.§ §You’ll have strong presentation and communication skills, with a confident ability to present strategic and operational direction, and secure commitment from external and internal stakeholders at all levels.§ §Your skills§ § §Driven, adaptable, and delivery focussed§ §Capable of focussing daily activity on executing our strategies§ §Capable of building both consensus and leadership through knowledge and curiosity of each specific market§ §Capable of proactively suggesting improvement opportunities, through team or individual initiatives§ §An exceptional team player with the ability to lead complex initiatives without direct authority§ §Highly self-aware, with strong perception of cultural nuances that shape behaviour§ §Entrepreneurial, ideas driven and able to orchestrate solutions that directly impact the business performance§ §Equally comfortable shaping stakeholder thinking as you are working with teams to get into the detail and deliver exceptional results§ §Able to quickly comprehend all the dynamics at play in a fast-moving complex consumer environment and carve a path to deliver results§ §Be a fantastic communicator, both written and verbal§ §Experience in the health sector is desirable§ §What’s in it for you?§ §You’ll get to be part of an energetic team who have a lot of laughs and enjoy coming to work. You’ll also play a lead role in shaping the future of Cubro’s Marketing and Communications strategies.§ §We offer heaps of great benefits including competitive remuneration, access to our gym, a free lunch produced by our in-house chef (yes, you heard right), health insurance and a personal development plan which includes ongoing training.§ §Next steps§ §If this sounds like the opportunity you have been waiting for then please click the “Apply” button to submit your CV and covering letter. Applications close at 5pm on Friday, the 16th of October 2020.§ § § § §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Are you experienced with copy writing and content creation?§§§

jobTitle: Copywriter Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50648115.txt	§Copywriter§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Copywriter§§Advertiser: §ANZ Bank New Zealand Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§ §Responsible for leading the design of memorable and useful customer and service communications (across Direct Mail, Email, SMS and more). §You will deliver sustainable value for our customers and shareholders through compelling communications that support increased customer retention, lower costs to serve, most importantly improving overall customer satisfaction and building brand engagement.§§About the role:§As a Copywriter, you will have the opportunity to:§Synthesise multiple sources of information to make sound copywriting decisions, keeping the customers at the heart of all content produced. §Be an expert in writing and delivering customer-centric communications across a number of projects and channels.§Be able to execute all communications according to a set communications framework and strategy. §Deliver customer communications across number of projects and channels that consistently meet requirements in and effective and efficient manner.§Ensure there is a consistent tone of voice, aligned with brand guidelines across customer interaction points.§Proactively engage and facilitate collaboration across cross functional teams to build relationships and generate value§Location:§ Auckland §Role Type:§ Permanent§ §About you:§To be successful in this role you will bring the following:§Experience - 5-8 years’ copywriting experience with a proven track record in email and digital copy writing. §Craft - You are confident with a range of existing copywriting tools. You are proficiency in content strategy and UX writing - including, synthesis of information, content development, editing and content management. §Growth mindset – You keep track of, and have demonstrated ability to adapt to, new trends and technologies. You are always looking for ways to improve and innovate, challenging status quo where required.§§ §§About ANZ§ §Our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. That’s why we strive to create a balanced, sustainable economy in which everyone can take part and build a better life. By helping people make the most of what they have, we transform ideas, hard work and ambition into reality. §  § §ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. Our recruitment decisions are based on the key inherent needs and requirements of each role, and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and characteristics.§  § §The ANZ values are the foundation of how we work and support our customers.§  § Integrity – We are honest and fair§ Collaboration – We work together for the customer§ Accountability – We take ownership and get things done§ Respect – We care for all those we serve§ Excellence – We challenge ourselves to be better§ § § §We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you.§ § § §ANZ recognises the importance of flexible working, watch our Global Stories to see how ANZ aims to meet the needs of our customers and to attract and retain the best people in a changing world. §  § §To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit anz.co.nz/careers §  § §You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and search for the reference number NEW042049.§  § §Applications close Monday 12th October 2020.  §§§§§

jobTitle: Marketing Lead/Senior Marketing Lead Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50648186.txt	§Marketing Lead/Senior Marketing Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Lead/Senior Marketing Lead§§Advertiser: §Health Promotion Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Marketing and Communications team§ §Wellington based – fixed term 18 months§ §Kia hiwa rā, kia hiwa rā§ §Nau mai, haere mai, whakapiri mai!§ §Kia koutou ngā rangatira mā§ §Kia kaha, Kia māia ki te tono mō enei nohonga ki ā Te Hiringa Hauora§ §We welcome you, come closer.§ §Come closer to hear the words of encouragement and urge you all to apply for the positions on offer at Te Hiringa Hauora.§ §Ko te kaupapa | About the role § §Are you an enthusiastic marketer keen to work on national behaviour change campaigns that reach down into the community? Do you want to champion communities who experience the greatest health challenges and inequities to make sure the marketing we deliver is evidence-based and has the audiences’ needs at the heart of it?§ §We work on brands and programmes like Smokefree, QuitStrong, Say Yeah, Nah, SunSmart, Minimising Gambling Harm, Nutrition and Physical Activity and Mental Wellbeing, including the National Depression Initiative and Like Minds, Like Mine.§ §Nga taonga kei roto I tou kete matauranga | What you bring § §You may have worked for government, an agency, a non-government organisation (NGO), or in the commercial sector. You will be able to demonstrate strategic thinking, and enjoy a challenge. You will have significant experience in managing ambiguity and shaping work, campaign planning, development and delivery, including contract and budget management. It is preferable you have experience marketing to Māori and/or Pasifika audiences, and have evidence of cultural competence.§ §Ideally we are looking for a senior marketer, but for the right candidate we would consider someone at intermediate level.§ §If this sounds like you and you would like to be part of a multi-disciplined team that encourages all New Zealanders to live healthier lives, we would love to hear from you.§ §Ko wai mātou | Who we are§ §Te Hiringa Hauora leads and delivers innovative and high quality national health and wellbeing initiatives. Te Hiringa Hauora is a Crown entity that works with partners including iwi, medical professionals, researchers and academics, community groups, public health advocates, and others who are aligned to our goals.§ §Te Hiringa Hauora acknowledges the special relationship between Māori and the Crown under Te Tiriti o Waitangi and is committed to recognise and respect the articles of Te Tiriti. Te Hiringa Hauora encourages and supports staff to learn and enjoy te reo, waiata and increase knowledge of te ao Māori.§ §Me pēwhea te tono | How to apply§ §TO APPLY FOR THIS ROLE §and for a full job description and application form §PLEASE GO TO THE VACANCIES PAGE§ on our website www.hpa.org.nz. Please send the completed Te Hiringa Hauora application form, CV and covering letter to §vacancies@hpa.org.nz§ or send directly to Vacancies, Te Hiringa Hauora, PO Box 2142, Wellington.§ §Applications close at 9am on Tuesday 13 October 2020. For further information, phone Linzie Sutton, People Culture and Capability Advisor on §(04) 9010 954§. Please note, Te Hiringa Hauora is a smoke free organisation. All applicants should be currently eligible to work in New Zealand§§§§

jobText: TXT/50648694.txt	§Graphic Design and Marketing Support§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graphic Design and Marketing Support§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Golf§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§About the Organisation§New Zealand Golf is a not-for profit charitable trust established in 1910 as the governing body for golf in New Zealand responsible for leading, growing and supporting the game. Golf is the most played sport in New Zealand with over half a million kiwis playing each year at one of the 390 clubs throughout the country.§The successful candidate will work with a passionate team who embrace a people and family first culture. With a central focus on employee wellbeing, our team enjoy benefits such as a flexible work environment, additional maternity/paternity support, birthday’s off plus gym and golf memberships. The team is a hard-working group who believe golf enriches the lives of those engaged with the game.§About the Role §Reporting to the Commercial and Marketing Manager, the key purpose of the role is to support the development and implementation of marketing and design activity across the business. The role will work closely with all departments of the organisation, particularly within the media/PR, content and digital, commercial and marketing.§1. Design§A real passion and strength in design you’ll oversee the representation of the New Zealand Golf brand and sub brands to ensure consistent presentation and messaging along with top class presentation of reports across the organisation from commercial partner reporting, social media and campaign reports to the annual report.§2. Marketing & Campaign Activation§Support the development, enhancement and successful implementation of New Zealand Golf’s marketing campaigns.§This position requires an energetic and skilled individual who can add value to our organisation and the wider golf sector.§For a full position description and application details please visit https://www.golf.co.nz/About/Careers.aspx §If you have the interest, passion and background to succeed in this role, we would love to hear from you. Please note that we may begin shortlisting as we receive applications. We encourage early applications as we may withdraw the advertising at any time.§Applications close 19 October 2020.§To be considered for any New Zealand Golf role you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand. New Zealand Golf is an equal opportunity employer. We recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Kaitohu Tuakana - Senior Advisor Māori and Pacific Communications Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50649309.txt	§Kaitohu Tuakana - Senior Advisor Māori and Pacific Communications§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kaitohu Tuakana - Senior Advisor Māori and Pacific Communications§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Other§§§§§§Permanent, full-time role§Wellington§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa and welcome.§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§The Communications team is critical to the Ministry. We lead communications and engagement around the biggest changes to New Zealand education in decades. We are responsible for ensuring that we listen and respond to the views of the tens of thousands of New Zealanders who are contributing to these changes. We lead all engagement with the media, and manage all the Ministry's internal and external communications channels, publications, branding and communications design. This is an exciting, fast paced and dynamic working environment and we have a great team focused on putting ākonga/students at the centre of all we do.§About this role§This role of Kaitohu Tuakana - Senior Advisor Māori and Pacific Communications will provide advice, influence and vision to support the Communications teams and the Business teams work effectively with Māori and Pacific audiences. This person will work closely with the Kaitohu Matua - Chief Advisor Māori and Pacific Communications. The role will lead and help others to deliver well-targeted communications and media services to Māori partners and Pacific audiences.§This includes providing advice and expertise to develop strategies, services and products which reflect the needs and aspirations of Māori and Pacific audiences. Also this person will bring expertise on how to connect effectively with Māori and Pacific networks and communities.§Key accountabilities are as follows:§Provide timely strategic communications advice to Business Groups and the Communications team§Advise and assist others to build their own ability to communicate effectively with Māori and Pacific audiences internally and externally, including building networks§Provide strategic insight and expertise to link to the Ministry's purpose§Deliver, advise and collaborate on key projects to identify communications opportunities, needs and risks for Māori and Pacific communities§Contribute to operational planning and seek feedback to continuously improve delivery§About you§We are looking for a Senior Communications Advisor with proven experience in leading with influence, strong relationship management and communications skills both strategically and in delivery. You will have well developed networks in government and Māori and Pacific communities and communications channels. You will bring a knowledgeable, proactive, resilient and calm approach to stakeholder engagement.§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to keeping to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§There is more information in the position description attached. Please take a look, and if this opportunity sounds like you, please apply now using the 'apply online' button.§For further information, please contact Fiona Weightman at §Fiona.Weightman@education.govt.nz§Click here to view the role description§§Applications close Midnight on Monday, 12 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

With a real sales focus, you will build an extensive network in the Business Events industry (bonus points if you already have one) to ensure the Waikato is at the forefront of the minds of those looking to host an event.§  § Working in conjunction with the Chief Executive, you will develop a strategic business plan to drive growth in an ever-changing business environment, and will work closely with the wider team as NZ navigates how to successfully attract, host and deliver meetings, conferences, exhibitions, and incentives in a post-COVID world.§  § §The Person§ Our ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of the world of Business Events, but we are open to hearing from candidates with experience in a similar sales/marketing role with a passion for the mighty Waikato. A role like this really is about networking, so it is important that you are comfortable getting out and leveraging your industry connections across New Zealand. jobTitle: Marketing Manager Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50649421.txt	§Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Talent International Institute§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§negotiable§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Aim:                                        §  §The aim of this position is to 1): develop marketing strategy for TII in-line with its mission statement, overall business strategy, and NZQA Code of Practice (CoP); 2): develop a marketing plan to execute the strategy; and 3): implement the marketing plan by developing and leading a quality team of marketing and sales staff, and agents’ network.§  § §  §Person specification:§            §  §The incumbent shall have excellent communication and presentation skills and proved experience and track record of successful marketing activities in PTE/ITP sectors for at least five years. Relationship development and management skills and experience is an important part of the role. You are a creative and forward thinker who understand dynamics of the business environment and embraces challenges of change management. You are able to innovate, create business solutions and identify business opportunities. Minimum qualifications should be bachelor’s degree in business/management with marketing major but post graduate qualifications shall be ideal. Comprehensive understanding of the New Zealand education marketing channels and relating bodies as ENZ, INZ, NZQA, MoE, NZTE shall be an added advantage. Current and sound knowledge of agents’ network in global markets is a pre-requisite.§  § §  §Special needs:§                    §  §The successful incumbent shall be required to have a full New Zealand driver licence, and valid New Zealand passport. Extensive international and national travelling is a necessary part of the role. TII may require the incumbent to undergo a medical examination from time to time to ensure level health and fitness to undertake the tasks efficiently. The role may require work over the weekends, holidays’ periods, late nights (due to New Zealand time difference with various markets) and during social hours.§  § §  §Remunerations:§                    §  §Successful incumbent shall earn a base salary and incentives/commissions by timely meeting the targets as agreed with the management. Remunerations shall be§  §negotiated on the basis of incumbent’s qualifications, experience and previous records of achievements.§  § §  §Responsibilities§  §Planning§ § §Develop a comprehensive market plan covering all the markets with clear marketing strategies, activities, and sales targets.§ §Carry out market analysis for each target and potential market.§ §Discuss marketing budgets and have them approved for marketing activities.§ §Plan sales and promotional activities and revenue targets.§ §Come up with a comprehensive marketing plan for 2019-21.§ §Meet timelines to achieve marketing and sales goals and targets.§ §Leadership§ § §Develop and lead a team of marketing and sales staff.§ §Identify various roles and positions within the marketing and sales departments.§ §Recruit and develop marketing and sales staff.§ §Plan professional development and training plans for the staff.§ §Provide goals and targets to the staff.§ §Monitor the performance and direct the staff.§ §Compliance and Risk Management§ § §Meet all the statutory requirements as set-out by the statutory bodies and TII Quality Management System.§ §Analyse market situation and have a robust risk-management system in place.§ §Fully read and understand NZQA Code of Practice.§ §Ensure that CoP is applied at all the time wherever applicable.§ §Timely complete CoP reviews; come up with action plans to deploy CoP changes and CoP review sign-off by the CEO.§ §Ensure that all agents’ contracts meet CoP requirements, and current at all times.§ §Ensure that visa approval rates are at 85% or above from all the markets.§ §Ensure that all students meet entry requirements including English proficiency requirements.§ §Engage with NZQA, INZ and ENZ risk functions and align TII marketing activities by mitigating market risks.§ §Promotion and Event Management§ § §Develop and implement TII brand promotion plan.§ §Plan, manage and run various events.§ §Ensure that TII brand equity is enhanced by arranging quality promotional activities.§ §Participate in fairs, conferences and seminars by agents, Education New Zealand (ENZ), Immigration New Zealand (INZ), NZQA, Ministry of Education (MoE) and ATEED and similar bodies.§ §Develop quality marketing promotional and give-away materials for TII.§ §Timely develop and distribute paper and electronic copies of marketing materials, such as prospectuses, flyers and other information materials for students and agents.§ §Plan and run various events including open days, networking sessions, seminars and roadshows.§ §Merchandising and Website development and management§ § §Review and develop quality monograms, logos, insignia, banners, colour scheme and signs for TII brand.§ §Review, design and develop TII Logo.§ §Ensure that TII premises represent with TII logos, signs and colour schemes.§ §Ensure that TII is well represented at all marketing fairs, seminars, and similar events with proper merchandising materials.§ §Ensure that TII website and all other portals, such as Facebook, linked inn, twitter etc. are all up-to-date and maintained at all the times.§ §Digital Marketing and Online tools§ § §Run effective digital marketing activities and online tools with clear outcomes as TII brand recognition and customer inquiries.§ §Analyse, plan and run marketing campaigns through various social media as WeChat, fb and other similar platforms.§ §Identify and deploy strategies to enhance SEO of TII brands.§ §Plan and run live streaming and YouTube channels targeting specific customers.§ §Stakeholders Engagement§ § §Identify, engage and consult with the stakeholders to ensure that stakeholders’ needs are addressed.§ §Identify and list all the stakeholders.§ §Ensure that marketing and sales staff are aware who their stakeholders are!§ §Regularly engage with the stakeholders and determine stakeholders’ needs.§ §Ensure that all stakeholders’ needs are met, which are including but not limited to students’ needs analysis, agents’ needs’ analysis, statutory requirements and needs (NZQA, INZ, ENZ).§ §Participate in senior management team (SMT) meetings as required and present reports and up-date management with any News, developments and information.§ §Technology and communication§ § §Ensure that technology is used effectively and efficiently to enhance the productivity and quality of communication and outcomes.§ §Learn the student management system (Enrolpro) and ensure that marketing and sales staff are using the Enrolpro functions correctly.§ §Ensure that digital marketing planning and execution is timely done and maintained.§ §Ensure that all outcomes are measured and reported.§ §Ensure that timeliness is adhered to while meeting targets, plans and deadlines of projects.§ § §  § §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing manager?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§§§

jobTitle: Contract Event Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50649664.txt	§Contract Event Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Contract Event Manager§§Advertiser: §Spur NZ td§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Event Management§§§§§§Spur is a full service live marketing agency delivering sponsorship, experiential and event services to an array of New Zealand's biggest corporates. § §We specialize in designing and delivering live experiences for brands, providing strategic advice and planning, followed by world-class execution. § §We're looking for an intermediate level contractor with a proven track record in account service or event management, preferably with a background in experiential marketing. Strong communications skills with a keen eye for detail are must haves.§ §THE ROLE§ §The contractor will be involved in planning and executing activation campaigns that Spur runs on behalf of its clients.§ATTRIBUTES & RESPONSIBILITIES:§ § §Working as part of a client service team to help develop and deliver creative and effective client campaigns.§ §Co-ordinating and managing all aspects of project planning including budgeting and cost control, health & safety, developing run sheets, liaising with suppliers, venues and stakeholders. § §Working on site at events, managing set up and break down of infrastructure with the event team.§ §Managing promotional staff, liaising with suppliers and venue personnel to ensure all aspects of the event or activation run smoothly and safely. § §First class customer service and work ethic§ §Ability to act calmly under pressure§ §Ongoing reporting to clients and Spur directors § §The internal culture and team composition are extremely important at Spur. We are focused on providing a fun, dynamic and supportive working environment which we want to share with like-minded people. We work hard, take enormous pride in what we do, and have fun along the way. § §To apply, please complete the Seek application process. Your chances of an interview are likely to increase if you take the time and effort to submit a short video explaining the following;§ §- A little bit about yourself§ §- Why you think experiential marketing is important § §- One good reason why we should hire you§ §Please submit your videos to §humanresources@spur.co.nz§,  including your name and  "Contract Role - Application" in the subject line. § §  § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an events manager?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Have you worked in a role where you were responsible for budget management & forecasting?§Have you completed a qualification in marketing?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Marketing Manager Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50652607.txt	§Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Populous People§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Napier§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Brand Management§§§§§§Our client is a well-known, significant entity and employer in the Hawke’s Bay region and so this is a really positive opportunity to have an impact.  You will quickly become the marketing champion of this entity’s vision both internally and externally.  This business often sits centre stage in the public eye, so there is plenty on the go here. You and your team you will have a day-to-day impact on their market presence, communications and PR activity.§   § This is a hands-on campaign and delivery-based role reporting to the Marketing and Communications Manager. You will be responsible for the day to day management of the entity’s marketing and branding functions and for the leadership of a small and engaged marketing team. There is a strong tourism and visitor experience focus in this multi-faceted role; you are there to make things happen at a functional level through their marketing strategies and plans and brand management. You’ll be the person that everyone turns to ensure coordinated and consistent messaging through their comms, brand and marketing material.§   § Experience at the intermediate to senior marketing level is a prerequisite, preferably from within a large corporate environment where there are many stakeholders and a large public audience.  You must have a strong baseline knowledge of core marketing principles.  The ability to capture and translate this organisation’s core values into your written work and into your general communication across the board will be key.  Ideally you will be tertiary qualified in marketing but that is not essential.  Importantly you will be able to demonstrate that you can keep many marketing and promotions activities going at any one time and that you can take projects from their infancy to completion. You will be joining an engaged and motivated team.§   § If you have the desire, experience and the marketing leadership qualities to perform here then please apply with your CV and cover letter through this seek portal. We will be moving fast to appoint this important role. §Feel free to phone the team at Populous People to learn more on §06 875 8446§ or §0272 565620§ to learn more. §   § § § § §Please note, only candidates who are have full NZ working rights will be eligible for this role.§ § §§§§

§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§ §Experienced creating and managing content for Facebook and Instagram pages§ §Strong research and analysis skills§ §The ability to prioritise your workload to meet deadlines§ §A keen eye for detail and design§ §Self-starter with ability to work independently§ §Ability to think on your feet and solve problems that may arise§ §Experience and proficiency using Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point§ §Experience preferable in Mailchimp and WordPress§ §An interest in digital marketing and growing the online presence of a business§ §The offer§ §A contract role 20 hours a week flexible working§ §Working from home unless attending planning or development sessions and/or events§ §Access to plenty of training and development§ §How to apply§ §Please outline in a brief covering letter why you are the right person for the job, send your CV and hourly rate expectations to Melanie Boyle, Founder Women Step Forward.§  §Download a full job description at www.womenstepforward.co.nz§  §Applications due:§ 13 October 2020§  §Initial interviews§:  These will be held over zoom on 19 October 2020 if you are shortlisted for the job.§§§§

If you’re ready to play a major role in our fast growing and evolving business, then apply before October 15th via seek with your cover letter and CV.§  § §  §Established in 2011, Triumph & Disaster's philosophy is to use the best of science combined with the best of nature to produce naturally derived skincare that works. Using local indigenous ingredients, our products are engineered to be clean, safe and efficient, with a focus on sustainability and creating value for our customers.§  § §  §Applicants must have the right to work in New Zealand.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience with Search Engine Optimisation (SEO)?§Which of the following online advertising methods do you have experience with?§§§

jobTitle: Bid Writer Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50655712.txt	§Bid Writer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Bid Writer§§Advertiser: §Calibre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Bid Writer §      §        §About Us§        §Calibre is a leading engineering and design consultancy, operating across multiple market sectors in Australia, New Zealand and the Pacific. We strive to deliver positive economic and social outcomes for our clients and the communities in which we work and live. While engineering is our core skill, we work with central and local government, and private clients to consider assets from a whole-of-life perspective and provide solutions to suit their needs.§        §At Calibre, people are at the heart of everything we do. Creating an exceptional experience for our clients, partners, employees and communities is central to our approach. We are committed to building and sustaining long-term relationships with our clients and partners, enabling our employees to thrive and succeed, and giving back to our communities.§        § §        §About the Opportunity§        §We have a fantastic opportunity available for a passionate, dynamic and proactive individual to join our team and play an active part in the continued growth and development of our business. Based in either Auckland or Wellington, you will be a key part of our Marketing team, who drives and supports the development and preparation of business opportunities and tender submissions.§        §This Bid Writer role is a permanent part-time opportunity, contracted to §32 hours per week§. You will have the flexibility to choose how you wish to structure these hours across the week to sustain to sustain what you consider a good work-life balance§        §The role will see you reporting into the Marketing & Client Development Leader, you will work with various bid leaders in the business to support them in development and delivery high-quality tenders. You will need to be a self-starter who can work autonomously and have effective coordinating skills, strong business acumen and the ability to work under pressure.§        § §        §Your responsibilities will involve:§        §          §Leading all aspects of the proposal writing to ensure a quality submission is put forward. This includes re-writing and editing proposal responses from a variety of internal stakeholders, communicating competitive differentiators and methodologies and demonstrating understanding of client needs and how we can deliver the best outcomes for them.§          §Collaborating with Bid Leaders to translate solutions into effective and compelling stories by ensuring win themes are client outcome focused are included in the bid.§          §Collaborating and coordinating with all relevant stakeholders during all tender stages as required§          §Raising the company’s profile via exceptional quality pre-qualification questionnaires and tender submissions§          §Supporting the Marketing and Client Development Leader with content creation for business development.§          §Developing proposal related presentation materials including handouts, graphical presentations, charts, illustrations of concept, case studies§          §Integrating new knowledge, skills and best practices into daily work and share with the team as appropriate§        §        § §        §What’s in it for you?§        §By joining our team, you will be part of our journey to deliver positive environmental, social and economic outcomes for our clients and the communities in which we work and live in.§        §We can offer an inclusive culture, and the opportunity to work with a team that believes and supports each other, as we work together to achieve a common goal.§        §You'll receive support from Leaders, company funded training and personal development, and experience our work/life balance and benefits including; working from home opportunities, an extensive range of health and wellbeing benefits, employee referral incentives, ongoing professional development and competitive remuneration packages.§        § §        §Essential Knowledge, Skills and Experience:§        §          §2-5 years of relevant professional experience in a bid writing capacity within the construction and/or engineering industry§          §Tertiary Qualification or a Diploma in Business Administration, Communications, Marketing or similar.§          §Natural and enthusiastic team player§          §Confident with Microsoft Office products (e.g. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, etc)§          §The ability to work across levels in the organisation and build strong working relationships§        §        § §        §We are looking for someone who sincerely wants to be part of the Calibre family and do their best for our people, clients and partners. If you are ready to join a dynamic and collaborative team and work with leading clients, apply now! §        § §        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About Us§ §Calibre is a leading engineering and design consultancy, operating across multiple market sectors in Australia, New Zealand and the Pacific. We strive to deliver positive economic and social outcomes for our clients and the communities in which we work and live. While engineering is our core skill, we work with central and local government, and private clients to consider assets from a whole-of-life perspective and provide solutions to suit their needs.§ §At Calibre, people are at the heart of everything we do. Creating an exceptional experience for our clients, partners, employees and communities is central to our approach. We are committed to building and sustaining long-term relationships with our clients and partners, enabling our employees to thrive and succeed, and giving back to our communities.§ § § §About the Opportunity§ §We have a fantastic opportunity available for a passionate, dynamic and proactive individual to join our team and play an active part in the continued growth and development of our business. Based in either Auckland or Wellington, you will be a key part of our Marketing team, who drives and supports the development and preparation of business opportunities and tender submissions.§ §This Bid Writer role is a permanent part-time opportunity, contracted to §32 hours per week§. You will have the flexibility to choose how you wish to structure these hours across the week to sustain to sustain what you consider a good work-life balance§ §The role will see you reporting into the Marketing & Client Development Leader, you will work with various bid leaders in the business to support them in development and delivery high-quality tenders. You will need to be a self-starter who can work autonomously and have effective coordinating skills, strong business acumen and the ability to work under pressure.§ § § §Your responsibilities will involve:§ § §Leading all aspects of the proposal writing to ensure a quality submission is put forward. This includes re-writing and editing proposal responses from a variety of internal stakeholders, communicating competitive differentiators and methodologies and demonstrating understanding of client needs and how we can deliver the best outcomes for them.§ §Collaborating with Bid Leaders to translate solutions into effective and compelling stories by ensuring win themes are client outcome focused are included in the bid.§ §Collaborating and coordinating with all relevant stakeholders during all tender stages as required§ §Raising the company’s profile via exceptional quality pre-qualification questionnaires and tender submissions§ §Supporting the Marketing and Client Development Leader with content creation for business development.§ §Developing proposal related presentation materials including handouts, graphical presentations, charts, illustrations of concept, case studies§ §Integrating new knowledge, skills and best practices into daily work and share with the team as appropriate§ § § §What’s in it for you?§ §By joining our team, you will be part of our journey to deliver positive environmental, social and economic outcomes for our clients and the communities in which we work and live in.§ §We can offer an inclusive culture, and the opportunity to work with a team that believes and supports each other, as we work together to achieve a common goal.§ §You'll receive support from Leaders, company funded training and personal development, and experience our work/life balance and benefits including; working from home opportunities, an extensive range of health and wellbeing benefits, employee referral incentives, ongoing professional development and competitive remuneration packages.§ § § §Essential Knowledge, Skills and Experience:§ § §2-5 years of relevant professional experience in a bid writing capacity within the construction and/or engineering industry§ §Tertiary Qualification or a Diploma in Business Administration, Communications, Marketing or similar.§ §Natural and enthusiastic team player§ §Confident with Microsoft Office products (e.g. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, etc)§ §The ability to work across levels in the organisation and build strong working relationships§ § § §We are looking for someone who sincerely wants to be part of the Calibre family and do their best for our people, clients and partners. If you are ready to join a dynamic and collaborative team and work with leading clients, apply now! § § § § §§§§

jobTitle: Advisor - Brand and Experience Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50657869.txt	§Advisor - Brand and Experience§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Advisor - Brand and Experience§§Advertiser: §Ministry for the Environment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Brand Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Advisor - Brand and Experience §      §        §Do you have excellent project management and marketing experience? Are you passionate about using your skills to help people connect with our environment and the important work the ministry is doing?§        §We are looking for an Advisor - Brand & Experience to join our team. You'll have a good understanding of brand and publications management and apply your skills to make sure the performance of the Ministry for the Environment brand grows and is positioned correctly and support staff across the Ministry to be advocates for the brand.§        §Our Environment Aotearoa report has shown that our natural environment is under pressure, and overwhelmingly our research shows that New Zealanders want to make a difference. You'll be supporting an integral and important piece of work to shape and reinforce our identity and build trust and credibility. The role sits within the team, which is tasked with inspiring Kiwis to take action in their daily lives, to help influence the system to create change and encouraging businesses to act.§        §People want to know more about what they can do - and here at the Ministry, we have evidence, facts and information that can help shape the debate.§        §Your work will be diverse, and you will be involved in a variety of projects so your project management skills will be put to good use. A key part of your role will be working on our publications as well as activating our channel strategy. You will also provide advice to a range of staff across the organisation, so your ability to build and maintain strong relationships is key. You'll need to be a solid all-rounder with a passion to help make New Zealand liveable, now and into the future. You will be part of busy team, so you'll be a self-starter with plenty of initiative.§        §This role sits within the Brand & Experience Team and reports to the Manager - Brand and Experience. Our team is tasked with the following for MfE:§        §          §Brand development and management§          §Publications management§          §Design management§          §Events planning and coordination§          §Marketing and sponsorship management§          §Channels planning and implementation§        §        §Here's what we want for this role:§        §          §A marketing and brand all-rounder in the space - think brand, publications, agency management, sponsorship, events and channel management.§          §Tertiary level qualification in marketing and/or communications-related disciplines, with a minimum of two years relevant experience§          §Experience in project management and coordination ideally in the publications and agency space§          §Experience in brand management and/or marketing§          §Ability to analyse complex information from a variety of sources to identify risks and opportunities§          §Experience delivering outcomes for projects or event management§          §Experience in managing the assessment and activation of sponsorship§          §Experience in delivering a channel strategy§          §An understanding of Te Ao Māori§          §Comfortable building and maintaining trusted relationships at all levels of an organisation and externally§          §Excellent written and oral communication skills§          §Understanding of Government processes and procedures would be an advantage§          §Someone who is happy with rolling their sleeves up and getting involved where they are needed§        §        §Why work for us?§        §As well as being part of an innovative organisation with an important purpose of making Aotearoa, New Zealand, the most liveable place in the world, we offer you:§        §          §a supportive and collaborative work environment§          §job satisfaction from contributing to crucial and meaningful work§          §a flexible by default approach to support your work-life balance§          §agile working, allowing you variety and challenges across the organisation as we work as ‘One MfE'§          §generous leave entitlements§          §Te Reo Maori language courses (and te Reo Maori competency allowance)§          §an active social club and employee networks§          §opportunities for development and education§          §open working location§        §        §We embrace diversity and inclusion and are committed to equal opportunities. What's important to us is ‘he rau kotahi tangata' - embracing our multiple talents - by harnessing our diversity and being inclusive.  We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds.§        §Further information§        §The Advisor - Brand and Experience position description is attached for your information (on the MfE Careers site)§        §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory, including a valid work visa covering the whole period of employment if applying internationally.§        §How to Apply§        §Apply directly by completing the online application form and submit your CV and cover letter outlining how your experience relates to this role.§        §If you require further information about the role please contact Emily Byrne by email at §Emily.byrne@mfe.govt.nz§        §Salary range for this role is $69,848 to $87,808. Appointment within these ranges will be based on skills and experience.§        §Applications close: 18 October 2020§        §§      §      §      §    §    §www.mfe.govt.nz§  §§§Do you have excellent project management and marketing experience? Are you passionate about using your skills to help people connect with our environment and the important work the ministry is doing?§We are looking for an Advisor - Brand & Experience to join our team. You'll have a good understanding of brand and publications management and apply your skills to make sure the performance of the Ministry for the Environment brand grows and is positioned correctly and support staff across the Ministry to be advocates for the brand.§Our Environment Aotearoa report has shown that our natural environment is under pressure, and overwhelmingly our research shows that New Zealanders want to make a difference. You'll be supporting an integral and important piece of work to shape and reinforce our identity and build trust and credibility. The role sits within the team, which is tasked with inspiring Kiwis to take action in their daily lives, to help influence the system to create change and encouraging businesses to act.§People want to know more about what they can do - and here at the Ministry, we have evidence, facts and information that can help shape the debate.§Your work will be diverse, and you will be involved in a variety of projects so your project management skills will be put to good use. A key part of your role will be working on our publications as well as activating our channel strategy. You will also provide advice to a range of staff across the organisation, so your ability to build and maintain strong relationships is key. You'll need to be a solid all-rounder with a passion to help make New Zealand liveable, now and into the future. You will be part of busy team, so you'll be a self-starter with plenty of initiative.§This role sits within the Brand & Experience Team and reports to the Manager - Brand and Experience. think brand, publications, agency management, sponsorship, events and channel management.§Tertiary level qualification in marketing and/or communications-related disciplines, with a minimum of two years relevant experience§Experience in project management and coordination ideally in the publications and agency space§Experience in brand management and/or marketing§Ability to analyse complex information from a variety of sources to identify risks and opportunities§Experience delivering outcomes for projects or event management§Experience in managing the assessment and activation of sponsorship§Experience in delivering a channel strategy§An understanding of Te Ao Māori§Comfortable building and maintaining trusted relationships at all levels of an organisation and externally§Excellent written and oral communication skills§Understanding of Government processes and procedures would be an advantage§Someone who is happy with rolling their sleeves up and getting involved where they are needed§§Why work for us?§As well as being part of an innovative organisation with an important purpose of making Aotearoa, New Zealand, the most liveable place in the world, we offer you:§§a supportive and collaborative work environment§job satisfaction from contributing to crucial and meaningful work§a flexible by default approach to support your work-life balance§agile working, allowing you variety and challenges across the organisation as we work as ‘One MfE'§generous leave entitlements§Te Reo Maori language courses (and te Reo Maori competency allowance)§an active social club and employee networks§opportunities for development and education§open working location§§We embrace diversity and inclusion and are committed to equal opportunities. jobText: TXT/50661833.txt	§Senior Operations Executive, Consumer and Media Insights (CMI)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Operations Executive, Consumer and Media Insights (CMI)§§Advertiser: §The Nielsen Company§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Market Research & Analysis§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Operations Executive, Consumer and Media Insights (CMI) §      §        §Looking for a dynamic career with a company that encourages and rewards creativity and fresh thinking? Do you love turning the complex into something simple and easy to understand?  Are you looking at starting a career in data analytics or media research? Are you keen to learn and keen to grow? This could be the ideal role for you.§ §        §The Consumer and Media Insights (CMI) Operations team are responsible for the ongoing delivery of survey data to clients.§        §The CMI survey provides a 360-degree view of the consumer and provides valuable insights to our clients on what people are buying, watching and doing. §        §The Operations team, based in Auckland, are seeking an enthusiastic, permanent new team member to join their hard-working, collaborative team. §        §The Senior Operations Executive plays an important role in impacting what we provide to clients.  Will work closely with key stakeholders in the CMI survey process to ensure the data we provide is of high quality, accurate and timely. § §        §RESPONSIBILITIES §        §          §Preparing and processing of data in a timely and quality-driven manner§          §Contributing towards the delivery of data to clients, following appropriate procedures and approvals in the given time§          §Conducting data audits and participating in Quality Control for all aspects of the CMI process§          §Troubleshooting technical data queries and assisting internal stakeholders§          §Small scale project coordination §          §Contribution towards process improvement and implementation§          §Working closely with internal stakeholders such as the Data Analytics team to ensure our survey codebooks are maintained and updated WITH. Troubleshooting & Quality checking of survey data.§ Implementing process improvements to the production process.§          §Working closely with Production Team Leader; to ensure consistency in our databases, investigating any discrepancies, identifying historical issues, being a point of contact with other Nielsen teams to integrate datasets, supporting custom client requests. §          §Updating and maintaining CMI’s resource and task management tools and updating and maintaining various CMI performance metrics.§        §        § §        §QUALIFICATIONS§        §          §Logical thought process§          §Excellent attention to detail§          §Good verbal and written communication skills§          §Good organisational skills & the ability to juggle competing priorities§          §Confidence liaising with internal stakeholders§          §An interest in data analytics§          §Outside of the box, solution-focused thinking§          §A ‘can do’ attitude§          §Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team, within a global company§          §Previous programming experience recommended§          §SQL experience desirable§          §Experience using a workforce planning/scheduling tool§          §Candidate must possess full work rights in NZ and currently based in Auckland§        §        § §      §      §      §    §  §§§Looking for a dynamic career with a company that encourages and rewards creativity and fresh thinking? Do you love turning the complex into something simple and easy to understand?  Are you looking at starting a career in data analytics or media research? Are you keen to learn and keen to grow? This could be the ideal role for you.§ §  §The Consumer and Media Insights (CMI) Operations team are responsible for the ongoing delivery of survey data to clients.§  §The CMI survey provides a 360-degree view of the consumer and provides valuable insights to our clients on what people are buying, watching and doing. §  §The Operations team, based in Auckland, are seeking an enthusiastic, permanent new team member to join their hard-working, collaborative team. §  §The Senior Operations Executive plays an important role in impacting what we provide to clients.  Will work closely with key stakeholders in the CMI survey process to ensure the data we provide is of high quality, accurate and timely. § §  §RESPONSIBILITIES § § §Preparing and processing of data in a timely and quality-driven manner§ §Contributing towards the delivery of data to clients, following appropriate procedures and approvals in the given time§ §Conducting data audits and participating in Quality Control for all aspects of the CMI process§ §Troubleshooting technical data queries and assisting internal stakeholders§ §Small scale project coordination § §Contribution towards process improvement and implementation§ §Working closely with internal stakeholders such as the Data Analytics team to ensure our survey codebooks are maintained and updated WITH. Troubleshooting & Quality checking of survey data.§ Implementing process improvements to the production process.§ §Working closely with Production Team Leader; to ensure consistency in our databases, investigating any discrepancies, identifying historical issues, being a point of contact with other Nielsen teams to integrate datasets, supporting custom client requests. § §Updating and maintaining CMI’s resource and task management tools and updating and maintaining various CMI performance metrics.§ § §  §QUALIFICATIONS§ § §Logical thought process§ §Excellent attention to detail§ §Good verbal and written communication skills§ §Good organisational skills & the ability to juggle competing priorities§ §Confidence liaising with internal stakeholders§ §An interest in data analytics§ §Outside of the box, solution-focused thinking§ §A ‘can do’ attitude§ §Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team, within a global company§ §Previous programming experience recommended§ §SQL experience desirable§ §Experience using a workforce planning/scheduling tool§ §Candidate must possess full work rights in NZ and currently based in Auckland§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Product Development and Innovation Executive Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50661869.txt	§Product Development and Innovation Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Product Development and Innovation Executive§§Advertiser: §Kenzzi§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Product Management & Development§§§§§§We are a small, nimble team that is passionate about pushing New Zealand brands forward. We're quick-thinking, design-driven, and customer-focused. We love good tech and are always on the lookout for smart new ways to optimize revenue.§ §In February of 2019 we launched KENZZI which is now the world's number one IPL handset brand. § §Who are we looking for?§ §We're looking for a Product Executive, Product Innovation & Development, to oversee the strategy, development, production, testing and optimization of our physical products. This high leverage role is the glue between manufacturing, marketing & design. You will own our product development road map, and will coordinate the journey of new products from their infancy to their launch.§ §Key Responsibilities:§ § §Collaborate with senior leaders to craft the strategic direction of the company§ §Own end-to-end new product development, from market & product research, competitive analysis, timeline development, design, sourcing, costing, packaging, and pricing.§ §Source and communicate with factories to negotiate pricing, terms, and manufacturing capabilities for both new and existing products.§ §Run user research, usability studies, data-driven experiments and customer interviews to identify new product opportunities and inform product strategy in this rapidly-evolving category.§ §Establish and measure success metrics after launch. Consistently integrate behavior data and customer feedback into essential product decisions.§ §Enforce the KENZZI brand values, aesthetic and quality standards across all of our products.§ §Partner cross-functionally with all teams to ensure brand & strategy alignment and build strong feedback loops.§ §Experience & Qualifications:§ § §1-5 years of experience in product development.§ §Entrepreneurial enthusiasm and grit, always willing to roll up your sleeves.§ §Knowledgeable about negotiating with overseas vendors and what drives their cost structures.§ §Ability to analyze user data and extract business requirements from multiple stakeholders and transform them into usable and elegant product specifications.§ §An uncompromising obsession for high-quality work and great design.§ §About KENZZI§KENZZI is a Kiwi company that has our horizons set across the globe. We have the number one at-home IPL hair removal handset and we are one of the world's fastest-growing beauty tech companies. The KENZZI IPL Handset will produce visible results in just a few treatments and is easy to use and gentle on your skin. The KENZZI is perfect for treating any body part and is backed by our 90 day 100% money-back guarantee.  §As a company we are proud of what we have achieved and wish to continue the growth with our dynamic, passionate and results driven team.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How many years' experience do you have as a product manager?§§§

jobTitle: Marketing Coordinator (Part-time 30 hours) Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50662083.txt	§Marketing Coordinator (Part-time 30 hours)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Coordinator (Part-time 30 hours)§§Advertiser: §Tauranga Art Gallery§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§Tauranga Art Gallery is seeking a proactive, enthusiastic and innovative individual to join our team as our Marketing Coordinator, based in Tauranga CBD.§ §We are looking for that special person with a unique combination of both marketing and media experience who is able to step in and hit the ground running in this busy role.  Reporting to the Director, you will be responsible for all promotion and marketing of the gallery and its programmes and activities including oversight of all digital platforms, brand management, advertising, collateral and media liaison.§ §Position Purpose§ § §Key contact point for all media enquiries and will proactively pursue media opportunities for the organisation.§ §Co-ordinate the gallery’s publicity, develop and distribute the visual and written material for media, marketing and the public.§ §To introduce innovative ways of marketing and promoting gallery exhibitions, events and other activities.§ §To be responsible for the development and implementation of the gallery’s marketing plan within approved budgets and monitor achievement.§ §Manage all digital platforms including the website, Facebook and Instagram as well as e-newsletters and other related promotional activity.§ §Implement and oversee the gallery brand strategy.§ §Co-ordinate and oversee the gallery’s voice through writing, proofing and editing. § § § §To be successful in this role the Marketing Coordinator will have proven marketing experience and ideally work experience in the arts sector. You will have a high level of relationship building skills, an ability to project manage as well as excellent writing and computer skills. Please see the Position Description for more details.§ §The successful applicant will also have:§ § §At least 2 years proven Media/Marketing experience § §Experience with digital platforms, website development, social media & adobe suite§ §Sound verbal and written communication including computer literacy§ §The ability to manage resources efficiently with budget management experience§ §An understanding of Māori cultural values and protocol§ §Integrity and reliability§ §Museum or public art gallery experience (desirable)§ §Photography & video editing (desirable)§ §Full and current drivers licence (desirable)§ §For more information on the Tauranga Art Gallery visit www.artgallery.org.nz.§ §Please forward your cover letter and CV via email to recruitment@artgallery.org.nz.  § §Applications close at 8pm on Sunday 11th October, 2020§ §If you require further information, please contact the Gallery Services Manager, phone (07) 579 0626.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How many years' experience do you have in social media marketing?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Wine Marketing Specialist Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50662608.txt	§Wine Marketing Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Wine Marketing Specialist§§Advertiser: §Villa Maria Estate§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Product Management & Development§§§§§§ Villa Maria is a family-owned winery recognised globally as an icon of the New Zealand wine industry. Exporting to over 60 countries worldwide, Villa Maria has a rich history of producing world-class wine. If you are interested in playing a key role in marketing one of New Zealand’s most iconic brands, read on.§The Wine Marketing Specialist is a newly established position and will be key role in the Global Marketing Team. The role requires a passion for and knowledge of wine and a willingness and ability to ‘own’ strategies that takes our reputation as a world-class winery to the next level. §This is an exceptional opportunity for an experienced Wine Marketing Specialist to join our Global Marketing Team and help us achieve our ambitious goals. Based in our winery office in Mangere, Auckland, this is an exciting role for someone who has solid marketing experience in the wine industry and a passion for world-class wines.§What you will be doing:§Managing a range of marketing activities and special projects that are key to supporting Villa Maria’s reputation as a world-class wine producer, for example the development and delivery of our Fine Wine Strategy, including the annual global fine wine release calendar§  §Supporting and implementing our wine critic outreach programme and the company-wide awards and reviews submission strategy§  §Provide technical wine-specific marketing support such as wine tasting notes and vintage reports§  §Global trade and media liaison for images, tasting notes, and bottle shots§  §Ensuring all notable wine accolades, reviews and/or scores are communicated widely and efficiently to relevant internal and external audiences; and§  §Be the ‘go-to’ wine expert in the Global Marketing Team and key liaison between our winemakers and the marketing team§About you:§A minimum of 3 to 5 years marketing experience in the wine industry§  §Previous experience in a wine marketing or communications role;§  §A high level of wine knowledge, for example WSET Diploma or similar§  §Exceptional verbal and written communication skills;§  §Demonstrated ability to influence effectively and build strong professional working relationships§ §What we offer:§  §Medical insurance policy to make you feel at ease.§  §Wine allowance and discounts so you can get to know our award-winning products.§  §Opportunities for continuous learning and development.§If this sounds like the role you have been looking for, please apply today by submitting your CV and Cover Letter. Please note that only applicants who are eligible to work in NZ permanently can be considered for this role.  §For a copy of the Job Description visit §Global-Marketing-TeamWine-Specialist-PD.docx§§§§

jobTitle: Head of Corporate Communications Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50662704.txt	§Head of Corporate Communications§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Head of Corporate Communications§§Advertiser: §Tower Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Public Relations & Corporate Affairs§§§§§§About the role§We're looking for a passionate Head of Corporate Communications to lead our communications and corporate brand activity here at Tower. We're on a mission to change up insurance by delivering beautifully simple and rewarding customer experiences, and we want everyone to know about it. Reporting to the Chief People Officer with a dotted line through to the Chief Executive Officer, you’ll work closely with the CEO and Executive team.§You'll be the lead person in telling Tower's story and promoting our reputation across media and social platforms like Linked In and other corporate social mediums.§You'll have oversight of external PR and also need to be adept at strategy and execution across these key areas:§External comms and PR§This will be a big part of your role. It's your job to hunt down stories and find data that demonstrates what we do for our customers. You will have the support of a leading PR agency, but you will need to be adept at finding the data and story opportunities and making it happen. You will also be responsible for leading financial results communications (mostly external) around our AGM, half-year and full-year results.§Internal communications§A skilled and effective internal communications manager is already part of the team. This person leads all of our internal comms activity, maintaining channels, developing content and ensuring we keep to our regular rhythms. Your role here is to support this person and enable them to do their job - acting as a sounding board and further developing their skills. There is also a role for you to play in working with the Chief People Officer to ensure internal cultural aspirations are achieved and other internal activity is delivered.§Sustainability§Tower has started its sustainability journey and it will be your responsibility to implement frameworks and activity that integrates sustainability practices across the business. As well as taking a thought leadership position, it's our role to educate customers in a practical way, so that they understand how to help mitigate it. There is a passionate CEO and engagement from the executive team, it is now up to you to shape and deliver the work.§About Tower§Cultural fit will be really important and you will need to align to our culture of passionate people doing things differently as well living and breathing our company values of values of Brave, Passionate, Driven and Collaborative. Tower prides itself on being a diverse and inclusive environment. We embrace and encourage our employees to bring their whole selves to work, and to celebrate their age, gender, sexual orientation, race, religion and anything else that helps to make our people unique. We are proud holders of the rainbow tick which is a really important symbol for us.§To apply for this job, please visit http://careers.tower.co.nz and enter the job code 35605SK. §Applications close Wednesday, 14 October 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Digital / Growth Marketer Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50662999.txt	§Digital / Growth Marketer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital / Growth Marketer§§Advertiser: §Talent Seed Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Enjoy a digital marketing / growth role driving customer acquisition and retention for startups and established small businesses, using low cost digital methods. You'll be solely focused on strategies related to growing the business. You'll hypothesize, prioritize and test innovative growth strategies and analyze and test to see what’s working.§ You combine two key skills: marketing and technical. You are adept at both marketing and interpreting the data that comes from the marketing.§ You'll be eager to try a variety of new techniques and unconventional strategies. You're excited by the lack of data that faces most new startups.§ You aren’t afraid of failure and will start dozens of different methods all at the same time and see what works and what doesn’t.§ You have an exceptional understanding of buyer psychology and the customer experience, so you can target the right audience and refine their journey to increase sales and retention. Hungry for information you absorb all you can to position a product or service to bring brand awareness and nurture the customer.  § You'll understand the sales funnel and the customer journey.  Qualified and experienced in Digital Marketing, you can provide solid evidence of improving companies’ online revenue.  What we need from you:§ § §To roll up your sleeves and get the job done - we don’t want pretty strategy presentations, we want someone who gets things done; The outcome is the key, and you’ll knock down walls to get there.§ §To be tech savvy: you understand the backend changes needed to improve performance and can work with web developers to get these in place. § §You understand data and you can translate that into what’s next - that’s the key to experimentation. You will see what has been done, and you will quickly come up with a hypothesis.§ §You’re able to work within a small business's budget.§ §You might not know how to do something in particular but you know how to get help to get things moving! § §You ask questions and you continually learn so that we can improve performance. § § Thinklazy is an innovation consultancy. We help clients solve problems for their customers, and we build apps and web apps. We also have our own startup at winedab.com, which matches individual tastes to provide a personalised wine subscription. You’ll be able to get your teeth into great opportunities, while having a variety of exciting projects to work on. This is a ground floor opportunity for someone who wants to make a mark.§ So, if you’re an experienced, resourceful Digital Marketer who’s highly analytical and understands customer psychology and the customer journey, let’s talk!  § §Full time, part time, permanent or contract, we are based in Auckland, but will accept applications for remote working.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience with Search Engine Optimisation (SEO)?§How many years' experience do you have in digital marketing?§Which of the following web analytics tools are you experienced with?§§§
