jobText: TXT/50672971.txt	§Communications Partner - People & Brand§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications Partner - People & Brand§§Advertiser: §Gallagher§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Internal Communications§§§§§§§§§  §    §Communications Partner - People & Brand §    §      §        §Gallagher is continually capturing world attention for our great culture and award-winning solutions.§        §Thinking about a new challenge as we head towards 2021?  There’s never been a better time to join our Group Communications team. §        §We’ve just launched our bespoke new intranet built on Office 365 (which is called “Connect”), we’re in the midst of supporting a ‘Future of Work’ programme which aims to further elevate our status as a leading place to work, and we’ve got a real focus on telling more of the inspiring Gallagher stories from throughout the world.  There’s so much to do and now we need a comms superstar to join our growing team.§        §Reporting to the Group Communications Manager and with close connections to the wider People & Brand team, this newly created Communications Partner position is extremely varied. §        §A large part of the role focuses on internal comms and engagement where your skillsets will be an important support to influence culture, smooth the way for change, keep everyone informed about what’s happening at Gallagher (and why).  There will also be some corporate external communication elements to this role, with a particular focus on sponsorship.  Connecting with our communities has been a fundamental part of the Gallagher fabric for our 80+ years in business. This role will be key to both administering the programme and maximising those connections both internally and externally.§        §On a day-to-day basis, you’ll be comfortable working through simple comms plans, feeding new ideas into our comms calendar, writing compelling stories, compiling engaging digital newsletters, supporting the content development for our global employee events, keeping a close connection with our team of over 1000 people and sharing our key corporate milestones with the world – this role has it all!§        §We’re looking for a driven, people-orientated communicator - to be successful in this role you will have:§        §          §A relevant qualification in communications, journalism, or marketing (or a related field).§          §At least 3+ years’ experience (some internal communications experience is preferred, but external communications, marketing, PR or journalism experience will also be considered).§          §Sound knowledge and understanding of communications best-practice, channels, and relevant technologies.§          §A willing and proactive approach to produce brilliantly simple, accurate and clear communications with ease that show empathy for the intended audience.§          §A strong end-to-end comms management skillset, including project and stakeholder relationship management, concept development, editing and publishing.§          §Flexibility, adaptability, and willingness to take on a wide range of tasks.§          §Excellent time management skills and the ability to work with the team to prioritise work based on impact and value.§          §And if you come with basic channel/intranet management experience, that’s a bonus!§        §        §So if you’re a true brand ambassador who is drawn in by our story and inspired by the uniqueness of our brand, then we’d love you to understand more. For a copy of the Position Description, please see the link on the job ad on our website. For general enquiries email §info@gallagher.com§.§        §Applications will close on Wednesday 4 November 2020.  We’ll look forward to hearing from you.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Gallagher is continually capturing world attention for our great culture and award-winning solutions.§Thinking about a new challenge as we head towards 2021?  There’s never been a better time to join our Group Communications team. §We’ve just launched our bespoke new intranet built on Office 365 (which is called “Connect”), we’re in the midst of supporting a ‘Future of Work’ programme which aims to further elevate our status as a leading place to work, and we’ve got a real focus on telling more of the inspiring Gallagher stories from throughout the world.  There’s so much to do and now we need a comms superstar to join our growing team.§Reporting to the Group Communications Manager and with close connections to the wider People & Brand team, this newly created Communications Partner position is extremely varied. §A large part of the role focuses on internal comms and engagement where your skillsets will be an important support to influence culture, smooth the way for change, keep everyone informed about what’s happening at Gallagher (and why).  There will also be some corporate external communication elements to this role, with a particular focus on sponsorship.  Connecting with our communities has been a fundamental part of the Gallagher fabric for our 80+ years in business. This role will be key to both administering the programme and maximising those connections both internally and externally.§On a day-to-day basis, you’ll be comfortable working through simple comms plans, feeding new ideas into our comms calendar, writing compelling stories, compiling engaging digital newsletters, supporting the content development for our global employee events, keeping a close connection with our team of over 1000 people and sharing our key corporate milestones with the world – this role has it all!§We’re looking for a driven, people-orientated communicator - to be successful in this role you will have:§A relevant qualification in communications, journalism, or marketing (or a related field).§At least 3+ years’ experience (some internal communications experience is preferred, but external communications, marketing, PR or journalism experience will also be considered).§Sound knowledge and understanding of communications best-practice, channels, and relevant technologies.§A willing and proactive approach to produce brilliantly simple, accurate and clear communications with ease that show empathy for the intended audience.§A strong end-to-end comms management skillset, including project and stakeholder relationship management, concept development, editing and publishing.§Flexibility, adaptability, and willingness to take on a wide range of tasks.§Excellent time management skills and the ability to work with the team to prioritise work based on impact and value.§And if you come with basic channel/intranet management experience, that’s a bonus!§So if you’re a true brand ambassador who is drawn in by our story and inspired by the uniqueness of our brand, then we’d love you to understand more. For a copy of the Position Description, please see the link on the job ad on our website. For general enquiries email §info@gallagher.com§.§Applications will close on Wednesday 4 November 2020.  We’ll look forward to hearing from you.§§§§

jobTitle: Bid Writer/Manager - flexible hours Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50673066.txt	§Bid Writer/Manager - flexible hours§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Bid Writer/Manager - flexible hours§§Advertiser: §Plan A Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Bid Writer/Manager – flexible hours§Perfect balance of autonomy and teamwork§Outstanding, supportive team§Challenging, varied, and satisfying work§Regular training and development§Work from your own premises - anywhere in New Zealand§You’re a bid writer with outstanding writing and organisation skills, a positive ‘can do’ approach, and exceptional attention to detail (as well as the ability to look at the big picture).§Personable, commercially astute, and a strong team player, you delight your clients – whether you’re facilitating a strategy session, reviewing a bid at the 11th hour, or writing compelling content from scratch.§You might be a ‘rising star’ or a bid writer with many years of experience. §Perhaps you’re working in an existing bid team (and yearning for a more flexible working arrangement), or you’re already a freelancer and comfortable with a flexible contracting environment.§If this is you, then becoming a Plan A team member could be right for you. §Plan A is New Zealand’s largest and most experienced professional tender writing company.§Being a Plan A consultant is like having your own business, but with ready-made systems, a strong market reputation, IP, collegial support and the ability to manage your workload and through that your income. Each team member invests time and effort in our regular in-house programmes of upskilling, designed with direct input from experienced NZ tender evaluators and Government procurement specialists. §This means that as a Plan A consultant you bring outstanding insight into how to score well in tenders, as well as practical support in writing and producing your tender responses. §Our work involves consulting in a wide range of sectors for clients across New Zealand and internationally. These include civil construction and engineering, security, health services, technology, professional services, and many other areas.§Our clients are most often engineers, managers, or technical people. They typically not only need someone to articulate their information exceptionally well in writing, but also need guidance based on senior experience, business acumen, and courageous, insightful questioning.§Are you right for this opportunity? §You have solid tender writing and bid management experience; excellent project and client management skills; and the ability to work under pressure (but to your own timetable and from your own office).§You have proven abilities in writing content, organising information and managing complex tenders.§Credible, intelligent and insightful – you will have a range of experience that enables you to quickly grasp the essentials in business sectors that are new to you. You will be recognised as an effective communicator – written, verbal, and face-to-face.§We have a national and international reputation for excellence in our field, which we're all fiercely proud of. We enjoy working with each other on projects, relying heavily on email, media platforms, video-conferences and phone discussions to work closely to develop outstanding documents for our clients.§If this sounds like you, please spend some time on our website at www.plana.co.nz. Check out our areas of expertise, client testimonials, and browse the articles we’ve written. You might wish to check the backgrounds of some of the members of our team.§If you’re ready to take the next step in your career and you can meet ALL these criteria, we'd love to hear from you!§Please send us a CV and a covering letter, both in MS Word. Naturally, we will use your response as a demonstration of your ability to analyse and respond to instructions (which is a big part of what we do); and we’ll be looking out for how well you match the description in this advert.§We look forward to your response!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a writer?§How would you rate your English language skills?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience preparing and submitting tenders?§§§

jobTitle: CRM Marketing Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50673108.txt	§CRM Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§CRM Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Westpac§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Direct Marketing & CRM§§§§§§Permanent full time§Britomart, Auckland§ § §Are you passionate about customer relationship marketing, data and results?  Then this is a challenge too good to pass up …§  §About the role:§ §CRM programmes, tracking, next best conversation, optimisation, programmatic – this is your world and this role will help you take it to the next level.   Reporting to the Customer Relationship Marketing Lead, you and the high-performing team you’ll be part of will develop and execute world class data-led marketing programmes to improve customer experience, value, and retention. §  §Responsibilities include:§Developing customer relationship communication plans§Ensuring communication plans deliver against team objectives§Building and maintaining strong relationships with key business divisions to effect positive change§Managing a broad range of internal and external stakeholders§Identifying new opportunities to deliver relevant and timely benefits to our customers and prospects which in turn drives commercial value§Establishing reporting, test and learn opportunities within each communication§Ongoing monitoring to continuously improve the programmes.§What you’ll need to succeed:§Recent experience in Customer Relationship Marketing§Gutsy: full of bravery and determination; not afraid to tackle the hard stuff§Astute: demonstrating knowledge and understanding to get to better customer solutions more quickly§Motivating: challenging and inspiring all those you work with to take action§Experience in the development and implementation of Customer Lifecycle communication programmes§Skilled at the development of trigger based communication programmes§Experience working within a large service organisation with large amounts of customer data, ideally researching and mapping customer experience journeys§Experience in marketing automation systems and programmatic marketing would be a plus.§ §What’s great about working for Westpac?§  §We’re passionate about people and take pride in building teams that reflect the diversity in our communities. As well as immersing yourself in a supportive team environment, you’ll be offered some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market, gain access to a suite of online learning modules and career planning tools to grow with us, as well as our industry-leading superannuation programme.§ § §Interested?§ §Apply today with your CV and cover letter via the link on this page.§ §§§§

jobTitle: Marketing Specialist Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50673262.txt	§Marketing Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Specialist§§Advertiser: §Toi Toi Wines§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Marlborough Wine Ltd is a family run winery which markets  the brands of Toi Toi, Staete Landt, Map Maker, Stone Bay, Marlborough Vines, Mouku and South Seas. §Our winemaking philosophy is t§o§ create exceptional wines of distinctive quality from top vineyards in New Zealand’s best grape growing regions. § Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Gris from Marlborough, Pinot Noir from Central Otago, Chardonnay from Gisborne and our red blends from Hawkes Bay.§  §Our winery is in Marlborough and our Head Office is on the North Shore of Auckland. 65% of our sales are exported.§  §We have driven our brands to be top performers in the NZ, Asian and Australian markets and will be investing to grow our brands in the North American market.§  §So we now seek a marketing specialist with top marketing mix skills, experience and technical knowledge to supercharge our brands in both the B2B and B2C digital market.§  §Simply put we are looking for the best of the best with attributes including:§ § §A solution driven, proactive approach § §Continual focus on excellence § §Attention to detail§ §Can-do, autonomous work ethic § §Enthusiastic team player § §Willingness to get stuck in & get the job done§ §You'll need to bring at least three years of proven marketing experience with clear digital knowledge, skills and technical competency. An up to date knowledge of industry and marketing best practice, coupled with the drive to stay on top of developments will be key.§  §To excel in this role you need to be a team player with excellent communication skills and the ability to rally the troops for the detail, collate and execute through various channels. You'll apply strong analytical skills and detail to your work and be comfortable managing multiple projects across various markets.  With that said, it's not just about strategy as you will need to get stuck into the nitty gritty and be a self described "doer".§  §You will report directly to the business owner and so will have the opportunity to grow the business directly.§  §Skills and Experience§ § §Add insight to our sales & marketing plans and take ownership for the continual development of the marketing strategy.§ §Ensure we are optimised across all channels whilst ensuring a solid focus on the key indicators.§ §Manage our paid search and online advertising campaigns to drive direct business and ensure excellent ROI.§ §Work across multiple markets and projects with active involvement in managing our web development and digital marketing agencies and resources.§ §Drive all our social platforms ensuring regular communication and engagement with our customers.§ §Take an analytical approach to all marketing activities, continually reviewing all available insights for improved reach, conversions, audience targeting, target market research, campaign planning and creative development.§ §Ensure our website SEO is targeted and continually up to date with industry changes.§ §Develop and implement regular communication strategies to engage with our customers including EDM's, social media, print and key partners § §Develop various marketing collateral § §Responsible for keeping imagery and all marketing folders up to date§ §Review, develop our brand positioning and alignment across all media§ §The ideal candidate:§ § §Experience across a diverse range of digital platforms including, CRM, SEO, SEM, Website CMS§ §A strong understanding of key tools including Google Analytics, Facebook Analytics.§ §Experience in managing deliverables, value, efficiency and QC with external agencies.§ §Experience within an FMCG brand related environment.§ §If you have what it takes we want to hear from you. §  §This position is a full time role but with flexible hours, so that you can manage a family environment  We are open to discussing options which will suit the right person. §  §Please apply through Seek attaching your CV and Cover Letter. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Junior Retail Project Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50673506.txt	§Junior Retail Project Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior Retail Project Manager§§Advertiser: §become§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Product Management & Development§§§§§§Junior Retail Project Manager§   § Our client is a global, full-service integrated marketing agency based on the North Shore who are on a look out for a Junior Retail Project Manager with experience in the retail design and marketing space. You will monitor and manage the progress of key retail projects, effectively collaborate with internal and external stakeholders ensuring projects are delivered on time within budget. You will work alongside the Head of Sales, overseeing the roll-out and development of cutting edge retail concepts and while delivering excellent customer service.§   § §Primary responsibilities:§ § §Working on retail projects, including opening of flagship stores§ §Responsible for seamless end to end process§ §Provide recommendations with design management and compliance§ §   §Duties:§ § §Managing multiple projects simultaneously§ §Assist with overseeing retail development, layout and fit-out activities§ §Fostering ongoing relationships with key partners§ §Daily project operation and management.§ §Work with partnering teams to deliver successful retail launches to the client.§ §Writing forecasting and budgeting reports.§ §   §Experience and skills:§ § §Minimum 2 years in retail and experiential marketing§ §Strong attention to detail and organisational skills.§ §Experience in consumer electronics, telco and in retail sectors§ §Project management tools such as Jira§ §   §Other requirements:§ § §Experience in retail design including retail development, layouts and fit-outs.§ §Commercially savvy§ §Self-motivated and a problem solver§ §Proactive, positive and can-do attitude, motivator, energetic and punctual§ §Great communicator - excellent written and verbal communication skills.§ §Knowledge in digital marketing, advertising and marketing communication a plus§ § This is a full-time permanent opportunity, starting as soon as possible.§   § In return you will work with a great team of people, helping the business and their clients grow in the New Zealand market. §Hit 'Apply' if you are looking to progress in your career and wanting to take the next step.§   §  §Please note:Only those who reside in New Zealand, with valid New Zealand working rights need to apply.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have experience in a sales role?§How many years of project management experience do you have?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Advisor, Communications and Engagement Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50673749.txt	§Senior Advisor, Communications and Engagement§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Advisor, Communications and Engagement§§Advertiser: §Fire and Emergency New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Internal Communications§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Senior Advisor, Communications and Engagement §    §    §      §        §We are looking for a Senior Advisor, Communications and Engagement based in Te Hiku (Auckland). This is a new regionally-based role, reporting through to the National Communications and Engagement Directorate based in National Headquarters (Wellington).§        §The Senior Advisor will need to be an experienced communications and engagement generalist, able to turn their hand to media management, identifying and implementing internal and external communications outputs as well as acting as Public Information Manager, as needed, during an emergency response.§        §This is a critical role and will ensure high-quality regional support is available and well aligned. As this will be a regionally based role reporting through to a national function, the Senior Advisor will need to be able to be adept at managing multiple priorities and working autonomously.§        §This is a permanent role and benefits include matched KiwiSaver employer contributions of up to 6%, life and income protection insurance, and generous sick leave provisions through our wellness policy.§        §About you§        §The successful candidate will need to have:§        §          §a relevant tertiary qualification in communications or related field§          §at least five years' experience working in a senior communications or engagement role§          §significant experience in media management§          §experience undertaking a Public Information Manager role in an emergency event, or significant experience in crisis and issues management, ideally within an operational context§          §demonstrated ability to manage competing priorities and deadlines§          §demonstrated experience developing and implementing communications and engagement plans§          §excellent ability to write clear, accurate communications for a range of channels (including digital channels)§          §experience building close and trusted working relationships with senior executives with the ability to influence§          §experience in a similar role in an operational delivery agency is highly desirable.§        §        §About us§        §For more than 150 years, fire service organisations have been at the heart of New Zealand communities, protecting and preserving life and property.§        §In that time, the importance of our service has remained vital to our communities but our role and the types of emergencies we respond to has changed.§        §Climate change, new technology, and a growing, aging and diversifying population, means our communities face new challenges. Unplanned emergency events are also increasing in frequency and severity.§        §In 2017, Fire and Emergency New Zealand was established to bring together New Zealand's urban and rural fire services into one integrated, modern fire and emergency services organisation to reflect the changing roles of firefighters and meet the changing needs of our communities.§        §These days, we do so much more than just fight fires. We work with communities to build their resilience by helping them prepare for, respond to and recover well from emergencies.§        §We respond to a wide variety of emergencies including motor vehicle accidents, medical emergencies, dealing with hazardous substances, severe weather events and natural disasters. We work to reduce risk to make our communities§        §How to apply§        §If this sounds like you go to our website §www.fireandemergency.nz§ to view the position descriptions and application details.§        §You will receive an email response to confirm we have received your application.§        §Applications close Monday, 12 October 2020. §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§We are looking for a Senior Advisor, Communications and Engagement based in Te Hiku (Auckland). This is a new regionally-based role, reporting through to the National Communications and Engagement Directorate based in National Headquarters (Wellington).§The Senior Advisor will need to be an experienced communications and engagement generalist, able to turn their hand to media management, identifying and implementing internal and external communications outputs as well as acting as Public Information Manager, as needed, during an emergency response.§This is a critical role and will ensure high-quality regional support is available and well aligned. As this will be a regionally based role reporting through to a national function, the Senior Advisor will need to be able to be adept at managing multiple priorities and working autonomously.§This is a permanent role and benefits include matched KiwiSaver employer contributions of up to 6%, life and income protection insurance, and generous sick leave provisions through our wellness policy.§About you§The successful candidate will need to have:§a relevant tertiary qualification in communications or related field§at least five years' experience working in a senior communications or engagement role§significant experience in media management§experience undertaking a Public Information Manager role in an emergency event, or significant experience in crisis and issues management, ideally within an operational context§demonstrated ability to manage competing priorities and deadlines§demonstrated experience developing and implementing communications and engagement plans§excellent ability to write clear, accurate communications for a range of channels (including digital channels)§experience building close and trusted working relationships with senior executives with the ability to influence§experience in a similar role in an operational delivery agency is highly desirable.§About us§For more than 150 years, fire service organisations have been at the heart of New Zealand communities, protecting and preserving life and property.§In that time, the importance of our service has remained vital to our communities but our role and the types of emergencies we respond to has changed.§Climate change, new technology, and a growing, aging and diversifying population, means our communities face new challenges. Unplanned emergency events are also increasing in frequency and severity.§In 2017, Fire and Emergency New Zealand was established to bring together New Zealand's urban and rural fire services into one integrated, modern fire and emergency services organisation to reflect the changing roles of firefighters and meet the changing needs of our communities.§These days, we do so much more than just fight fires. We work with communities to build their resilience by helping them prepare for, respond to and recover well from emergencies.§We respond to a wide variety of emergencies including motor vehicle accidents, medical emergencies, dealing with hazardous substances, severe weather events and natural disasters. We work to reduce risk to make our communities§How to apply§If this sounds like you go to our website §www.fireandemergency.nz§ to view the position descriptions and application details.§You will receive an email response to confirm we have received your application.§Applications close Monday, 12 October 2020. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

our communities face new challenges. jobTitle: Marketing Automation Specialist Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50674477.txt	§Marketing Automation Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Automation Specialist§§Advertiser: §Vodafone New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Market Research & Analysis§§§§§§Company description:§We want to inspire people to capture the opportunities of a digital future and connect for a better future. That is why we are here. §At Vodafone we have changed the lives of billions of people for over 30 years. We made the first ever mobile phone call over 30 years ago. And we sent the first SMS: “Merry Christmas”. From taking 4G to the Moon and using big data for social to intelligent transport systems and emergency drones, we are still shaking things up. §Be part of a company which helps those who need it most. Whether teaching girls to code, providing connectivity to disaster hit areas or putting on our trainers and running for charity. §The future is exciting. Ready?§Job description:§Tihei mauri ora! Tēnā koutou katoa.§“Behold, there is life! Acknowledgement to all.”§ §At Vodafone, we’re committed to providing you with a friendly workplace environment where you can manage home and work balance through our leading flexible working practises. We value the diversity of thought, perspective and backgrounds our people bring to work with them every day. We support our communities through the Vodafone New Zealand Foundation with an ambitious goal to halve the number of disadvantaged young people in Aotearoa by 2027. Our world-leading Wellbeing program supports your holistic wellness and connects you with the tools, skills and people that enable you to be at your best on a daily basis. §Reporting to the Direct Marketing & Automation Centre of Excellence Lead, the §Marketing Automation Specialist§ is responsible for building, executing and optimising high quality marketing automation programs that deliver key business outcomes across Vodafone’s owned channels.§You’ll focus on segmenting and analysing the customer database to target campaigns, with strong attention to detail and the ability to follow and refine analytic procedures and reporting standards.§ §What Will I Be Doing?§ §Delivery of targeted direct marketing campaigns to drive against key cross-sell, upsell, retention and engagement initiatives§ §Drive campaign insights and reporting to help the business optimise its marketing investment§ §Continually identify opportunities to refine the execution of effective campaigns, new initiatives or products, and promotions § §Work closely with Base Marketers and Customer Data Analysts in the delivery of campaigns§ §What Will I Bring?§ §Demonstrated capability in working with campaign management tools such as Marketo, (or others such as Unica, Eloqua and Adobe)§ §Clear understanding of digital marketing techniques§ §Exceptional logical thinking and ability to simplify decision making§ §Ability to analyse and manipulate data§ §High attention to detail and level of accuracy § §Able to manage multiple projects simultaneously with a positive attitude§ §Strong commercial acumen§ §Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to manage relationships cross-organisation as well as with external consultants and providers§ §A growth mind-set and the desire to continuously improve§ § §Joining the Vodafone whānau will stretch you, challenge you and provide opportunities you’ve been seeking to expand your career. You’ll engage in unique workplace experiences, be exposed to exciting and innovative technology, and gain opportunities for learning beyond Aotearoa.  §Me mahi tahi tātou mo te oranga o te katoa. §“We work together for the benefit of all”§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Event & Marketing Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50674860.txt	§Event & Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Event & Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Neighbourhood Events Co§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$25,000 - $34,999 plus super§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Event Management§§§§§§About Neighbourhood Events Co.§ § § §Neighbourhood Events Co is a fun, personal and professional event agency who are driven by the "Support Local" ethos. § §With established events taking place throughout the year in neighbourhoods across Australia and New Zealand, everything we do is about creating memorable experiences to enjoy in excellent company and over a few glasses of exceptional local beer, wine and food.§ §Our culture is one that is down-to-earth, adventurous, welcoming and respectful; we strive for the highest standards both in the events we create and people that belong to our awesome team.§ § § §About the role§ § § §With our head office located in Perth, Western Australia the successful applicant will be required to work autonomously and remotely.§ §In close contact with the business owner your day-to-day will be varied depending on what events we have going on at any given time – there's a lot of different events at once so if you like having lots of balls in the air at once, this is the job for you!§ §Here's what you'll be responsible for in the role:§ §Event Management§Digital Marketing - Social media management, content creation and engagement§Various PR tasks including regular media releases and networking with stakeholders / influencers§Email marketing including content creation, management and analysis§Basic artwork creation§ §The successful applicant will also be required to travel domestically within New Zealand.§ §Please Note - This is a part time role (15-22.5 Hours Per Week)§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Flexible working options. Want to work from home or a local cafe? No problem!§An organisation that is committed to providing career and self-learning opportunities§A fabulous team to work with, vibe off and socialise with§ § § §Who were looking for§ § § §As a small, dynamic team we're searching for someone who knows how take an opportunity and make it their own! With growth opportunities available this is the perfect role for someone with past experience who wants to re-enter the events industry.§ §5+ years experience in events management§Marketing experience§Strong understanding of social media platforms and their capabilities§Experience in design (Adobe Creative Suite / InDesign / Canva)§A keen creative eye for detail§Ability to be responsible for and coordinate multiple projects and tasks at the one time§Loves new challenges, naturally ambitious, enthusiastic and wants to be part of an innovative team§Very personable and confident§Passion for social media and creative industries§Available to work weekends if required§Copy writing prowess§Highly organised and has worked within small teams§Client focused attitude and customer service driven, passionate and motivated§Ability to work independently and autonomously§ §Please Note - This is a part time role (15-22.5 Hours Per Week)§ §Please include a cover letter with your resume along with any links to or examples of your creative work or past projects.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in event management?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

jobTitle: Digital Marketing Executive - Tall Poppy Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50675348.txt	§Digital Marketing Executive - Tall Poppy§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing Executive - Tall Poppy§§Advertiser: §NetYourJob§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Kapiti Coast, Full Time, Marketing§Please Quote Reference Number 77407§§Great opportunity for an Junior level Digital Marketer§12 month maternity cover role - Potential to become permanent§Join an exciting company that is doing great things!§Tall Poppy are a modern real estate company with a unique business model. We put the customer at the heart of everything we do and through a collective team environment we accomplish big results.§We're looking for a §Junior level Digital Marketing Executive§ to join our Head Office team in a 12 month maternity cover contract with the possibility that the role could become permanent.§As a key member of our Marketing Team you'll work alongside the team to plan, develop, implement and continuously improve digital marketing communications to assist the business in meeting its objectives.§Reporting to the Senior Manager - Brand and Digital Performance, your day-to-day responsibilities will include (but are not limited to)§:§Executing end to end digital marketing campaigns including; email, search, display, video, and social campaigns§Reviewing and critiquing campaign briefs and working with business units to create the best digital marketing campaigns and solutions§Selecting and targeting relevant customers for digital campaigns§Developing your understanding of data analysis and customer targeting to ensure effective campaign performance§This role would be great for someone with a few years' experience in digital marketing who is looking for their next challenge.§Key skills and attributes include§:§2+ years' experience in a digital marketing role§Experience reviewing, executing and managing digital marketing campaigns§Strong attention to detail§Strong communication skills§Exceptional time management§A tertiary qualification in marketing would be desired§Tall Poppy is going through a significant period of growth and we are looking for someone that is interested in growing with us. We value an individual's attitude and aptitude and someone who has a desire to continually learn and develop will find Tall Poppy an incredible place to work.§Parking is available.§To express your interest, please APPLY NOW through our online application form with a current CV and covering letter§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you completed a qualification in marketing?§How many years experience do you have in a digital marketing role?§What is your salary expectation for this role?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Brand and Comms Manager : 13 Month Maternity Contract Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50679259.txt	§Brand and Comms Manager : 13 Month Maternity Contract§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Brand and Comms Manager : 13 Month Maternity Contract§§Advertiser: §Bright NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§3 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Brand Management§§§§§§Are you a brand superstar with a passion for bringing the customer journey to life?§  §Do your exceptional communication skills help you gain traction across marketing and media initiatives?§  §Are you a natural self-starter and relationship builder who can harness the talents of the team around you?§  § §  §Our client is no ordinary company.§ §They are a premium, award-winning global brand with a unique history of performance, quality, and style.  A legacy of advanced innovation and excellence delivers a customer experience that is in a class of its own. This is all driven by people passionate about going the extra mile, faster. §  §The Marketing Team is looking for a talented Brand and Comms Manager §(intermediate level) §who shares this passion and is committed to supporting the brand to achieve its strategic vision. §  §This is an incredible 13-month contract opportunity to join a market-leading brand synonymous with luxury and peak performance.§  §Your brand and comms management skills are a given, but what sets you apart is your energy and ability to immerse yourself in the brand. You are a self-starter who draws on exceptional organisational skills, initiative, and creative thinking to align the brand vision and business objectives.§  §Importantly, to thrive in this role you will have a positive and team-focused communication style. So, you will be receptive, engaging and a natural when it comes to building trust and developing strong working relationships.§  §Your resourcefulness, planning and time management skills mean you always deliver and are calm under pressure. You care about the detail and accuracy but can adapt and adjust your approach to maximise opportunities and achieve consistent results.§  §Your Primary Purpose§  §Supporting the Head of Marketing, the primary purpose of the role is to achieve and maintain an industry-leading brand position and help the organisation realise its strategic vision.§  §Background & Qualifications§  §You will have a tertiary qualification in marketing, communications, or a related discipline, with several years of experience in marketing, PR experience, strong writing, and computer skills. Experience within the automotive industry or working with high-end luxury brands will be advantageous.§  §Key Areas of Responsibility include: §  §MARKETING§ § §Leading preparation of advertising briefs§ §Liaising with agencies and team on briefing, deliverables§ §Preparing and managing timelines, implementation, tracking and reporting§ §MEDIA§ § §Creation & distribution of media releases, product information and imagery to media§ §Media liaison§ §Lead Ambassador management§ §EVENTS§  §•  Lead strategy, with the support of Head of Marketing, of event planning/management§  §Key technical skills §  §As well as exceptional writing and editing skills, you will have a strong technical working knowledge and understanding of:§ § §Website management using a content management system and CRM capabilities§ §Social media management and planning§ §Marketing automation platforms will be advantageous§ §If this sounds like you and you are ready to take the next step, please send your CV and cover letter to Tracy Meyer: Managing Director – Talent Partner: Bright NZ§  §A detailed Job Description, for shortlisted applicants, is available on request. jobTitle: Marketing Manager - Growth and Performance  Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50679877.txt	§Marketing Manager - Growth and Performance §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Manager - Growth and Performance §§Advertiser: §Tend§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§Are you ready to be part of the team that changes the way Kiwis experience healthcare?  We are!  At Tend, we have designed and built a digital-first, primary healthcare service that is set to transform the way Kiwis receive care in New Zealand. We are committed to changing health outcomes for New Zealanders and at the same time creating a workplace that is diverse, innovative, collaborative, compassionate and bold. What better opportunity than to do this alongside our very own founders and Co-CEO’s James and Cecilia Robinson. This dynamic duo who are well recognised for their leadership within business, are also responsible for one of NZ’s most successful startups, My Food Bag. Now onto their next chapter, James and Cecilia’s focus, along with our passionate team of health professionals, technologists and business leaders is in transforming NZ healthcare. Do you want to be part of this journey?§This Marketing Manager - Growth and Performance role is a newly created role that will be responsible for co-designing and driving the strategic marketing direction of Tend. Reporting to the CEO this role will be focused on delivering results through the use of digitally led channels to achieve our growth objectives. Some of your main responsibilities will include;§Design, implementation and performance of marketing campaigns, creative and digital e-commerce opportunities§Setting the strategy for customer growth and engagement by developing and executing the overall digital marketing strategy§Building brand awareness and converting leads to drive growth and impact§Create and oversee compelling content creation that adds value to our customers and is aligned to our business goals§Leverage your experience with digital marketing tools to drive growth§Develop, drive and maintain key performance metric reporting and overall marketing budgets§About you§We are looking for someone who has proven technical marketing experience and can demonstrate their ability to grow brands and top line performance.  You will think commercially and thrive on opportunities to take ownership and deliver strong business results. You will be a driven, self-starter who works collaboratively.. You will be hard working and competent at an experienced level with marketing platforms. You will also have exceptional written, analytical and problem solving skills and have at least 7 years of marketing experience.§As part of our recruitment, we will allocate you a task so you are able to demonstrate your skills and what you could bring to this role. If you’re ready for a new challenge in a dynamic, fast-paced startup environment with some of NZ’s top talent, we would love to hear from you.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing manager?§§§

jobText: TXT/50680123.txt	§Marketing and Engagement Advisor - Youth - Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing and Engagement Advisor - Youth - Oranga Tamariki§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Marketing and Engagement Advisor - Youth§Permanent, full-time opportunity§Wellington§The Engaging all New Zealanders team within Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children exists in order to encourage New Zealanders to take actions that support children and young people facing significant challenges.§n this new newly created, youth-centred Marketing and Engagement Advisor role, you will design and produce engaging documentation, promotional and multimedia content that supports the Engaging all New Zealanders marketing campaign and strategies.§You will be making a significant impact to the lives of New Zealand tamariki and rangatahi by educating the public about the experiences of young people confronting difficult challenges. The content that you produce will help New Zealanders understand how they can support tamariki and rangatahi in the community, and how NGOs and other organisations support these efforts.§The team you will be joining has significant skills and experience in marketing, social media, video content production and community engagement. From time to time you may support with other communications, engagement and marketing projects.§What you will bring:§To be successful in this role, you will ideally have the following:§Proven experience providing pastoral support to a diverse range of children and young people§Proven experience running child and young person-centred workshops and other insight gathering processes§Proven graphic design and multimedia content production experience§Experience co-designing creative content with children and young people§Prior experience managing promotional activity through social media§Expert youth engagement skills§Knowledge of a range of pastoral support techniques and when to apply the right option§Proficiency in Te Reo Māori and a thorough understanding of Te Ao Māori would be an advantage§Creative thinker, with a passion for the wider goal of supporting young people facing significant challenges to reach their potential§Sound risk assessment, and risk mitigation skills§Ability to establish positive relationships at a high level and to manage complex working relationships with people at all levels within and outside of government in a discrete and confidential manner§About us§All tamariki and rangatahi deserve to feel safe, have their voices heard, and be surrounded by loving whānau. At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, we're on a journey to ensure that it happens.§How to apply§Apply online with your CV and cover letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. If you have any questions about the role, please contact §Gaynor.Brymer@ot.govt.nz§Applications close Sunday, 18 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

an exciting time to join our small but focused team with ample opportunities to make your mark and lead on high profile projects and campaigns. §ABOUT THE ROLE §Marketing & Communication 60% §• Lead copy-writing and production of marketing materials and key publications §• Manage the quarterly electronic newsletter, including sourcing content and images and using newsletter software to distribute it §• Develop, manage, update & write content for the Parafed Auckland website §• Create and implement a social media plan §• Maintain social media accounts §• Report back on web metrics (i.e. user traffic, online mentions, social media statistics) and analysis of this data for social media use going forward §• Provide creative, editorial and operational support for key projects and campaigns §• Build the profile of the charity through local and regional media §• Identify key media contacts, build and maintain contacts §• Liaise with suppliers such as agencies, design, and print and production teams at all stages §• Co-ordinate management of the Parafed Auckland database §• Produce marketing reports from database as and when required §Business Development 20% §• Developing an annual market and business development plan §• Planning, preparation and delivery of bids and proposals for new businesses §• Growing revenue and revenue streams (Sponsorship) §• Representing and promoting Parafed Auckland programmes, products and services §• Planning and execution of promotional activities and events §• Developing and maintaining trusted relationships with existing and new partners §• Establishing contracts and commercial arrangements that best represent the interests of Parafed Auckland §• Ensuring effective engagement and handover of projects §• Analysis of activity and reporting to the management §Others 20% §• Help to organise and promote events §• Carry out any other duties commensurate with the general level of responsibility of the post §EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS §• Relevant experience in Marketing, Communication and business development, preferably gained in the charity sector §• Experience of campaign development and management to support brand awareness and fundraising goals §• Proficient in using social media marketing & communication across key platforms (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn) §• Proven track-record of building strong working relationships with a wide range of people – internally and externally §• Eye for design and ability to produce in-house marketing materials as required §• Experience of devising communications plans on modest budgets §• Experience of drafting news releases and liaising with media to secure coverage §• Excellent written and verbal communication skills §• Excellent organisational skills §• Experience of working to tight deadlines and in a fast-changing environment §DESIRABLE §• Educated to degree level. However, exceptions will be made for candidates demonstrating a high level of experience in similar roles. §• Understanding of the political, cultural and social environments affecting disability sport §• Understanding of Disability and Para sport §• A willingness to be proactive in undertaking continuous personal development §• Experience of budget management §• Experience in coaching/delivering sport or recreation activities §• Experience working with people with disabilities PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES §• Forward-thinking and ability to use initiative §• Energy and willingness to work to deadlines and meet challenging demands §• Excellent attention to detail to produce high quality work consistently §• Self-disciplined and self-motivated §• A strong team player with good inter-personal skills §FLEXIBILITY §With a small team and a changing environment, flexibility is required to enable the organisation to work effectively meaning the completion of other tasks may be required at times. The postholder must be prepared to travel throughout Auckland when needed and work varying hours in accordance with the demands of competitions, programmes and events. §Benefits§: Laptop, work phone, access to pool car and Kiwi Saver contribution. §Reports to§: CEO, Parafed Auckland Location: Parafed Auckland Office, Auckland Spinal Rehabilitation Unit, 30 Bairds Road, Otara §Contract Type§: Permanent Hours: 40 hours per week, core hours 9-5 Mon – Fri. Weekend work might also be required and the successful candidate would be expected to cover hours out of this so may start earlier / later as required. §Starting date§: ASAP §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

To achieve this, we have designed a comprehensive work programme, which will be delivered over five years, with work prioritised to provide benefits for customers. To achieve this, we have a new position for a §Team Manager - Communications §to join us immediately.§        §About the role§        §Managing a small team of professionals, the Team Manager - Communications delivers a plan of proactive communications to ensure everyone is kept well informed as we transform our ways of working and how we deliver our services and products to our customers. the fixed term contract.§ §If you think you fit the above criteria, apply now!§§§§

That is why we are here. §At Vodafone we have changed the lives of billions of people for over 30 years. We made the first ever mobile phone call over 30 years ago. And we sent the first SMS: “Merry Christmas”. From taking 4G to the Moon and using big data for social to intelligent transport systems and emergency drones, we are still shaking things up. §Be part of a company which helps those who need it most. Whether teaching girls to code, providing connectivity to disaster hit areas or putting on our trainers and running for charity. §The future is exciting. Ready?§Job description:§One of our strategic imperatives is: digital first, trusted experts when you need them. This role will be responsible for ensuring we realise this expectation in all of our digital journeys.  § § §We are looking for somebody who will bring outstanding digital experience, a wide range of digital skills, and a proactive, can-do attitude to a marketing team that has ambitions to transform our digital customer experience. You will be a part thinker (digital strategy, influencing our martech stack), and part doer (digital campaign management, content updates across our digital touchpoints, shaping digital media plans, etc). § § § §Specifically,  you will curate the end-to-end digital sales experience for customers to deliver the digital sales channel target (lead generation and straight through digital sales).  The role will understand the digital conversion funnel from paid advertising through to activation and drive action to optimise customer and commercial outcomes.§ § § §The role will also own digital go-to-market for Enterprise propositions and campaigns and play a hands-on role in creating, producing and deploying content across email, social, web, search and display channels.  § § § §What will I be doing?§•    Designing the programme of work that transforms us into a Digital First business for SoHo, SME, Corporate and Public Sector customers§•    Be the point person for Enterprise Marketing with Vodafone’s Digital Accelerator programme. §•    Evaluate our self service capability and take the lead on designing an improvement programme based on customer needs§•    Build and deploy marketing content in web, email, display, search and social channels§•    Use analytics and targeting tools to contently optimise the performance of digital assets§•    Maintain ongoing awareness of digital channel performance and drive actions within squad and across business unit teams to meet and exceed targets§•    Identify and implement change based on opportunities identified internally and from market best practice to improve channel performance§ § § §What will I bring?§•    Experience with modern Digital Marketing tools – e.g. email platforms (Eloqua/Marketo), DMP (Salesforce), Testing platforms like Optimizely, Content Management Systems (Brightspot)§•    Ablilty to build and deploy marketing content in web, email, display, search and social channels§•    Ability to understand overall customer and business value and prioritise to achieve outcomes§•    Experience owning commercial/sales targets§•    Ability to build strong relationships across the business, leadership teams, and with internal and external stakeholders and customers§•    Understanding of ecommerce principles, including acquisition/digital marketing, Search Engine Optimisation, digital personalisation, UX design and HTML principles§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We have won numerous awards for our work including 2019 IAB Digital Agency of the Year and Beacons Media Agency of the Year (twice). set-up, implementing and reporting social and programmatic performance media campaigns on behalf of MBM client teams.§ §What you will do § § §Working directly with client teams to maximise their first and third party data§ §Undertake optimisation to ensure best outcomes for client investment.§ §Develop, implement and support the use of best practice social campaign set ups§ §Work with the data supplied by the reporting platforms to create insightful campaign performance reports (both interim and final) to be presented internally and to clients.§ §Identifying insights from results to inform future campaigns.§ §Maintaining relevant Google Partners certifications e.g. , DCM, Google Analytics, Facebook Blueprint etc§ §Monitoring, identifying and sharing wider trends in digital media that MBM can leverage.§ §Staying abreast of platform developments and maintaining technical proficiency.§ §About you§ § §You will have strong attention to detail§ §Strong numeracy skills§ §Good understanding of digital and social landscape§ §Works well within a team based dynamic§ §Curious and a hunger for learning § §Our offer to you § § §A collaborative, fun and rewarding team culture where collaboration is key § §All the benefits of being part of a global network with a Wholeself program, Learning & Development opportunities, flexible working and an industry leading parental leave policy  § §Confidential 24 hour support via our employee assistance programme.§ §Additional Information§ §Publicis Groupe, believes that our people are our greatest asset. Our people are chosen for their personalities, their ethics and professional qualities without any exclusion, preferential treatment or discrimination. We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer and do not discriminate by reason of age, gender, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, nationality, religion or disability or any other difference. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals and will provide appropriate assistance for candidates with disabilities or special needs throughout the recruitment process upon request. § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Marketing Specialist Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50681419.txt	§Marketing Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Specialist§§Advertiser: §Money Empire§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§MARKETING SPECIALIST§ §Money Empire is after a talented Marketing Specialist to lead the creative development and strategy for the two brands within our business. This role is focused on setting the brands narrative, content creation and taking this to market through innovative social and online content. The role includes end to end management of creative development through to content creation and social and digital execution. This role is suited to a candidate who thrives working in a warm friendly atmosphere, who is self-motivated and driven by making an impact to our business and our prospective clients.       § § § §DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES§ § §Build, develop and execute brand marketing strategies to drive growth and engagement across both entities in the business.§ §Develop and produce content that delivers a strong brand narrative across all social platforms.§ §Measure and report on the performance of marketing campaigns and assess against goals.§ §Coordinate all marketing activities to generate leads.§ §Set, oversee, and analyse marketing budget across two entities.§ §Manage internal requirements for all forward-facing interactions.§ § § §SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS§ § §Ideally 2+ years’ experience in marketing roles§ §Established knowledge of digital marketing§ §Relevant tertiary qualification – Marketing / Business / Communications§ §Clear understanding of digital channels, content marketing and social media to drive brand affinity and connect with future clients and networks.§ §Copywrite and design.§ §Experience in systems including WordPress, Sprout Social, Photoshop, NCH MixPad & Video Pad software and Mail Chimp would be ideal (or similar systems).§ § Ability to problem-solve, multi-task, take initiative, prioritise, stay organised and manage time effectively.§ §An understanding of finance would be desirable but not essential. § §Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a strong ability to influence at all levels.§ §A strong can-do attitude.§ § § §ABOUT MONEY EMPIRE§ §We are a young, energetic, and vibrant team based in Ponsonby - who doesn't want to work in Ponsonby!! We specialise in all things property and have a new innovative solution to how we advise and service our clients.  If you have done your homework and looked us up online and SM you will see we are a down to earth team, that love a good laugh and love to help our clients build their empires.  The Money Empire culture is a big part of our business and the right candidate will bring a good sense of humour and a killer work ethic!     §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Are you experienced with copy writing and content creation?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§
