Warehouse Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Market Research & Analysis§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Analytics or Data Science Chapter Member §      §        §We are looking for high performing graduates to come join our growing Insights and Data Science Chapter (team).  These are fantastic roles to put your studies into practice and work alongside a talented and supportive team – we can guarantee it will be fast pace with lots of scope and opportunity! §        §Our purpose at The Warehouse Group is ‘Helping Kiwis live better every day.” The Warehouse Group (TWG) is moving into an exciting phase as we transform our way of working as the retail industry continues to evolve.  As a Company we’ve gone agile to ensure our customers always come first.   To meet the ever-changing demands of our customers, we’re simplifying the way we work, speeding up decision making, and breaking down the hierarchy so we work better, faster. §        §Our Insights and Data Science chapter members are experts in exploiting data, science, analytics, research and design led thinking to enable data informed decisions through experimentation and ultimately balancing business needs and customer problems. §        § §        §The Roles§        §As a research and analytics or data science chapter member you will be responsible for undertaking activities aligned to the mission of a squad, using your  analytical skills to identify and support opportunities that positively impact customer and shopper experience to deliver increased satisfaction and incremental growth.§        §You will be providing analytics and insights that enhances our business decision making, by putting stakeholder understanding at the centre of everything we do. You will leverage one of the richest customer and sales data sets in New Zealand to create compelling, impactful and actionable recommendations. You will be responsible for the development and execution of research, analytics, or data science programs to support key strategic initiatives, empowering the business to make customer centric decisions through the democratisation of insight.§        § §        §About you§        §You are passionate about translating business needs and customer problems into analytical and research solutions.  We will rely on your ability to collate and analyse data, and/or build statistical models, leveraging data from multiple data sources to tell one coherent story, with a clear call to action for the business.  Our new structure and ways of working will see you extensively work cross functionally hence your collaboration skills will be top notch, coupled with the customer centric lens and approach you bring to work everyday.   §        §Our wish list also includes:§        §          §Relevant degree in Research, Analytics, STEM, Data Science, Retail, Marketing, or Digital§          §Expertise in research and/or analytics methodologies§          §Excellent communication and presentation skills§          §Proven experience in running ad hoc and continuous qualitative and quantitative research with stakeholder groups would be a bonus§          §Inquisitive and curious nature§          §Highly resilient and adaptable§        §        § §        §About Us§        §What's in it for you? We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. The business is at an exciting point in its life story.  By empowering our teams and increasing cross-collaboration, we aim to make TWG New Zealand’s best place to work!   §        §Does this move sound like something you’re up for? If you’ve read this far, go the whole way and apply now! §      §    §    §twg.co.nz§  §§§We are looking for high performing graduates to come join our growing Insights and Data Science Chapter (team).  These are fantastic roles to put your studies into practice and work alongside a talented and supportive team – we can guarantee it will be fast pace with lots of scope and opportunity! §  §Our purpose at The Warehouse Group is ‘Helping Kiwis live better every day.” The Warehouse Group (TWG) is moving into an exciting phase as we transform our way of working as the retail industry continues to evolve.  As a Company we’ve gone agile to ensure our customers always come first.   To meet the ever-changing demands of our customers, we’re simplifying the way we work, speeding up decision making, and breaking down the hierarchy so we work better, faster. §  §Our Insights and Data Science chapter members are experts in exploiting data, science, analytics, research and design led thinking to enable data informed decisions through experimentation and ultimately balancing business needs and customer problems. §  § §  §The Roles§  §As a research and analytics or data science chapter member you will be responsible for undertaking activities aligned to the mission of a squad, using your  analytical skills to identify and support opportunities that positively impact customer and shopper experience to deliver increased satisfaction and incremental growth.§  §You will be providing analytics and insights that enhances our business decision making, by putting stakeholder understanding at the centre of everything we do. You will leverage one of the richest customer and sales data sets in New Zealand to create compelling, impactful and actionable recommendations. You will be responsible for the development and execution of research, analytics, or data science programs to support key strategic initiatives, empowering the business to make customer centric decisions through the democratisation of insight.§  § §  §About you§  §You are passionate about translating business needs and customer problems into analytical and research solutions.  We will rely on your ability to collate and analyse data, and/or build statistical models, leveraging data from multiple data sources to tell one coherent story, with a clear call to action for the business.  Our new structure and ways of working will see you extensively work cross functionally hence your collaboration skills will be top notch, coupled with the customer centric lens and approach you bring to work everyday.   §  §Our wish list also includes:§ § §Relevant degree in Research, Analytics, STEM, Data Science, Retail, Marketing, or Digital§ §Expertise in research and/or analytics methodologies§ §Excellent communication and presentation skills§ §Proven experience in running ad hoc and continuous qualitative and quantitative research with stakeholder groups would be a bonus§ §Inquisitive and curious nature§ §Highly resilient and adaptable§ § §  §About Us§  §What's in it for you? We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. The business is at an exciting point in its life story.  By empowering our teams and increasing cross-collaboration, we aim to make TWG New Zealand’s best place to work!   §  §Does this move sound like something you’re up for? If you’ve read this far, go the whole way and apply now! §§§§

jobTitle: Programme Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50681582.txt	§Programme Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Programme Manager§§Advertiser: §Fonterra Co-operative Group Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§ §Impactful and highly visible role§ §Drive large capital projects with FBNZ’s largest customer§ §12-month fixed term contract, with potential for longer-term opportunities§ § §  §Your Purpose§  §We have an opportunity within Fonterra Brands NZ for a forward-thinking Programme Manager who is looking for an impactful role with an important purpose. This is a pivotal role in FBNZ’s success to deliver on large scale capital projects with our largest customer, ensuring swift and cost-effective programme delivery.§  §Being the driving force of the programme, you’ll operate across multiple streams; commercial, sustainability, quality, safety, technical and operational to deliver future packaging solutions.§  §Engraining yourself in opportunities to incorporate other categories into the scope you’ll utilise your extensive influencing and internal/external stakeholder management skills to ensure appropriate engagement and delivery of the projects with key impacts across FBNZ’s core operation.   This will be done by managing programmes of work across the FBNZ Value Chain using an approach of ‘Engage, Design and Collaborate’ with relevant stakeholders.§  §The role encompasses all standard programme management responsibilities from programme definition, portfolio prioritisation, governance modelling and control, resource management and issue resolution through to successful implementation.§  §Based in Auckland with some regional travel to our world class R&D centre in Palmerston North, this will enable you manage your internal stakeholders in the FBNZ lead team as well as external senior customer stakeholders ensuring they are kept informed of progress against the agreed programme objectives and deliverables.§  § §  §What you’ll bring§  §Without shying away from our ambitious timeframes, you will have a natural ability to engage, influence and lead project teams and ensure success by establishing important connections both in and outside of the business.§  §It’s important that we find a strategic leader with a proven success in delivering on large programmes on time, to scope and to budget.  Ideally from an FMCG background, you’ll be confident working in complex and fast paced environments and with a strong commitment to successful project delivery you’ll also have the following key skills and experience:§ § §Extensive project management experience at a senior level§ §Knowledge of the whole programme management lifecycle§ §A solid appreciation of project management principles where you may be formally certified in PMP or Prince2§ §Prior experience within a supply chain or logistics environment§ § §  §Our Story§  §Proudly New Zealand owned and operated, we are a dairy nutrition co-operative made up of farming families. Collaboration, innovation and passion were the cornerstone of our creation and continue to drive all of us at Fonterra.§  §Our dairy know-how and innovation capability mean we can do amazing things with our milk to enhance people’s lives, creating goodness from our farms to over 140 countries around the world. We are purpose lead, empowering people to create goodness for generations.§  §Sustainable farming is at the heart of our strategy. We are committed to farming in a way that regenerates our farms and the environment.§§§§

jobTitle: Digital Marketing Strategist Wanted Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50681597.txt	§Digital Marketing Strategist Wanted§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing Strategist Wanted§§Advertiser: §Zeald§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Digital Marketing Strategist Wanted §    §    §      §        §Do you have a passion for digital marketing? Do you have the skills to promote someone's business in a way that generates real tangible results? If so, you could be the person we are looking for!§        §Zeald is a full-service website design and digital marketing agency.  We are passionate about delivering excellent, tangible results for our clients throughout New Zealand. You can find out more about us, our history, our team, and what make us tick, on our website at www.zeald.com.§We are on the hunt for a Marketing Strategist with outstanding client relationship expertise and excellent project management skills to join our Tauranga based Agency (work from home). To be successful in this role, you will need to have extensive knowledge of digital marketing disciplines such as SEO, SEM, CRO, inbound marketing, keyword research, social media marketing, mobile marketing, email marketing and more. We need a professional who eats, drinks and sleeps Digital Marketing.§        §In this role, you'll be able to apply your knowledge and experience to optimise website traffic and conversion rates for your portfolio of customers. You will do this by analysing web pages and digital marketing campaigns, then coming up with key changes to improve performance. Most of all, you'll need to have an instinct for what's needed to boost business for our clients.§ §To be successful in your application, you’ll need the following:§        §          §At least 6 years experience in a marketing position§          §At least 3 years experience in project/account management or in an agency type role.§          §Outstanding client relationship management skills with the ability to manage client expectations and have effective conversations regarding budget and timelines§          §The ability to execute successful digital marketing campaigns through others - by working with your colleagues and third parties and overseeing their work§          §Good in-depth knowledge of all digital marketing disciplines§          §Excellent understanding of Google Analytics and performance-based marketing§          §Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)§          §To be highly organised and attentive to detail§          §An eye for design§          §To be a fast learner with the ability to adapt and cope well with continual change and innovation§          §To be prepared to commit to the role for the long-term (2 years plus minimum)§        §        § §Key tasks include:§        §          §Building and managing client relationships while delivering significant business value§          §Developing, implementing and monitoring strategic digital marketing plans for clients, making refinements and adjustments as necessary§          §Implementing traffic generation and optimisation activities for clients§          §Planning, implementing, reporting and then explaining results to clients so that they fully understand the value you have delivered§        §        § §This is a contract position based for our team based in Tauranga. This role is a work from home role with flexibility required for face to face meetings with clients.§Please submit your CV along with a cover letter. We look forward to talking with you!§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Do you have a passion for digital marketing? Do you have the skills to promote someone's business in a way that generates real tangible results? If so, you could be the person we are looking for!§  §Zeald is a full-service website design and digital marketing agency.  We are passionate about delivering excellent, tangible results for our clients throughout New Zealand. You can find out more about us, our history, our team, and what make us tick, on our website at www.zeald.com.§We are on the hunt for a Marketing Strategist with outstanding client relationship expertise and excellent project management skills to join our Tauranga based Agency (work from home). To be successful in this role, you will need to have extensive knowledge of digital marketing disciplines such as SEO, SEM, CRO, inbound marketing, keyword research, social media marketing, mobile marketing, email marketing and more. We need a professional who eats, drinks and sleeps Digital Marketing.§  §In this role, you'll be able to apply your knowledge and experience to optimise website traffic and conversion rates for your portfolio of customers. You will do this by analysing web pages and digital marketing campaigns, then coming up with key changes to improve performance. Most of all, you'll need to have an instinct for what's needed to boost business for our clients.§ §To be successful in your application, you’ll need the following:§ § §At least 6 years experience in a marketing position§ §At least 3 years experience in project/account management or in an agency type role.§ §Outstanding client relationship management skills with the ability to manage client expectations and have effective conversations regarding budget and timelines§ §The ability to execute successful digital marketing campaigns through others - by working with your colleagues and third parties and overseeing their work§ §Good in-depth knowledge of all digital marketing disciplines§ §Excellent understanding of Google Analytics and performance-based marketing§ §Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)§ §To be highly organised and attentive to detail§ §An eye for design§ §To be a fast learner with the ability to adapt and cope well with continual change and innovation§ §To be prepared to commit to the role for the long-term (2 years plus minimum)§ § §Key tasks include:§ § §Building and managing client relationships while delivering significant business value§ §Developing, implementing and monitoring strategic digital marketing plans for clients, making refinements and adjustments as necessary§ §Implementing traffic generation and optimisation activities for clients§ §Planning, implementing, reporting and then explaining results to clients so that they fully understand the value you have delivered§ § §This is a contract position based for our team based in Tauranga. This role is a work from home role with flexibility required for face to face meetings with clients.§Please submit your CV along with a cover letter. We look forward to talking with you!§§§§

jobTitle: Research and Analytics Chapter Lead Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50681956.txt	§Research and Analytics Chapter Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Research and Analytics Chapter Lead§§Advertiser: §The Warehouse Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Market Research & Analysis§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Research and Analytics Chapter Lead §      §        §Insights are driving a key part of the agenda here at The Warehouse Group (TWG).  One of our Research and Analytics Chapter Leads is heading back home to the UK, so we have a key gap to fill.  We are looking for a data savvy storyteller to join us and be a critical player in our insights journey, where your recommendations are impactful, making a difference. §        §Kiwis shopping behaviours are changing due to technology, competition and shifting economies.  For TWG to thrive in this landscape we’ve gone agile to ensure our customers always come first.  What this means is that TWG is saying goodbye to traditional business structures, we’re simplifying the way we work, speeding up decision making, and breaking down the hierarchy so we work better, faster and get back to the innovation that made us great.§        §The Role§        §Our Insights and Data Science chapter members are experts in exploiting data, science, analytics, research and design led thinking to enable data informed decisions through experimentation, ultimately balancing business needs and solving customer problems. §        §This role is two-fold.  Sitting within the Insights and Data Science Chapter (and reporting into the Insights and Data Science Chapter Area Lead), your time will be split between developing engaging work and people management. §        §You will be a valued strategic partner to all business areas focused on brand development.  This will be achieved by driving the customer agenda on all matters relating to brand insights. Understanding the drivers of brand preference and how they impact customer engagement and experience (both instore and online) is central to this role. Equally important, will be identifying opportunities for business growth and ultimately optimising our brand delivery. All whilst being mindful of priorities – so being a master in juggling initiatives! §        §You’re someone who’ll drive best practice in research and analytics while developing, supporting, nurturing, and empowering the team to be at its very best.  The people management aspects of this role will see you facilitate capability growth, consistency and allocation of resources within your chapter (circa 7 Chapter Members). §        §About You§        §Your ability to make things happen, influence at all levels and your comfort to work at pace will sum up success in the role.  We will rely on your excellent storytelling, communication and relationship management skills, as this visible role will see you work cross functionally with a range of internal stakeholders at all levels.   We will rely on your ability to develop, empower and nurture your team to drive engagement and best practice.  Your passion and drive to share knowledge and raise the bar will be infectious.  Living and breathing Agile attributes such as servant leadership, collaboration and a growth mindset will come naturally to you.    §        §          §6-8 years’ experience in an insight’s capacity or in the brand manager space§          §Storytelling (and presenting) ability – an absolute must§          §Track record of delivering excellence§          §Previous people leadership experience§          §A pragmatic and resilient work style§          §Excellent verbal and written communication skills§        §        §About Us§        §What's in it for you? We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. The business is at an exciting point in its life story.  By empowering our teams and increasing cross-collaboration, we aim to make TWG New Zealand’s best place to work!   §        §Does this move sound like something you’re up for? If you’ve read this far, go the whole way and apply now§      §    §    §twg.co.nz§  §§§Insights are driving a key part of the agenda here at The Warehouse Group (TWG).  One of our Research and Analytics Chapter Leads is heading back home to the UK, so we have a key gap to fill.  We are looking for a data savvy storyteller to join us and be a critical player in our insights journey, where your recommendations are impactful, making a difference. § §Kiwis shopping behaviours are changing due to technology, competition and shifting economies.  For TWG to thrive in this landscape we’ve gone agile to ensure our customers always come first.  What this means is that TWG is saying goodbye to traditional business structures, we’re simplifying the way we work, speeding up decision making, and breaking down the hierarchy so we work better, faster and get back to the innovation that made us great.§ §The Role§ §Our Insights and Data Science chapter members are experts in exploiting data, science, analytics, research and design led thinking to enable data informed decisions through experimentation, ultimately balancing business needs and solving customer problems. § §This role is two-fold.  Sitting within the Insights and Data Science Chapter (and reporting into the Insights and Data Science Chapter Area Lead), your time will be split between developing engaging work and people management. § §You will be a valued strategic partner to all business areas focused on brand development.  This will be achieved by driving the customer agenda on all matters relating to brand insights. Understanding the drivers of brand preference and how they impact customer engagement and experience (both instore and online) is central to this role. Equally important, will be identifying opportunities for business growth and ultimately optimising our brand delivery. All whilst being mindful of priorities – so being a master in juggling initiatives! § §You’re someone who’ll drive best practice in research and analytics while developing, supporting, nurturing, and empowering the team to be at its very best.  The people management aspects of this role will see you facilitate capability growth, consistency and allocation of resources within your chapter (circa 7 Chapter Members). § §About You§ §Your ability to make things happen, influence at all levels and your comfort to work at pace will sum up success in the role.  We will rely on your excellent storytelling, communication and relationship management skills, as this visible role will see you work cross functionally with a range of internal stakeholders at all levels.   We will rely on your ability to develop, empower and nurture your team to drive engagement and best practice.  Your passion and drive to share knowledge and raise the bar will be infectious.  Living and breathing Agile attributes such as servant leadership, collaboration and a growth mindset will come naturally to you.    § § §6-8 years’ experience in an insight’s capacity or in the brand manager space§ §Storytelling (and presenting) ability – an absolute must§ §Track record of delivering excellence§ §Previous people leadership experience§ §A pragmatic and resilient work style§ §Excellent verbal and written communication skills§ §About Us§ §What's in it for you? We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. The business is at an exciting point in its life story.  By empowering our teams and increasing cross-collaboration, we aim to make TWG New Zealand’s best place to work!   § §Does this move sound like something you’re up for? If you’ve read this far, go the whole way and apply now§§§§

jobTitle: Marketing and Communications Coordinator Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50681968.txt	§Marketing and Communications Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing and Communications Coordinator§§Advertiser: §The Life Flight Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§Every moment counts when the emergency phone rings at Life Flight. Each call-out is different and important - it may be to save a car accident victim, to rescue a stricken diver, or to fly a premature baby to urgent medical care.§  §A team effort is required to make emergency flights possible 24/7 and everyone working for Life Flight plays a part in achieving the overall mission: To save lives.§  §Life Flight is a charitable organisation that holds a special place in the hearts and minds of the community. Operations include the Wellington-based Westpac Rescue Helicopter and a nationwide Air Ambulance Plane service.§  §This is your opportunity to be part of an organisation that literally saves lives every day. In addition, you’ll be part of a team that is creative, thoughtful and cutting-edge.§  §We are looking for an enthusiastic junior marketer to join our team in Lyall Bay, Wellington.§  §This role is central to the success of the Marketing and Fundraising Team, which promotes Life Flight and raises funds to ensure lives can continue to be saved.§  §The primary requirements of this role are to co-ordinate Life Flight’s presence across key online/offline channels through written and visual content while tracking and analysing the performance of these efforts. Other tasks include internal communications, media relations support, events support and assisting with Life Flight’s supporter care activity.§  §To be successful in this role you will have excellent written and verbal communication skills, customer service skills and computer skills, §  §You will also be willing and enthusiastic to assist in the myriad of tasks that arise when working within the not-for-profit sector.§  §An outgoing and proactive person will thrive while gaining valuable marketing, communication and digital expertise. Training and development opportunities will be provided§  § §  §To be considered for this role you must be a New Zealand or Australian citizen or have permanent residency of either country and be currently living in New Zealand.§  §If you would like to be considered for this role, please apply through Seek with a cover letter and your CV by 28th October 2020.§  §Please email §recruitment@lifeflight.org.nz§ if you would like a copy of the Position Description§  § §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Digital Marketer Job in Gisborne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50682298.txt	§Digital Marketer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketer§§Advertiser: §Xplode Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Gisborne§, §Gisborne§§Salary§§$50,000 - $69,999 base plus commission§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Who and What is Xplode? §Renee Carmody from Xplode is a leading High Performance Business Growth and Mindset strategist who is obsessed in providing small to medium sized business owners the tools, strategies and tactics to accelerate growth and overcome the obstacles they encounter on their journey as an entrepreneur.§Renee believes the system is fundamentally broken and is here to change the way business is done, her mission is to unleash business owners to not just master their business, but master life.§This is not standard business coaching, this gets to the core of why the entrepreneur is in business and taps into the essence of how they are going to impact and serve the world at a higher level to deliver bigger results faster. § §Based in sunny Gisborne NZ with a small but fast growing team who are focused every day on how they can generate client results faster with more impact.   We truly live and breathe our company values, we pride ourselves on high performance, wellbeing, community, purpose and mission, and creating an environment to THRIVE in!§ §The Role§ Due to our continued and exciting growth, we are looking to hire an experienced digital marketer to work with our incredible clients to achieve and deliver revenue targets for their business and over deliver on objectives. § Working directly with our CEO and you will be hands on with our businesses as well as with clients and our partner agencies to support our clients to grow their business in the digital landscape.   This role has significant growth opportunities for the right person who is ready for their next step.  §You will be responsible for developing digital marketing strategies - then supporting our partner teams to implement, track and optimise digital campaigns across a variety of performance media channels. §You will develop your analytical skills to measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns and assess against goals. This will also come to include full web analytics implementations using Google Analytics & Tag Manager§Our services cover most of the digital marketing spectrum including:§Strategy / Consulting§Social Media Advertising§Google Advertising (SEM)§SEO§Websites§Sales funnels§CRM §About You:§Experienced digital marketer with proven results, who lives and breathes digital marketing. §Ability to project manage multiple campaigns §Incredible communication and presenting skills  §Hands-on experience with Google Ads and Facebook Advertising platform.§Experience using website analytics tools (such as Google Analytics & Facebook Analytic) for reporting and insights. Ideally with implementation experience too.§Hands-on knowledge with Google Tag Manager to implement the Standard and Custom tags on the website. §Intermediate building skills to build digital sales funnels and landing pages.§Managing and creating reports with Google Data Studio.§Basic knowledge of Managing Websites using WordPress and shopify§Understanding direct response marketing copy understanding the psychology of customers shopping behaviour §Experience in setting up and managing CRM tools like activecampaign §Experience in Clickfunnels §Good knowledge of the following tools is required:§Facebook Business Manager§Google Ads Manager §Google Analytics Tool§Google Tag Manager §Click Funnels§ActiveCampaign/Klaviyo or similar §Next Steps:§If you are ready to unleash and take your life to the next level, please apply by sending your up-to-date CV alongside a cover letter.§Please note, due to the high volume of candidates only successful candidates will be contacted. §To  be considered for this position you will need to have full NZ Residency/Citizenship or hold a valid working visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Which of the following content management systems (CMS) do you have experience with?§How many years of project management experience do you have?§Which of the following online advertising methods do you have experience with?§§§

jobText: TXT/50682453.txt	§Marketing Automation Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Automation Specialist§§Advertiser: §Fletcher Building Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Help us build New Zealand! PlaceMakers is New Zealand’s leading and largest supplier of building materials to the commercial and residential construction markets. We are part of the New Zealand Distribution Division of Fletcher Building which also spans Mico and Forman and sees us with a vast national network of branches and sites across NZ.§§We strive to be the best building partner in the market, and we take huge pride in providing the highest level of service to our customers. To continue to achieve this we currently undergoing a digital transformation - bringing together strategy, technology, devOps and marketing to transform the customer experience and to provide them with a suite of Digital tools which they can use to interact with us. §§The role:§§Reporting to the Marketing Manager based at our Fletcher Building Penrose site, you will support our team to roll out Salesforce Marketing Cloud.§§Initially this role will be a six month contract however there is a potential for this to be extended. §Your responsibilities include but are not limited to:§§Working hands on rolling out Sales Force Marketing Cloud.§Creating campaigns including drawing up, configuring and defining segments in SFMC.§Build and manage the customer journey in SFMC.§Mentoring and imparting your Marketing Automation knowledge to the wider Marketing team§§About you:§§At least two years experience hands on working within Marketing Sales Force Cloud and the related data§Experience drawing up your own segments including proven insights into successful segmentation strategies§Comfortable implementing and designing trigger emails to generate revenue over time and better cater to our individual customer needs§Experience defining customer journey maps within an e-commerce platform§A strong people focussed attitude with the willingness to collaborate with our wider Marketing team to impart knowledge is an absolute necessity!§§What’s in it for you?§§Be inspired to come to work each day as part of an innovative workplace that you can really leave your mark in. This opportunity will see you contribute to exciting initiatives that push the boundaries and transforms the way our business engages with our customers. You will be supported by a team with a collaborative culture that encourages creativity.§§If this sounds like you, and your keen to contribute to the ongoing success of PlaceMakers, please do click Apply now! If you have any questions please do feel free to call §Jenna on §0276414052§.§§Please note, applications close on 23 October, 2020. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Product Marketing Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50682715.txt	§Product Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Product Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Serko Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Other§§§§§§Serko is at the forefront of business travel and expense management innovation and is one of the most exciting businesses in the high tech sector. As the 2020 Hi Tech Company of the Year we are conquering global markets from our Headquarters in Parnell, with the leadership, strategy and resources to grasp the opportunity to reinvent the retailing of business travel. §We're a diverse, close knit group where everyone's opinion matters and anyone can lead.   The work is challenging, and hugely rewarding.  To find out more about working at Serko go to http://www.serko.com/careers.§As the Product Marketing Manager, you are responsible for making our flagship product, Zeno, "fly-off the shelf". This role is the glue that binds our product strategy to the tactics we need to drive success in our go-to-market model. You will be a product evangelist that plays an integral role in educating our people, our channel partners and the market about new product launches, features and enhancements.§As part of a small, dynamic team you will collaborate with the rest of the sales and marketing operation to own the development of innovative programs that optimise channel partner enablement, including our partner portal and partner training program. §In addition to the marketing team, you will work closely with product development teams to incorporate market and customer insights and you will be an active ambassador to our partners as a product expert.§You will know our competitors like the back of your hand, and you also know our buyers better than they know themselves, including how they make their buying decisions. You back up strategic insights with market evidence and then use that knowledge to drive the development of positioning and messaging that resonates with buyers and empowers our channel partners to be successful.§Being able to effectively communicate ideas verbally and visually are critical to your success, along with an ability to grasp and present our value proposition in a way that resonates and clearly articulates how we solve our buyers' problems.§Requirements§§Key accountabilities§Collaborate with the product management team to bring new features and capability to life through product marketing content and communications§Provide regular product updates to partners and customers in conjunction with the product managers and technical writer§Manage the Zeno website, supported by an external agency§Manage the Zeno Partner Program to support sales and operations enablement across our global reseller network§Own the Zeno Partner Portal, a central knowledge hub of product and sales resources §Support the Chief Marketing Officer with general in-market activity including events and campaigns§Skills, knowledge and experience§5+ years of product marketing experience§Technical native, able to quickly grasp technology innovations§Travel or Expense management / Finance industry knowledge is highly desirable§Exceptional communication and copy-writing skills, with the ability to design and create knockout product communications§Experience delivering client training or customer on-boarding portals through leading edge e-learning/training delivery§Excellent people and management skills to interact with colleagues, cross-functional teams and third parties§Practical experience with marketing automation platforms (i.e. HubSpot) and partner relationship management platforms (i.e. Allbound) is preferred§Qualifications, courses and professional memberships§Bachelor's degree in business or marketing preferred §§Benefits§A career-making challenge to build a product marketing function, a great salary, competitive benefits, awesome offices with pool table, table tennis table, exceptional coffee and a great social atmosphere.§If you want to be part of the success story that is Serko then we really want to hear from you.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

As a leading air conditioning company, with over 80 production bases in each region around the world, Daikin has earned a reputation of world leading performance, quality and reliability.§ §An amazing opportunity is now available for a talented Digital Coordinator to join our marketing team based in East Tamaki. Our team works closely together to develop, expand and maintain our marketing channels.§ §A taste of what the position will be involved with...§ § §Content creation - photography & video/animations§ §General Marketing Support§ §Effective digital marketing execution: drive effective execution of the digital marketing calendar on a quarterly, monthly and weekly basis; take a lead role in digital communication and marketing§ §Assist in delivering the direct email program including data base management - internally and externally§ §Lead activities and provide day-to-day support to increase engagement and growth of all social media and digital platforms§ §Take ownership of the co-operative advertising programme run in conjunction with our dealers and related administration requirement§ §Other examples of day to day tasks are: assisting with the social calendar & strategy, digital ad creation, managing and amplifying product review content, creating product demonstration videos, photoshoots, arranging competitions, blog posts, supporting small events such as product launches, engaging with other social media communities and bloggers, building the image libraries on social platforms, responding to enquiries and social media posts…§ §We are looking for someone who is unwaveringly passionate about marketing and social media, keen to develop and contribute to a small team, has good digital knowledge and experience. If you feel you have what it takes we would love to hear from you.§ §We offer a competitive remuneration package including salary, performance bonus and a competitive superannuation scheme.§ §Our Core Values - Absolute Credibility, Enterprising Management, Harmonious Personal Relations.§ § § §To apply for this job go to: daikin.recruitmenthub.co.nz/Vacancies & enter ref code: 5235650. §§§§

To continue to achieve this we currently undergoing a digital transformation - bringing together strategy, technology, devOps and marketing to transform the customer experience and to provide them with a suite of Digital tools which they can use to interact with us. §§The role:§§As an integral step to refining our e-commerce customer experience, you will join the team and have full end to end hands on accountability from reviewing the current state to writing our SEO strategy and imparting knowledge to our wider team.§§Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:§§Auditing and optimisation of our websites, including getting hands on within our CMS to resolve issues and writing compelling high quality website content§Research SEO keywords to utilise through websites and marketing materials including SEO keyword research of competitors§Develop an SEO Strategy including setting daily performance metrics to understand and demonstrate SEO strategy performance success§Upskilling others within the marketing team around SEO best practise.§§ §About you:§§At least two years of experience in successfully developing and executing SEO campaigns including understanding of search engine algorithms and ranking methods§Experience with SEO industry programs, such as Google Analytics§Knowledge of keyword research and data mining tools (Semrush is a plus)§Able to complete competitive analysis of other companies within the industry§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§Familiarity with content management systems (Umbraco is a plus)§Familiarity with ecommerce systems (Ucommerce and/or Bigcommerce is a plus)§§§What’s in it for you?§§Be inspired to come to work each day as part of an innovative workplace that you can really leave your mark in. This opportunity will see you contribute to exciting initiatives that push the boundaries and transforms the way our business engages with our customers. You will be supported by a team with a collaborative culture that encourages creativity.§§If this sounds like you, and your keen to contribute to the ongoing success of PlaceMakers, please do click Apply now! If you have any questions please do feel free to call Jenna on §0276414052§.§§Please note, applications close on 23 October, 2020.§§ §§§ §§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50684066.txt	§Digital Marketing/E-Commerce Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing/E-Commerce Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Sprocket Digital§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§About Sprocket Digital & the Role§  §Sprocket Digital is a New Zealand owned digital marketing agency and is backed by experienced and motivated industry veterans. Our growth has (and will always be) fueled by client success, and the strong reputation it brings in a market as small as New Zealand. §  §A new and exciting position exists for an intermediate level Digital Marketing Coordinator, with proven experience in eCommerce (both nationally and globally). We require an experienced Shopify / Woocommerce expert with a proven track record of achieving profitable ROI across all major marketing platforms. §  § §  §Responsibilities§  §This newly created role is based in Penrose, Auckland and demands a motivated candidate to perform the following:§ § § §Focus on building and optimising digital marketing campaigns (especially e-commerce)§  § § §Establishing accurate conversion tracking of all valuable website interactions using a suite of third-party applications (Tag Manager, Hotjar, Call Tracking etc)§  § § §Regularly review and maintain e-commerce inventory in Merchant accounts§  § § §Maximise campaign exposure and profitable sales growth§  § § §Possess strong attention to detail§  § § §Liaise and work closely with all members of Sprocket Digital§  § § §Attend client-facing meetings, and confidently answer technical questions related to campaign performance/strategy§  § §Skills & Experience§  §To be successful in this role candidates must possess:§ § § §Minimum 2 years of hands-on experience in a similar role§  § § §A background working knowledge with e-commerce platforms, in particular, Shopify§  § § §Expert working knowledge of Facebook and Google Marketing platforms§  § § §Expert working knowledge of Google Analytics§  § § §Presentation skills for accurately and confidently discussing campaign activities§  § § §Basic understanding of SEO, CRO and Offline Media - understand the role they play in a full marketing analysis§  § § §Enjoy working on new challenges and providing input and opinion on projects§  § § §Be able to work individually and in a team environment§  § § §Possess strong verbal and written communication skills§  § § §Positive attitude with a passion to succeed§  § § §Be highly motivated and able to learn and adapt quickly§  § § §Effective time management skills with proven ability to prioritise workload§  § §This is a full-time position with a competitive salary offered to the successful candidate.§  §Please note that due to the high number of applicants, we will only be contacting candidates that go through to the next stage. Thank you. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Which of the following online advertising methods do you have experience with?§§§

jobTitle: Digital Content Writer Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50684081.txt	§Digital Content Writer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Content Writer§§Advertiser: §Monster Group New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§We are looking for a bright individual to join our Wellington team as a talented Digital Content Writer. If you have a passion for marketing and are up to the challenge of working to strict deadlines while producing fantastic content then we are looking for you. § § § §Our New Role§ §We are looking for candidates that are seeking long-term employment and are career-driven. Currently, we require an enthusiastic Digital Content Writer who has a passion for data and everything tech! § §Reporting to the Management Team you will already have a solid understanding of producing volumes of engaging, clean copy, while also being able to introduce vital SEO and marketing elements to your content as required.§ §So, if you are looking for an opportunity to enter the workforce on the ground floor and show us what you've got, we can offer an exciting role with lots of opportunities to evolve with us.§ § § §What you will get in return...§ §Mentoring and guidance will be provided by our established team as needed to ensure you have everything required to be the effective team member we need, but the ability to hit the ground running will also be of an advantage as we have plenty of work here for you to get stuck into.§ §Importantly we want you to love what you do and do it well! So if you are able to take instruction and then work effectively using your own initiative that will be a great advantage to the successful applicant.§ §You will need to write a one-page copy to apply for this position. Examples of your previous written content will also be asked of shortlisted applicants.§ § § §What you will be doing:§ § §Produce high-quality articles and reviews that are customer-focused, informative and engaging§ §Manage and update our front-facing content§ §Identify relevant content themes that will resonate with readers§ §Develop an understanding of the importance of keyword research and targeting§ §Be creative in finding new ways to attract audiences to our websites.§ §Proactively source and pitch new article topics§ § § §We are looking for someone who:§ § §Recent Marketing Graduate§ §Passion for all things tech§ §Has a high attention to detail and accuracy§ §Has the ability to be innovative and creative when producing content§ §Organised and process driven§ §Analytical thinking, and loves data! § §Understanding of SEO and keyword targeting would be beneficial§ §To apply click on 'Apply for this job' in the top right.  §Applicants need to be willing to relocate to Wellington.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Advisor - Web (Digital Channels) Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50684535.txt	§Senior Advisor - Web (Digital Channels)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Advisor - Web (Digital Channels)§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Pacific Peoples§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§ § §Connecting people and communities through web channels§ §Human centric website design that delivers digital strategies that enrich our Pacific communities in Aotearoa§ §Strong web disciplines with web management and advice§ § As a Senior Advisor Web managing our web footprint, you will focus on the execution of our web content, ensuring design and published material that reaches our Pacific People across Aotearoa.  This is much more than a web management role – we are growing our digital platforms, and engagement is a significant part of this role, the other aspects require a thorough analysis of trends and insights to measure success of content.  As our lead web resource, you will ensure that web solutions are sustainable, innovative, best practice and high quality.§  § §Working for us§ § § The Ministry for Pacific People make a significant contribution to improve outcomes for Pacific People. We bring the Pacific voice, perspective and understanding into fabric of New Zealand government. We are the guardians and the caretakers of Pacific knowledge, culture, and identity, and we support and take stewardship over our Pacific communities and peoples.§ § §What you will do each day§ § §Be responsible for web design and development as well as managing the Ministry’s websites, intranet and associated web applications.§ §Solid experience in SEO, web accessibility standards, you will bring plain English writing, ensuring web best practise is adhered to across the Ministry. § §Run web projects; monitoring, analysing, and reporting on website analytics; and publishing web content when required.§ §Manage websites, intranet, and associated web applications within government standards.§ §Deliver excellent human-centric service and experience across digital channels.§ §Build social media presence and influence with our Pacific People’s communities.§ §Build web content strategy that increases awareness of Ministry for Pacific People and the work we do.§ §Support growth in website traffic, conversation rates and understand the data obtained through google analytics to enhance our web footprint.§ §Work closely with Senior Advisor who manages Design / Content Producer to brainstorm new and creative growth strategies and deliver created content across all channels.§ §Content Management System – ideally Silverstripe but training can be provided.§ § §What you will need to be successful in this role§ § §Strong web design experience across multiple social media platforms - design and maintenance of quality content.§ §SEO, UX and best practice web management – a tech savvy individual§ §UX design experience who also knows how to run customer journey checks§ §Great engagement skills - being confident to work with Ministry staff, other agencies, and our regional partners to ensure we have providing the right digital messaging.§ § § § §Be part of our Ministry family§ § At the Ministry for Pacific Peoples, we offer attractive employment benefits including market salary, flexible working arrangements and family friendly policies. Whilst the work is challenging, you be rewarded by contributing to positive outcomes with a focus on better outcomes for our Pacific People.§  § At the Ministry for Pacific Peoples, we recognise that diversity, inclusion, and accessibility is important to our business. We embrace the unique perspective and capabilities of our current and future employees, which will help us continue to drive innovation for our Pacific People and achieve our business goals. Our culture enables us to create an environment of involvement, respect, and connection with the communities where we work - benefitting individual employees and our Pacific People across New Zealand rewarded by contributing to positive outcomes with a focus on better outcomes for our Pacific People.§  § If you would like more information please email §recruitment@mpp.govt.nz§ quoting the position title in the subject.  Applications will be reviewed throughout advertising and we may reach out to you if further information is required. §  § §Applications close on Sunday 18 October 2020§ If you would like a copy of the position description please click on the link below.§ https://www.mpp.govt.nz/assets/Uploads/Senior-Advisor-Web-Sept-2021.pdf§  §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

The team works closely with vendors and partners and in collaboration with internal stakeholders, focussing on day to day country specific marketing requirements including the localisation of global campaigns, regional ABM initiatives, targeted campaigns and bespoke programs.§The role§Working under the direction of the ANZ Marketing Manager, the Marketing Executive will land regional and local marketing tactics across all channels and programs to deliver against business goals and KPIs.  The role focusses on enabling our partners to capture the Cloud opportunity in their market/s and deliver the best solutions to their customers both existing and new.§Collaborate with New Zealand Country Sales Manager, BDM, Sales and Pre-Sales to co-own the country vendor relationships from a marketing perspective and overall execution§Drive and balance multiple initiatives, collaborating remotely with teams and marketing functions (global, regional and marketing ops) to achieve business outcomes§Demonstrate return-on-investment (ROI) through the strategic investments in programs and manage the in-country marketing budget, including marketing development funds (MDF)§Partner across internal teams to evolve our centralized partner relationship management platform to deliver a world-class experience for our partners§Work  with the wider Marketing, Sales and Business Development teams to develop and project manage an effective in-country marketing calendar, measures and ROI reporting§Serve as the SME on all relevant country market intelligence (market conditions, industry trends, data analytics) that contribute to the organization's growth and industry reputation§Experience§This role is suited to someone with agile ways of working; has worked within a business that has a technology focus and/or deep channel experience with focus on vendors, distribution and end-customer marketing§The successful candidate will ideally have:§5+ years' experience in a B2B Marketing role with broad ranging marketing experience across the spectrum of marketing disciplines and practices§Good understand of marketing automation§Strong marketing demand and lead generation experience§A background that demonstrates nurture and buyer journey marketing and the ability to balance brand strategy with data, digital and analytical methodologies§Preferred experience in leading agile ways of working§Skills§A passion for and experience in or demonstrated ability to use:§Marketing automation and lifecycle technology and tools, such as Marketo§Online event tools/engines (e.g. Webinar, Event Bright)§Propensity tools, data and customer segmentation models and analytics§Social media marketing, selling and amplification (e.g. LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, Hoot Suite)§Some experience with digital, search-engine marketing, analytics, programmatic and SEO tools§Microsoft productivity suite (Outlook, PPT, Excel, Word, Yammer, Sharepoint/OneDrive, Teams etc.)§Why rhipe§?§Rhipe is a market leader for cloud and service provider software licensing in the APAC region.  We help businesses build, transform and accelerate their journey to the Cloud and our employees are at the heart of what we do.§We support equal opportunity and aim to provide a dynamic, inclusive and friendly work environment. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. With our flexible and diverse culture, we encourage candidates who may be seeking a flexible working arrangement or require reasonable work adjustments, to apply.§Our benefits§We offer an attractive remuneration package along with ongoing career opportunities, technological and professional development and support. We have a culture that empowers our people, promotes teamwork, flexibility and work-life balance.  §Some of our perks include an Employee Assistance Program, paid parental leave, employee 'Me day', Cultural Leave Day swap, CSR initiatives, regular social events.....plus, the added advantage of working with top-notch technology and colleagues that are passionate about what they do.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What is your expected annual salary?§How many weeks' notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Digital Marketing Assistant Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50685913.txt	§Digital Marketing Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing Assistant§§Advertiser: §ArchiPro Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§Our entrepreneurial culture and warm family atmosphere will surround you with a fun and dynamic work environment you will only find at ArchiPro. Currently Team of 50, quickly growing to a team of 100+§ §Here is our founder's and CEO story as featured on M2 Magazine; https://m2magazine.co.nz/refugee-to-digital-powerhouse-the-man-who-set-out-to-transform-an-industry/§ §ArchiPro§ §At ArchiPro, our platform empowers millions of people embarking on their building journey - from homeowners and local artisans to architects shaping NZ’s most iconic buildings - fueled by our mission to simplify the building process, our goal is to provide people with an easy-to-access, one-stop destination for all things Architecture and Building.§ §The Role§ §To establish ArchiPro as the leading platform for connecting homeowners with products and professionals for their building project. You will be part of a team of content marketers, editors, writers, and social media strategists all with the purpose of driving audience engagement, content consumption, brand favorability, and increased revenue. § §Social Media Responsibilities§ § §Implement and manage the monthly social content calendar§ §Manage social communications from users§ §Liaise with clients around their existing projects on ArchiPro§ §Ensure that client content on our platforms is boosted daily, as well as publishing content daily through the user of some third-party apps.§ §Knowledge of social trends and social tools is a must§ §Manage and own the creation of content on Pinterest and implement the LinkedIn marketing comms§ §Email Marketing/CRM Responsibilities:§ § §Code the weekly newsletters (previous knowledge not required, you will be taught in the role)§ §Report on email performance weekly and provide insights§ §Maintain data integrity in our CRM§ §Help set up new starters on our CRM system § §You will be required to help with ad-hoc marketing tasks from the wider brand team, as they arise.§ §This is a junior role, where training and upskilling will be provided where necessary, and there is plenty of room for growth.  We are looking for someone who can step into the team and help push our strategies and visions to the next level.§ §Skills and attributes§ § §Excellent multi-tasking and coordination skills, effective communication, and teamwork§ §Must be detailed oriented, well organised and possess the ability to prioritise multiple tasks under pressure§ §A positive attitude and professional demeanour are essential, along with the flexibility to work in a rapidly changing team environment§ §Strong oral and written communication skills§ §Architecture, building and interior industry experience preferred but not essential.§ §Perks§ § § Central, contemporary office space in Parnell, in the heart of the design and architecture cityscape§ §Being part of a quickly-growing PRO team - the possibilities are endless here§ §On tap coffee, fruit, wine and beer§ §Friday team huddle and drinks§ §Monthly team-building functions§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing assistant?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Communications & Engagement Lead - Maori Impact - ESR Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50686112.txt	§Communications & Engagement Lead - Maori Impact - ESR§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications & Engagement Lead - Maori Impact - ESR§§Advertiser: §ESR§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Communications & Engagement Lead - Maori Impact - ESR §      §        §ESR is a Crown Research Institute that specialises in science relating to people and communities. It's our science that helps safeguard people's health, protect food-based economies, improve the safety of freshwater and groundwater resources and contributes expert forensic science to justice systems.§        §While our roots might be in Western science, we are changing how we work to ensure that we embed Mātauranga Māori into everything we do. This year we created a Māori Impact Group to provide distinct organisational Māori leadership and deliver high-quality Mātauranga-based, science-supported solutions. The Group works across ESR as well as with iwi and hapū partners, Māori entities, key government agencies, local government and industry. Ultimately, we want to make more impact and create systemic change for, and with, Māori.§        §ESR has around 400 people working at our sites in Auckland, Christchurch, Upper Hutt, and Porirua.§        §About you§        §You'll be a talented connector, collaborator and communicator who lives and breathes Te Ao Māori. Your role will be to develop and implement smart strategies that bring us closer to our iwi partners and help us grow our cultural capability through excellent engagement and communications. Reporting to the Head of Communications and Engagement, you will also work closely with senior leaders.§        §You'll bring to the role your warmth and ability to relate to people from all walks of life. You'll have a great sense of the big picture and be able to nimbly execute communications strategies. You will be an excellent writer and storyteller and have worked across a range of different mediums - from publications to social and the screen. Having an eye for potential risks and being able to employ your emotional intelligence to pick the best path forward in difficult or ambiguous situations will also be needed. Ideally, you'll have strong networks with Māori media, but we can also support you to build these here at ESR.§        §The ideal candidate will have a tertiary qualification, preferably combining communications with marketing, Māori studies, science or a related discipline; and around five years plus of work experience in communications and engagement. Fluent te reo Māori is a plus rather than a necessity.§        §In return for your knowledge, skills and experience, ESR can offer you:§        §          §A career-shaping role within a fun and hardworking team that will genuinely care about you and your aspirations§          §Active work/life policies including family-friendly initiatives and flexible hours§          §An opportunity to make a real difference to communities in Aotearoa§          §A competitive salary§          §Free parking§          §Ongoing personal and professional development§        §        §For more information please contact Aleisha Rouse at §aleisha.rouse@esr.cri.nz§.§        §A pre-employment drug-screen, disclosure of criminal charges/convictions, are conditions of employment for this position.§      §      §      §    §  §§§ESR is a Crown Research Institute that specialises in science relating to people and communities. It's our science that helps safeguard people's health, protect food-based economies, improve the safety of freshwater and groundwater resources and contributes expert forensic science to justice systems.§While our roots might be in Western science, we are changing how we work to ensure that we embed Mātauranga Māori into everything we do. This year we created a Māori Impact Group to provide distinct organisational Māori leadership and deliver high-quality Mātauranga-based, science-supported solutions. The Group works across ESR as well as with iwi and hapū partners, Māori entities, key government agencies, local government and industry. Ultimately, we want to make more impact and create systemic change for, and with, Māori.§ESR has around 400 people working at our sites in Auckland, Christchurch, Upper Hutt, and Porirua.§About you§You'll be a talented connector, collaborator and communicator who lives and breathes Te Ao Māori. Your role will be to develop and implement smart strategies that bring us closer to our iwi partners and help us grow our cultural capability through excellent engagement and communications. Reporting to the Head of Communications and Engagement, you will also work closely with senior leaders.§You'll bring to the role your warmth and ability to relate to people from all walks of life. You'll have a great sense of the big picture and be able to nimbly execute communications strategies. You will be an excellent writer and storyteller and have worked across a range of different mediums - from publications to social and the screen. Having an eye for potential risks and being able to employ your emotional intelligence to pick the best path forward in difficult or ambiguous situations will also be needed. Ideally, you'll have strong networks with Māori media, but we can also support you to build these here at ESR.§The ideal candidate will have a tertiary qualification, preferably combining communications with marketing, Māori studies, science or a related discipline; and around five years plus of work experience in communications and engagement. Fluent te reo Māori is a plus rather than a necessity.§In return for your knowledge, skills and experience, ESR can offer you:§A career-shaping role within a fun and hardworking team that will genuinely care about you and your aspirations§Active work/life policies including family-friendly initiatives and flexible hours§An opportunity to make a real difference to communities in Aotearoa§A competitive salary§Free parking§Ongoing personal and professional development§For more information please contact Aleisha Rouse at §aleisha.rouse@esr.cri.nz§.§A pre-employment drug-screen, disclosure of criminal charges/convictions, are conditions of employment for this position.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We’re committed to providing our customers with the best fresh, value and convenience, so they’ll enjoy the best overall shopping experience in store or online.  § §Both here and around the world there is a growing focus on health and wellbeing, and we are seeing that reflected in NZ through the continued growth in demand for Fresh food, organic and healthy products and we want to make sure we can meet the needs of customers and to be able to provide fantastic fresh and healthy product for Kiwis. To ensure we continue to deliver on this promise we are looking for an §Associate Project Manager - Fresh§ to assist the delivery of this exciting project. § § § § § § § §What we are looking for:§ § §Proven knowledge of Marketing – preferably from food wholesale and retail back ground§ §Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time§ §Experience in leading a team§ §Commercial acumen and negotiation skills§ §Ability to manage project reporting, budgets, timelines and cost controls§ §Coordination of teams including sales, procurement and QS§ §A high level of customer and Health & Safety focus§ §If you have a good marketing and sales experience and proven achievement, then this is the role for you. taking ownership of reporting within our Salesforce Marketing Cloud squad - from set up through to execution and post campaign analysis, achieving alignment with wider Countdown requirements.  §          §Working alongside talented peers in the analytics and insights team, you will be specifically tasked with: §          §            §              §Delivering accurate, timely reporting and relevant insights that are easy to consume, audience appropriate, magnetic and engaging using tools such as Tableau§            §            §              §Sourcing data from Salesforce and other relevant systems (e.g SQL Server, Data Lakes, SAP, GCP, Google Analytics, Azure, API, adhoc files, SFTP, JSON)§            §            §              §Developing and maintaining highly engaged relationships with internal and external stakeholders including 3rd party vendors§            §          §          §To be successful in this role you must be comfortable dealing with large volumes of data from multiple sources and be passionate about the influence and value you will create in this newly formed squad. You will need to understand the importance of maintaining our Salesforce reporting integrity and achieve consistency and alignment with wider Countdown reporting.  §          §Your prior experience will likely reflect.§          §            §              §Strong technical capabilities across tools such as: Salesforce,Tableau, Excel and Google Analytics§            §            §              §Skills within data mining, finding patterns, correlations and trends to drive business insights§            §            §              §Project coordination experience and the ability to present confidently to key stakeholder group§            §            §              §The ability to build collaborative relationships across a diverse stakeholder base§            §            §              §Large-scale, fast paced corporate experience and the ability to manage risks and make pragmatic decisions  (FMCG highly advantageous)§            §            §              §An understanding across Analytics and Insights-capable of leveraging insights via qualitative and quantitative sources§            §          §          §We love what we do and are proud of who we are. Countdown offers an amazing range of staff benefits and our new office in Ponsonby is a vibrant, contemporary working space that facilitates strong collaboration.  §          §If any of this resonates and you feel you have what we need, we’d love to speak to you! Apply now.§        §        §        §      §      §    §  §§§Countdown continues to drive innovation from the front within NZ’s online retail landscape and remains genuinely committed to making Kiwi’s lives a little easier every day.  Whether we are doing our bit for the environment or children's health, at Countdown we work hard to create great experiences and drive positive change in the communities we serve.  § §CountdownX is our team of cross functional experts who will build and extend our digital and data capabilities to ensure connected customer experiences.  We work end-to-end within an Agile tribal model that allows us to deliver quickly and be ahead of the game.  Implementing Salesforce Marketing Cloud is a key strategy as we continue this innovation-specifically to deliver targeted offers and personalised communications at scale for a future fit, connected customer experience.§ §This is a unique opportunity within NZ’s largest eCommerce retailer.   You will play a key role - taking ownership of reporting within our Salesforce Marketing Cloud squad - from set up through to execution and post campaign analysis, achieving alignment with wider Countdown requirements.  § §Working alongside talented peers in the analytics and insights team, you will be specifically tasked with: § § § §Delivering accurate, timely reporting and relevant insights that are easy to consume, audience appropriate, magnetic and engaging using tools such as Tableau§ § § §Sourcing data from Salesforce and other relevant systems (e.g SQL Server, Data Lakes, SAP, GCP, Google Analytics, Azure, API, adhoc files, SFTP, JSON)§ § § §Developing and maintaining highly engaged relationships with internal and external stakeholders including 3rd party vendors§ § §To be successful in this role you must be comfortable dealing with large volumes of data from multiple sources and be passionate about the influence and value you will create in this newly formed squad. You will need to understand the importance of maintaining our Salesforce reporting integrity and achieve consistency and alignment with wider Countdown reporting.  § §Your prior experience will likely reflect.§ § § §Strong technical capabilities across tools such as: Salesforce,Tableau, Excel and Google Analytics§ § § §Skills within data mining, finding patterns, correlations and trends to drive business insights§ § § §Project coordination experience and the ability to present confidently to key stakeholder group§ § § §The ability to build collaborative relationships across a diverse stakeholder base§ § § §Large-scale, fast paced corporate experience and the ability to manage risks and make pragmatic decisions  (FMCG highly advantageous)§ § § §An understanding across Analytics and Insights-capable of leveraging insights via qualitative and quantitative sources§ § §We love what we do and are proud of who we are. Countdown offers an amazing range of staff benefits and our new office in Ponsonby is a vibrant, contemporary working space that facilitates strong collaboration.  § §If any of this resonates and you feel you have what we need, we’d love to speak to you! Apply now.§§§§

Products at an enterprise level§  § § §Intermediate proficiency in G Suite and Design tools (Photoshop, Indesign etc) §  § § §High level of accuracy and attention to detail§  § § §A great attitude!§  § § WHAT WOULD MAKE YOU IDEAL § § § §Experience in a start-up or agile environment§  § § §A tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Software Development§  § § §Previous experience writing marketing material for highly technical software products§  § §Next steps:§  §If this sounds like the right challenge for you, apply now! We'd love to hear from you.§  §At Nyriad we believe in equal opportunities for all. We celebrate and encourage diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.§  §Please Note: This position is based in Cambridge, New Zealand.
