jobTitle: eCommerce and Digital Marketing Manager Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50701780.txt	§eCommerce and Digital Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§eCommerce and Digital Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §YY Nation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§YY NATION; ABOUT THE COMPANY§We are a group of people who love our planet and wanted to develop the most comfortable, durable, sustainable sneakers in the world for all day everyday wear!  We are a Wellington start-up in the process of launching YY Nation sneakers globally, using the wonder of nature by working with specially formulated sustainable materials such as New Zealand Merino Wool, to Pineapple Husk, Bamboo, Algae and Sugarcane.   We recently launched our range on Kickstarter having reached our funding goal within 5 days.  Our primary sales network will be through global ecommerce direct to consumer.  This role is a key strategic role to lead YY Nation e-commerce and digital marketing programs.§Drive digital strategy and sales for yynation.com globally§Lead the growth of a global start up brand with a great future§Utilise all your digital channel experience in a unique and innovative company§  §ABOUT THE ROLE§We are seeking on our team a superstar ecommerce and digital marketer who shares the vision and values of YY Nation.  This is a hands – on key strategic role that requires proven experience in digital and social marketing, with a broad understanding of eCommerce. §Reporting to the founder / CEO, your role is to set the digital direction and strategy that will tell the YY Nation story and vision. You will develop and contribute to content that will attract, grow, and convert potential customers by creating inspiring messages and information on the unique product we have developed.  You will create and develop campaigns across all digital channels including social media, search, display advertising, retargeting, automation to generate targeted interest growing the YY Nation brand globally. You will be able to analyse analytics and data to support marketing activities and spend.§You will also use your knowledge to develop and grow YY Nation customers, creating relevant content to market segments, monitor direct marketing results. §This unique opportunity would allow you to lead all things digital using your in-depth knowledge of ecommerce, digital channels, and campaigns.  You would be part of YY Nation at the very beginnings, allowing you to shape and help direct the company to become a global leader in the marketing and development of sustainable footwear, making a lasting positive impact on the World and environment for generations to come. § §PROVEN SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE§We are looking for a seasoned digital commercial manager with proven experience in developing performance-driven marketing strategies. Experience in working with Shopify and CIN7 would be a benefit.  You will be able to tell us about;§ §Your ability to bring to life a brand using digital channels, design and story telling§Tell us about your experience in creating and directing ecommerce performance strategy in line with brand values§Display proven understanding of marketing automation and future ecommerce trends §Proven experience and expert knowledge in applying marketing spend and content development to digital channels Facebook, Instagram, Google marketing platform and display advertising, §Having a good understanding of SEO, CRO and Offline Media - understand the role they play in a full marketing analysis§Have ability and knowledge to understand analytics and customer data, audience, and customer segmentation and what drives conversion§Have a minimum 2 years of hands-on experience in a similar ecommerce and digital marketing role,§Preferably have a background in working with e-commerce platforms, in particular Shopify / CIN7§Ability to work individually and in a team environment with good verbal and written communication skills§Be a highly motivated person, able to learn and adapt quickly§Display effective time management skills with proven ability to prioritise workload§This is a full-time position, based in Wellington, with a competitive salary offered to the successful candidate.§ §HOW TO APPLY§To apply please make contact below with any questions, or email your application and we will be in touch soon! §Phone:§ Jeremy on +64 021 430840§Email your application to:§ jeremy@yynation.com [link removed]§ §KEYWORDS§Digital marketing, ecommerce, shopify, social media, email marketing, marketing automation, digital strategy, performance marketing, performance channels, §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a digital marketing manager?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Do you have experience with Search Engine Optimisation (SEO)?§Which of the following web analytics tools are you experienced with?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Advisor - Engagement Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50702316.txt	§Senior Advisor - Engagement§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Advisor - Engagement§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Internal Communications§§§§§§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa, and welcome.§Permanent - full-time§Manage the internal and external engagement for our Technology in Schools and School Transport teams§Broad communication and engagement role§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§About us§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, the largest payroll in the country, and transportation of over 100,000 students to and from school each day.§Our vision for school property is that all schools have quality learning environments as part of a well-managed and sustainable portfolio that helps deliver equitable and excellent outcomes for every child.§About the role§You will provide general external and internal engagement across EIS with a specific account management responsibility to School Transport and Technology in Schools teams.§Engagement support may include developing communication plans, media statements, website and intranet content, social media and proactive media content; reviewing other stakeholder engagement materials; and developing practice and processes.§This role will report to the Team Leader - Service Support and must be able to confidently contribute to the driving forward of the EIS engagement and communications strategy.§About you§We are looking for an experienced Senior Advisor with significant corporate communications experience covering internal and external engagement advice and implementation support. You will be adept at managing stakeholder risks, issues and opportunities, and contributing to the development and implementation of plans to ensure risks are mitigated.§You will also offer the following: §Exceptional writing skills, driven to produce work of a high standard, and with energy to deliver high volumes of work for extended periods of time§Proven experience in working across a broad range of engagement activities and channels§The ability to provide best practice engagement advice and support using a variety of methods and approaches to support delivery§Strong interpersonal skills will help you partner with the business, ensuring early engagement and the ability to provide proactive engagement support§The ability to deal effectively with pressure and multiple deadlines through good time management and prioritisation§If you'd like to bring your skills to a challenging but rewarding role within an organisation that's continuously reaching goals and striving for a better future for New Zealand, we'd love to hear from you.§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§Please review the job description and if this opportunity interests you, and you meet the requirements, apply now using the 'apply online' button. §For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at §eis.recruitment@education.govt.nz§§Applications close midnight on Monday, 19 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50702548.txt	§Digital Marketing Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing Specialist§§Advertiser: §Whitecliffe§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Whitecliffe College is a leading Private Training Establishment that is expanding. What awaits is an exciting chapter in our organisation, making it a great time to play a part in contributing to our ongoing success. We've got great courses and programmes and have expanded our offerings for 2021. We are looking for an experienced and passionate individual to join our Marketing and Communications team to be part of our Whitecliffe success story.§About You§§You have great communication skills and are driven to get things done. You relish a challenge and the opportunity to enact change in an organisation. You’ll be creative, love discussing new ideas and have the skills to implement them – which most likely means outstanding copywriting skills, a good eye for design and know how to use data to measure the impact of your work.§You’ll have experience in HTML and CMS across website and working across digital channels. Finally, you are a team player who enjoys a high degree of trust, collaboration and fun.§§The Work§You will be responsible for all aspects of digital marketing, including the website, social platforms, blogs, newsletters and various advertising campaigns.  We need someone who enjoys the content production aspect of marketing as much as planning and executing campaigns.§§Responsibilities:§§Develop and deliver the social media strategy to successfully increase brand awareness and stakeholder engagement§ §Creates effective content (written, video and photography) for distribution across various digital channels including social media, websites and EDMs§ §Coordinates and manages content calendars and workflows for all digital channels§ §Responsible for content governance to ensure it is: consistent; right for the channel; optimised and adheres to brand guidelines and tone of voice§ §Distribution of content via digital channels ensuring best practice guidelines are met§ §Pro-actively searches for new opportunities and new trends to leverage content§ §Monitor discussions, content postings, and trends within the various social and digital channels§ §Collaborate across departments; faculty, sales and students to create promotional concepts§ §Collect, monitor and analyze social and website metrics, and make improvements accordingly§ §Builds and fosters strong internal relationships§ §Provide regular monthly reporting ensuring key internal stakeholders are across departmental and brand performance across social media channels and the website§ §Plan and execute all web, SEO/SEM, marketing database, email, social media and display advertising campaigns§§Skills and expertise required:§§3-5 years’ experience working in social media or digital marketing§ §Agency experience preferred working across multiple channels§ §Proven copy writing expertise creating compelling content§ §Exceptional time management skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment§ §Experience ranging from Account/Project Management, Paid Search, Paid Social, Content Creation, Google Analytics and the delivery of digital products is a bonus§ §Technical skills, such as UX or development, HTML, website CMS and Dynamics 365 are an advantage§If this opportunity sounds like you, let us know what you can bring to the table today by sending in your cv and cover letter no later than 22nd October 2020.§§§§

Is it you?§ §The role involves:§ § §Developing & executing an innovative, engaging marketing plan.§ §Overseeing our social media accounts and growing our following on Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, Pinterest, LinkedIn, Twitter and YouTube.§ §Building an engaged customer community and liaising with various SMIs/brand ambassadors.§ §Developing successful lead generation, marketing automation and segmented EDM campaigns.§ §Writing fun and engaging copy for EDMs, blogs, product descriptions and digital advertising.§ §Managing a small team of design creatives during periods of high activity.§ §Analysing sales results, producing performance reports, and improving ROI.§ §In addition to the significant career advancement this position offers, you’ll have the opportunity for outstanding professional development. jobTitle: External Communications Advisor Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50705168.txt	§External Communications Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§External Communications Advisor§§Advertiser: §Coca-Cola Amatil NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§The Pitch§We’ve got a unique opportunity that doesn’t come around often. We’re after an External Communications Advisor who will join one of the most highly engaged teams at one of New Zealand’s best employers.§This is your chance to take on a highly visible role and help beloved local and global brands tell their story authentically to key internal and external stakeholders including consumers and media. The role will stimulate both sides of your brain as you use your skills, experience and initiative to support our communication projects that will truly make a positive difference to both the brands you work on and the community you live in.§If you are passionate about making an impact through driving External Comms, then this role is for you!§ § §The Role§The unique role calls for a unique person. We’re looking for someone who has experience providing quality communications, storytelling, and able to naturally build positive relationships with internal & external stakeholders.§In this role, you’ll take ownership of:§ § §Communications advice and support§ §help manage and support strategically important projects§ §managing media enquiries§ §creating and implementing communications plans writing engaging content for multiple channels§ §prioritisation and time management of multiple projects§ §building relationships with a diverse range of stakeholders§ §As well as this, you will be the go-to person to support all things external comms and advise our people on how best to communicate with stakeholders.§ § § §What do I need?§You will be an exceptional communicator! Excellent writing skills are essential. You’ll have proven ability to prioritise, coordinate and execute complex projects in a fast-moving business.§ §You will not just get the job done, but get it done the right way by taking people on the journey and ensuring win-win outcomes for all stakeholders involved.§ §Ideally, you’d have a strong working understanding of the NZ media landscape from TV and print to digital and social§ §You will have a minimum of three years’ experience in communications or a similar field and have a tertiary qualification in communications or related discipline. An advantage for you would be experience in a fast moving complex business.§ §The Benefits.§You'll get a fantastic competitive salary, superannuation, shares and the opportunity to earn an annual incentive - not to mention plenty of complimentary product.  It doesn't get much better than that! Most importantly, with our world-famous learning and development environment it is your future that will be invested in - who knows where your career path will take you!§ § § §The Culture.§We are exceptionally proud to be recognised as one of NZ’s Best Employers four years in a row! And within this, you will be joining one of the most highly engaged teams in the business. If you ask our team what they love about working here, they'll tell you it's our people, our brands, and our culture. Our vision and values are at the heart of everything we do, and we are committed to creating millions of moments of happiness and possibilities for our employees. Bring the real you and be part of a culture where we embrace equal opportunities and promote diversity and inclusion. We encourage you to apply to bring your unique differences and perspectives to Coca Cola Amatil.§ § §. Applications 22 October 2020.§§§§

For good. § § §Opportunity to assist with an industry-leading large-scale (and award-winning!) event§ §Be part of a dynamic team, working for a great cause§ §Creativity and initiative encouraged§ §The role§We have an opening in our Events Team for an enthusiastic and people-focused team member.  This role is an opportunity to work on Oxfam’s award-winning flagship fundraising event – Oxfam Trailwalker. If you’re looking to gain some events management, marketing or fundraising experience, this is the perfect job to get experience in a range of areas.§  §You know the qualities we are after – organized, flexible, people focused, IT savvy, a team player with great communication skills.  A great sense of humour will also go a long way when the pressure comes on, while a demonstrated commitment to the values and principles of our work is essential.§  §As the Events Assistant, you’d be responsible for the delivery of exceptional customer care to Oxfam’s potential and confirmed events participants, and to support in key areas within marketing, fundraising, and some logistics for Oxfam’s fundraising events.§  §Our ideal candidate§ § §Experience in providing excellent customer service, including strong phone and email communication skills§ §Excellent attention to detail§ §Organisational and IT skills (particularly Microsoft Office applications)§ §Experience in customer services, desirable§ §Experience of working with volunteers, desirable§ §Experience with CRM Microsoft database, desirable§ §To Apply:§ §In return, we offer a fun, supportive work environment and the opportunity to build a career in events, fundraising or marketing. With your work, you will contribute to ending poverty! The starting salary for this full-time role is §$50,469 per annum§ (and possibly more depending on the skills and experience of the successful candidate).§  §Copy & paste the following link into your web browser to submit your application via our job portal: §https://oxfamnz.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=82&source=aWQ9MTA%3D §  §DO NOT APPLY VIA SEEK.§  §For the full job description, visit our job portal via the link above.§  §Applications closing date§ 26 October, 9:00am. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted after this date.§  §Note: Only candidates currently living in NZ with the right to work in New Zealand need apply. All offers of employment will be subject to satisfactory references and may also be subject to additional screening checks, which can include criminal record and medical checks.§  §We are committed to: preventing any type of unwanted behaviour at work including sexual harassment, exploitation and abuse, lack of integrity and financial misconduct; and promoting the welfare of children, young people and adults.  Oxfam expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment through our Code of Conduct. We place a high priority on ensuring that we recruit only those who share and demonstrate our values.§  §Oxfam New Zealand is an equal opportunities employer and encourages diversity in the workplace.§ §§§§

The satisfaction of a delicious and beautiful meal - with time to spare. Time for a glass of vino. For a conversation. Or time to just recline. If you are looking to take the next step in your career and have a pivotal role in taking Woop to the next level then this is the role for you!§§You are:§§Born to communicate: §you're eloquent and able to strike the perfect tone, whether you are writing advertising copy or engaging with your team.§Cool and calm under pressure: §you always feel comfortable, have superior organisational skills, integrity, great follow-through on tasks, attention to detail and are rigorous.§A massive foodie: §you are totally passionate about eating & cooking.§Skilled at planning, organising, prioritising:§ you are able to execute simultaneous projects and activities.§Analytical and data driven: §you can simplify complex data to gain actionable insights§ §Digital marketing savvy: §a native social community nurturer, you know how to maximise opening rates and click through when emailing tens of thousands of customers.§Stoked: §you're constantly smiling and full of energy with the ability to collaborate across teams.§Naturally curious: §you love learning how things work and you're always looking for ways to innovate and improve.§Adaptable: §you can roll up your sleeves, be hands on and get involved in the detail§§Working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, you'll be responsible for:§§Brand Strategy: §Creating, managing and leading a brand strategy that drives market share, brand awareness and profitability.§Campaign execution: §Design, plan and execute creative marketing communications across all channels (digital and traditional). To drive web traffic, lead acquisition and customer acquisition.§Team: §Lead an Assistant Brand Manager, ensuring they have set and ambitious objectives, are given regular feedback and contribute actively to the companies’ objectives.§Customer Retention: §Develop marketing strategies and campaigns to maximise customer retention and reactivation along their lifecycles.§Communication: §Design and implement communications strategy.§Agency Management: §Manage a number of partner agencies across brand.§Social Community Management: §Oversee all social content creation on Instagram & Facebook and monitor community interactions to drive engagement.§Customer Event Management: §Maximise customer engagement, retention and referral by planning and executing outstanding events for high value customers.§Partnerships: §Create partnerships that build brand awareness.§§This is an amazing opportunity and would suit someone with 5 years consumer marketing experience in a branded environment. FMCG or Retail industry experience is desirable but not essential. Become a part of Woop’s amazing success story and work for a company who lives and breathes their values.§§Woop HQ is located in Eden Terrace. All the action happens at Woop HQ and where you will be surrounded by foodies and of course food!§§Apply now for this game-changing position in a vibrant and fast-moving industry sector!§§To apply, please complete the Weirdly quiz and submit your CV by the links provided here. Shortlisted candidates may also be asked to submit a short initial video interview§ §https://app.weirdlyhub.com/q/woop/brand_manager§§Bob Walker§bob.walker@joyn.co.nz§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Intermediate / Senior Digital Conversion Designer Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50708041.txt	§Intermediate / Senior Digital Conversion Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate / Senior Digital Conversion Designer§§Advertiser: §double§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$70,000 - $90,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§The down-low:§We’re looking for an exceptional Graphic/UI Designer to lead the design of beautiful landing pages, graphics and ads for our growing list of ambitious clients. §Who you are:§You breathe world-class design.§You can speak with clients, and inspire them to be bold.§You get satisfaction from seeing your work made a real impact.§You see design as a path to making things more functional.§You take the quality of your work personally.§You care about the products you buy, their impact and how they make you feel.§About Double§Our goal is to double the revenue of every company we work with - This isn’t a job for small thinkers, slow movers or those who don’t strive to become ridiculously good at their craft. Double is a digital agency specialising in delivering an explosion of new customers for ambitious NZ companies using data-lead and beautifully scalable digital marketing. Double is home to a diverse and high performing team that includes social and video advertising experts, digital strategists, UX designers, data scientists and technical marketing experts. §Your designs will define the visual identity of our clients, add meaning to products and drive users to act. You will increase awareness and loyalty for brands and drive sales by designing enticing interfaces for conversion. Your conversion-led design approach will give users a fresh, playful cross-device browsing/shopping experience to support our digital advertising teams campaigns. §This role is a full-time position and based out of our office at Grey Lynn @studiotwentysix_auckland.§About your new role:§Lead the design of bold website projects, landing pages and social campaigns and graphics. §Lead design that simplifies and beautifully explains client software, products and services (alongside our copywriting and advertising leads).§Consult on brand/visual strategy on some of NZ’s most ambitious companies. §Run conversion-focused design projects from hypothesis/mockup through to design and conversion measurement, supported by our analytics team. §Help concept and plan campaign visuals alongside our Head of Video. §Oversee graphic animation for digital ads, video campaigns, fun website animations. §Work side-by-side a fast-paced results-focused team to deliver digital turnarounds.§Your skills and experience:§3-8 years as a Graphic/CRO/Web/UI designer with previous client-facing design experience.§How to craft a seamless journey from ad campaigns through to landing page and conversion experience. §You understand the basics of digital marketing, Social and Google advertising. §Firm understanding of User Experience (UX) & Design fundamentals.§Solid communication skills - Being able to confidently communicate the reasons behind your creative decisions to team members or clients.§Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Knowledge - Not Required however it is a plus.§How to balance graphic and written content for experience and revenue goals§You understand people and can put yourself in the shoes of your users. You know how graphic style, consistency, and tone of voice support your design goals and you can seamlessly use these in your work. §You can manage multiple projects at once, set client expectations, work individually and collaborate across teams with ease. You know how to work with marketers, copywriters and analysts to get your ideas delivered to your audience.§What Double offers:§Opportunities to do your best work with incredible clients.§Beautiful Grey Lynn office. §Join a fast-paced team of digital experts§A positive and inspiring working atmosphere. We believe in learning, empowerment, trust and honest feedback. §Competitive and equitable pay, centrally-located modern office, Apple laptop, flexible working times, friendly §office pug§, treat jar, coffee etc.§Budget for training and passion clients. §Mentoring and personal development opportunities§Double is experiencing huge growth and we need your design expertise to take our clients to the next level. We’re building a fast-paced team culture of honest, ambitious & motivated team members who are driven by the opportunity to do exceptional work. §CVs to the top of the pile have a portfolio of beautiful graphics/creative/advertising work that has made a clear impact on sales or user experience. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a designer?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§§§

You will be the advocate for content best practices across our digital channels. We work with many of New Zealand’s best known brands and provide our clients with services including cross-channel media strategy and planning, negotiations and media buying, digital campaign management, paid search & SEO, social media, analytics and data science, plus content strategy and production. We have won numerous awards for our work including 2019 IAB Digital Agency of the Year and Beacons Media Agency of the Year (twice). We strive for doing great work and cultivating a supportive, respectful and fun company culture.§Job Description§An MBM Digital Director takes responsibility for a portfolio of clients and the digital product delivered by MBM through strategic council with a focus on clients’ business objectives. They lead digital and communications strategy, platform and infrastructure recommendations, and solve challenges above and beyond client briefs.  It is also their responsibility to future proof MBM clients as they progress their digital marketing and data capabilities, and to manage a team of Digital Managers across the planning, activation management and reporting of digital media campaigns. §What you will do §Be a client partner in identifying and solving business needs through a digital lens§Digitally lead pitch and business development efforts §Lead and develop digital comms strategy across a portfolio of integrated and standalone clients, working with clients to maximise their digital activities§Deliver digital thought leadership; monitor, identify and share wider trends in digital media; Develop proactive discussion papers and initiatives specific to client digital marketing needs§Lead and mentor a high functioning team of Digital Managers while collaborating with in-house senior specialist leads across Analytics & Data, Search, Social and Ad Platforms Implementation§Ensure appropriate team processes are in place to support effective campaign measurement, implementation, management and delivery, and insightful/effective reporting§Own ultimate responsibility for digital component of client profitability.§About you §8+ years digital media experience §Experience agency media side, and/or has led an in-house digital team §Experience in owned platform architecture: CRM audience segmentation development, architecture and messaging strategy, wider platforms and tech stack decisioning, data organisation and activation §Fundamental skills in digital media planning and related measurement§A strong problem solver with the ability to work under pressure and meet agreed deadlines§Collaborative team player and confident people manager §Actively contribute to agency culture through positive teamwork and energy§Dedicated to quality client service and solutions focused.§Our offer to you §A fun and rewarding team culture where collaboration is key §All the benefits of being part of a global network with a Whole-self program, Learning & Development opportunities, flexible working, and an industry-leading parental leave policy  §Confidential 24 hour support via our employee assistance programme.§Additional Information§Publicis Groupe, believes that our people are our greatest asset. jobText: TXT/50709790.txt	§Senior Adviser Communications & Engagement§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Adviser Communications & Engagement§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Whatungarongaro te tangata toitu te whenua§          §As man disappears from sight, the land remains§        §        §Senior Adviser Communications & Engagement §        §          § §          §Fixed term until 30 June 2021§          § §          §Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua - About MPI§          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is helping to seize export opportunities for our primary industries, improve sector productivity, ensure the food we produce is safe, increase sustainable resource use, and protect New Zealand from biological risk.§          §The Animal Health and Welfare directorate is responsible for the laws and systems that sit around animal welfare and the safe trade in animals and animal products.§          §We develop and maintain legislation and systems around import health standards for animals and animal products, and for exports in live animals and germplasm. Using a science-based, risk-management approach, and aiming to hit the right balance between protecting our primary industries and allowing export-focussed growth.§          §We also work towards a better care for animals in New Zealand, including the treatment of kept animals and humane pest control. We do this through developing and maintaining our animal welfare legislation, including codes of practice. Here we collaborate with other parts of Policy, the Ministry, and with stakeholders and partners to ensure our advice is grounded and evidence based.§          §We also promote animal welfare codes of practice, and work closely with our enforcement partners in this - MPI's Animal Welfare Compliance and SPCA.§          § §          §Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the Role§          §As the Senior Communications Adviser supporting the Animal Health and Welfare Directorate, you'll play a key role within our work programmes. You will support the Director and relevant teams to drive and deliver communications related work for animal exports and animal welfare activities§          §In this Directorate there is complexity and challenge, so no two days are the same. You'll need to be energetic and adaptable to thrive in this environment. This role requires strategic nous and tactical know how. The work we do is important and often contentious, and this role provides a stimulating and important opportunity.§          §You'll be developing and implementing stakeholder and communications plans that go above and beyond the standard template. We need someone who can be creative and push the boundaries to reach our goals. You will be writing web content and targeted communications.§          §You'll also need to be flexible to jump in and help others in the team on the variable issues that appear daily.§          §You'll have a good risk radar and nose for innovative message delivery.§          § §          §Mōu - About You§          §You'll have a proven track record for communications, the ability to think strategically and a keen eye for detail. You'll show initiative and be a self-starter whilst also being a creative problem-solver.§          §This is a busy and varied position. There is complexity and challenge, so you will need to be adaptable and innovative to thrive in this environment.§          §You'll also need:§          §            §A minimum of 5 years' experience in successfully developing and delivering effective communications strategies and plans§            §Advanced skills in writing and editing communications material§            §Ability to drive internal and external communications§            §Experience building great working relationships with senior managers, staff, external stakeholders§            §Experience planning and delivering multi-channel communications including social media and web content§            §Experience working with media, including responding to enquiries and proactively pitching stories§            §Knowledge of Government processes, including working with Ministers' offices§          §          § §          §Ngā hua o te Mahi i te Manatū Ahu Matua: - Benefits of working at MPI§          §By joining MPI's well-regarded and effective team of communications professionals in Public Affairs, you'll create and deliver innovative communications strategies and plans on issues and projects that matter.§          §The salary for this role is $92,073 to $110,000 depending on skills and experience§          §If you want to be part of an organisation that is all about growing and protecting New Zealand apply now!§          § §          §Me pēhea te tuku tono - How to Apply§          §To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click "APPLY NOW" or visit the MPI Careers Site.  For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online career's portal. §          § §          §Applications close: 23 October 2020§          § §          §            §              §                § §              §            §          §          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§        §        §        §      §    §    §  §§§ §§Fixed term until 30 June 2021§§ §Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua - About MPI§The Ministry for Primary Industries is helping to seize export opportunities for our primary industries, improve sector productivity, ensure the food we produce is safe, increase sustainable resource use, and protect New Zealand from biological risk.§The Animal Health and Welfare directorate is responsible for the laws and systems that sit around animal welfare and the safe trade in animals and animal products.§We develop and maintain legislation and systems around import health standards for animals and animal products, and for exports in live animals and germplasm. Using a science-based, risk-management approach, and aiming to hit the right balance between protecting our primary industries and allowing export-focussed growth.§We also work towards a better care for animals in New Zealand, including the treatment of kept animals and humane pest control. We do this through developing and maintaining our animal welfare legislation, including codes of practice. Here we collaborate with other parts of Policy, the Ministry, and with stakeholders and partners to ensure our advice is grounded and evidence based.§We also promote animal welfare codes of practice, and work closely with our enforcement partners in this - MPI's Animal Welfare Compliance and SPCA.§ §Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the Role§As the Senior Communications Adviser supporting the Animal Health and Welfare Directorate, you'll play a key role within our work programmes. You'll need to be energetic and adaptable to thrive in this environment. This role requires strategic nous and tactical know how. The work we do is important and often contentious, and this role provides a stimulating and important opportunity.§You'll be developing and implementing stakeholder and communications plans that go above and beyond the standard template. We need someone who can be creative and push the boundaries to reach our goals. You will be writing web content and targeted communications.§You'll also need to be flexible to jump in and help others in the team on the variable issues that appear daily.§You'll have a good risk radar and nose for innovative message delivery.§ §Mōu - About You§You'll have a proven track record for communications, the ability to think strategically and a keen eye for detail. jobText: TXT/50710473.txt	§Marketing Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Executive§§Advertiser: §Escea§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Marketing Executive§ §Escea is a fast-growing and innovative company that designs, manufactures and exports fireplaces across the world from our Dunedin hub.  Our Marketing team is key to our global growth and we’re looking to bring on someone to work in the communications team furthering our content marketing strategy.§ §We are looking for a talented Marketing Executive who will first and foremost excel at creating content, but who also loves to wrangle marketing campaigns. You will work alongside a highly experienced and talented marketing team to deliver marketing strategy with your communications skills and delight our customers.  No two days are ever the same and your ability to 'roll with the punches' is essential. § §Writing, creating and managing campaigns will require the ideal candidate to be immersed in the many facets of marketing. You don't need to be an expert in specialist areas - we have those - we're looking for someone to pull it all together and smash out our campaigns successfully. § §The ideal candidate will be passionate about interior design/architecture and will have an abundance of ideas for creating customer focused content. They must bring a strong arsenal of techniques and methods to promote our products, services and public image.§ §You will have experience writing for established brands and know how to capture users interests with strong effective copy, while keeping within brand guidelines.§ §Being flexible and adaptive in your approach is essential, as is always being open to feedback, prepared to speak your mind, and definitely up for a laugh.  You will love a challenge and thrive in an environment that demands your creativity to flow.  § §What you'll do:§ § § §Copywriting - a variety of writing for the business across technical, creative and business related topics§ § § §Content creation - not only will you write the content but you'll be integral in identifying what to write about, researching the latest trends, immerse yourself in the interior design influencer world to understand who's hot and who's not § § § §Campaign Management - you'll be the organiser of the campaigns, ensuring everything gets done, on time and in the order it needs to be done - bringing everyone together working towards the same outcome§ § § §Competitor and industry analysis - you need to work with others in the team on keeping up to date with what's happening in our market - competitor movements and products, positioning, product specifics, live and breathe fireplaces§ § §The details:§ § §Permanent full time 40 hours per week§ §Based in Dunedin office§ §Works directly with Communications Lead § §Fixed Term role - 12 months§ § § §Your Essential Skills§ §These are skills we want to see in anyone pursuing this role, however, if you feel you need to improve on one of them and have a plan for that then please let us know.§ §Requirements§ § §Proven experience in a similar or relevant role (at least 2 years)§ §Strong copywriting and creative writing capabilities § §Experience with writing for social media § §Experience writing for web and basic understanding of SEO§ §Excellent communication and people skills§ §Strong organizational and time-management abilities§ §Strong research abilities§ §Proficient in MS office§ §Must have a sense of humour and be up for some fun§ §Advantageous but not essential:§ § §Interest or experience in Interior Design or Architecture§ §Experience using a content management system§ §Basic Image preparation and Photoshop skills§ §We are looking for a keen individual who wants to join our marketing family so if this sounds like you, apply with a cover letter and CV to §sarah@escea.com§ §Applications for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work permit.§ §Closing date is 5pm Monday 26th October, 2020§ § §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50711674.txt	§Senior Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Fidelity Life§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Fidelity Life is the largest New Zealand owned and operated life insurer and the 2017, 2018 and 2019 ANZIIF New Zealand Life Insurance Company of the Year. These are exciting times for Fidelity Life as we transform our business for a successful and sustainable future, with our customers at the heart of everything we do. At Fidelity Life we’re ambitious and customer-obsessed. jobTitle: Senior Marketing Executive- APAC Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50717097.txt	§Senior Marketing Executive- APAC§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Marketing Executive- APAC§§Advertiser: §Re-Leased§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Re-Leased is pioneering the future of Commercial Real Estate (CRE) by pulling the industry into the cloud. § §Our cloud-based commercial property management software is designed to specifically meet the needs of commercial property owners and property managers and make Commercial Real Estate simple and seamless for all parties. § §Our marketing team is in growth mode and has helped us transform the way we interact and service our customers through the Covid-19 period.  To ensure we continue this momentum while our wonderful Head of Marketing is on maternity leave, we are seeking a keen and capable marketing executive to manage our APAC region for six months.§ §This role will serve as a conduit between marketing and sales and as a heavy focus on campaign management, content creation and marketing execution.  The role requires high levels of communication, project management and will suit someone who enjoys a fast paced and change driven environment, who can work autonomously.§ §The role will encompass the following:§ § §Working quickly and using initiative to find a way to think creatively and innovate; we are a team that rolls our sleeves up to get the job done § §Leading localised global brand initiatives to resonate and influence the APAC market§ §Working with our global teams (which will require evening and morning calls) and supporting our lead generation and sales effort globally§ §Global project support for our teams in market§ §We are ideally seeking someone with experience in SaaS and/ or a bend toward digital communication and content creation. In saying that; this role is about fit so if you are excited by the sound of it, don’t let that hold you back!§ §This is a role for someone who has worked autonomously and is looking to expand their remit into a growing global business.  § §Culture fit is very important to us too, so we’re looking for someone to join us in living out our core values: § § §People First§: One team globally; our people and customers always come first.§ §Find a Way§: Like a river, we find a way around all obstacles § §Win or Learn:§ Our journey for improvement never ends; enjoy the ride!§ §This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing global business where we encourage thought diversity and driving new ideas. In exchange, we can offer a genuine opportunity to develop your career in a fast paced, successful software business and the chance to become part of an award winning team.§ §If this sounds like you, please submit your application and tell us your story!§§§§

Our governing legislation is the Veterans’ Support Act 2014. We are a customer service team, with a goal of ensuring that that we support ill or injured veterans to live their best lives. As part of ensuring ongoing recognition and respect for service we also provide policy advice on issues relating to veterans and manage government’s relationship with veteran representative organisations.§Every hour of every day, 365 days of the year, the New Zealand Defence Force is contributing to the defence, security and well-being of Aotearoa / New Zealand.  As a modern, professional military, it is our goal to maintain well trained, equipped and disciplined armed forces that can react to crisis at short notice. §Why Us§NZDF is an inclusive organisation that is open to flexible working arrangements and welcomes applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, age, beliefs/opinions, or family circumstances.§In return for your expertise, dedication and hard work, NZDF is offering remuneration reflective of your experience, along with:§        §          §Great benefits for you and your family§;§          §Full time ongoing work;§          §Discounts Handbook for selected retail, entertainment and service providers;§          §5 weeks annual leave per year.§        §        §How to Apply§To view the Position Description and to apply online please visit our §Defence Careers§ website, or use the links on this page.§Please note:§ If you are an existing NZDF employee (excluding contractors) you must apply through our Internal Vacancies site, via the HR Toolkit.§Applications close on §Monday 19 October 2020§.§Please note: §Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (NZ) and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position applied for. The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the NZ Defence Force are as follows:§Higher level Security Clearance§        §          §most preferably a NZ citizen who §has resided continuously§ in this country for the last §10 years§, OR§          §is a citizen of, §and/or has resided continuously§ in one or more of the following countries for the last §10 years§: either Australia, Canada, NZ, UK or the USA; §and§ has a background history that is verifiable and can be assessed as appropriate by the NZSIS towards a recommendation of suitability for a security clearance at a higher level.§        §        §If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§What you will do§You will be responsible for the development, implementation, engagement and communication initiatives for Veterans’ Affairs, at both the strategic and tactical level, managing channels, publications and also the Commemorative Fund. You will also be responsible for supporting the Project Manager in the management and delivery of major projects on behalf of Veterans Affairs.§What we need§To be successful in this role you will be an excellent communicator who has the ability to build and maintain relationships across a large and complex organisation. §You will need to have:§ § §Experience with developing and implementing both strategic and tactical communications;§ §Experience in event management and the ability to oversee a budget;§ §Sound research and analytical skills; and§ §The ability to travel within New Zealand, as required.§ §Who we are§ §Veterans Affairs is the unit within NZDF which provides services to veterans who have been injured or become ill as a result of their service. Our governing legislation is the Veterans’ Support Act 2014. We are a customer service team, with a goal of ensuring that that we support ill or injured veterans to live their best lives. As part of ensuring ongoing recognition and respect for service we also provide policy advice on issues relating to veterans and manage government’s relationship with veteran representative organisations.§Every hour of every day, 365 days of the year, the New Zealand Defence Force is contributing to the defence, security and well-being of Aotearoa / New Zealand.  As a modern, professional military, it is our goal to maintain well trained, equipped and disciplined armed forces that can react to crisis at short notice. §Why Us§NZDF is an inclusive organisation that is open to flexible working arrangements and welcomes applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, age, beliefs/opinions, or family circumstances.§In return for your expertise, dedication and hard work, NZDF is offering remuneration reflective of your experience, along with:§ § §Great benefits for you and your family§;§ §Full time ongoing work;§ §Discounts Handbook for selected retail, entertainment and service providers;§ §5 weeks annual leave per year.§ §How to Apply§To view the Position Description and to apply online please visit our §Defence Careers§ website, or use the links on this page.§Please note:§ If you are an existing NZDF employee (excluding contractors) you must apply through our Internal Vacancies site, via the HR Toolkit.§Applications close on §Monday 19 October 2020§.§Please note: §Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (NZ) and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position applied for. The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the NZ Defence Force are as follows:§Higher level Security Clearance§ § §most preferably a NZ citizen who §has resided continuously§ in this country for the last §10 years§, OR§ §is a citizen of, §and/or has resided continuously§ in one or more of the following countries for the last §10 years§: either Australia, Canada, NZ, UK or the USA; §and§ has a background history that is verifiable and can be assessed as appropriate by the NZSIS towards a recommendation of suitability for a security clearance at a higher level.§ §If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50716856.txt	§Marketing Manager - Growth and Performance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Manager - Growth and Performance§§Advertiser: §NZCompare§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§About the business§ § §Based on the city fringe, NZ Compare is a Deloitte Technology Fast 500 APAC Winner in 2019 and a rapidly growing national business with global growth plans. We support Kiwis in making fully informed choices through the use of our comparison sites, covering telco, energy, mobile, travel, study and more. Our top brands, Broadband Compare and Power Compare are examples of how we are leading the change in empowering the Kiwi consumer in their decisions, through seeing the best options on offer to them, saving money, time and energy. § §We offer a close-knit, people-first work culture. We take care of our teams, clients and consumer. With the right mix of business and fun, the NZ Compare environment is one you'd be proud to be part of. Go home looking forward to the next day is our staff objective. If this sounds like your next step, then please apply. We would love to hear from you!!§ § §About the role§ § §The 'Marketing Manager - Growth and Performance' role is a newly created role that will be responsible for co-designing in collaboration with leadership the strategic marketing direction of NZ Compare and driving it to success. We are looking for a creative individual, who can demonstrate their ability to grow brands and increase top line performance. You must have the experience and 'can do' attitude to deliver not only the strategy but the daily BAU tasks required to create success across all marketing platforms. Excellent communications skills, content design and the ability to adapt are a must, as is fostering strong relationships with key internal and external stakeholders as required.§ §The successful applicant, will have a hands on, positive approach to their duties.§ § §Benefits and perks§ §Be part of an award nominated and winning business§Close to transport links§Enjoy the varying and delicious food on Eden Terrace and stop in at Basque park next to the office to soak up some sun and fresh air§Be led by management who understand work/life balance is a must not a negotiation § § §Skills and experience§ §Minimum 3 years in a mid-level Marketing position§Ability to develop strategy and communicate effectively§Understand how to support sales through lead generation and campaign management§Have a proven track record in stakeholder engagement and management§Experience in online marketing including analytics, execution and placement of adverts,  PR feeds and social media strategy, media planning and content posting§Ability to evaluate competitors and overarching demand for NZ Compare services§Create all marketing collateral§Develop, drive and maintain key performance metric reporting and overall marketing budgets§Event co-ordination including our annual Broadband Awards§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Which of the following online advertising methods do you have experience with?§Have you worked in a role where you were responsible for budget management & forecasting?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50720268.txt	§Digital Acceleration Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Acceleration Manager§§Advertiser: §Nestle NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§Car Allowance + Bonus§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Digital Acceleration Manager§      §        §§        §          §Be the catalyst in driving eBusiness results within the New Zealand Food & Beverage business§          §Join one of the leading FMCGs company in Nutrition, Health, and Wellness§          §Opportunity to work with market leading brands§          §Build your career with a global organisation §        §        §Our Story§        §Nestlé enjoys a reputation as one of the world’s largest FMCGs, and a leader in nutrition, health and wellness. Our inclusive and high performance culture is a testament to the great training, development, rewards and recognition we extend to every member of our 5,000-strong Oceania workforce.§        § §        §We believe in collaboration, a people focus and long-term career development and, because nothing stands still for long, each day brings opportunities and challenges to grow and reach your potential. In return, we look for our people to be dynamic, pragmatic, team players, people of integrity, and high achievers.§        § §        §Your Opportunity§        §We have an exciting new opportunity for Digital Acceleration Manager to be the catalyst in driving eBusiness results within the New Zealand F&B business.  You will be responsible for implementing the eBusiness strategy, the data strategy, and optimising search and growing our eBusiness sales through new and existing customers.§        §Key responsibilities include:§        §          §Lead the eBusiness Strategy in partnership with the domestic brand team focused on  Nestle brands and products: Kit Kat, Maggi, Nescafe, Milo, OKD, Scorched Almonds, Milky Bar, Starbucks§          §Implement the data strategy for lead brands, ensuring quality data capture that drives improved brand performance (Brand Love, Comms Engagement)§          §Develop and implement the eRetailer Pipeline with existing customers within the Grocery Channel, including  Woolworths, New World, Pakn'Save, TWG for priority brands & SKU's, with the right range, right pack and right price for Channel§          §Develop and implement the eRetailer Pipeline with new and potential customers including Mighty Ape, Costco and any new market entrants, with the right range, right pack and right price for Channel§          §Establish best in class SEO | SEM strategies for owned and retailer sites to maximise digital presence for key brands§          §6. Implement best in class content for owned and retailer sites to maximise digital presence for Nestle F&B brands§          §Partner the marketing team to ensure marketing plans/initiatives incorporate digital and e-Commerce as key components§          §Partner with the brand teams to execute powerful data driven digital initiatives including website, eCRM, advocacy etc§          §Ensure all digital activities are compliant with Nestle guidelines and Australia / New Zealand legal requirements§        §        § §        §About You§        §Our ideal candidate will have a strong strategic and executional marketing and brand communications capability and background, with a minimum of 3 years’ experience. You will be well versed in digital media basics (planning and buying and integration). You will also have a strong understanding of use of best practice digital marketing tools and services as well be well versed in the trends and innovations with the marketing realm and able to bring relevant insights and best practices into the business. Strong communication and relationship building skills are essential for this role as you will need to be able to engage and influence at all levels of the organisation.§        § §        §Interested?§ Apply online to register your details. Applicants must be eligible to work in NZ.§        §Nestlé Oceania believes diversity in our business is an asset that impacts the way we think and the way we work together. We are committed to an inclusive workplace that respects all cultures, different ways of thinking and supports our people to perform at their best and develop to their full potential§      §    §    §  §§§ §Be the catalyst in driving eBusiness results within the New Zealand Food & Beverage business§ §Join one of the leading FMCGs company in Nutrition, Health, and Wellness§ §Opportunity to work with market leading brands§ §Build your career with a global organisation § §Our Story§ §Nestlé enjoys a reputation as one of the world’s largest FMCGs, and a leader in nutrition, health and wellness. Our inclusive and high performance culture is a testament to the great training, development, rewards and recognition we extend to every member of our 5,000-strong Oceania workforce.§ § § §We believe in collaboration, a people focus and long-term career development and, because nothing stands still for long, each day brings opportunities and challenges to grow and reach your potential. In return, we look for our people to be dynamic, pragmatic, team players, people of integrity, and high achievers.§ § § §Your Opportunity§ §We have an exciting new opportunity for Digital Acceleration Manager to be the catalyst in driving eBusiness results within the New Zealand F&B business.  You will be responsible for implementing the eBusiness strategy, the data strategy, and optimising search and growing our eBusiness sales through new and existing customers.§ §Key responsibilities include:§ § §Lead the eBusiness Strategy in partnership with the domestic brand team focused on  Nestle brands and products: Kit Kat, Maggi, Nescafe, Milo, OKD, Scorched Almonds, Milky Bar, Starbucks§ §Implement the data strategy for lead brands, ensuring quality data capture that drives improved brand performance (Brand Love, Comms Engagement)§ §Develop and implement the eRetailer Pipeline with existing customers within the Grocery Channel, including  Woolworths, New World, Pakn'Save, TWG for priority brands & SKU's, with the right range, right pack and right price for Channel§ §Develop and implement the eRetailer Pipeline with new and potential customers including Mighty Ape, Costco and any new market entrants, with the right range, right pack and right price for Channel§ §Establish best in class SEO | SEM strategies for owned and retailer sites to maximise digital presence for key brands§ §6. Implement best in class content for owned and retailer sites to maximise digital presence for Nestle F&B brands§ §Partner the marketing team to ensure marketing plans/initiatives incorporate digital and e-Commerce as key components§ §Partner with the brand teams to execute powerful data driven digital initiatives including website, eCRM, advocacy etc§ §Ensure all digital activities are compliant with Nestle guidelines and Australia / New Zealand legal requirements§ § § §About You§ §Our ideal candidate will have a strong strategic and executional marketing and brand communications capability and background, with a minimum of 3 years’ experience. You will be well versed in digital media basics (planning and buying and integration). You will also have a strong understanding of use of best practice digital marketing tools and services as well be well versed in the trends and innovations with the marketing realm and able to bring relevant insights and best practices into the business. Strong communication and relationship building skills are essential for this role as you will need to be able to engage and influence at all levels of the organisation.§ § § §Interested?§ Apply online to register your details. Applicants must be eligible to work in NZ.§ §Nestlé Oceania believes diversity in our business is an asset that impacts the way we think and the way we work together. We are committed to an inclusive workplace that respects all cultures, different ways of thinking and supports our people to perform at their best and develop to their full potential§§§§

jobText: TXT/50717859.txt	§Digital Marketing Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing Specialist§§Advertiser: §Commission for Financial Capability§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§About us §  §The passionate and creative team at the Commission for Financial Capability (CFFC) is on a mission to help New Zealanders retire with confidence. We want to ensure people feel secure that they'll have resources to live and the know-how to make ends meet. We are committed to to helping New Zealanders of all ages make informed decisions throughout their lives that will help them get ahead financially and prepare them for retirement. You might know us for our award-winning sorted.org.nz website, but there's much more to us than that. §  §We focus on three areas; Retirement Policies, Retirement Villages and Financial Capability. As part of our role we advise Government on the policies that will enhance retirement outcomes for New Zealanders. Together with a range of partners, we are building wealth and wellbeing for the retirees of today and tomorrow.§  §For more information about the CFFC and what we do, please go to: www.cffc.org.nz/reviews-and-reports/corporate-reports/§  §About the role§  §This is a great growth role for someone in-tune with digital marketing trends, content and brand in relation to their influence and impact on our target audiences. The focus is connecting Sorted and CFFC trusted information to Kiwis by understanding how to attract and retain audiences across digital marketing channels. This role is a good mix of being insights driven, with a strong creative element. §  §Key aspects of the role include:§  §Manage the development and implementation of always-on social, search and email marketing activity to reach, attract and retain audiences across Sorted.org.nz§  §Brief media, creative agencies and internal stakeholders for digital outreach content; maintaining content calendar for Sorted §  §Support product and campaign-based marketing activities to be integrated to digital marketing channels§  §Oversee and report on social media and search performance, ensuring continual optimisation of budgets aligned to goals§  §Community management of Sorted social channels; governance and advice on best practice §  §Help implement the email marketing programme to drive deeper engagement and retention, ensuring best practise principles are applied and activity is tracked and reported on.§  §For the full position description go to: https://cffc.govt.nz/news-and-media/news/new-vacancy-digital-marketing-specialist/§  §If this is the opportunity you have been looking for, and you have skills and experience outlined below, we look forward to hearing from you! Please apply using Seek, submitting a cover letter and resume.§  §Skills & experience§ § §Digital marketing skills - deep understanding of digital landscape and marketing with proven success in email marketing, social media and search either working in digital, media or creative agency environment or client-side digital marketing positions§ §Experience using Hubspot / other CRM / automation platforms to drive digital engagement§ §Demonstrated understanding of social media planning - including experience using Facebook Business Manager to create and optimise ad campaigns§ §Understanding of SEM/SEO§ §Ability to plan online campaigns from conception to development § §Ability to develop digital creative a bonus § §Strong verbal and written communication; Ability to effectively communicate to stakeholders at all levels of the organisation§ §Organisational skills - effective project prioritisation.§ §Benefits & perks§  §We're flexible – work from home days and more - we are people-centric culture focused on wellness, teamwork, diversity§  §Three additional leave days during the summer holidays§  §Generous KiwiSaver employer contributions §  §A passionate and innovative team environment - we're not your typical government agency§  §The ability to be part of an organisation making a difference to the lives of New Zealanders.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50716510.txt	§Transcription Typist (Part Time)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Transcription Typist (Part Time)§§Advertiser: §Isentia - Talent§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Other§§§§§§A fantastic opportunity has become available in our Wellington office for a media-savvy person to join our Transcription team. This role would suit a motivated individual interested in current affairs.  § §The Transcription team provides quality verbatim transcripts of audio from television, radio and media conferences as ordered by our clients (NZ Government and corporate). The work is fast-paced, varied and requires an astute understanding of priority management.§ §This is a part-time role working afternoons/evenings five days a week.  Hours are as follows:§ §Monday, 4.30pm - 11pm§ Wednesday, 3.30pm - 9pm§ Thursday, 3.30pm - 9pm§ Friday, 4pm - 11pm§ Saturday, 2pm - 9.30pm§ §If you worked as a Transcription Typist what would you have done last week? § § § § §Worked in a fast-paced environment with a team of passionate people to delivers premium service to a range of clients across both the government and private sector.§ §Transcribed a variety of news stories, media conferences and interviews on a range of topics and delivered them on a tight turnaround.§ §Assisted in managing the team's workload with a great sense of urgency and high attention to detail.§ §Liaised with our Account Executive teams in order to deliver the best possible service for our clients§ § §Who are you?§ § § § §You have a genuine interest in news and current affairs and love working in an environment that constantly changes.§ §You have a sound knowledge of current affairs and public figures.§ §You thrive under pressure and know how to think creatively in order to meet strict deadlines.§ §You can determine priorities when it's busy and are able to work well both independently and collaboratively in order to achieve goals with minimal supervision.§ §You're positive, keen to learn and want to be part of a great team.§ §You have exceptional spelling and grammar and are passionate about the quality of your work.§ §You are an experienced and quick typist with a thorough understanding of Microsoft Word.§ §Have preferably used a pedal in your past transcription.§ § §Who are we and what else do you need to know?§ Isentia is the Asia-Pacific region's leading media intelligence company; we're a client-centric organisation where you can really add value to our clients' businesses. Our clients are diverse, ranging from globally renowned brands right through to start-ups and not for profit organisations.§ §We provide our team members with constructive feedback to foster their career growth, and you will have many opportunities to work with fun and talented people.  We also have an open and inclusive culture where we embrace opportunities to do better and we celebrate achievements wildly.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that is dedicated to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application.§ §At Isentia we are continuing to hire nationally during COVID-19, with our recruitment process now fully conducted virtually. As a business, we have moved to a working from home environment until it is safe for all employees to return to our offices.§ §If you are interested in joining this dynamic organisation in a key role, then please apply now.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§
