jobText: TXT/50718180.txt	§Project researcher and coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project researcher and coordinator§§Advertiser: §Apagie Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Market Research & Analysis§§§§§§At Apagie we help our clients solve commercial challenges by shifting consumer behaviours.  We provide businesses with advice, guidance, and capability, to grow sales and increase the quality of their connections to customers. §  §We offer a team an environment that provides constant learning, challenges, and new experiences where contribution is encouraged and recognised.§  §Our business is founded on our strong desire to make a difference, to improve businesses to help create great communities. §  § §  §The position.  §  §We are looking for a project researcher and coordinator to work alongside our consultants and clients.  You will be responsible for contributing towards consumer insight and analysis and assisting with the broader delivery of projects.  We expect our team to be committed, responsible and keen to be accountable for the work they do.§  § §  §What will the day-job look like?§ § §Our clients rely on Apagie's research for in-depth consumer insight.  In this role you will participate in quantitative data collection and analysis and qualitative, interview-style research following Apagie's research methodologies.§ §You will join client meetings and be responsible for documenting and following up on key activities in coordination with our consultants.§ §We assist our clients with follow-through activities and you will be responsible for coordinating Apagie's skills to assist our clients to achieve their objectives.§ §You will be encouraged to contribute to Apagie's growth by way of actively participating in the future decisions we make to grow and deliver optimum outcomes for our clients.§ § §  §Requirements.  § § §A qualification in marketing, psychology, economics, or business would be useful but your character is most important to us.§ §You should be naturally curious, keen to understand how businesses operate and what drives consumers to make the choices they make.§ §You need to have strong verbal and writing skills and be proficient dealing with numbers. One of our core values is to ‘understand but not necessarily agree’ with others’ perspectives.  Great communication skills are essential.§ §You should be a good listener and keen to explore alternative perspectives.§ §You will likely be a good continual-learner and a keen reader.§ §You will be capable of prioritising and managing your time effectively.§ § §  §Location §  §This role is based in Tauranga, but you will be required to travel from time to time and work with clients across New Zealand. §  §Apagie operates a four-day-workweek so that our team can have a better balance and return to work each week refreshed and energetic. Family comes first and we understand the need for flexibility. §  §Constant learning is essential in our business and we expect our team to allocate paid working time to this each week. §  § §  §Why should you apply?§ § §We are a rapidly growing business creating a unique position in the market.  This role is the starting point, where you take the role over time is up to you.§ §We provide an open environment with no politics, based on strong communication and an interest in understanding other’s perspectives.  You will be heard, expected to contribute, and recognised.§ §Our work environment is challenging, continually different and you will grow.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§How many years' experience do you have in market research?§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing coordinator?§How many years' experience do you have in a client services / account management role?§§§

The global pandemic threat to our economy and society continues unabated. Until either effective treatment or a vaccine is widely disseminated, a robust all-of-government response is required to protect the position we have gained. DPMC is responsible for coordinating and where necessary leading that all of government response.§        §We currently have a twelve month fixed-term employment or secondment opportunity for an experienced Senior Communications Advisor to join the Communications & Public Engagement Team of the COVID-19 AOG Response Group in DPMC.§        §The successful applicant will be someone who enjoys proactive media work and pitching stories, who can identify and manage risk as it arises, has reactive media experience and has an analytic mind. They will also enjoy working at pace, and have good resilience strategies.§        §Key responsibilities:§        §          §Proactive media work to support the objectives of COVID-19 AOG Response advantage.§          §Demonstrated ability to think analytically and conceptually§          §Demonstrated ability to prepare, and guide others to prepare, effective written content§          §Demonstrated proficiency in modern communication tools e.g. Microsoft Office, including PowerPoint; and social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn)§          §Can assimilate new and complex information and provide advice accordingly§          §Able to organise and prioritise work to ensure it is carried out effectively§          §Able to be innovative and creative in working through variety of people§          §Shows an awareness of, and commitment to, the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and able to sustain an environment that promotes diversity and inclusion§          §Demonstrates a knowledge of the government environment§          §Demonstrates high levels of integrity, self-responsibility and focus on quality§          §An interest in your own growth and development and that of others around you§          §Ability to meet the requirements to hold a NZ Government security clearance§          §Experience developing and implementing internal and external communications strategies and plans§          §Excellent oral and written communication skills and an ability to convey key messages effectively to others§        §        §Please apply online. We are open to secondments for this opportunity.§        §The application period closes on §18 October 2020.§        §For further information, please contact §sarah.helm@dpmc.govt.nz§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§New Zealand is pursuing an ambitious COVID-19 elimination strategy. The global pandemic threat to our economy and society continues unabated. Until either effective treatment or a vaccine is widely disseminated, a robust all-of-government response is required to protect the position we have gained. DPMC is responsible for coordinating and where necessary leading that all of government response.§We currently have a twelve month fixed-term employment or secondment opportunity for an experienced Senior Communications Advisor to join the Communications & Public Engagement Team of the COVID-19 AOG Response Group in DPMC.§The successful applicant will be someone who enjoys proactive media work and pitching stories, who can identify and manage risk as it arises, has reactive media experience and has an analytic mind. They will also enjoy working at pace, and have good resilience strategies.§Key responsibilities:§Proactive media work to support the objectives of COVID-19 AOG Response Group.§Reactive media work, responding to media queries or requests and/or referring requests onto other agencies.§Produce a regular dashboard that shows the prevalent media coverage and other audience feedback to inform the wider business unit and other stakeholders and partners§Develop media releases, talking points and other communications products as required.§Assist the Communications Manager to keep the Head of Communications & Public Engagement and other communications groups aware of emerging media and other issues, and advise on how we might respond to them§Write informational material for the public, partners or stakeholders.§Anticipate issues that might impact adversely on the AoG COVID-19 Business Unit's interests, and be willing to take responsibility for dealing with such issues§Where relevant, develop and maintain relationships across the government to ensure that a communications perspective is incorporated early into work that is significant or presents communication risks or opportunities§Ensure that all communications activities give effect to the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi§Key requirements:§Demonstrated media and communications work with proven results§Proven success in proactive media work§An understanding of, and experience working with Māori media§Successful risk identification and risk management experience§Some understanding of ethnic and community media an advantage.§Demonstrated ability to think analytically and conceptually§Demonstrated ability to prepare, and guide others to prepare, effective written content§Demonstrated proficiency in modern communication tools e.g. Microsoft Office, including PowerPoint; and social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn)§Can assimilate new and complex information and provide advice accordingly§Able to organise and prioritise work to ensure it is carried out effectively§Able to be innovative and creative in working through issues and problems as they arise§Able to work effectively as a team member and autonomously, as and when required§Ability to build and maintain strong relationships with a variety of people§Shows an awareness of, and commitment to, the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and able to sustain an environment that promotes diversity and inclusion§Demonstrates a knowledge of the government environment§Demonstrates high levels of integrity, self-responsibility and focus on quality§An interest in your own growth and development and that of others around you§Ability to meet the requirements to hold a NZ Government security clearance§Experience developing and implementing internal and external communications strategies and plans§Excellent oral and written communication skills and an ability to convey key messages effectively to others§Please apply online. We are open to secondments for this opportunity.§The application period closes on §18 October 2020.§For further information, please contact §sarah.helm@dpmc.govt.nz§§§§

At Credit Union Baywide we’re about making an impact. We offer simple, smart money solutions for Kiwis, whether it’s savings, lending or everyday banking.*  We’re a team of more than 200, with 21 branches and over 60,000 members.   §We keep it real. We are 100% customer owned and 100% of our profits go back into the business to create great products and solutions for our customers, so they can get on and prosper. §We get results. We have one of the highest customer satisfaction scores in our industry and our solutions are independently recognised and awarded by Canstar. §We put People first. We care and support our people to meet their career aspirations while having the flexibility to meet their personal and whanau needs. §We’re looking for a Senior Marketer to join our team, based in Hastings, Hawke's Bay. §You’ll have strong generalist experience and have worked in a senior role across all aspects of marketing including research, product development, pricing, channel development, campaign development, media planning, communications and reporting. §You’ll develop and execute successful marketing strategies, and work to develop new product solutions that enable both retention and acquisition in desired new and existing market segments. §We’re at an exciting stage of brand development, and work in a fast-paced retail environment. jobText: TXT/50745120.txt	§Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Astro§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§ MARKETING MANAGER - BLENHEIM§Full time or part time hours by negotiation§Family owned business with positive fun culture§Excellent salary on offer§About Us§At Astro, we are driven by the vision to become the preferred brand in the hotel/accommodation industry. As an established New Zealand family owned business, we provide a supportive environment with a team of positive and engaged people that encourages success.  Based in Blenheim, our reputation for service is second to none and our fantastic culture is based on family values.  This is your opportunity to join an excellent team where your hard work will be acknowledged.§About The Role§For this newly created and “hands on” role, we are looking for a dynamic and experienced Manager to be responsible for all aspects of marketing and ensure that we grow new and existing customer loyalty.  With a minimum of 5 years experience in a mid to high level marketing role, you will bring with you proven experience in:§Marketing strategy and planning§Design and implementation of marketing campaigns§Building and maintaining brand awareness§Development of marketing collateral§Social media content, campaigns and management§Database and email marketing§Supporting sales team/generating incoming leads§Maintaining and driving metric reporting.§About You§With a relevant tertiary qualification, you may come from a large corporate and be looking for your next step up, or be a more experienced marketer who would now welcome a more flexible working week. You will also:§Be motivated to achieve targets and deadlines§Be an excellent communicator and team player§Possess strong commercial acumen§Thrive on trust and collaboration§Be driven to take ownership and deliver strong business results.§In Return§On offer is a competitive package, a company in growth mode and the opportunity to work with a great close knit team who all have the drive and personality to succeed.  §Apply§If you have the skills and experience required, please email a copy of your CV and cover letter outlining your interest in the role to §careers@astro.net.nz§.§You must have the right to work in New Zealand to apply for this role.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50753751.txt	§Social Media and Marketing Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Media and Marketing Assistant§§Advertiser: §Bird on a Wire§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$45,000 - $49,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Put simply, Bird on a Wire wants to feed the world better food. We believe in delicious food that nourishes our bodies. We believe in our awesome staff and they believe in what we do. We believe it's everybody's responsibility to look after the environment. We believe in real food. We believe in spreading §good vibes only§.§ §We are looking for a full-time §Social Media & Marketing Assistant§ to oversee, administer and drive our digital platforms.§ §You will be based in our support office but will also be required to spend time in our restaurants regularly to capture content.  We are a highly agile team and need a like-minded individual to join our collaborative team who work hard, enjoy the job and have fun doing it.§ § § § § §About the role§ § § §Responsible for sourcing, developing and managing content for use across digital and social media channels.§Assisting in the development of our social media strategy in order to grown engagement§Manage various BOAW digital platforms, ensuring content is integrated, current and on trend§Assist with Photoshoots and video creation§Weekly reporting and analytics on social channels and online performance§Responsible for updating and enhancing copy writing for digital channels and company websites§Responsible for monitoring and reporting on marketing campaigns with insightful ideas to shape future campaigns.§Provide general marketing support on a project by project basis as required§Assist with inhouse printing projects using our print hub§Assist with sponsorship and charity partnerships§Answering phones and provide general admin support and assistance for BOAW HQ team§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Real opportunity to develop your career and grow with us as we build our brand across NZ and globally §Fun, energetic and supportive team §Exciting role with heaps of variation - spend some days in the office and others in our awesome restaurants capturing content for social media. § § § §Skills and experience§ § § §Experience with digital marketing, social media and content strategy and creation.§Strong enthusiasm for creating high quality content (Food and beverage images, video, and posts.).§Must have a strong interest and background in photography - video editing is a bonus.§Must be active on social media yourself and possess a strong working knowledge of social media platforms.§A positive attitude, vibrant personality, and a passion for marketing, creativity and graphic design.§Must have initiative and can apply this confidently, with a strong desire and ability to take ownership of projects.§Love being organised and methodical, and can work on multiple projects at once.§High level of attention to detail with exceptional writing and communication skills.§Advanced graphic design skills, particularly with Adobe Creative Suite.§Strong computer skills particularly ability to use Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel).§Hospitality experience is a bonus but not essential.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50748376.txt	§Communications Guru§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications Guru§§Advertiser: §LegaSea§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Internal Communications§§§§§§We are searching for a tenacious individual, a communications guru with a passion for the marine environment.  §We are a small non-profit organisation focused on restoring our coastal fish populations. Destructive fishing techniques, over fishing and mismanagement has seen the health of our marine ecosystem continue to decline. Thankfully, Kiwis are increasingly aware of these issues and offers of support are increasing daily. §Working closely with our Communications Lead, the objective of this role is to communicate, motivate and inspire a growing number of supporters. §On a daily basis you would communicate using a variety of mediums. Be it emails, social media posts, magazine articles or simply on the phone or at events. Good written communication skills and experience with the Microsoft suite of products are critical. Experience with other digital mediums and a Fisheries Management or Marine Sciences background would be advantageous.  §We are looking for an individual who is excited to make an impact, to restore abundance in our coastal fisheries.§Applicants must have the legal right to work in New Zealand. Profiling will be completed for those candidates who shortlist.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50738925.txt	§Strategic Communications Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Strategic Communications Manager§§Advertiser: §Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Strategic Communications Manager §      §        §New Zealand is pursuing an ambitious COVID-19 elimination strategy. The global pandemic threat to our economy and society continues unabated. Until either effective treatment or a vaccine is widely disseminated, a robust all-of-government response is required to protect the position we have gained. DPMC is responsible for coordinating and where necessary leading that all of government response.§        §We currently have a twelve month fixed-term employment or secondment opportunity for an experienced communications expert to join the Communications & Public Engagement Team of the COVID-19 AOG Response Group in DPMC, as the Manager Strategic Communications.§        §You are a seasoned communications professional and manager, who has spent some time in the government sector. As a manager, you are adept at leading a resilient team that achieves great things, even under pressure. A systems-thinker, who has demonstrated an ability to understand complex issues and their inter-relationship, and a proven ability to develop communications strategies that coherently describe and pose solutions to the inherent communications challenges they present. You have a range communications skills, with a mix of strategic communications, media, digital and/or campaign and marketing experience. You appreciate the need for integrated messages, and proactively initiate the sharing of communications across channels and other organisations. Ideally, you also have commissioned, or have a good understanding of, quantitative and qualitative audience research and understand how to use it to best effect.§        §You enjoy working at pace, are resilient and a team-player.§        §Key responsibilities:§        §          §Managing the strategic communications team of senior and principal communications advisors and a media advisor.§ daily (or otherwise regular) messages, to ensure integrated messages are shared across the system and through AOG channels so that the government has one clear, coherent voice to enable all New Zealanders to be empowered, understand what is needed, and take necessary action.§          §Ensure that all communications activities give effect to the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi.§          §The development of daily/regular strategic communications products.§          §Media queries and proactive media activity§          §Assist the Manager Campaigns and Channels with the commissioning of audience research, adding strategic input and strategic advice on utilising the findings.§          §Keep the Head of Communications and other AoG communications groups aware of emerging media and other issues, and advise on how we might respond to them.§          §Assist with the relationship with the Chief Press Secretary in the Prime Minister's Office and other media and policy staff.§ opportunities.§        §        §Key requirements:§        §          §A minimum of ten years' experience working in communications, media and/or marketing, with proven results.§          §Experience in the public service.§          §Experience at a manager-level.§          §A tertiary qualification in communications or other relevant discipline (post graduate desirable) or equivalent experience.§          §Significant senior experience developing and implementing external and internal communications and engagement strategies. Relevant experience in a similar role is desirable.§          §Preferred understanding and experience of developing communications for a range of channels, including marketing or behaviour change, social media and website communications.§          §Preferred experience and capability of commissioning and utilising quantitative and qualitative audience research§          §A people manager with the ability to calmly manage a team under pressure.§          §A systems-thinker, who has demonstrated an ability to think about complex issues and their inter-relationship.§          §Shows an awareness of, and commitment to, the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi.§          §Proactively develops communications that are able to reach a range of diverse people.§          §Promotes diversity and inclusion.§        §        §Please apply online. This is a varied writing role involved in the production and distribution of communications collateral for public relations, advertising, editorial, case studies, events, and more.  You’ll be involved in developing and nurturing relationships with media to maximise exposure and ensure our content gets seen by the right audience.§        §Working with the Brand and PR Manager you’ll be at the forefront of driving global brand awareness and shouting out about the amazing things we do and problems we solve here at Gallagher security.§        §To be considered for this role, you will have:§        §          §3-5 years of experience and a tertiary qualification in communications, journalism, or similar.§          §Demonstrated experience in your way with words and your passion for storytelling. §          §Had exposure to global communications and understand the subtleties of addressing a global audience.§          §Proven history of converting technically complex information into simple compelling stories. §        §        §This role provides a nice balance between copywriting and content writing, and you’ll be comfortable switching between the two as you work on multiple projects at once. You will be part of a team of innovative and creative minds who are often recognised with awards and accolades. §        §Working for Gallagher is a move in the right direction. Visit our website www.gallagher.com to see our journey and the uniqueness of our brand. §        §Applications will close on Sunday 1 November 2020. We look forward to hearing from you.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Are you a wizard with words?  Do you have the skills to take complex information and craft a compelling and engaging story?  If you’ve said yes, then you’re just the person we’re looking for!§One of our awesome Communication Creators is going on maternity leave and we are looking for someone to fill in for a year. You will be part of a team of innovative and creative minds who are often recognised with awards and accolades. §Working for Gallagher is a move in the right direction. Visit our website www.gallagher.com to see our journey and the uniqueness of our brand. §Applications will close on Sunday 1 November 2020. We look forward to hearing from you.§§§§

jobTitle: Change Specialist Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50722904.txt	§Change Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Change Specialist§§Advertiser: §NZ Health Partnerships Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Internal Communications§§§§§§§§§.job-template__wrapper [border="0"] { border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; }§§  §    §    §      §Change Specialist §      §        §          §Work with the manager to deliver change management activities§          §Brand new programme of work in the Health sector§          §Great office space in Greenlane§        §        §About the Opportunity§        § §        §Currently we are launching a brand new programme of work called the ‘Health System Catalogue'. The Health System Catalogue Programme will provide procurement savings to the health sector through the introduction of a centralised repository of medical devices allowing DHBs to maximise their use of nationwide contract arrangements.  The programme will also deliver data analytics to provide insight into the spending patterns and compliance to purchasing arrangements.  It is a foundational programme that will provide the building blocks for future procurement and non-procurement initiatives.§        § §        §As the Change Specialist you will use your change management experience to assist the Change, Communications and Training Team to deliver the activities in the Change, Communications and Training Plans.  You'll also act as a conduit to facilitate information flow between the programme team and stakeholder groups.§        § §        §Day to day you can expect to be responsible for:§        §          §Preparing surveys and other methods of gauging stakeholder readiness for change;§          §PowerPoint presentations, reports, newsletters and other audio visual material;§          §Participating in the preparation of strategies to deal with arising changes;§          §Preparing status reports and assist with the management of risks and issues, as well as analysing the impact of changes across our various stakeholders;§          §Scheduling of training and organising change and communications related events and meetings.§        §        § §        §Please note this is either a 1 year fixed term or contracting opportunity.§        § §        §About You§ § §        §To be successful in the role you will need to have experience in similar roles working on change and communication programmes within complex organisations. We will specifically be looking for experience working on large IT and Business transformation projects. §        § §        §We will also be looking for:§        §          §The ability to engage with senior management and influence where necessary;§          §Range of experience working with different and challenging stakeholders;§          §Knowledge and understanding of the machinery of government;§          §Experience in the health sector will be extremely advantageous.§        §        § §        § §        §About Us§        § §        §NZ Health Partnerships is supported and owned by New Zealand's 20 District Health Boards (DHBs). By thinking, acting and investing collaboratively through us, DHBs can achieve greater efficiencies than they would by operating independently. We provide a range of programme and national services for DHB's including shared banking, collective insurance, procurement and an Oracle ERP system build and implementation. Should you wish to learn more please visit www.nzhealthpartnerships.co.nz§        § §        §APPLY NOW, to join an organization that makes a difference!§  §        § §      §      §      §    §    §      §        §          §            § NZ Health Partnerships Ltd§ Level 2, Building 2 Central Park§ 660 - 670 Great South Road, Penrose, Auckland, 1061§ PO Box 11-410 Ellerslie, Auckland 1542§ Ph:§09 487 4990§            §            §nzhealthpartnerships.co.nz§          §        §      §    §  §§§Work with the manager to deliver change management activities§Brand new programme of work in the Health sector§Great office space in Greenlane§§About the Opportunity§ §Currently we are launching a brand new programme of work called the ‘Health System Catalogue'. The Health System Catalogue Programme will provide procurement savings to the health sector through the introduction of a centralised repository of medical devices allowing DHBs to maximise their use of nationwide contract arrangements.  The programme will also deliver data analytics to provide insight into the spending patterns and compliance to purchasing arrangements.  It is a foundational programme that will provide the building blocks for future procurement and non-procurement initiatives.§ §As the Change Specialist you will use your change management experience to assist the Change, Communications and Training Team to deliver the activities in the Change, Communications and Training Plans.  You'll also act as a conduit to facilitate information flow between the programme team and stakeholder groups.§ §Day to day you can expect to be responsible for:§§Preparing surveys and other methods of gauging stakeholder readiness for change;§PowerPoint presentations, reports, newsletters and other audio visual material;§Participating in the preparation of strategies to deal with arising changes;§Preparing status reports and assist with the management of risks and issues, as well as analysing the impact of changes across our various stakeholders;§Scheduling of training and organising change and communications related events and meetings.§§ §Please note this is either a 1 year fixed term or contracting opportunity.§ §About You§ § §To be successful in the role you will need to have experience in similar roles working on change and communication programmes within complex organisations. We will specifically be looking for experience working on large IT and Business transformation projects. § §We will also be looking for:§§The ability to engage with senior management and influence where necessary;§Range of experience working with different and challenging stakeholders;§Knowledge and understanding of the machinery of government;§Experience in the health sector will be extremely advantageous.§§ § §About Us§§ §NZ Health Partnerships is supported and owned by New Zealand's 20 District Health Boards (DHBs). By thinking, acting and investing collaboratively through us, DHBs can achieve greater efficiencies than they would by operating independently. We provide a range of programme and national services for DHB's including shared banking, collective insurance, procurement and an Oracle ERP system build and implementation. Should you wish to learn more please visit www.nzhealthpartnerships.co.nz§ §APPLY NOW, to join an organization that makes a difference!§  § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50733040.txt	§Strategic Communications Specialist: Climate Change (E-Volunteer)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Strategic Communications Specialist: Climate Change (E-Volunteer)§§Advertiser: §Volunteer Service Abroad (VSA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Strategic Communications Specialist: Climate Change (E-Volunteer) §      §The Organisation§The World Health Organisation's (WHO) primary role is to direct and coordinate international health within the United Nations system. Established on the 7th of April, 1948, a date that is now celebrated as World Health Day, WHO now has a global staff team of 7000 people working across 150 country offices and six regional offices with headquarters in Geneva, Switzerland. §WHO's Division of Pacific Technical Support (DPS) works in collaboration with pacific governments, other UN agencies, and NGOs to achieve better health outcomes in 21 pacific countries and areas. Climate change has been identified as having an impact on health outcomes and amidst the shock of Covid19, people are further realising  the need to protect both. §§The Assignment§This is a part-time e-volunteer assignment where you work from home. Partnering with technical teams on climate change and environment, communications staff based in Suva, Manilla, and WHO's new Asia-Pacific Centre for Environment in Seoul, the volunteer will ensure advocacy and communications activities are effectively developed and successfully implemented. §Responsibilities will include; §        §          §Supporting the development of health advocacy plans for WHO Western Pacific region;§          §Contributing to the development of communications publications and advocacy materials,§          §Media and stakeholder engagement; and§          §Supporting the development of digital communications platforms. §        § §The Volunteer§Our ideal volunteer is an experienced communications professional. Tertiary qualifications in a related field as well as  demonstrable experience in strategic communications with a large NGO is essential. As this assignment will be delivered on-line, you will need to be highly motivated, demonstrate the ability to work cross-culturally in a remote setting and be adequately and appropriate resourced for a home-based assignment. §If you believe you have the skills to be successful and are committed to improving regional health outcomes, we'd love to hear from you.§https://vsa.org.nz/assets/Assignment-Descriptions-§2019-2020§/41486_-Strategic-Comms-Climate-Change-1.pdf§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§The Organisation§The World Health Organisation's (WHO) primary role is to direct and coordinate international health within the United Nations system. Established on the 7th of April, 1948, a date that is now celebrated as World Health Day, WHO now has a global staff team of 7000 people working across 150 country offices and six regional offices with headquarters in Geneva, Switzerland. §WHO's Division of Pacific Technical Support (DPS) works in collaboration with pacific governments, other UN agencies, and NGOs to achieve better health outcomes in 21 pacific countries and areas. Climate change has been identified as having an impact on health outcomes and amidst the shock of Covid19, people are further realising  the need to protect both. §§The Assignment§This is a part-time e-volunteer assignment where you work from home. Partnering with technical teams on climate change and environment, communications staff based in Suva, Manilla, and WHO's new Asia-Pacific Centre for Environment in Seoul, the volunteer will ensure advocacy and communications activities are effectively developed and successfully implemented. §Responsibilities will include; § § §Supporting the development of health advocacy plans for WHO Western Pacific region;§ §Contributing to the development of communications publications and advocacy materials,§ §Media and stakeholder engagement; and§ §Supporting the development of digital communications platforms. § § §The Volunteer§Our ideal volunteer is an experienced communications professional. Tertiary qualifications in a related field as well as  demonstrable experience in strategic communications with a large NGO is essential. As this assignment will be delivered on-line, you will need to be highly motivated, demonstrate the ability to work cross-culturally in a remote setting and be adequately and appropriate resourced for a home-based assignment. §If you believe you have the skills to be successful and are committed to improving regional health outcomes, we'd love to hear from you.§https://vsa.org.nz/assets/Assignment-Descriptions-§2019-2020§/41486_-Strategic-Comms-Climate-Change-1.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

This is an interesting and varied role encompassing the purchasing, project planning, and the development of new products. We envisage the hours for the role being 24-30hrs per week, dependent on skills and previous work experience. § §This is a great opportunity to help with the development and launch of New Zealand created products to a global customer base. Having touchpoints throughout the product lifecycle, as such we are looking for a very unique set of skills to be effective in this role.§ § § §Key Duties and Responsibilities:§ § §Support and strategize with the management team for the creation of new product ranges§ §Bridge the gap between marketing and production, to ensure commercial, legal and market fit products are sourced, developed and launched§ §Managing all regulatory, quality and project management functions, both local and international§ §To be active and strategic in assisting the team with new product selection§ §Stock planning / strategic forecasting to ensure constant stock availability while keeping inventory turnover ratios relevant to market activity§ §Source, select and negotiate the best purchase package for product and components- Local and Overseas§ §Working with vendors to ensure smooth on time deliveries and meeting of quality control standards§ §​​​​​​​§ § §Personal Qualifications:§ §Must have a minimum of 5 years’ experience with stock management and product development within the skin care industry§ §A real passion for skin care and natural ingredients, with an interest to learn further in this area§ §Knowledge of NZ labelling standards and EU compliance for skincare is ideal§ §Strong attention to detail for quality control of regulatory protocols and goods manufactured to agreed specification§ §Excellent organisational and project management skills to handle a variety of projects on the go§ §Good written and oral communication to develop relationships with local and overseas suppliers§ §Intermediate to Advanced Excel skills§ §Strong business and marketing acumen.§ §Enthusiastic & self-motivated§ §Good creative skills and production processing knowledge§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a procurement role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have purchasing experience?§Do you have experience with inventory management?§§§

jobTitle: Communications Manager Job in Tasman - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50732602.txt	§Communications Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications Manager§§Advertiser: §Aquaculture New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Public Relations & Corporate Affairs§§§§§§§Communications Manager §  §Nelson Based§  §The opportunity: §Our farmers produce the world’s best seafood and our premium food and unique nutraceutical products are in demand in over 80 countries. Our industry is still in its infancy but already employs over 3,000 Kiwis and is the lifeblood of our regional towns. The New Zealand aquaculture industry is one of the most efficient and sustainable forms of protein production on the planet.§  §The organisation: §Aquaculture New Zealand is the national representative body for the country’s Greenshell mussel, King salmon and Pacific oyster farmers. We are a sector with tremendous potential to contribute towards New Zealand’s social, environmental, and economic well-being. Our story is about a love of food, love of people and love of place. Our authentic voice provides trusted insights and builds appreciation of the primary industry of the future.§  §The role: §An outstanding opportunity now exists for an exceptional writer and creative professional to take the helm of our multi-faceted communications programme.§  §Externally, you will be focused on engaging New Zealanders through a range of digital mediums to grow community support and understanding of the industry and boost consumption of our products.  While internally you will work closely with a small team of highly specialised professionals to inform, support and inspire the wider industry.§  §Ideally you will have a flair for writing in a variety of formats and voices ranging from business plans to magazine feature stories to speeches.  You will also have a full range of digital skills to create and manage social media campaigns, e-newsletters, video productions and website content systems and ideally but not absolutely required, some knowledge of the aquaculture industry.§  §This fast-paced role will see you engaging with Government, councils, Iwi, environmental groups, communities, media and industry participants.§  §This is a real opportunity to apply your passion, professionalism and specialist knowledge to make a significant and meaningful impact on the future growth of this exciting sector of New Zealand’s economy.§  §Remuneration will be commensurate with experience.§  §Applications close at 5.00pm on Thursday October 29, 2020.§  §To discuss this opportunity in confidence, please contact by telephone or email with CV to:§  § §  §Karen Morley§  §Business Manager§  §Aquaculture New Zealand, Nelson§  §Telephone: +64 21 2444 156§  §karen.morley@aquaculture.org.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50736836.txt	§Senior Content Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Content Designer§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Content Designer §      §      §      §        §          §Take a lead role managing content on the INZ website.§          §Ensure the delivery of effective, accurate, clear and consistent content - developed with the needs of the audience in mind.§          §Write, review, edit and manage the delivery of new and existing content§          §Salary range $79K - $94K§        §        § §        §About the role.§        §As Senior Content Designer you will create web content for Immigration's website. You will manage day-to-day requests, and work with subject matter experts (SMEs) to prepare, review and ensure content accuracy.§        §You will work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders and actively look to improve INZ's web content, including providing editorial support.§        §You will be big on continuous improvement, utilising data and analytics to inform decision making on our content.§        §We're looking for:§        §          §A natural collaborator, you'll be comfortable building relationships across INZ and MBIE at all levels.§          §You'll bring a proven track record of writing great content and understanding which channels to use effectively to reach our audience.§          §You'll enjoy working at pace, juggling deadlines and delivering quality outputs, including plain English, customer-centric, fit for purpose content.§          §You'll be hands on, happy to get stuck into the day to day work as well as helping to develop our strategic digital channel initiatives.§        §        §What you'll bring:§        §          §Demonstrated experience of online content creation and development of digital strategy for websites and social media.§          §Experience writing and creating fit for purpose content for different audiences and digital channels§          §Knowledge and understanding of web content best practice, including accessibility and plain language.§          §Knowledge of Google analytics, you'll be able to use evidence to recommend change.§          §Experience conducting content audits and redesigning content for websites.§          §You'll be a natural communicator and influencer of people, presenting ideas and bringing them along on the journey.§        §        §About the team:§        §Digital Channels is part of INZ's Information & Education (I&E) team. The I&E team deliver high-quality information and education resources to help migrants and other key stakeholders engage with the immigration sKystem and supports migrants to integrate into New Zealand society.§        §Immigration New Zealand works with international organisations and industry partners to improve border security and make immigration easier. We lead government strategy designed to help migrants settle into New Zealand.§        §We are part of the Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment (MBIE), New Zealand's largest government department. MBIE's purpose is to grow the New Zealand economy to provide a better standard of living for all New Zealanders.§        §How to Apply§        §All applicants must be New Zealand citizens or hold a residence class visa. §        §Click on the §APPLY§ button below where a position description is also available. jobText: TXT/50747601.txt	§Content Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Content Designer§§Advertiser: §ANZ Bank New Zealand Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Other§§§§§§We’re excited by design! § §We’re a big bank with a simple ambition: extraordinary outcomes and experiences for our customers and staff.§ §To reach this goal we’ve embedded Human-Centred Design (HCD) principles into the creation of our products and services with our customers’ front and centre.§ §We are building a new content design team as part of the Design Centre of Expertise and we need experienced content specialists like you to make it happen.§ §In this role you will:§Report to the Content Design Lead.§ §Lead and contribute to content projects across the Bank, bringing your exceptional UX writing, content management and content strategy skills to the fore.  § §Approach content problems from an HCD perspective and work closely with other designers and members of cross-functional teams to produce beautiful experiences on ANZ technology platforms such as Internet Banking, goMoney, and the website. § §Develop, create and promote content strategies across customer journeys.§ §Help embed content design into the Design System to support customer experience and ensure consistency through tone, voice, terminology and the like. § §Understand the technology required to manage content in today’s environment and contribute to the design of these systems to ensure smart content distribution.§ §Advocate and champion design thinking by bringing customer insights and data to the decision table.§ §Advocate for inclusive design principles and diversity across all content development, especially accessibility.§ §Role Location:§ Wellington or Auckland§Role Type:§ Permanent §Hours:§ Business hours with plenty of flexibility available§ §Now what about you?§Content is your passion. You’re a skilled UX writer, editor and content strategist. You always have the customer in mind when creating content and can switch from thinking about micro-copy interactions to cross-platform customer journey content strategies. §Through your experience, you can demonstrate that you have:§ §A developed understanding of the many facets of content design and design thinking§ §Strong experience leading content strategy and content design activities and projects (3-5 years)§ §The ability to work collaboratively across multiple product and project teams across different geographies§ §Proficiency in project planning, communication and presentation, including an aptitude for convincing others of the value of their ideas§ §Confidence with a range of existing digital tools, whilst being open and adaptive to new trends and technologies. § §Experience with Adobe Experience Manager; or content as a service; or scaled content management would be an advantage.  § §Proficient in project planning, communication and presentation, including an aptitude for convincing others of the value of their ideas§ §Good understanding of design system and its application§ §Working knowledge of digital accessibility and familiarity with WCAG 2.1 standards and guidelines§ §Great work ethic, proactive and positive mindset§ §About ANZ§Our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. That’s why we strive to create a balanced, sustainable economy in which everyone can take part and build a better life. By helping people make the most of what they have, we transform ideas, hard work and ambition into reality. §ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. Our recruitment decisions are based on the key inherent needs and requirements of each role, and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and characteristics.§The ANZ values are the foundation of how we work and support our customers.§Integrity – We are honest and fair§Collaboration – We work together for the customer§Accountability – We take ownership and get things done§Respect – We care for all those we serve§Excellence – We challenge ourselves to be better§We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you.§ANZ recognises the importance of flexible working, watch our Global Stories to see how ANZ aims to meet the needs of our customers and to attract and retain the best people in a changing world. §To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit anz.co.nz/careers §You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and search for the reference number §NEW042312.§Applications close Thursday, 29 October 2020.§ §§§§§

jobTitle: Customer Experience Designer Job in Auckland - SEEK
experience: The team has been running for three years
jobText: TXT/50746078.txt	§Customer Experience Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Experience Designer§§Advertiser: §Auckland Transport§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Other§§§§§§Join an in-house experience design lab that follows a project from inception to delivery§Viaduct Harbour location§At Auckland Transport, we are passionate about putting our customers at the heart of everything we do in our crusade to deliver 'easy journeys' with safe, innovative and sustainable transport options for a vibrant, growing city.§'Customer Central' is our co-design and innovation lab where we work with people from inside and outside AT to deliver better outcomes for Aucklanders. Using human-centred design and agile methods, we work to quickly discover/design/test/deliver solutions to customer problems, big or small. We also help project teams from across the business to design customer interventions and work towards long term solutions; whether it's in the digital space, community interaction, tactical urbanism, or future infrastructure.§The team has been running for three years and are more in demand than ever, so it's a great time to join. The work is challenging, varied and meaningful, and you'll be supported by a great team who are constantly learning and sharing ideas and methods.§About the role§The role of the §Customer Experience Designer§ is to facilitate and design better outcomes for our customers and communities. No two days will ever be the same. You will perform a diverse range of functions, including but not limited to, designing customer experience sessions with business representatives, facilitation of sprints and workshops, service design, concept generation, prototyping and testing, as well as engaging with key stakeholders to build momentum and gain buy in.§About you§You will have proven experience in designing and facilitating sprints and workshops as well as creating and guiding cross-functional teams to explore and prototype potential solutions. You are adept at leading design research, utilising appropriate tools as well as applying insights from research and analytics to unpack problems and identify opportunities to enhance AT's customer experiences.§As a superior communicator, you will have a growth mindset and stakeholders and peers alike respect you - and listen to you. An agile team player through and through, you are dedicated to continually improve processes in order to achieve high quality outcomes efficiently.§At Auckland Transport we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where people come first and we feel safe, respected, valued and supported, regardless of our differences. We also support flexible working that meets the needs of our people and the business, so please talk to us about how we could make this role flexible for you.§Our values are woven into all we do at AT. We recently refreshed our values as a team to ensure they were meaningful and truly reflect how we behave with one another. Welcoming talent with aligned values is important to us, our values that guide every encounter are:§Manaakitanga - We care ..full stop§Tiakitanga - Safe with us§Whanaungatanga - We connect§Auahatanga - Better, bolder, together§Excited? We are! It is our people that make the difference, and in-house experience design labs like this are rare in Auckland. You'll be able to follow a project from inception through to delivery, and help us make commuting and moving around Auckland easier.§Apply now and begin your journey with Auckland Transport!§§§§

We are vocal supporters of our industry, working to ensure tourism gets the recognition it deserves as a vital contributor to the country’s economy and social health.§ §Our core beliefs at TIA include: People Matter, Share the Passion, Take It On and Make A Difference. These values have shaped an organisation that has a culture of passion for the tourism industry, that cares about its people and takes pride in the work we do and how we do it. § § § §About the role § §We are looking for an Events and Marketing Manager to lead one of our busiest teams. A key part of our leadership group, this role is highly valued within TIA and with our members, and the wider tourism industry. As well as overseeing the successful delivery of our events (including our largest event – TRENZ), you will be busy developing and executing marketing strategies and initiatives that capture the attention of members, the industry, and wider NZ. If that doesn’t keep you busy enough, you will also manage and grow TIA’s commercial partnerships. All of this will be done with the support of your team, and the wider TIA team.  § § § §About you§ § §Ideally you will have at least 3 years experience in a similar management level role.§ §Marketing or events may be your main background, but experience in both is required.§ §You will be able to come up with clever marketing strategies, and be confident articulating them and their benefits.§ §You have experience in obtaining and maintaining commercial partnerships.§ §You will be a natural relationship builder, being able to quickly build rapport and build long term relationships.§ § § §TIA has a collaborative team culture and is a flexible, supportive and fun place to work. We are looking for a flexible, dedicated and experienced professional with a great work ethic who brings enthusiasm, passion and sense of humour to the role. § § § §Applications close 26 October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing manager?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have a current Police Check (Criminal Record Check) for employment?§§§

lifetime opportunity to join the team and learn from some of the best in the business.  Recruitment is an extremely rewarding career (both financially and personally) where you’ll be changing lives as you assist people into their dream jobs and become the go-to person for career advice and guidance (obviously this would come over time as you become more experienced).§  §What could be more fun than clients.  Social Media and your smartphone will be your best friends, as you use them as key communication channels to attract and screen potential candidates.§  §You’ll be given full training by the best in the business and have access to all the latest technology tools & systems, to enable you to uncover what most call hard to find skillsets. §  §The role of Talent Manager has evolved over the last few years and now seen as the most critical role in every recruitment business (our heart).  This role allows you to be an instrumental playmaker in the recruitment process without worrying about sales.  You can have a career in Talent Management or progress into a client-facing role in the future – The choice is yours!§  §What experience is required?§ § §We don’t require any previous experience! §You might be a recent Graduate, or someone working in IT (support, development etc), or marketing, or sales, or customer services.  Essentially you’re someone who’s passionate about technology & digital and looking for a fun and rewarding career.  This opportunity will allow you to expand your network and build relationships with talented professionals in the technology and digital industry.§  §Why Apply?§  §Worst case scenario is that recruitment’s not for you and you end up finding yourself your dream job through RWA! Best case is that you’ll love recruitment, have an exciting career where every day is filled with new challenges and in doing so make more money than you thought possible!§  §Don’t be afraid to explore this once in a lifetime opportunity!  If we’ve sparked your interest and you’d like to hear more about what life could be like in the tech recruitment industry, click apply or pick up the phone and call us on §09 579-7929§.§Reference number: JH_3176477§      §    §    §  §§§Why Recruitment and why with RWA?§Put your passion for technology & digital to the ultimate test in the exciting world of Tech and Digital Recruitment. With the innovation of social media and the speed of change in today’s digital world, it’s completely reshaped the way organisations need to operate.  There’s a war on talent and organisations are finding it harder and harder to find the right people at the right time to enable them to survive and thrive.§  §RWA is NZ’s leading Technology & Digital recruitment firm and this is your once in a lifetime opportunity to join the team and learn from some of the best in the business.  Recruitment is an extremely rewarding career (both financially and personally) where you’ll be changing lives as you assist people into their dream jobs and become the go-to person for career advice and guidance (obviously this would come over time as you become more experienced).§  §What could be more fun than spending all day with like-minded people, talking about your passion (technology & digital) while earning more money than you’d ever thought possible?§  §What will you be doing?§ § §Joining our Talent Management team you’ll ultimately be responsible for building relationships and engaging with technology talent (candidates) both locally and overseas to discuss the amazing job opportunities with our clients.  Social Media and your smartphone will be your best friends, as you use them as key communication channels to attract and screen potential candidates.§  §You’ll be given full training by the best in the business and have access to all the latest technology tools & systems, to enable you to uncover what most call hard to find skillsets. §  §The role of Talent Manager has evolved over the last few years and now seen as the most critical role in every recruitment business (our heart).  This role allows you to be an instrumental playmaker in the recruitment process without worrying about sales.  You can have a career in Talent Management or progress into a client-facing role in the future – The choice is yours!§  §What experience is required?§ § §We don’t require any previous experience! §You might be a recent Graduate, or someone working in IT (support, development etc), or marketing, or sales, or customer services.  Essentially you’re someone who’s passionate about technology & digital and looking for a fun and rewarding career.  This opportunity will allow you to expand your network and build relationships with talented professionals in the technology and digital industry.§  §Why Apply?§  §Worst case scenario is that recruitment’s not for you and you end up finding yourself your dream job through RWA! Best case is that you’ll love recruitment, have an exciting career where every day is filled with new challenges and in doing so make more money than you thought possible!§  §Don’t be afraid to explore this once in a lifetime opportunity!  If we’ve sparked your interest and you’d like to hear more about what life could be like in the tech recruitment industry, click apply or pick up the phone and call us on §09 579-7929§.§Reference number: JH_3176477§§§§

jobText: TXT/50748318.txt	§Global Marketing Lead - Product Innovation§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Global Marketing Lead - Product Innovation§§Advertiser: §Zespri International Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§Zespri is more than simply the world’s single-largest marketer of kiwifruit. We like to think of ourselves as fruit on a mission and as rebels with a cause: to help people, communities and the environment around the world thrive through the goodness of kiwifruit.§ §We supply one of the world’s healthiest little superfruits to millions of people around the world in more than 50 markets. We are one of New Zealand’s best-known international brands, dedicated to creating sustainable long-term value for growers.§ §We are growing quickly, driven by our success in engaging more and more consumers and by offering the world’s best kiwifruit 12 months of the year. We have bold ambitions and aim to grow sales from approximately $3 billion in 2018 to $4.5 billion by 2025.§ § § § §Global Marketing Lead – Product Innovation§ This role is responsible for Innovation Marketing and leading the product marketing team. The role is also responsible for defining the direction and development of Zespri’s current and future product portfolio supporting our growth ambitions. Anticipating consumer long term trends and understanding the insights that will further guide new cultivar developments and the respective investments on to scale up orchard cultivation trials.§   § This role is critical to support Zespri’s purpose of creating long term value for growers and shareholders by helping more consumers to healthy and delicious lives.§ § §Responsibilities:  § § §Anticipate and follow long term consumer trends and translate those into actionable portfolio development plans§ §Be the voice of the consumer and develop an insightful mindset across the Innovation organization§ §Develop a future portfolio strategy for new kiwifruit varieties in close collaboration with Innovation – New Cultivar Development and PFR teams§ §Develop consumer facing concepts and lead total marketing mix development for new varieties.§ §Be an active participant in Innovation forums and Innovation led projects to develop new varieties, representing the market interests and the voice of the consumer§ §Provide Market guidance for Stage 1 and 2 Breeding Programs of kiwifruit at PFR§ §Lead Market Group Decisions on New Cultivars Stage 3, at pre-commercial level§ §Lead consumer research and in market pre-commercial trials in close collaboration with Market Research Manager, the pre-commercial team and the in-market teams§ §Lead business case development, particularly from the market dynamics point of view, anticipating demand volumes, pricing and financial returns for Zespri and the growers.§ §Liaising with Orchard, SC and Export teams the sourcing of fruit to support the required trials§ §Develop the “launch information kit” for new cultivars from a Market point of view, when a commercialization decision is made§ §   § §Qualifications and Experience:§  § § §Tertiary qualifications in business administration, marketing, agribusiness or related fields§ §At least 8 years in a formal / disciplined corporate brand marketing environment with relevant experience in consumer products;§ §Innovation management experience, from insight generation to marketing mix development ando leading innovation projects§ §Business and financial acumen§ §Experience operating in highly complex, global markets;§ §Strong relationship management and communication skills with stakeholders.§ §Ability to lead and participate in cross functional teams,§ §Experience within foods, specially fresh produce categories is an advantage§ §   § All applications should be submitted by §Friday 30th October 2020§§§§

jobTitle: Digital Marketing & Content Specialist Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50751191.txt	§Digital Marketing & Content Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing & Content Specialist§§Advertiser: §Kin§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§A bit about us... § Hatch is a Kiwi Wealth’s digital investing platform that allows Kiwis to have easy access to US share markets – and soon to be more! Hatch is seriously straight-forward investing and we’re helping Kiwis grow their wealth long term. We are a growth-minded team, we go above and beyond for our investors, and we want to keep growing our exceptional team with exceptional people. §    § §The role § The Digital Marketing & Content Specialist role is a rare opportunity to be involved across Hatch’s marketing activities and help us hit our growth targets. This role will be delivery focused, juggling multiple things at once. This role will: § § §Manage and deliver a comprehensive content marketing strategy § §Analyse the effectiveness of our content and suggest improvements § §Coordinate and deliver all partner activities § §Manage and grow our social media engagement as a channel for growth § §Manage and deliver in-person and digital events § §Champion the effort to build our brand consistently across all channels § § This is not your average role; it is dynamic and will likely evolve over time. It is a key to our growth and directly influences our mission that every Kiwi deserves to up their wealth. §    § §About you§ § You will be positive and adaptable, with a natural ability to deliver. Driven by learning and developing your craft, you will bring a broad range of marketing experience to this role. Your main expertise will be in content marketing and you will be able to easily deliver initiatives that help grow our business and engage our investor base. §    § You will also have: § § §Strong experience in content coordination and marketing § §Exceptional writing and communication skills § §Solid experience in managing and growing engagement across multiple channels § §Experience in organising and delivering digital and in-person events § §Proven collaboration skills with ability to juggle multiple things at once § §An affinity with investing § §A resilient and ‘can-do’ attitude § § We are a highly agile team and need a like-minded individual to join us. In return, we offer a fun, collaborative environment, where we celebrate success and support your growth. §    § If you think you have what it takes, then what are you waiting for?  We have partnered with Kin to fill this exciting role. If you are ready to go, apply now with your CV and cover letter telling us why you’d be a great addition to the team. Or, if you have some questions, please contact Tracey Fletcher on tracey.fletcher@kin.co.nz.  We are reviewing applications as we go, so apply now and don’t be left behind!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50739591.txt	§Senior Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Lotto NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Marketing Manager §      §        §Lotto NZ exists to provide safe gaming that allows New Zealanders to play and win while contributing money back to Kiwi communities. Every person who has ever bought a Lotto NZ game has played an important role in helping make good things happen in our communities, with 100% of profits going to over 3,000 groups and organisations around the country every year. With both players and Kiwi communities winning every day, there’s no denying that Lotto NZ has great stories to tell – and that’s where you come in! §        § §        §Leading a small team, this role is fast-paced and dynamic. You will find yourself: §        §          §Leading the delivery of Instant Kiwi’s marketing communications and media strategy to support our iconic Instant Kiwi brand §          §Displaying strong media planning, creative, and analytical skills, and be able to champion all media and communications, use data-informed decisions, and deliver plans through to execution §          §Driving sales performance and profitability for Instant Kiwi through developing and executing marketing strategy and championing responsible gaming and harm minimisation  §          §Reporting to the Head of Instant Category, and supported by the Instant Kiwi Marketing Assistant as a direct report §        §        §  §        § Your skills and experience:§ §        §As an experienced Senior Marketing Manager, you will be passionate about what you do and be proud of it. You will: §        §          §Have strong stakeholder management skills, both internally and externally and at all levels of the business §          §Have an excellent understanding of marketing strategy and proven experience with brand campaigns, above the line media, point of sales (POS) development, and trade marketing plans§          §Effectively manage media campaigns laydowns from beginning to end in a fast-paced and fun environment§          §Have worked closely with internal cross-functional teams to bring ideas to life, and managed agency partners to deliver engaging campaigns to market on time and within budget §          §Be able to analyse data and ROI on sales, margin and media spend, and use findings to influence future decisions §          §Proven ability to lead individuals and group situations, with experience managing a direct report §        §        §  §        §The Right Opportunity for You?§ §        §We believe in teamwork, trust, and being reliable. We want to lead by doing as well as challenging you to grow and evolve. We offer great benefits, a fantastic culture and are somewhere you can continue to learn, develop, innovate, and have fun! §        §  §        §If this sounds like you please apply via SEEK or visit §mylotto.co.nz/careers§ §      §    §    §    §  §§§Lotto NZ exists to provide safe gaming that allows New Zealanders to play and win while contributing money back to Kiwi communities. Every person who has ever bought a Lotto NZ game has played an important role in helping make good things happen in our communities, with 100% of profits going to over 3,000 groups and organisations around the country every year. With both players and Kiwi communities winning every day, there’s no denying that Lotto NZ has great stories to tell – and that’s where you come in! § § § §Leading a small team, this role is fast-paced and dynamic. You will find yourself: § § §Leading the delivery of Instant Kiwi’s marketing communications and media strategy to support our iconic Instant Kiwi brand § §Displaying strong media planning, creative, and analytical skills, and be able to champion all media and communications, use data-informed decisions, and deliver plans through to execution § §Driving sales performance and profitability for Instant Kiwi through developing and executing marketing strategy and championing responsible gaming and harm minimisation  § §Reporting to the Head of Instant Category, and supported by the Instant Kiwi Marketing Assistant as a direct report § §  § § Your skills and experience:§ § §As an experienced Senior Marketing Manager, you will be passionate about what you do and be proud of it. You will: § § §Have strong stakeholder management skills, both internally and externally and at all levels of the business § §Have an excellent understanding of marketing strategy and proven experience with brand campaigns, above the line media, point of sales (POS) development, and trade marketing plans§ §Effectively manage media campaigns laydowns from beginning to end in a fast-paced and fun environment§ §Have worked closely with internal cross-functional teams to bring ideas to life, and managed agency partners to deliver engaging campaigns to market on time and within budget § §Be able to analyse data and ROI on sales, margin and media spend, and use findings to influence future decisions § §Proven ability to lead individuals and group situations, with experience managing a direct report § §  § §The Right Opportunity for You?§ § §We believe in teamwork, trust, and being reliable. We want to lead by doing as well as challenging you to grow and evolve. We offer great benefits, a fantastic culture and are somewhere you can continue to learn, develop, innovate, and have fun! § §  § §If this sounds like you please apply via SEEK or visit §mylotto.co.nz/careers§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing manager?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§§§
