jobText: TXT/50722067.txt	§Digital Content Writer§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Content Writer§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Intro§ §Passionate about a career in Marketing? Are you looking to get your foot in the door and kickstart your marketing career? We are looking for entry-level content writers to join our growing team. § §Our digital content role offers an environment to learn, practice, challenge, and establish a strong foundation that's invaluable in your career. The focus is on supporting our marketing team with more content, more consumer traffic and more revenue. Your efforts directly give to Monster Groups top-line growth – providing you with full training on how to create, develop and maintain high-quality SEO content, to a Senior Content role.§ §Who We Are§ §The Monster Group was launched in 2015 to help consumers save on their energy needs. After a period of rapid growth, we have now diversified into both the Solar and Telco markets, helping households and business save even more! Our organisation has focused on recruiting great minds from around the world to help build our company. Keeping with this strategy, we are now inviting talented individuals to join our growing team.  § §Why the Monster Group§ §1) 100% year on year growth for 3 straight years§ §2) Young innovative company§ §3) Rewards hard work and the want to grow § §About the role § §You will be working in the heart of our marketing team, brainstorming and implementing ideas that attract customer to our ever-growing brand. You will be responsible for creating and managing great content that engages with our market and promotes our panel of suppliers. Data is everything, so you will be analysing traffic numbers and conversions to help the team optimise the success of your content.§ §Requirements§ § §Intelligence, Coachable, Experience, Organised§ §Focused on a long-term marketing career§ §Degree in Marketing§ §You will succeed if § § §A love for marketing and an interest in consumer psychology§ §Organised and process-driven individual§ §Analytical thinking and a love of data is a plus§ §What you get§ § §Personal Development Plan§ §Daily Training and Coaching§ §Great Team Environment§ §Monthly Company Incentives§ §What we value § §At the Monster Group, we go by 11 core values that have steered us to success. Never Stop Learning, Opportunities Are Everywhere, Be Personally Responsible, Customer First, Trust the Process, No "I" in "Monster", Radical Transparency, No Lazy Brain, Speed with Accuracy, Cutting Edge Technology and finally Mahia te Mahi! § §How to Apply § §If some or all of these resonate with your personality, then we want to hear from you! Please apply by clicking the button below.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50753859.txt	§Pouāwhina Whakawhiti (Communications Support/Advisor)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Pouāwhina Whakawhiti (Communications Support/Advisor)§§Advertiser: §Rezource Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Internal Communications§§§§§§Ngāti Tama ki Te Waipounamu Trust based in Nelson represents te uri o Ngāti Tama.  Established to manage and administer the Trust Fund for the benefit of Ngāti Tama ki Te Tauihu, now and into the future.§We are looking for a content savvy Communications Advisor with excellent writing skills and content creation experience to join for a fixed term 12-month period.§Reporting to the Communications Manager, you will support the objectives of our whānau engagement strategy.  Focusing on creating engaging and dynamic content that connects whānau with the Trust and Ngāti Tama ki Te Tauihu stories, history and kōrero.  Your key duties will be to maintain and curate content for our online platforms, including our social media, website and quarterly print pānui.  You will also promote events and support with communications related tasks.§This is a 12-month fixed term role working 20 hours per week based in our Nelson office.  §The Ideal Candidate will have the following:§At least 2 years’ experience in a communications, marketing or content development role. §Experience with social media, websites, and have exemplary written communication skills. §Experience using Adobe Suite, and MS office programmes including PowerPoint is advantageous.§An understanding of Te Reo me ōna Tikanga in principle and practice in relation to your work.§The ability to juggle multiple projects at one time, meet deadlines, and work quickly under pressure when required.§Joining a close knit team you will be encouraged to share your ideas in a supportive, open work environment. All enquiries and applications will be treated in strict confidence.§Applications close: 30th October 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50724504.txt	§Sales & Marketing Administrator (Contract)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sales & Marketing Administrator (Contract)§§Advertiser: §Campfire Digital Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§Commensurate with Experience§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Sales & Marketing Administrator (Contract) §      §        §If you are looking to start a new junior digital marketing job right now, this is your chance!§        § §        §          §Research potential clients§          §Run targeted digital marketing campaigns§          §Report on digital marketing§        §        § §        §ABOUT THE COMPANY §        § §        §This Wellington-based brand has a fantastic reputation for producing high-quality B2B products. A super friendly and happy team, they are well-established, well-funded and growing fast. They are now in the process of ramping up their marketing to attract more customers, and as such, they’re looking for a marketing-savvy individual to come onboard and help them with research, reporting and digital campaigns.§        § §        §ABOUT THE ROLE §        § §        §Working alongside the Marketing Manager, you’ll focus on market research, reporting and digital marketing campaign implementation.§        § §        §Firstly, you will actively scout new, potential clients by researching key market areas. Then you’ll add target companies and contacts into the CRM.§        § §        §Then, you will implement and monitor digital marketing campaigns that target the new contacts. These campaigns could be email marketing, digital content marketing, Google Ads, or Facebook, just depending on what your skillset is.§        § §        §Finally, you’ll report on marketing and sales activity using the CRM system.§        § §        §This role is a 3-month temporary contract, with the possibility of extending to 6 months total, dependent on business needs.§        § §        §SKILLS & EXPERIENCE§        § §        §We’re looking for someone with strong attention to detail, who can research markets and comb through information. jobText: TXT/50749723.txt	§Specialist - Media and Content Design§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Specialist - Media and Content Design§§Advertiser: §Canterbury District Health Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Specialist - Media and Content Design §      §        §          §Be a part of our People and Capability function, delivering innovative learning and change content and initiatives§          §Be a creative, innovative, forward-thinking learning designer who has experience creating behaviour change at scale through utilisation of media and digital content tools§          §Design and develop learning content and initiates to support a high pressure, diverse workforce that is consistently under immense time pressure§          §We are looking for an innovative, creative tāngata to build Canterbury and West Coast DHB's own HR youtube!§        §        §Our Purpose:§ Why we do it§        §When you work with the Canterbury District Health Board, you are part of something very special. We plan, fund and deliver health services to the almost 600,000 people that live in the Canterbury region. Our primary goal is to put people at the heart of everything we do.§        §The Team: §What we do§        §We're looking for a creative, innovative tāngata to join our Talent, Leadership and Capability (TLC) team and the wider People and Capability function. A tāngata who genuinely thrives on developing effective learning and change initiatives to help others, ensuring the content is streamlined, and delivers a memorable message in an easy, effective, simple way. If you get a thrill from working with diverse groups of tāngata who make a valuable difference and always bring your best to whatever you do, then read on.§        §The Role:§ Where you fit in§        §Based in the Learning Design team within TLC, your role will be engaging with our operational leaders to develop our self-service model and build content that brings one of the core components of our People Strategy to life, Everyone is Enabled to Lead. We are looking for tāngata who can turn information into engaging, effective messaging that will enable and empower our tāngata to streamline their HR needs. You'll understand the importance of how change and learning content and initiatives can create positive behaviour change. It is important you are a trusted learning development partner, a champion of diversity, and a co-designer of practical and relevant solutions.§        §Your role will include:§        §          §Commitment to Te Tiriti o Waitangi and implementing protection, participation and partnership into all our change and learning solutions§          §Working with the wider TLC team, and other key internal and external stakeholders on learning approach and design§          §Develop innovative learning and change content and initiatives using a variety of media and design tools and story-telling techniques to effectively deliver key messages§          §Build learning content and solutions that meet target audience needs, focusing on user experience and positive behavioural change§          §Collaborate with our OD Analyst to ensure all change and learning solutions have clear objectives to support measured success§          §Support lifting the capability of the whole learning community of expertise by effectively coaching and mentoring others on various media and creative content tools§        §        §To be successful in this fantastic opportunity you will:§        §          §Have at least one year of experience designing, developing and implementing end to end solutions that resulted in positive behaviour change within a project team environment§          §Be capable of using and integrating leading media and content editing technology to create a seamless user experience through blended learning solutions§          §Be capable of using and integrating media tools (e.g. video, powtoons, squarespace) to create a seamless user experience through blended learning solutions§          §Be able to balance best practice with stakeholder engagement§          §Be able to keep user experience as the non-negotiable in any design§        §        §If you're a positive, action-orientated and passionate about people and want to contribute to a diverse and inclusive working environment, you'll fit right in.§        §Our Culture:§ What matters to us§        §Ko ngā tāngata, te mātua mahi§Putting people at the heart of all we do§        §Health is ultimately all about people. What's important around here is the way we care for and respect others, the responsibility taken for delivering outcomes, and going about our work with integrity.§        §Belonging Here:§ Becoming part of our story§        §Being part of the Canterbury District Health Board, you will enjoy a fantastic benefits scheme, the opportunity for flexible working arrangements and ongoing focus on your career development.§        §If this role has sparked your interest but does not match your skills then please visit our careers website and have a look at our roles that better suit your expertise.§        §If you are interested in this role please apply directly on our career site here. Please note only applications submitted via our career site will be accepted.§        §Contact Tennile Toulson on §tennile.toulson@cdhb.health.nz§ §or §021827174§ for additional information.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Be a part of our People and Capability function, delivering innovative learning and change content and initiatives§Be a creative, innovative, forward-thinking learning designer who has experience creating behaviour change at scale through utilisation of media and digital content tools§Design and develop learning content and initiates to support a high pressure, diverse workforce that is consistently under immense time pressure§We are looking for an innovative, creative tāngata to build Canterbury and West Coast DHB's own HR youtube!§§Our Purpose:§ Why we do it§When you work with the Canterbury District Health Board, you are part of something very special. We plan, fund and deliver health services to the almost 600,000 people that live in the Canterbury region. Our primary goal is to put people at the heart of everything we do.§The Team: §What we do§We're looking for a creative, innovative tāngata to join our Talent, Leadership and Capability (TLC) team and the wider People and Capability function. A tāngata who genuinely thrives on developing effective learning and change initiatives to help others, ensuring the content is streamlined, and delivers a memorable message in an easy, effective, simple way. If you get a thrill from working with diverse groups of tāngata who make a valuable difference and always bring your best to whatever you do, then read on.§The Role:§ Where you fit in§Based in the Learning Design team within TLC, your role will be engaging with our operational leaders to develop our self-service model and build content that brings one of the core components of our People Strategy to life, Everyone is Enabled to Lead. jobText: TXT/50725759.txt	§Marketing & Business Development Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing & Business Development Manager§§Advertiser: §DLA Piper New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§Position:§ Marketing & Business Development Manager§Experience: §Minimum of 10 years marketing & BD experience, with at least 5 years' experience within a professional services environment, including at least 3 years' experience within a legal environment. The addition of communications experience is advantageous. §Team: §Marketing & BD team§Location: §Auckland§  §Looking for change? It’s already happening.§  §The whole legal industry is changing. The old establishment is gone, and there’s a new establishment in town. It’s an exciting and dynamic future, which we at DLA Piper are leading.§  §It’s a new business world, with new client needs. Clients want more than legal advice, they want strategic business advisers that cross borders and geographies. They want global insights with local savvy. And so do we.§  §DLA Piper is a firm built for this rapidly globalising world, and we’re looking for people to join us on this mission. We’re looking for people who see the world differently, who listen and solve problems. Being well read is good, but being able to read the room is great. §  §Why do you want to work with DLA Piper?§  §•    Work with ambitious, skilled and down-to-earth people within a leading global firm§•    Access to a network of skilled specialists and resources across the Globe§•    A diverse workload - strategic involvement in BD and Marketing initiatives as well as responsibility for hands-on delivery of projects§•    A supportive and collaborative environment and a diverse and inclusive culture§  §The opportunity§  §DLA Piper New Zealand was the first global business law firm operating in New Zealand, with offices in the Americas, Europe, the Middle East, Africa and Asia Pacific.  We provide a seamless service, advising international clients doing business in New Zealand and New Zealand organisations doing business elsewhere.§  §Joining DLA Piper New Zealand means you become part of a team that is recognised for its unmatched client service and down-to-earth, pragmatic manner.§  §The role§  §We have an opportunity for an experienced Marketing and BD Manager to join our Auckland office. You will have worked within a legal environment and be able to play an important role, assisting the Head of Marketing and BD to provide senior marketing and BD advisory services, key client account management and brand support.§  §In this role, you will provide business development and advisory services, nationally, to practice groups and assist with executing the team's annual marketing and business development action plans and key practice group projects. §  §You will lead the Key Account programme, in conjunction with the Head of Marketing and BD. You will project manage practice group pitches, firm-wide panel pitches and capability statements. You will also oversee the Legal Directory submissions for the group including Chambers and Legal 500 as well as assist with other award submissions. §  §You will play an important role in building the DLA Piper brand, within the local market, including the firm's media strategy. This means you will have the opportunity to collaborate with others on the execution of strategic events. This opportunity will also allow you to design and deliver business development learning programs to our senior lawyers and partners.§  §This is a broad and varied role giving you the opportunity to get involved across the Firm. If you're looking to broaden your skillset and enjoy a varied workload then this role may be a good match for you. §  §About you§  §As a senior member of the Marketing & BD team, you will have at least 10 years' experience in marketing and BD, ideally with at least three years' experience working in a legal environment. A relevant degree in marketing, communications, BD or law would be advantageous. §  §In addition to having a proven track record in and a passion for marketing and BD, you will also be experienced in project work and bids project management. You will pride yourself on your exceptional stakeholder management, have strong negotiation skills and be able to manage a number of different priorities.§  §Attention to detail, excellent business writing skills and the ability to multi-task is essential.  You'll have an interest in and understand the legal industry. You'll enjoy fostering authentic stakeholder relationships and networking with key people in the legal industry to foster and maintain good working relationships with all stakeholders. This is a small and collaborative team and we require flexibility.§  §The firm§  §We offer an environment where personal leadership is strong and encouragement is the norm. Our supportive Marketing and BD team is solutions focused and driven to provide an outstanding service to the firm and partnership. In return, you will have the opportunity to work alongside great people and be involved in some exciting local and global projects. §  §Keen to find out more?§  §You can learn more about DLA Piper here: https://www.dlapiper.com/en/us/aboutus/§If you think your repertoire of skills, abilities and energy matches this exciting and dynamic career opportunity, we want to hear from you!§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

That combined with the thrill of live harness racing action, makes the organisation truly exciting and unique. §  §About the role:§ § §We require an experienced Events Coordinator to assist with events over our busy Christmas period§ §Key responsibilities of the role are to:§ § §Assist with booking of events to ensure clients understand services/function options offered§ §Co-ordinate client requirements amongst the various departments§ §Manage effective client relationships§ §Supervise event planning and delivery with overall responsibility§ §About you:§  §This is a very close-knit team. You must be flexible with the hours you work as you will need to work varied hours to match operational demands. §  §Prior software experience with Events Management systems such as Ivvy would beneficial.§  §What we offer:§ § §Competitive remuneration package§ §Onsite free car parking§ §Training and personal development opportunities§ §Vibrant, diverse and an inclusive work environment§ §Staff dining discounts§ §If you have the relevant skills and experience, please contact Henna, HR Manager at §Henna.Chugh@alexandrapark.nz§ or apply directly and we will be in touch with you accordingly.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an events coordinator?§Are you available to work on a rotating roster?§§§

jobText: TXT/50731900.txt	§Lead Advisor Communications and Engagement§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lead Advisor Communications and Engagement§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§§§§  §    §Lead Advisor Communications and Engagement §    §      §        §Job Ref: 35253§        §Kaitohutohu Tūhono Mātāmua§        §Fixed term, full time, Wellington §        §          §Support improving outcomes for our tamariki and rangatahi§          §Drive your own work programme §          §Be part of a new organisation, a new team and a new way of operating§        §        §Nau mai, haere mai!  Tirohia tēnei. Welcome! Please check this out.§        §The Independent Children’s Monitor (the Monitor) is a new organisation set up to provide independent oversight across the Oranga Tamariki system*, monitoring those organisations that have custody and care of tamariki (children) and rangatahi (youth) with a focus on supporting improved outcomes for tamariki, rangatahi and their whānau. §        §Our values are Kia Māia – to be Courageous; Kia Pono, Kia Tika – to be Trustworthy; Manaaki – to be Respectful; and Kia Huritao – to be Reflective.  We are looking for people who share these values to join us.   §        §The Kaitohutohu Tūhono Mātāmua /Lead Advisor Communications and Engagement is a stand-alone role and therefore we are looking for someone who is comfortable in both the strategic and tactical space. On a day-to-day basis you will be primarily focussed on implementing and enhancing the communications strategy. You will be actively thinking about ways for the Monitor to build the team culture and be proactive about organising opportunities to do this. §        §Responsibilities will include:§        §          §Managing and enhancing the Monitor’s existing website – experience with Silverstripe or similar, and Google analytics, a real advantage.§          §Drafting the monthly external newsletter – we use MailChimp. §          §Providing editing and formatting support for all external documents, some basic design experience an advantage.§          §Liaising with external printing, graphics and creative providers. §          §Supporting the Monitor’s leadership team with media, key messages, presentations and other communications collateral, including regular internal communications. §          §Building the Monitor’s profile over time.§        §        §We are also looking for someone who has experience with engagement and who is confident to maintain and monitor the national engagement plan. This involves supporting the Leadership team and Operations team with regular engagements with partners and supporting hui and events. § §In this role you will have autonomy, the ability to drive your own work programme and the opportunity to work flexibly in a way that works for you and your other commitments.   §This fixed term role will initially run through to the end of June 2021.  §        §How to Apply§        §Internal MSD Employees§ – please apply through your myHR portal at work. This will ensure that your myHR employee profile is visible as an internal candidate. §        §External applicants§ (including Oranga Tamariki, Ministry for Children employees) – please apply through the apply button and upload your CV and cover letter to our applicant tracking system. §        §Please apply online with your CV and cover letter via the “apply” button. All applications must be made online. If this is not possible or if you have any queries, please contact §jobs@msd.govt.nz§        §Your cover letter will be a key part of our assessment process, so please highlight how your experience and capability relates to the competencies listed in the position description.§        §Application close: Tuesday, 27 October 2020.§        §If you have any questions, please contact §shelley.tyson002@msd.govt.nz§  §        §*The term “Oranga Tamariki system” is used to describe any agency services provided to children and young people under the Oranga Tamariki Act 1989 and includes all agencies that provide services to children in the Oranga Tamariki system, for example health, education and disability services and includes non-government organisations.§        §Joining us§        §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 35253§  §Kaitohutohu Tūhono Mātāmua§  §Fixed term, full time, Wellington § § §Support improving outcomes for our tamariki and rangatahi§ §Drive your own work programme § §Be part of a new organisation, a new team and a new way of operating§ §Nau mai, haere mai!  Tirohia tēnei. jobText: TXT/50749117.txt	§Senior Product Marketing Manager - Music Production§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Product Marketing Manager - Music Production§§Advertiser: §Serato Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Product Management & Development§§§§§§Serato is one of the world leaders in audio software for professional DJs, producers, and musicians.§World-renowned artists such as Fatboy Slim, A-Trak, Snoop Dogg, and DJ Snake love our products and use them on a regular basis.§We are based in central Auckland and are currently looking for someone to join our team in a newly created role of Senior Product Marketing Manager - Music Production.§In this role, you will develop and own the execution of effective marketing strategies for Serato’s world-class music production products - Serato Studio, Serato Sample, and Serato Pitch ‘N Time.§The key areas of focus and responsibilities in this new role are:§Growth§§Implement, manage and lead the execution of an ongoing product marketing strategy to attract new customers and retain existing ones§Work closely with Serato’s digital, creative, product, and web teams to execute go-to-market strategies and plans. §Have a clear understanding of music production revenue targets, then help develop marketing strategies and campaigns to help reach these§Develop and own marketing personas that are created from a deep understanding of the viable customer segments across territories around the world§§Reporting and Analysis§§Compile detailed ad-hoc and monthly reporting on all Serato Studio marketing activity and its effectiveness, with actionable insights for the business§Ongoing assessment of the music production market trends, will a view to defining strategies that ensure our product marketing is best-in-class§§Communication and Content§§Work closely with the Head of Product Marketing, Head of Digital Marketing, and Insights to define all customer segments, then formulate tailored marketing strategies, messaging, and content for the varying audiences.§Lead the development and ongoing optimisation of all communications for our music production products - with a strong emphasis on building and maintaining a rigorous always-on A/B testing plan.§§Management §§Manage and support the Product Marketing Manager - Music Production§Our ideal candidate would have the following essential skills and experience:§§You love music and ideally have a strong knowledge of hip-hop and dance music §Experience with beat making/music production is an advantage§Minimum 5 years of product marketing experience, ideally you have worked for a company with a subscription or recurring revenue-based business model§An analytical mind for measuring results and provide actionable insights/plans§Demonstrate the ability to adapt, lead, and coach others in a fast-paced environment§A clear understanding of UX/CX principals §§Working for Serato§Working in our central Auckland office provides an opportunity to work for a New Zealand company that is very successful in the global market. Our work culture is fun, fast-paced, and encourages a passion for music.§All applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (this means having NZ citizenship, permanent residency, or a current work permit) and be willing to relocate to Auckland.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50726118.txt	§Marketing & Business Development Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing & Business Development Consultant§§Advertiser: §DLA Piper New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Other§§§§§§Position:§ Marketing & Business Development Consultant§  §Experience:§ Minimum of 5 years marketing & communications, with at least 2 years' experience within a professional services environment. Proven track record in business development/marketing environment, including experience in bids project management.§  §Team:§ Marketing & BD team§  §Location:§ Auckland§ §  §Looking for change? It’s already happening.§  §The whole legal industry is changing. The old establishment is gone, and there’s a new establishment in town. It’s an exciting and dynamic future, which we at DLA Piper are leading.§  §It’s a new business world, with new client needs. Clients want more than legal advice, they want strategic business advisers that cross borders and geographies. They want global insights with local savvy. And so do we.§  §DLA Piper is a firm built for this rapidly globalising world, and we’re looking for people to join us on this mission. We’re looking for people who see the world differently, who listen and solve problems. Being well read is good, but being able to read the room is great.§  §Why do you want to work with DLA Piper?§ § §Work with ambitious, skilled and down-to-earth people within a leading global firm§ §Access to a network of skilled specialists and resources across the Globe§ §A diverse workload - providing marketing and business development support, including working on key business development initiatives and on internal and external communications§ §A supportive and collaborative environment and a diverse and inclusive culture§ §The opportunity§  §DLA Piper New Zealand was the first global business law firm operating in New Zealand, with offices in the Americas, Europe, the Middle East, Africa and Asia Pacific.  We provide a seamless service, advising international clients doing business in New Zealand and New Zealand organisations doing business elsewhere.§  §Joining DLA Piper New Zealand means you become part of a team that is recognised for its unmatched client service and down-to-earth, pragmatic manner.§  §The role§  §We have an opportunity for an experienced Marketing and Business Development Consultant to join our Auckland office. You will have worked within a professional services environment, ideally within a legal environment, and have experience providing marketing and BD support. This includes working on key business development initiatives and on internal and external communications.§  §You will play an important role in planning and supporting BD and advisory services, nationally. You will provide regular BD reporting; help deliver bespoke client relationship programmes and assist on pitches and capability statements. You will also assist with preparing the legal directory and league table submissions.§  §You will look to provide support on our client management initiatives, assisting with the preparation for Client Listening meetings and supporting the Key Account Management programme. You will also support the team with learning and development sessions as required.§  §Working on the firm's communications, you will manage our monthly Leadership Update, manage the responsible business communications programme, coordinate all client mailings and plan and manage our social media strategy to amplify our marketing and BD initiatives.§  §This is a broad and varied role giving you the opportunity to get involved across the Firm. If you're looking to broaden your skillset and enjoy a varied workload then this role may be a good match for you.§  §About you§  §As a key member of the Marketing and BD team, you will have at least five years' experience in marketing and BD, ideally with at least two years' experience within a professional services environment. A relevant degree in marketing or communications, would be advantageous.§  §In addition to having experience in and a passion for marketing and BD, you will also be familiar with managing projects and have excellent business writing skills. You will have a strong client service orientation, thrive on delivering results and be able to adapt to changing priorities. You will be a strong team player and enjoy working in a small and collaborative team.§  §Attention to detail, excellent business writing skills and the ability to multi-task is essential. Ideally, you'll have an interest in and understand the legal industry. You'll enjoy fostering authentic stakeholder relationships and networking with key people in the legal industry to foster and maintain good working relationships.§  §The firm§  §We offer an environment where personal leadership is strong and encouragement is the norm. Our supportive Marketing & BD team is solutions focused and driven to provide an outstanding service to the firm and partnership. In return, you will have the opportunity to work alongside great people and be involved in some exciting local and global projects.§  §Keen to find out more?§  §You can learn more about DLA Piper here: https://www.dlapiper.com/en/us/aboutus/§  §If you think your repertoire of skills, abilities and energy matches this exciting and dynamic career opportunity, we want to hear from you!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

We specialise in delivering effective communications to Pacific people via an integrated platform of radio, news, social media, online digital services, events and promotions. We have direct access to Pacific communities and aim to deliver the best Pacific content to our Communities strategically across Entertainment, Lifestyle and News. § §The Role§ §An opportunity has become available for a Videographer and Content Creator. The purpose of this role is to produce and edit high quality digital content that tells concise, visually pleasing stories that best convey PMN messages to its intended audiences.  You will be actively involved in Digital and Content team discussions to ensure a consistent production of high quality and engaging digital content as seen through a Pacific lens.  Graphic Design experience would also be ideal but not essential.  § §The role sits within the digital team and reports to the General Manager of Content.§ §What you would do§ §The main things you would do include:§ § §Responsible for conceptualising, capturing and editing video content suitable for all PMN digital platforms.§ §Prepare creative plans from internal and external creative briefs (ie establish priorities, prepare timelines, draft creative, prepare proof, obtain approvals, monitoring for compliance)§ §Working closely with other Departments to plan and determine filming and editing requirements for the week.  This will also include offsite locations.§ §Monitor compliance of PMN branding§ §Organising footage for storage and editing shoots in a timely manner§ §Preparing content for all PMN platforms. § §Develop and maintain effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders§ §Participate in projects and tasks as required§ §Ensure all content is compliant with NZ Broadcasting Standards Authority, and the NZ Media Council §How can I tell if this is for me?§ If this sounds like you then please apply:§ § §Knowledge and understanding of Pacific communities, cultures, identity and languages.§ §Relevant Bachelors degree in Videography or Filmmaking. Ideal qualifications in graphic design.   § §Media industry experience beneficial§ §Must have experience using Adobe CC, Premiere Pro, After effects, Photoshop, Illustrator, Indesign, Additional Expertise: HTML & OBS Livestreaming. Proficient with Microsoft Office§ §Ability to create original ideas which can be used to develop new or improved processes, systems or products etc.§ §A definite multi tasker who can juggle multiple projects at once§ §A definite team player§ §Able to meet deadlines§ §Current NZ Motor Vehicle Licence §How to Apply§ §Get involved - click the §Apply§ button to submit your application§ § Applications close Friday 30th of October§ § § § § § § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§What's your highest level of education?§§§

We have won numerous awards for our work including 2019 IAB Digital Agency of the Year and Beacons Media Agency of the Year (twice). We strive for doing great work and cultivating a supportive, respectful and fun company culture.§Job Description§Working across key clients in the Auckland Office, this role is a pivotal one within the agency responsible for the delivery of social media ad campaigns on behalf of MBM clients.§This role reports to a Senior Social Manager.§What you will do §Attending client WIPs, briefings and other client meetings and presenting responses to client briefs.§Providing input into social strategy and social implementation campaign development; taking a client or internal brief for social media investment and developing an analytically led recommendation.§Planning and checking master media plans across a portfolio of social brands.§Conducting research to support the creation of social media plans. §Identifying appropriate social and data partners, sites and/or platforms to use.§Loading ad placements into the relevant self-service systems across Facebook, Snapchat, Instagram, YouTube or other platforms as required. Our people are chosen for their personalities, their ethics and professional qualities without any exclusion, preferential treatment or discrimination. We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer and do not discriminate by reason of age, gender, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, nationality, religion or disability or any other difference. jobText: TXT/50746171.txt	§Digital Services Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Services Advisor§§Advertiser: §Upper Hutt City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Permanent | Full time§ §Last year we launched a number of new websites across UHCC - fast-forward to 2020, we are looking for a Digital Services Advisor to help us manage and develop these sites. In this role you’ll plan, design and lead improvements to these platforms so that we continue to offer a great customer experience. You’ll be able to get stuck into providing strategic advice on our digital presence, leading improvements, managing content, training editors and building relationships across the organisation.§ §Key responsibilities in this role include: § § §Plan, design and implement continued improvements to upperhuttcity.com and sub-sites to build our digital footprint and provide a great customer experience.§ §Advise, support and train website editors so our digital environment provides the most effective end-to-end customer experience.§ §Provide strategic advice and support regarding digital services, managing analytics and reporting to ensure we meet organisational priorities.§ §To be considered for this role we are looking for someone with:§ § §Proven experience in leading projects to improve websites.§ §Proven ability to establish strong working relationships.§ §Experience and technical capability with websites. §Familiarity with platforms such as Microsoft SharePoint, OpenCities, SilverStripe and Google suite are preferred.§ §Comfortable preparing data and insights.§ §Strong skills in time management and working independently.§ §We are looking for ~ 5 years’ experience in applying these skills.§ §Working with the Upper Hutt City Council is a rewarding way to support the community, work with a great team, and develop your career. We do more than just pay you a salary, we have a range of great benefits to support you.§ §With 50% of the Wellington regions green space, boutique shopping, award winning Brewtown and quirky cafes all within walking distance, train station close by and free parking, Upper Hutt is a great choice for your next career move.§ §If you would like to be considered for this role then please apply online: www.upperhuttcity.com/careers.  All applications must include a cover letter, CV and a completed online Upper Hutt City Council application form.§ §Applications close 31 October 2020§ §NOTE THAT YOU MUST HAVE THE RIGHT TO WORK IN NEW ZEALAND TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS ROLE.§§§§

jobTitle: Global Lead New Value Opportunities Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50748679.txt	§Global Lead New Value Opportunities§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Global Lead New Value Opportunities§§Advertiser: §Zespri International Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Product Management & Development§§§§§§Zespri is more than simply the world’s single-largest marketer of kiwifruit. We like to think of ourselves as fruit on a mission and as rebels with a cause: to help people, communities and the environment around the world thrive through the goodness of kiwifruit.§ §We supply one of the world’s healthiest little superfruits to millions of people around the world in more than 50 markets. We are one of New Zealand’s best-known international brands, dedicated to creating sustainable long-term value for growers.§ §We are growing quickly, driven by our success in engaging more and more consumers and by offering the world’s best kiwifruit 12 months of the year. We have bold ambitions and aim to grow sales from approximately $3 billion in 2018 to $4.5 billion by 2025.§ § § § §Global Lead New Value Opportunities § This role will be the lighthouse in terms of future portfolio growth opportunities, beyond new cultivars and fresh fruit, which are currently the core business of Zespri. We want to take a broader angle to innovation, including shaping product solutions for new channels and new occasions – through packaging, new product formats, or even new business models.§   § This role is critical to support Zespri’s purpose of creating long term value for growers and shareholders by helping more consumers to healthy and delicious lives.§ § §Responsibilities:  § § §Scoping the opportunity for new value add business opportunities, including new business models and new product formats, in line with the growth strategy§ §Develop new consumer driven concepts in line with the strategic priorities and the portfolio architecture, including consumer validation and road mapping for implementation§ §Piloting new kiwifruit formats as a learning ground for global implementation of new formats business models that will secure value added opportunities for Zespri and its growers§ §Planning the required research and trials in close collaboration with Market Research Manager§ §Develop the supporting business models and respective business cases for implementation of new product innovation§ §Establish a framework and governance to assess co-branding and new product proposals from current and new business partners, and provide guidance to the markets for implementation as required.§ §Liaising with external partners and suppliers in order to develop prototypes and long term partnerships that will support the new concepts and create value added opportunities for Zespri and its growers§ §Lead new packaging development initiatives that are feasible, scalable and will make a positive contribution to achieve the overall Zespri Sustainability commitments (Re-usable, Recyclable or Recycled by 2030), while enhancing the Zespri brand and improve efficiency (incl. but not limited to cost reduction).§ §Lead in market trials for new packaging formats, monitor results and collect the learnings as a way to identify and roll out global best practices to the markets.§ §Continuously developing and enhancing consumer packaging related brand metrics and driving the achievement of these metrics§ §Keeping abreast of trends, technology and other developments in the field of consumer needs, including packaging§ §   § §Qualifications and Experience:§  § § §Tertiary qualifications in business administration, marketing or related fields§ §Over 10 years experience in a formal / disciplined corporate brand marketing environment with relevant experience in consumer products;§ §Innovation management experience, from insight generation to marketing mix development and leading innovation projects§ §Strong Business and financial acumen§ §Experience operating in highly complex, global markets;§ §Strong relationship management and communication skills with stakeholders.§ §Ability to lead and participate in cross functional teams, comprising of both internal and external partners§ §Experience within foods categories is an advantage§ §   § All applications should be submitted by §Friday 30th October 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50735737.txt	§Intermediate Digital Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate Digital Specialist§§Advertiser: §Digital EQ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§We have a position available for a talented, driven, and experienced Digital Specialist to join our team at Digital EQ.  Must be a New Zealand resident or have a working visa.§  §You’ll be responsible for providing ongoing advice and leading the implementation of hand-crafted digital growth strategies for our clients, including customer journey mapping, digital advertising, conversion rate optimisation, email marketing, analytics -  plus everything in between.  You will also be responsible for honing your existing digital expertise in one particular field and lead upskilling and development in that area for our team. §  §We are driven to be the best boutique growth consultancy for fashion, lifestyle + beauty consumer brands. With a range of clients both in size and field, each day at work is different and requires brand-led innovative thinking. From client management and ad-hoc growth advice to implementing and monitoring campaigns on a variety of digital platforms; to join our team you'll need to be a nimble, flexible, no-fuss, subject matter expert.  As we are a small team, you’ll be expected to step up and help out when and where required across all things digital. §  §We want high energy, motivated, forward-thinkers to join our team. The role is very autonomous, and there’s potential to grow. Our office vibe is pretty chilled, and a collaborative working environment is super important to us. We work hard and expect our team to go over and above, but also enjoy flexible hours, work from home days, team lunches and Friday beers. §  §Based in our Auckland Office.§  §Your direct responsibilities will include: § § §Complete audits of the entire digital landscape of a client and how they interact with their customers to identify opportunities for growth and improvement. Including but not limited to looking at E-Commerce stores, email, press, social media, organic search ranking, user experience, advertising. § §Plan, implement and maintain advertising campaigns across various digital channels.§ §Plan, implement and maintain email automation and marketing campaigns.§ §Analyse and report on the performance of e-commerce stores and relevant digital channels. Use this data to guide decisions and recommendations for optimisation, budgets, streamlining processes and generating creative ideas.§ §Core responsibility for oversight and continued development of at least one area of expertise delivered to clients - e.g. Social media advertising, conversion rate optimisation, Google Search and/or Display advertising, Data Studio. § §Liaising with clients, internal team and external partners. § §Keeping up to date with new developments in the digital world, particularly those with potential for luxury consumer brands. § §Essential skills & expertise required for this role:§ § §Minimum of 3 years experience in an agency or marketing team role, managing brand growth, advertising across social media, Google and other digital platforms, email marketing and digital strategy. § §Experience in planning and executing multi-channel campaigns. § §Creative flair and interest in consumer brands.§ §Highly competent in either Facebook and/or Google Ads media buying for conversion performance and brand awareness.§ §Experience in client management and relationship building. Experience in pitching and driving new business is advantageous.§ §Strong technical knowledge of Ads Manager, Data Studio, Klaviyo, Shopify, Google Analytics & Tag Manager.§ §A data-driven approach. § §Knowledge of other digital marketing platforms and website development is a bonus! §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Which of the following online advertising methods do you have experience with?§How many years' experience do you have in social media marketing?§Do you have FMCG marketing experience?§Have you worked in a role where you were responsible for brand planning?§§§

This role is responsible for integrated marketing plans, excellent execution across multiple channels, measurement of marketing effectiveness and agency management.  The plans will balance traditional media with digital, direct and social media as appropriate and will champion the appropriate marketing technology within the business, such as data management systems and marketing automation. This team works closely with Customer Insight, Product Management, Business Marketing, Media & Internal Communications, therefore a natural approach to integrated and collaborative working is essential. §        §As the ideal candidate for this role you will be able to identify the following types of career achievements so far:§        §          §10 years experience leading a marketing team with significant experience building high performing teams and building capability through coaching and development§          §Experience or exposure to leading a team of in-house creative and content generation§          §Strong working knowledge of best practice marketing communications and agency management with proven success in delivering value§          §Demonstrated experience acting as strategic thought partner to senior leaders and teams§          §A collaborative, proactive and engaging style to enable you to work alongside a wide range of stakeholders across the business§        §        §This is a great time to be part of our organisation. Appointees will be subject to a security check.§        § §      §      §      §      §jobs.nzpost.co.nz§    §    §  §§§As our much loved current Head of Marketing Communications heads away on maternity leave towards the end of this year we are starting to search to find an experienced Mar Comms expert to continue her great work, on a one year fixed term contract or secondment. §The needs of our customers are ever-changing and happening faster every day - our team needs to be one step ahead of these changes and act quickly, knowing exactly how the network is performing and able to deliver for our customers. §Reporting to our GM Consumer, Marketing & Brand this is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced marketing communications senior leader, with demonstrated success gained within a services organisation such as telecommunications, energy, airlines, banking or insurance. jobText: TXT/50758807.txt	§Marketing Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Assistant§§Advertiser: §Spida Machinery§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§Marketing Assistant                §                                                §Unique and exciting career opportunity in marketing§Established and successful business§Full time position§ §With over 100 employees and offices spread across New Zealand, Australia and the USA, Spida Machinery is a leader and specialist in the manufacture of high quality, precision machinery for the timber wall, floor and roof prefabricated building industry.  § §Spida Machinery is a success story, which owes its existence to a loyal and dedicated staff and a wealth of experience, built over many decades.  Spida’s success has been driven by a strong commitment to “bringing innovation, fresh ideas and new concepts to deliver the best product!” § §We are seeking to appoint an experienced Marketing Assistant, reporting to the Sales and Marketing Manager.  We are located in the fabulous Bay of Plenty with our office and manufacturing facility in Tauranga. This is a wonderful role for the right person, with a willingness to liaise with external suppliers as well as interact with our offices globally as required.  You will need broad skills and experience in marketing; not just digital and/or social media.§ §You will be asked to participate in the development and maintaining of:§ §Management of marketing collateral including branding, literature, online and social media presence§Researching the market environment, competition, and performing market analysis§Creating business documents; content creation and publication §Communicating new product/service developments to current and prospective customers§Coordinating attendance and representation at Trade Shows and Exhibitions§Compiling and maintaining contact lists and building relationships with prospective clients to identify potential opportunities§Managing and updating the website and social channels such as Linkedin§Managing advertising program, including editorial opportunities§Co-ordinate video production§Managing and co-ordinating internal and external events§ The ideal candidate would have:§Minimum 5 years’ experience in a similar marketing administration role§Tertiary qualifications in Marketing or a related subject§Strong written and verbal communication skills§A creative, practical and ‘hands on’ approach§Ability to gather and analyse data and produce reports§Good organisational and time management skills§Strong IT skills§Attention to detail§Excellent team working skills § §A competitive remuneration package will be on offer in line with the skills and experience brought to this role.  To apply, please submit a Cover Letter telling us why we need you and how your qualifications and experience suit this role along with your CV.  Send your letter & CV to: §wendy@spida.com§Only those allowed to live and work in New Zealand should apply.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing assistant?§Do you have customer service experience?§Have you worked in a role where your duties included proof reading and sub-editing?§§§

Encouraging career development, this role has arisen due to a promotion. With sizeable budgets, and an extremely busy marketing calendar spanning the full marketing mix and a highly competitive market, they are lively, enthusiastic, and wanting to continue elevating the brand. Proactive and dynamic, they are seeking an equally motivated and energetic marketing manager who can shape and redefine the future of this well-known brand.§ § §Position§        §As Marketing Manager, you would be responsible for successfully managing the annual calendar of activity. Reporting to the NZ Marketing Director and collaborating with the wider marketing team, this role involves all aspects of marketing blends – a experienced generalist looking for their next challenge.  You have scope to deliver exceptional work making a huge impact on your brands market presence. A sale, results focused and fast paced environment, you will be adept with numbers for forecasting, market analysis, reporting on trends and tracking sales; speed to market and taking calculated risks is what is important§   § §Person§        §You are sharp, commercially savvy, at the top of your game and are excited by the opportunity to build a new world. You have very strong communication skills at all levels and styles, as well as being able to skillfully navigate all channels - You will understand brand architecture and be experienced managing ATL campaigns, budgets, and multiple agency relationships. Adaptability to change, ability to work autonomously and make decisions based on sound commercial judgement is critical. Your experience is likely to be from either retail or FMCG marketing as you will have learnt the importance of speed, innovation and keeping things fresh in a competitive market. §    §Career Opportunity§ As a broadly skilled marketer, with a talent for creative thinking and strong communications, this position will allow you to join a fresh thinking team. Be part of a business that is customer and outcome focused, vibrant and collaborative, and encouraging you to make your mark using your expertise.§ §To apply send your application directly to us, via the application link.§   § §Your application may be discussed with our client unless otherwise requested.§ § § § Applicants should be in New Zealand and hold a current work visa / residency or NZ citizenship.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Make an impact creating engaging content and contributing to the ongoing success of well-loved businesses§ §Overview§ §With a portfolio of globally recognised brands, this organisation is a leader in their industry and a New Zealand success story. Encouraging career development, this role has arisen due to a promotion. With sizeable budgets, and an extremely busy marketing calendar spanning the full marketing mix and a highly competitive market, they are lively, enthusiastic, and wanting to continue elevating the brand. Proactive and dynamic, they are seeking an equally motivated and energetic marketing manager who can shape and redefine the future of this well-known brand.§ § §Position§ §As Marketing Manager, you would be responsible for successfully managing the annual calendar of activity. Reporting to the NZ Marketing Director and collaborating with the wider marketing team, this role involves all aspects of marketing blends – a experienced generalist looking for their next challenge.  You have scope to deliver exceptional work making a huge impact on your brands market presence. A sale, results focused and fast paced environment, you will be adept with numbers for forecasting, market analysis, reporting on trends and tracking sales; speed to market and taking calculated risks is what is important§   § §Person§ §You are sharp, commercially savvy, at the top of your game and are excited by the opportunity to build a new world. You have very strong communication skills at all levels and styles, as well as being able to skillfully navigate all channels - You will understand brand architecture and be experienced managing ATL campaigns, budgets, and multiple agency relationships. Adaptability to change, ability to work autonomously and make decisions based on sound commercial judgement is critical. Your experience is likely to be from either retail or FMCG marketing as you will have learnt the importance of speed, innovation and keeping things fresh in a competitive market. §    §Career Opportunity§ As a broadly skilled marketer, with a talent for creative thinking and strong communications, this position will allow you to join a fresh thinking team. Be part of a business that is customer and outcome focused, vibrant and collaborative, and encouraging you to make your mark using your expertise.§ §To apply send your application directly to us, via the application link.§   § §Your application may be discussed with our client unless otherwise requested.§ § § § Applicants should be in New Zealand and hold a current work visa / residency or NZ citizenship.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing manager?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Advisor - Engagement - Regional (Christchurch) Job in Canterbury - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50757219.txt	§Senior Advisor - Engagement - Regional (Christchurch)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Advisor - Engagement - Regional (Christchurch)§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Internal Communications§§§§§§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa, and welcome.§Fixed-term - full-time - two years§Provide school property engagement support on school major redevelopments and new school builds§Broad communication and engagement role§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§About us§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, the largest payroll in the country, and transportation of over 100,000 students to and from school each day.§Our vision for school property is that all schools have quality learning environments as part of a well-managed and sustainable portfolio that helps deliver equitable and excellent outcomes for every child.§About the role§You will provide school property, project-specific, external and internal engagement support on all school major redevelopments and new school builds in your region.§This will be done through development of stakeholder engagement plans, talking points for school visits/community huis, support on media enquiries, proactive story/event opportunities, creating content for school websites and reviewing correspondence to schools and stakeholders.§This an exciting new role for the right person to grow and define to increase engagement support to our frontline staff and to contribute to the shaping of an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§You will report to the Team Leader - Service Support and will also be supported by a regionally based Lead Advisor - Engagement. The successful applicant must be able to confidently contribute to the driving forward of the EIS engagement and communications strategy.§This regional role covers the South Island.§Please note there is more information in the job description attached.§About you§We are looking for an experienced Senior Engagement Advisor with significant corporate communications experience covering internal and external engagement advice and implementation support. You will be adept at managing stakeholder risks, issues and opportunities, and contributing to the development and implementation of plans to ensure risks are mitigated. Please note that some travel will be required.§You will also offer: §strong writer and proof-reading skills§experience working with the media§ability to spot good news stories and share them through the media and other communication channels§ability to build trust and confidence quickly§be able to think on your feet and react§a strong risk radar§the desire to be part of the delivery of quality learning environments for tomorrow's learners.§If you'd like to bring your skills to a challenging but rewarding role within an organisation that's continuously reaching goals and striving for a better future for New Zealand, we'd love to hear from you.§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§Please review the job description and if this opportunity interests you, and you meet the requirements, apply now using the 'apply online' button. §For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at §eis.recruitment@education.govt.nz§§ Applications close midnight - Thursday, 29 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

§Marketing Communications§§§§§§About the Role§The Communications and Events Coordinator is responsible for communication with PBT stakeholders and overseeing all aspects of event planning and management, including events internal to PBT clients and external events designed to reach the greater Pacific business community.§The position is responsible for the following:§Create content in support of PBT’s communication strategy.§Adhere to the organisation’s style guide, ensuring all copy is of high quality and error free.§Work with key stakeholders to brainstorm content ideas in line with the communication strategy and in support of brand initiatives.§Support and evaluate results of communication campaigns.§Responsible for managing social media channels.§Arrange and coordinate press conferences and other events.§Identifying the requirements and budget for each event in collaboration with PBT management, employees and other key stakeholders as required.§Research venues and vendors that fit the occasion and are within budget.§Managing all event set-up, tear down and follow up processes.§The Events Coordinator is also expected to assist the Marketing and Communications Manager in performing their duties.§You will ideally have:§A tertiary degree in Communications or other relevant field.§2+ years of experience in a similar position.§Experience and knowledge in copywriting, proofreading and editing.§Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills.§Outstanding organisational and time-management skills.§Experience in web design and content production.§Solid understanding of project management principles.§Working knowledge of MS Office; photo and video-editing software.§Outstanding organisational and planning abilities.§Work well under pressure and can meet tight deadlines.§Self-motivated, team player with a flexible mind set.§Pacific Business Trust – Who we are and what we do§The Pacific Business Trust is the Pacific Economic Development Agency of New Zealand. Its focus is on growing innovation, talent and leadership through bespoke and responsible business programmes, and to provide business grants that grow Pacific business.§PBT’s purpose is to be a navigator and leader in supporting Pasifika people to thrive in business and employment through the provision of support and resources to Pacific people, communities, and businesses. We aim to improve the capability and prosperity of Pacific business as well as fuel its growth.§PBT works to generate holistic wealth in its role as a trusted partner in Pacific communities. By helping to capture and nurture the Pacific competitive advantage, we can enable businesses to adapt and thrive with increased ability and resilience. §PBT has recently undergone a business transformation enabling a new customer-centric service model to address the key challenges impacting Pasifika. This has resulted in a refreshed programme of service offerings and approach which is now being scaled across New Zealand.§For more information please see: www.pacificbusiness.co.nz §How to apply:§Please ‘apply now’ and send your CV along with a cover letter letting us know why you'd be great for the role.§All candidates that apply must hold the right to work in New Zealand. §Applications close Monday 2 November.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§What's your highest level of education?§§§

We have high value, long-term, relationships with our customers based around our intellectual property in content and systems, and our services to tailor content to their local context whilst also facilitating high levels of collaboration between customers.§  §In recent years, our focus has been exclusively on enhancing our services and supporting the success of our customers. We are proud of the fact that the work we do in Christchurch has a positive impact on the health and wellbeing of the 30 million people under the care of our customers.§  §We are now turning our minds to doubling the size of our business over the next five years. This will require us to be better at:§ § §telling our customer success stories§ §improving our online presence and positioning § §packaging and promoting new offerings§ §planning and running targeted campaigns§ §supporting a team of highly respected senior executives who’ve been recruited to engage with some of the largest health and social care agencies in our chosen markets.§ §To that end we are creating a new role, Marketing Services Manager, reporting to the Growth Strategy and Planning Manager, Community Growth.§  §About the role§ §This role will support the Community Growth team to plan and deliver all elements of the marketing mix, by: § § §Contributing to marketing strategy and all elements of the marketing mix.§ §Planning and supporting effective use and maintenance by the Community Growth team of our prospect tracking and reporting tool, and planning and managing multi-channel campaigns.§ §Planning and executing targeted awareness raising and lead generation campaigns.§ §Improving and maintaining a web presence to support our market positioning goals and Community Growth.§ §Developing templated business cases and pricing tools for use by the Community Growth team to, in turn, support prospective customers with their decision-making processes.§ §Contributing to specific customer proposals.§ §Developing and maintaining a suite of marketing resources that can be consumed by prospects and used by the Community Growth team.§ §You will be strongly supported by our executive team, in full appreciation that this role will carve out new space in the mindset and operation of our business. §  §To be successful in this role§  §We think the role will suit someone who has:§ § §a degree in marketing, product management, communications, public relations, business administration, or equivalent experience, and § §at least five years’ experience in planning and delivering marketing services in a professional services and/or social care environment.§ §You’ll need proven experience and success in:§ § §leading marketing projects from conceptualisation to delivery of project objectives. § §developing and delivering marketing plans and campaigns.§ §applying systematic approaches to planning, executing, reporting on, and reviewing marketing initiatives.§ §using CRM solutions and marketing automation to report on lead scoring, ROI, leading volume trends, and forecasting.§ §Knowledge of the healthcare sector would be an advantage.§  §Why Streamliners?§ § §We are respectful of the expertise, passions, needs, and priorities of the people (colleagues and customers) we work with.§ §We are confident in our expertise and the high standards we apply to our products and services.§ §We influence and meet expectations of customers through effective communication, partnership, and delivering value-for-money services.§ §We foster performance development of our staff by supporting their: § §Purpose (knowing your work makes the world a better place)§ §Mastery (working with confidence and skill)§ §Autonomy (influencing your own direction of travel)§ § § §Applicants must be Christchurch based, possess the right to work in New Zealand, and be a current resident.§  §For a copy of the position description, email §nick.burns@healthpathwayscommunity.org§  §Applications close on Friday, 30 October 2020.§§§§
