jobText: TXT/50764752.txt	§Digital Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Canterbury of New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Salary§§Competitive salary, buying benefits and more§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§About Us§ §Canterbury of New Zealand was established back in 1904 when John Lane, Pringle Walker and Alfred Rudkin began producing woollen garments deep in the Canterbury Province of New Zealand.  Before long, they were making uniforms for the army during the First World War, and they earned themselves a reputation for manufacturing tough, durable kit.  So much so, the legendary All Blacks rugby team approached them to produce rugby attire in which they could play. § §The rest as they say is history; Canterbury of New Zealand outfitted the All Blacks team for over 75 years and is now the largest dedicated rugby brand in the world.  Canterbury currently supplies kit to numerous high-profile national teams; England Rugby, Ireland Rugby, British & Irish Lions, Australian Rugby league as well as leading clubs such as NZ Vodafone Warriors, NSW State of Origin, Leinster and Bath Rugby including a number of NPC sides.§ §About the Role§ §Our lovely Digital Marketing Manager is heading off on maternity leave in late January, so we have the need to fill her shoes with a passionate consumer-centric growth digital marketer to temporarily join the business.§ §As Digital Marketing Manager you will be responsible for implementing the regional digital marketing strategy in line with the annual brand plan  and responsible for the ANZ online eCommerce channels to forecast, merchandise, optimise and deliver annual revenue targets.  § §With an extensive job description this role will see you responsible for§ § §Translate Marketing “jobs to be done” to campaigns and conversion led objectives§ §Drive and deliver day to day ANZ eCommerce business delivering a best in class shopper experience ensuring regular reviews are carried out on accessibility, performance, capabilities and branding updates§ §Brief and manage external digital performance agencies.§ §Own and manage campaign assets for online platforms including product imagery and product copy for new product launches.§ §Define audience segments, channel and content testing roadmap and feed into broader media and comms brand briefs that are led by the brand team.§ §Strategize and implement “Always On” across multiple digital and social platforms§ §Undertake analysis and provide performance reports & insights across eCommerce & Marketing activities covering campaign effectiveness & performance.§ §Manage external agency partners to engage consumers and set KPI’s across all digital channels developing strategies for increasing traffic and sales through email, affiliates, PPC, SEO and online advertising.§ §Ensure data and insight is used effectively to maximize sales and marketing performance. Primarily focusing on email segmentation marketing activity to engage consumers and increase the size/quality of the database and average order value.§ §Support the Teamwear channel with the new DYO platform, ensuring optimum traffic, SEM, SEO, email marketing to continuously promote the platform. Analyse traffic and performance and recommend tactics for continuous improvement.§ §Responsible for signing off on any DYO platform enhancements keeping optimum performance and high user experience in mind.§ §Lead communications and creative development for assets ensuring they are on brand, adhere to current marketing campaigns.§ §Building annual digital budgets, tracking spend, monthly reconciliation for both digital marketing and performance spend.§ §Execute the digital brand roadmap and communicate the digital marketing calendar, ensuring campaign activity is delivered on time and on budget. Ensure evaluations are done and deployed to the broader business.§ §Combine marketing, customer and sales data to give regular recommendations to the business for a best in class omni channel experience to drive brand growth.§ §Digital expert for the whole business and ability to work across and support multiple channels – D2C, Teamwear and Wholesale.§ §Work with the marketing and commercial teams to align promotional activity and key marketing events.§ §Manage external social media agency to ensure the content strategy pillars are being delivered on, artwork and messaging is consistent and on brand and KPIS are being met.§ §Regular cross functional communications with commercial, finance, operations, merchandising, warehouse, and customer service teams to ensure the purchasing process is seamless and delivering the brand experience throughout the customer journey.§ §Leadership responsibility with one direct report§ §As a §fixed term contract§ to cover maternity leave, we require a start date of early §January 2021§ to complete handover & training with the contract running through to §November 2021§. § §About You§ §You will need the following essential skills§ § §Enjoys working in a fast-paced environment§ §Strategic and forward thinking, pioneering and proactive to enhance consumer experience§ §Experience working within a successful and fast-moving ecommerce platform.§ §Understanding of the full marketing mix and key metrics used.§ §Experienced in executing digital brand strategies§ §Demonstrated experience in successfully delivering brand strategies in the Digital Marketing space§ §Minimum of 5 years’ experience within the ecommerce trading and digital marketing industry§ §Understands commerce platforms & technologies with experience using CRM/CMS§ §Excellent organisational and prioritisation skills§ §A motivated team player with excellent communication and time management skills§ §Passionate about consumers, brand digital marketing and eCommerce§ §High commercial acumen§ § § § § § § §What’s on Offer§ § § §We offer a competitive salary and a range of employee benefits including clothing allowance, discounted purchasing for Canterbury and other group brands and the odd game day ticket.§ § § §With the team spread across Australia and New Zealand we are a happy bunch of sports and apparel enthusiasts -although you don’t have to be either to fit in as we will make everyone welcome.§ § § §How to apply§ § § §Please apply via Seek with your current CV.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a digital marketing manager?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50757260.txt	§Marketing Officer - China market§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Officer - China market§§Advertiser: §NEW ZEALAND LANGUAGE CENTRES LIMITED§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§Marketing Officer §  § §  §Reference #MO1020§  § §  §The Company§ §Our mission is to provide industry-leading English education that enriches lives and creates pathways to new opportunities in New Zealand and beyond.§  §With three campuses across Auckland and Wellington, NZLC is one of New Zealand's largest English language schools for international students and a four-time STM Star award winner in the category "Best English Language School – Southern Hemisphere".§  §We are an international team and have a diverse student mix from all over Latin America, Europe, and Asia.§  §Our company’s core values are:§  §We are open - §We value new ideas, welcome feedback, and embrace change.§  §We care - §We are ready to help and we take pride in everything we do.§  §We empower people - §We inspire each other to grow.§  §We are a community - §We respect diversity and we work together to create a positive local and global impact.§  § §  §Do these values resonate with you? If so, please read on!§  § §  §The Location§You will be based at our Auckland campus, located just steps from the Viaduct Harbour in the Auckland CBD. The school is easily reachable by public transport and lets you enjoy this vibrant area and its great views during your lunch break or after-work drinks.§  § §  §The position§We currently have an opening within our marketing department for a highly motivated individual with a strong sense of ownership and drive to succeed.§  §This is a 4 month fixed term position working flexi hours. (On average 20 hours per week, but let us know what you have in mind!).§  §You will be looking after our Chinese market, communicating with our overseas agents as well as students directly - so fluency in both English and Chinese (written and spoken) is essential! §  §As someone who prides themselves in delivering excellent customer service, student and client satisfaction will be your highest priority. This will be achieved through your outstanding administration, organisational and people skills. §  § §  §Required§ § §Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a related field such as business and education§ §Minimum two-year’s work experience in a similar role (marketing/sales/student services)§ §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§ §Fluency in English and Chinese (written and spoken)§ §Customer service perfection§ §Excel skills a must§ §Ability to adapt in a fast-paced environment§ §Attention to detail and highly organised§ §Creative problem solving§ §Positive, can-do attitude§ § §  §Desired§ § §First-hand experience with other cultures or study abroad§ §Sales experience§ §Experience with online communication platforms (e.g. WeChat)§ §Experience with database systems§ §Social media marketing skills§ §Fluency in additional languages an asset§ §Knowledge of The NZQA Code of Practice for the pastoral care of international students§ § §  §You must have the right to work in New Zealand to apply for this position.§  §Please email your CV and cover letter to §hr@nzlc.ac.nz§ explaining why you are a good fit for the role. Please include your name and job reference number in the subject line.§  §Due to the high volume of applications we receive, only short listed applicants will be contacted. The position will be advertised until filled.  §  § §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Do you have customer service experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50771551.txt	§Marketing Assistant Graduate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Assistant Graduate§§Advertiser: §Auckland Eye Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§ §A perfect job for a well-rounded marketing or communications graduate§ §B2B and B2C campaigns§ §Highly experienced and energetic manager to mentor you§ §Digital, including social media, and traditional channels§ §Complexity and variety§ §Innovation and problem solving§ §About the role:§ §Working in a small, busy team, you’ll be amazed at what you can achieve and learn in this role. Not only is the industry complex, but so is the business and there will be lots of variety in your job. You will be the primary ‘owner’ of the digital communications, including social media, and also support our very knowledgeable Business Development and Marketing Manager with all aspects of a diverse, results driven marketing plan. As you develop, you will refine your skills on y our own projects in a company that thrives on change and growth and a team that is confident to ask the hard questions and be accountable.§ §About you: § §You’ll need great people skills - that’s essential and of course - you will be genuinely passionate about service and professionalism. Digital talent is a ‘must have’ as well as perfect written and verbal English.  We know that as a Grad, you might not have a lot of work experience, but we want to understand how you have used your skills in planning and measuring campaigns, innovation, drive and problem solving.§ §This job will need someone with drive and energy to match the rest of the team and you’ll need to be willing to give things a go and learn on the job. You’ll get fantastic mentoring from your manager, so be prepared to learn as much if not more than you did at University!§ §About Auckland Eye Limited:§ §We are a growing private Ophthalmology practice, with 16 specialists.  Our primary clinic and day stay facility is located in Remuera.  We also have two additional hubs in New Lynn and Takapuna.§ §Our core values of Empathy, Integrity, Partnership and Expertise weave through all that we do and help us deliver outstanding, life changing results for our patients. We have great plans for growth and leading our industry into the future, so we’re passionate about continued development and knowledge sharing as well as leading the way in our industry.§ §The team is warm, passionate, hardworking. We’re nice people doing a job we love in an industry we really care about and it doesn’t get much better than that!§ §Apply now! § §Roles like this don’t come along very often, so make sure you let us know if you’re interested.  Send us your CV and cover letter - we’re keen to hear from you.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

You will be an energetic, self-motivated and highly efficient Specialist whose key responsibility is to support our busy and growing team.  § § § §Here’s why our people work for oOh!§ § §We’re creative, innovative and love to challenge the status quo§ §The culture is second to none§ §We’re about acceptance and support – you can always bring your full self to work§ §We’re flexible and appreciate a balance in life§ §We focus on growth. Growth of our business and growth of our people§ § § §Here’s what you’ll do…§ § §Support Head of Marketing in delivering trade marketing and community support activity§ §Support HoM in Public Relations activity for NZ including briefing and liaison with internal and external stakeholders§ §Manage and maintain website, as well as other digital channels (including social media, SEO and SEM where applicable)§ §Manage Marketing budget, invoicing and reporting on behalf of the Marketing Leadership team § §Event management and activation of our trade partnerships and client hosting events§ §Liaison with teams – both trans-Tasman and other NZ locations and functions§ §Proof of Posting where required§ § § §This is what you’ll look like…§ § §Demonstrated 4+ years’ experience in a similar role§ §Brilliant communication skills – both verbal and written§ §Proven time and project management skills and a demonstrated ability to effectively manage multiple tasks  § §Demonstrated event management and planning skills§ §Process & efficiency focused with exceptional attention to detail § §Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (Advanced) § §Ideally experienced in Adobe Creative Cloud – Photoshop, InDesign§ §Experience using CRM software – Marketo or equivalent§ §Ability to constantly improve and optimise existing processes § §Marketing or Communications qualification and experience§ §Highly organised § § § §If you’re curious, brave, and ready to leap into a career like no other, we’re ready to open our doors to you.§ §If this isn’t the right role for you, we’d also love for you to be part of our Talent Community so you can be the first in line to be considered when a new opportunity comes up!§§§§

We do this by combining our legal automation software with our world-class training programmes. We are the only company offering this combination of technology and training to law firms.§  §Our customer base and the popularity of our training programmes is growing fast (we have grown to 220+ law firm customers in 3 years) and we need a superstar Marketing Manager to help us take Automio to the World.§  §What We Believe In:§ § §Radical Personal Responsibility§: We take responsibility for our own lives and look within. We don’t blame others for things not going our way.§ §Customer Success is Paramount§: We are 100% committed to serving our customers to the highest level in a scalable way to get them results.§ §If It’s Not Fun We’re Not Doing It§: We work hard and we play hard and we share a lot of laughs along the way. If you’re not having fun, what is the point?§ §Werrrking To Our Strengths§: Every day we work in our strengths, have fun and get paid for it!§ §Doing Epic Stuff:§ We do things at work and in life that push us outside our comfort zone. We are rebels and risk takers!§ §Being Resourceful§: We are a team of doers and we ALWAYS find a way.§ §Constant Improvement§: We are committed to growth. We actively look for ways to improve what we do and then implement them.§ §High Standards§: Attention to detail is EVERYTHING - to ensure we are always putting the best software, education and content out into the world.§ §Position§  §Position§: Marketing Manager§  §Team§: Marketing Team§  §Reports to§: Chief Operating Officer§  §Role:§  §In this position you will manage our marketing initiatives. You will plan our marketing activities and create transparency and efficiency in marketing processes like our social media, events, Instagram, FB clients, metrics, podcasts, content creation and more, as well as developing and implementing new marketing processes.§  §Responsibilities:§ § § §Ensuring the marketing team is working towards the same goals promoting the mission and values of Automio — while also exceeding marketing targets.§  § § §Creating marketing and content plans and content calendars that support the strategy of the business.§  § § §Research, development and testing of new marketing channels and locations.§  § § §Writing copy for blogs, video scripts, lead magnets, landing pages, the website, social media posts and webinars in the voice of our CEO (which may include working with copywriting contractors).§  § § §Posting to social channels, including Instagram (feed and stories), Facebook (business page and multiple private groups), LinkedIn, and Twitter. §  § § §Scheduling posts and selecting images to go with them.§  § § §Creating IG stories from storyboards.§  § § §Tracking metrics: social channel follows/likes, newsletter open rates, conversion metrics of newsletters, tracking customer journey/conversions, etc.§  § § §Sending out tests of and scheduling: newsletters, blog posts, and marketing emails.§  § § §Creating and organising brand and marketing assets.§  § § §Handling communication in our free Facebook communities.§  § § §Building landing pages, email marketing funnels, live and automated webinars and other marketing assets in accordance with our specific strategies.§  § § §Coordinating with our team of marketing contractors (podcast, FB ad, graphic design, etc) to ensure all parties have the information and assets they need to execute our marketing strategies.§  § § §Completing service tasks for key clients.§  § §Personal qualities§ § § §Proactive and always looking for marketing strategies that can be created or improved.§  § § §Delivers well ahead of deadlines. §  § § §Enjoys researching and understanding our unique position in the market. §  § § §Seeks out information about our target market by reading what’s current in the industry. §  § § §Proactively studies online marketing strategies and keeps up with the shifts in this space.§  § § §Displays a positive attitude, and is open to feedback and suggestions. §  § § §Pivots quickly and is communicative of any hold ups or roadblocks in projects. §  § § §Can handle blunt and direct feedback.§  § §Requirements §  §As we’re looking for an ideal fit, our new Marketing Manager will have:§ § § §Excellent marketing data analysis skills.§  § § §Excellent communication skills (written and verbal). §  § § §Excellent organisational, planning and delegation skills, and the ability to prioritise workload. §  § § §Awesome copywriting skills.§  § § §Critical thinking, analytical, & problem solving skills. §  § § §Tech skills: Canva, Zapier, Squarespace, Wordpress, Instagram stories, Zoom, LinkedIn Ads, Mailchimp, Thinkific, LeadPages, Vimeo, Google documents, Facebook Ads Manager, Trello, Hubspot, Slack.§  § § §Ability to work in a fast paced environment. §  § § §Ability to prioritise multiple projects under pressure. §  § § §Ability to work on multiple projects at any one time. §  § § §Willingness to work a flexible schedule. §  § § §Ability to operate in a fast moving environment and adhere to deadlines while producing high quality work each and every time. §  § § §Passion for working with others (being collaborative) and helping our team members grow and learn. §  § § §Problem solving skills and think ahead to ensure any challenges don’t greatly impact project progress or outcomes.§  § § §Ability to set goals and develop achievable timelines to hit them. §  § §We’re a mission-driven company that, at the core, is about changing the lives and businesses of lawyers and their clients. Sometimes you might have to work late, sometimes you may have to work a Saturday, sometimes you’ll get a weekday off. If we have a project and work needs to get done, then we’re all hands on deck. It is important that this sounds exciting to you. If this doesn’t sound exciting, then this role isn’t for you.§  §Perks and benefits: § § § §Competitive remuneration. §  § § §4 Day Work Week, flexible hours and some remote work possible.§  § § §Career prospects with the potential to grow into another role at Automio.§  § § §Creative team fizzing with energy and innovative ideas.§  § § §Your voice heard! Every one of our team members has the chance to give input, create value and make a big impact on the future of our company. §  § § §A team behind you that is cheerleading you, supporting you, guiding you and championing you. §  § § §Collaborative digital workspaces.§  § § §Cool Automio swag.§  § §Application Instructions§  §Keen? Awesome - please email our Chief Operating Officer at §zac@autom.io§ by 27 October 2020 (keep in mind we will begin interviewing potential candidates immediately so we highly recommend applying as soon as possible) with the following details:§ § § §Step #1: Take the DISC assessment here. §  § § §Optional Step #2: the StrengthsFinders assessment here (note there is a $19.99 USD fee to take this assessment, hence it is not mandatory and will not be held against you if you don’t submit it).§  § § §Step #3: Respond to this posting with:§  § § §Your assessment results from step #1 (required) & #2 (if you are able).§  § § §Your CV.§  § § §A 1 - 2 minute video about why we should hire you.§  § § §Write the word “Orange” in the subject line (so we know you’re paying attention).§  § § § §Automio is committed to honouring diversity on our team, in our clientele and within our community. We value and respect all types of diversity including, but not limited to, ethnicity, race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, religion and abilities. We believe that a diverse workplace makes our business stronger. We especially invite diverse candidates to apply.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing manager?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§§§

Developing our project to build online communities grow innovative ways of joining the union will be part of your brief.§        §We will be looking for evidence of your ability and experience in managing a creative team, building a positive team culture, managing workflows, building strong relationships with stakeholders, and giving robust advice and training to senior leaders.  You will be happy instigating, analysing, and implementing new initiatives, while also doing hands-on work when necessary.§        §This is a full-time role with responsibility for the overall direction of the communications functions of NZEI Te Riu Roa, including media, social media, web, our bi-annual journal, Ako as well as communications strategies and budgets.  If you have got a commitment to the union movement and the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi, an interest in public education and a desire to make positive change for children and those working with them, please apply!§        §A full job description is available on our web site: www.nzei.org.nz/jobs or contact Sue Braggins at §sue.braggins@nzei.org.nz§        §Applications in confidence should be emailed to §vacancies@nzei.org.nz§ with “HOC” in the subject line.§        §Applications close at 5pm Monday 2nd November 2020§        §NZEI Te Riu Roa welcomes and supports people of all gender identities, ages, ethnicities, sexual orientations, religions, and disabilities/ abilities.  An expectation of this role is to actively support and promote our diversity and inclusion principles.  We want NZEI Te Riu Roa to be a place where you can bring your whole self to work.§      §    §    §      §Sue Braggins at §sue.braggins@nzei.org.nz§ §    §  §§§Thinking about a new challenge for 2020?  If you are keen to work in a campaigning environment on the critical issue of educating New Zealand kids, we are looking for a strategic leader to head our communications team.§ §As the union for primary and early childhood educators, NZEI Te Riu Roa is one of the country's largest membership organisations.  We are looking for someone who understands the power of using communications to engage with 49,000 educators and the public to make positive changes for education.  § §You will be an experienced communications professional with strong political acumen and a history of creating and implementing successful communications strategies, preferably in a membership environment.   You will understand the opportunities for leveraging social media to engage members in action, the power of good design, and the need for integrated and consistent communications. Developing our project to build online communities grow innovative ways of joining the union will be part of your brief.§ §We will be looking for evidence of your ability and experience in managing a creative team, building a positive team culture, managing workflows, building strong relationships with stakeholders, and giving robust advice and training to senior leaders.  You will be happy instigating, analysing, and implementing new initiatives, while also doing hands-on work when necessary.§ §This is a full-time role with responsibility for the overall direction of the communications functions of NZEI Te Riu Roa, including media, social media, web, our bi-annual journal, Ako as well as communications strategies and budgets.  If you have got a commitment to the union movement and the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi, an interest in public education and a desire to make positive change for children and those working with them, please apply!§ §A full job description is available on our web site: www.nzei.org.nz/jobs or contact Sue Braggins at §sue.braggins@nzei.org.nz§ §Applications in confidence should be emailed to §vacancies@nzei.org.nz§ with “HOC” in the subject line.§ §Applications close at 5pm Monday 2nd November 2020§ §NZEI Te Riu Roa welcomes and supports people of all gender identities, ages, ethnicities, sexual orientations, religions, and disabilities/ abilities.  An expectation of this role is to actively support and promote our diversity and inclusion principles.  We want NZEI Te Riu Roa to be a place where you can bring your whole self to work.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50769226.txt	§Insights Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Insights Specialist§§Advertiser: §Tourism New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Market Research & Analysis§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Insights Specialist §      §      §    §    §      §        §Auckland Based§        §Full time, Permanent§        §New Zealand is the ultimate destination. Tourism New Zealand's role is to attract people to visit multiple parts of our beautiful country. This helps make sure that tourism enriches New Zealand and the wellbeing of New Zealanders today and tomorrow.§        §What will you be doing?§        §We need a Marketing and Insights specialist to join our world class team in our efforts to gain maximum value from our marketing efforts.  Reporting to the Global Manager Insights you will be responsible for maximising value through gaining a deep understanding of our global audience, the New Zealand tourism industry, and measuring impact of our work. Working with our global and market teams, you bring a holistic approach to insights translating that into actionable insights to drive decision making across the organisation.  §        §Insights play a critical role in determining where and how we focus our organisational resource, ensuring evidence-based decision making, and ensuring TNZ can provide useful insights for the broader industry.§        §What you will need?§        §You will be comfortable embracing a broad scope of work that spans different skill sets and requires flexibility and openness to operate in a rapidly changing environment.§        §We are looking for someone with a commercial marketing and insights background with an excellent understanding of the power of consumer research and data to inform marketing strategy and implementation. You will not only be able to support in managing research and conducting analysis but be able to extract insights and apply them to Tourism New Zealand's marketing efforts using your marketing know-how. As our work at Tourism New Zealand is insight led, you'll be an expert at communicating at all levels in a complex global organisation and your ability to influence strategy and operations will be second to none as we strive to continually improve the way we communicate to enhance the visitor experience.  §        §The role requires a big thinker who is passionate about making a difference, thrives on inquiry and can turn that knowledge into strategic insight.§        §Sound like you?§        §If you are highly curious, thrive on delivering extraordinary work, and want to work for an organisation which is delivering high impact and award-winning work, then look no further.§        §Hono mai ki a mātou§(come join us!)§        §To apply, please send us your cv and covering letter.§        §Applications close: Monday 2nd November§        § §        § §        § §      §      §      §    §    §For more information visit§      §www.tourismnewzealand.com/about/careers§    §  §§§Auckland Based§§Full time, Permanent§New Zealand is the ultimate destination. Tourism New Zealand's role is to attract people to visit multiple parts of our beautiful country. This helps make sure that tourism enriches New Zealand and the wellbeing of New Zealanders today and tomorrow.§What will you be doing?§We need a Marketing and Insights specialist to join our world class team in our efforts to gain maximum value from our marketing efforts.  Reporting to the Global Manager Insights you will be responsible for maximising value through gaining a deep understanding of our global audience, the New Zealand tourism industry, and measuring impact of our work. Working with our global and market teams, you bring a holistic approach to insights translating that into actionable insights to drive decision making across the organisation.  §Insights play a critical role in determining where and how we focus our organisational resource, ensuring evidence-based decision making, and ensuring TNZ can provide useful insights for the broader industry.§What you will need?§You will be comfortable embracing a broad scope of work that spans different skill sets and requires flexibility and openness to operate in a rapidly changing environment.§We are looking for someone with a commercial marketing and insights background with an excellent understanding of the power of consumer research and data to inform marketing strategy and implementation. You will not only be able to support in managing research and conducting analysis but be able to extract insights and apply them to Tourism New Zealand's marketing efforts using your marketing know-how. As our work at Tourism New Zealand is insight led, you'll be an expert at communicating at all levels in a complex global organisation and your ability to influence strategy and operations will be second to none as we strive to continually improve the way we communicate to enhance the visitor experience.  §The role requires a big thinker who is passionate about making a difference, thrives on inquiry and can turn that knowledge into strategic insight.§Sound like you?§If you are highly curious, thrive on delivering extraordinary work, and want to work for an organisation which is delivering high impact and award-winning work, then look no further.§Hono mai ki a mātou§(come join us!)§To apply, please send us your cv and covering letter.§Applications close: Monday 2nd November§ §§ §§ §§§§

jobTitle: Product Marketing Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50773309.txt	§Product Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Product Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §SnapComms§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Product Management & Development§§§§§§SnapComms is a fast-growing, global leader in SaaS employee communications and engagement solutions with over 600 customers and 2.5 million users. Our customers are large organizations from different industries (healthcare, financial services, higher education and more) and parts of the world (the Americas, UK, Asia and elsewhere).§  §Solving the seemingly insurmountable problem of information-overload and message-fatigue is the reason SnapComms exists. We passionately believe that enabling organisations to deliver their message in the right channel, to the right people, at the right time is the answer. Empowering employees starts with exceptional employee engagement, so delivering a complete communications experience that increases motivations, fuels aspirations and enhances productivity is what inspires us every day!§  §But the SnapComms story is just beginning. That’s where you come in…§  § §  §What is the role?§  §This is an exciting, newly created role in our product marketing team, so you’ll be an ambitious and experienced marketing professional with a history of successfully taking products to market. As a Product Marketing Manager, you’ll make an impact by deeply understanding a range of verticals so you can position our SnapComms platform across different use cases to drive acquisition and retention.§  § §  §Who are we looking for?§  §If you’re a Product Marketer with B2B tech experience who wants to transform employee communications world-wide then this role is for you. You’d also thrive in this role if you’re an exceptional problem-solver who loves bringing clarity to complexity and have experience in consulting or advisory services where you’ve helped clients succeed by articulating the value of technology, e.g. with business cases.§  § § § §You have strong business acumen with relevant experience in product marketing or consulting and know what it takes to get your audience excited about a technology solution – you know how to assimilate customer/client pain points, market dynamics and product/solution capability and turn those insights into value propositions and pitches.§ § § § §You have experience with customer and market research and are comfortable turning analysis and data into compelling stories that persuade your audience.§ § § § §You are passionate about truly understanding your customers’ problems and the language they speak so you can develop positioning and messaging that resonates. § § § § §You’re familiar with dealing with different functions and stakeholders in an organization. Interviewing customers or clients to get the insights you need to succeed is nothing new to you.§ § § § §You have experience marketing or presenting to audiences in a B2B environment, including technical audiences.§ § § § §You have an innate curiosity to discover what makes people tick, embrace challenges and work well with ambiguity. You’re focused on results and coming up with innovative, imaginative ways to achieve them.§ § § § §You’re a great communicator and thrive in a collaborative environment as part of a very engaged global team.§ § § § §You love working in a team but you’re also comfortable working on your own and you know what you need to know to get things done.§ § § § §When managing projects, you engage and support all stakeholders, articulate your expectations clearly and guide individuals to optimize their performance and achieve outcomes. § §What you will be doing?§ § §Become an expert in employee communications and acquire in-depth understanding of the various use cases across different functions including IT, HR and Internal Communications. § § § § §Own vertical deep dives and research projects, e.g. for financial services or healthcare, to really understand our different buyer personas. You’ll be the expert on who they are, how they buy, their buying criteria and journey. You’ll also understand the world of our user personas and how their experiences influence the buying decision.§ § § § §Based on your research and insights, you’ll develop positioning material that crisply articulates value propositions, stating how we help our customers uniquely solve problems, and achieve ROI. § § § § §Based on your research and insights, develop persona-based messaging that will be used by our Digital Marketing team to create relevant and consistent marketing content across the customer journey. Work with the Digital Marketing team to disseminate your research in various editorial formats and channels to drive brand awareness and generate leads.§ § § § §Based on your research and insights, work with the Sales team to create different types of sales enablement material such as pitch decks, ROI tools and business case frameworks to help them drive faster sales cycles and larger deal sizes.§ §What’s in it for you?§  §SnapComms is an amazing place to work. How amazing? You’ll be surrounded by a group of incredibly talented, diverse and passionate people. When you invest in us by joining the team, we invest in you through professional development – travel, training and mentoring opportunities to expand your knowledge and grow your skills.§  § §  §You’ll be motivated by celebrating shared successes across the whole company, with regular off-site team-building events. You’ll be well-fed with monthly staff BBQs, weekly fresh fruit and celebratory cakes. You’ll be inspired by our location near Takapuna beach, with offices full of natural light and a large sunny deck for lunch or relaxing. §  § §  §We firmly believe in work/life balance, so you’ll be able to work from home some days, enjoy flexible hours and wear casual attire. You’ll also receive a commute to work incentive and paid volunteering days – as well as doing a job you love in an environment that encourages you to be your best every day. See more about being part of the SnapComms team on our website.§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Do you have product management experience within a Software as a Service (SaaS) company?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§Have you worked in a role where you had to identify user needs and form product requirements?§§§

jobText: TXT/50772720.txt	§eCommerce Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§eCommerce Manager§§Advertiser: §Nature Baby Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Nature Baby is an innovative retail brand of sustainable, natural and organic baby products sought after both locally and around the globe.§We constantly strive for brilliant things from our Grey Lynn offices to the world. We love our team and all things baby, natural, sustainable and design inspired. We pride ourselves on striving to be the best in class, engaging with our loyal customers building something that is purpose driven and authentic.§We are seeking a champion of eCommerce who shares our vision and values.  This is a hands-on key strategic role that requires proven experience in eCommerce and digital marketing, with an understanding of digital strategies. §Collaborating with our Brand Manager and reporting to the founder / CEO, your role is to set the digital direction that will reach and engage with our customers in the best possible way. You will manage the Nature Baby website operations, develop strategies to create campaigns across all digital channels to generate targeted engagement growing the Nature Baby brand within New Zealand and globally. You will be able to analyse analytics and data to support marketing activities and spend.§This unique opportunity would allow you to lead all things eCommerce using your in-depth knowledge of ecommerce, digital channels, and campaigns.  You would be part of Nature Baby at this exciting next stage, allowing you to build on, shape and help direct the company to become a global leader in digital and development of an ethical and sustainable brand.§PROVEN SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE§Have a minimum of 5 years’ experience in a Digital/ eCommerce role, ideally within great retail brand/s.§Proven experience and knowledge in digital media principles and metrics, applying marketing spend and content development to digital channels§Demonstrated knowledge and capability to review, analyse and interpret data from tools such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, Facebook Business Manager customer segmentation and reports.§Have the ability to understand analytics of customer data, audience, and customer segmentation and what drives conversion with data-driven thinking.§Have a good understanding of SEO and the role it plays.§Have experience with eCommerce/website development and innovation in line with industry trends and brand values§Be a highly motivated, organised person with the ability to work individually and in a team environment leading others with good verbal and written communication skills.§Be passionate about sustainability§Applicants should be highly motivated, organised, passionate individuals who are able to learn and adapt quickly keeping on top of developments within digital, marketing and comms, using all digital channels to maximise reach and engagement to champion our brand. This is a key role with a strong focus on growth. We are looking for someone who loves what we stand for and wants to take Nature Baby's ideas to our customers and the world.§To apply for this role, please send your CV and cover letter telling us why you would love to work in this role at Nature Baby.§Please note this is a full time role.§Applications close: November 8th 2020, note only successful applicants will be contacted.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following web analytics tools are you experienced with?§Which of the following content management systems (CMS) do you have experience with?§Do you have experience with multi-variate and A/B testing methodologies?§How many years of project management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50773779.txt	§Marketing and Brand Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing and Brand Specialist§§Advertiser: §Decipher Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Rest of Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Brand Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §Marketing and Brand Specialist §    §    §      §        §Drive your marketing career forward in this growing and innovative company §        §Use your creativity to drive the marketing strategy & increase brand visibility §        §Join this team which will support your personal & professional development §      §      §        §About the Company §        §Pure Oil New Zealand Limited operates a large commercial oilseed crush plant located in the Izone Business Park, Rolleston, Canterbury.  We supply quality New Zealand grown seed oils and protein meals for export and domestic markets. The business is made up of a series of product brands which each have their own unique identity.  These product brands are sold into food ingredient, retail supermarkets, industrial oils and stock feed sectors. §        §We are a vertically integrated business, managing the growing of crops, handling and processing of seed, through to marketing oil and protein meal.   Vertical integration gives us control over the supply chain and allows us to guarantee the quality of our products to our customers.  We are a customer focused business and have successfully launched numerous products and brands over the last eight years and our growth has come from innovation.§        §We are creating our first marketing role and require a “go-getter” Marketing Specialist to further develop our brands and help launch new products.  The varied nature of the product brands offers both variety and challenge for an applicant who has the drive to succeed.§        §About the Opportunity §        §Reporting directly to the Managing Director, the Marketing and Brand Specialist will work across all Pure Oil brands providing a broad range of marketing services. The Marketing and Brand Specialist will support the Managing Director and work closely with the Sales Managers in the implementation of the annual strategic and operational marketing plan and will take accountability for delivery of the plan as it relates to brand management, events, social media, e-commerce and marketing campaigns. This is a key role in supporting business performance across and for all the Pure Oil brands and requires the development of strong working relationships with internal customers combined with the delivery of exceptional output and results.§        §About You§        §To be successful in this role, you will hold a relevant tertiary qualification and at least three years’ marketing experience preferably with broad marketing, communications and brand management responsibilities. You will be very familiar with digital marketing and ideally have experience in the e-commerce space. You will be able to demonstrate a potential to critically analyse opportunities and implement marketing initiatives to capitalise on these together with being able to prepare compelling content that delivers on business objectives.§        §What will set you apart as the successful candidate for this role will be your passion for marketing, your strong initiative and your high personal energy combined with an eye for designing and implementing an effective marketing mix that could be tailored for our varied brands and products. In return, Pure Oil NZ will provide excellent career progression for the successful applicant along with further upside potential. §        §Are you ready to take the next step in your career?§        §How to Apply§        §For a copy of the position description visit the Decipher Group website on www.deciphergroup.co.nz/current-vacancies/marketing-and-brand-specialist/ §        §To discover more about Pure Oil NZ, visit § https://pureoil.nz/§        §For a confidential discussion about the role; contact Katy Erickson on §0272782860§ or email §katy@deciphergroup.co.nz§.§        §Applications close:§ Monday 9th November 2020 §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About the Company § §Pure Oil New Zealand Limited operates a large commercial oilseed crush plant located in the Izone Business Park, Rolleston, Canterbury.  We supply quality New Zealand grown seed oils and protein meals for export and domestic markets. The business is made up of a series of product brands which each have their own unique identity.  These product brands are sold into food ingredient, retail supermarkets, industrial oils and stock feed sectors. § §We are a vertically integrated business, managing the growing of crops, handling and processing of seed, through to marketing oil and protein meal.   Vertical integration gives us control over the supply chain and allows us to guarantee the quality of our products to our customers.  We are a customer focused business and have successfully launched numerous products and brands over the last eight years and our growth has come from innovation.§ §We are creating our first marketing role and require a “go-getter” Marketing Specialist to further develop our brands and help launch new products.  The varied nature of the product brands offers both variety and challenge for an applicant who has the drive to succeed.§ §About the Opportunity § §Reporting directly to the Managing Director, the Marketing and Brand Specialist will work across all Pure Oil brands providing a broad range of marketing services. The Marketing and Brand Specialist will support the Managing Director and work closely with the Sales Managers in the implementation of the annual strategic and operational marketing plan and will take accountability for delivery of the plan as it relates to brand management, events, social media, e-commerce and marketing campaigns. This is a key role in supporting business performance across and for all the Pure Oil brands and requires the development of strong working relationships with internal customers combined with the delivery of exceptional output and results.§ §About You§ §To be successful in this role, you will hold a relevant tertiary qualification and at least three years’ marketing experience preferably with broad marketing, communications and brand management responsibilities. You will be very familiar with digital marketing and ideally have experience in the e-commerce space. You will be able to demonstrate a potential to critically analyse opportunities and implement marketing initiatives to capitalise on these together with being able to prepare compelling content that delivers on business objectives.§ §What will set you apart as the successful candidate for this role will be your passion for marketing, your strong initiative and your high personal energy combined with an eye for designing and implementing an effective marketing mix that could be tailored for our varied brands and products. In return, Pure Oil NZ will provide excellent career progression for the successful applicant along with further upside potential. § §Are you ready to take the next step in your career?§ §How to Apply§ §For a copy of the position description visit the Decipher Group website on www.deciphergroup.co.nz/current-vacancies/marketing-and-brand-specialist/ § §To discover more about Pure Oil NZ, visit § https://pureoil.nz/§ §For a confidential discussion about the role; contact Katy Erickson on §0272782860§ or email §katy@deciphergroup.co.nz§.§ §Applications close:§ Monday 9th November 2020 §§§§

jobText: TXT/50777436.txt	§Content and Digital Marketing Extraordinaire§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Content and Digital Marketing Extraordinaire§§Advertiser: §Rocketspark Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§About our company§ §With COVID fast-forwarding the trend of trading online, what a fantastic time to join our growing marketing team as we tell the world about Rocketspark—a website & ecommerce platform headquartered in Cambridge, New Zealand that’s rated 5 stars for ease of use and customer support with thousands of clients in dozens of countries. §  §Started in 2009, Rocketspark websites are utilised by businesses needing a beautiful website and/or online store and a hassle-free experience. Rocketspark also have a design partner network where design/marketing gurus offer their clients websites/ecommerce. §  §In the past 10 years, the Rocketspark team has been very focused on building a user-friendly and effective product that helps our customers succeed online. Most of our new customers come from word of mouth referral and the time has come to ramp up our marketing activity to welcome more customers on board so that they too can benefit from experiencing Rocketspark. §  § §  §About the role§ §We are seeking on our team a superstar all-rounder marketer who shares the vision and values of Rocketspark. This is a hands-on content and digital marketing role that requires proven experience in content and digital marketing. §  §You need to be gifted at telling the stories of our brand, our product, and our customers. You’ll also need to be experienced with writing for organic and paid digital channels. We’d love it even more if you’re creative, with the skillset to create graphics and/or videos that will help to get our brand name heard and recognised by people in need of a website or ecommerce solution in New Zealand and abroad..§  §You need to be a fast learner—someone who can not only draw out our brand story, company history and future dreams quickly, but you’ll need to be comfortable with ongoing learning about our software as it evolves over time. Can you convert tech-talk to everyday language when conveying the value of Rocketspark to our customers?  §  §We’re looking for a great team player who can be flexible, adaptable and able to work across multiple comms channels and tasks—for the common goal of customer acquisition. §  §This is a 40hr/week full-time role that would be ideal for a marketing extraordinaire with intermediate experience. Apart from creating organic and paid content for different distribution channels, this role may include moderate amounts of design and video production, email marketing, or project management for paid digital campaigns. §  §Our strong preference is someone with design and video-making skills that could contribute to our visual comms production, or someone who is SaaS experienced or from a PR or journalism background. But if that’s not you and you think you're nailing all other criteria we’d still love to hear from you.  §  §This is a full-time position but we will consider superstar candidates for a part-time role to fit with school hours.  §  § §  §Skills and experience§ §Essential§ § §Formal tertiary qualification in marketing, communications, PR, or related field§ §2 years or more experience working in a similar role§ §Amazing written and verbal communication skills§ §Experience with writing for search rankings§ §Proven track record of successfully implementing creative marketing campaigns that deliver results for acquiring new customers§ §A self-starter who can manage your own workload and multi-task§ §An ability to hit the ground running, come up to speed quickly and adapt to the role as required§ §Desired§ § §Creative design skills, graphics and ability to produce simple videos§ §Experienced with Google AdWords and other paid digital channels§ §Experience working with internal and external creative and media agencies§ §Experienced with segmented email marketing§ §Has worked in SaaS, software or other tech industry§ § § §Start date:§You’ll need to be able to start asap or before summer.§  §Work position:§You’ll need to work from our headquarters in Cambridge the majority of the time. §Flexible and innovative working approaches will be considered for the right candidate. §  §Application close date:§  §This role is open for applications until 6 Nov 2020 but if we find the right person before that time, the job application will close earlier.§  § § §To apply:§ §Design a 3-page website using the Rocketspark platform selling us on why we should choose you. Make it wow, make it pretty, and show us your amazing writing skills. § §Submit your application by filling out the form on https://www.rocketspark.com/careers-at-rocketspark/.§ §NOTE:§ § §When creating the trial website, please §add RSCAREERS in the Last Name field.§ §The website should act as your online CV as well as a portfolio of your work. The more examples of your work you can showcase the better, be it written content, design work, or videos you’ve made—anything that showcases what you can do.§ §We’d love it if you could record a short video of yourself explaining why you'd be great for the role. You can embed it onto the page using the Rocketspark video block.§ §Don’t just stick with the base template, get creative!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50778266.txt	§Brand Product Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Brand Product Manager§§Advertiser: §ZURU§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Brand Management§§§§§§Location§Start: Auckland, New Zealand§Relocation to Shenzhen, China within 2021§Role Overview §You champion product excellence and brand alignment driving the overall product and packaging strategy across a portfolio of brands.  §The Brand Product Manager oversees the entire product development cycle - from ideation to launch - working closely with creative, marketing and project management teams to develop award-winning brands.. Liaise with diverse teams (Marketing, Business Development, Project Management) across the business to ensure overall project success.  §The Brand Product Manager demonstrates strong creative ability, attention to detail as they are the final approver of all product and packaging and also excellent project management skills. This person will work across team to develop short, medium and long term brand and range planning. You are also responsible for how the products are featured and brought to life at fairs, showrooms and sample packages across the globe. §Responsibilities§Develop and lead global Brand/Product plans and identify future growth areas by analysing market, product and industry-specific trends. Pushing boundaries to create innovative and award-winning toys and packaging.§Liaise with New Product Development Project Managers throughout the entire product development process to set product, packaging and merchandising options. Approves all product and packaging at every development stage. Collaborate with legal team to finalize Trademark registration.§Work with creative team from ideation to development of best-in-class product and packaging designs. Take charge of creating appealing packaging copies.§Coordinate with diverse teams (Sales, Marketing, Merchandising) and define global brand roll out strategies to ensuring a smooth market launch and champion sales. Develop appealing showroom concepts as well as sales/marketing collaterals. §Be the internal contact for all aspects of the new product development process. Provide project data and product/brand information to the wider business ensuring all relevant stakeholder are informed and updated. §Experience Desired§2-4yrs in Product Management or Brand Marketing§Must demonstrate strong creative ability to be able to influence and approve the design & development of a broad range of product and packaging. §Knowledge of branding, product development and keen eye for detail§Experience working in a fast-paced environment with a high attention to product quality and safety.§Must be a self-starter with energy, creativity and time management skills.§Superior verbal and written communication skills.§Related Degree or equivalent relevant experience in Marketing or Product Development preferred.§About ZURU§ZURU is a disruptive and award-winning company that designs, manufactures and markets innovative toys and consumer products. Driven by innovation and inspired by imaginative play, ZURU is known for their agility, creativity and new-age manufacturing techniques. The company that started in New Zealand and is now headquartered in China, directly or indirectly employs more than 5,000 staff across 10 countries and distributes to most major retailers in over 120 countries. ZURU has delighted millions of families all over the world with brands such as Bunch O Balloons™, X-Shot™, Rainbocorns™, Robo Alive™, Smashers™, 5 Surprise™, Pets Alive™ and Metal Machines™ as well as through partnerships with entertainment properties, including Nickelodeon, Disney, Universal Studios and DreamWorks. More recently ZURU Edge has launched innovative digital-first consumer goods brands, such as Rascal + Friends Diapers and Nood Pet Food, that have disrupted stale categories and are taking significant market share. §With a strong commitment to the community, ZURU supports Captivating International, local China orphanages and also student development programs in Asia and in New Zealand. §Visit us at www.zuru.com, Like us on Facebook @ZURUToysCompany, or Follow us on Linkedin @ZuruToyCompany & @Zuruedge§§§§

jobText: TXT/50778297.txt	§eCommerce Trading Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§eCommerce Trading Executive§§Advertiser: §Oxfam New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$63,727+ per annum pro-rated§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§§Want to make a difference to the lives of people across the globe with your eCommerce & Digital Marketing experience?§ §Join us at Oxfam, where we’re ending the injustice of poverty. § §For everyone. For good. § §The role§We have a great opportunity for a talented individual to own and advance our growing eCommerce site! This unique opportunity allows you to champion all things eCommerce while working to make a difference in the lives of people living in poverty.§ §As a part of Oxfam New Zealand’s passionate Fundraising Team, you will grow and develop our community of ethics-based customers at Oxfam Shop. We are looking for someone who thrives on rolling up their sleeves and working across admin, strategy, sales and reporting. This is an exciting hands-on role that requires proven experience in digital marketing, e-commerce site management and fulfilment. You will work closely alongside other team members to coordinate sales strategies with our various fundraising streams, develop relationships with potential vendors and drive corporate sales. This new role is an exciting opportunity to join Oxfam New Zealand as we look to grow and develop our eCommerce offering.§ § §Our ideal candidate§ § §Proven 3+ years eCommerce trading experience, preferably in a start-up environment, with an understanding of how to drive eCommerce sales in retail or other fast-paced industry.§ §Experience using eCommerce platforms: Woocommerce is preferable.§ §Excellent project management skills§ §Strong knowledge and experience using digital marketing channels, including EDM, search, social, remarketing, etc.§ §A demonstrated ability to develop and execute marketing campaigns that engage members of the public.§ §Demonstrable success in improving sales growth and site optimisation.§ §Experience with Google Analytics, producing business reports and general lines of sales reporting.§ §Experience with managing and optimising successful Facebook advertising.§ §Experience with Adobe Creative Suite (Indesign, Photoshop, Illustrator).§ §An understanding of brand development.§ §Financial and stock management experience.§ §Proven people and relationship management skills.§ §Commitment to Oxfam New Zealand’s ethical, sustainable and fair-trade values.§ §Apply now!§ §Please apply below & we'll email you a link to quick-apply through our job portal, which includes the full job description.§ §In return, we offer flexibility, a great work culture and an amazing global Oxfam network. You will have the opportunity to build your career in the non profit sector and to make a tangible difference to those living in poverty. Based in central Auckland, the post is §part-time (24 hours per week), 12 months fixed term contract, and attracts a starting salary of $63,727 per annum pro-rated§ (or potentially higher depending on your experience). § §Applications closing date§ Tuesday 3 November, 5:00pm. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted via our job portal, after this date.§ §Who are we?§At Oxfam we work alongside people impacted by disasters, and help them rebuild afterwards. We confront the causes that keep people poor, like extreme inequality, discrimination against women, climate change, and the eviction of people from their land. We work alongside people living in less wealthy countries to build better lives for themselves. For Oxfam staff this work gets us out of bed with the certainty that our work day is making a difference. At Oxfam New Zealand we work alongside those in the Pacific Islands and South East Asia.§Note: §Only candidates currently living in NZ with the right to work in New Zealand need apply. All offers of employment will be subject to satisfactory references and may also be subject to additional screening checks, which can include criminal record and medical checks.§ §We are committed to: preventing any type of unwanted behaviour at work including sexual harassment, exploitation and abuse, lack of integrity and financial misconduct; and promoting the welfare of children, young people and adults.  Oxfam expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment through our Code of Conduct. We place a high priority on ensuring that we recruit only those who share and demonstrate our values.§ §Oxfam New Zealand is an equal opportunities employer and encourages diversity in the workplace.§ §§§§

jobTitle: Insight Analyst - Customer Experience (6 month fixed term contract) Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50774601.txt	§Insight Analyst - Customer Experience (6 month fixed term contract)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Insight Analyst - Customer Experience (6 month fixed term contract)§§Advertiser: §AIA New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Market Research & Analysis§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to champion New Zealand to be one of the healthiest and most protected nations in the world. We strive to help Kiwis live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our operating philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§ §This role is in our Customer Experience (CX) and Communications team in Marketing and will support the delivery of the CX framework. They will also provide regular reporting around customer and adviser experience, insight on pain points to highlight opportunities to improve experience as well as assist in embedding customer centric concepts and measures across all areas of the business.§ §Key responsibilities:§ § § §Analysis, Reporting and Survey Management; Review Voice Of Customer (VOC) and Voice of Intermediary (IX) outputs along-side complaints and deep dives to identify  people, process, service or system issues.§ § § §Present findings from integrated customer feedback (complaints, deep dives and VOC/IX), to tell a clear story to the business in format suited to stakeholders.§ § § §Support the development of, and manage, Quality of Experience systems – including VOC and IX.§ § § §Consult with a variety of stakeholders in survey planning, execution and assisting with survey design and distribution.§ § § §Demonstrate continuous application of key business and consumer insights to address key business challenges or create new opportunities.§ § § § §Skills and experience required:§ § § §Strong analytical skills, with complex analysis and problem solving.§ § § §Ability to reach sound decisions and solve problems independently.§ § § §Excellent written and oral communication skills.§ § § §Good interpersonal, stakeholder and negotiation skills.§ § § §Understand reporting tools.§ § § §The ability to view the organisation from both an internal perspective as well as through the eyes of the customer.§ § § §Intermediate to advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills.§ § § §2+ years experience in data analysis / insight / report writing.§ § § §Experience in similar Service industry roles.§ § § §A clear understanding of the role that data and insights play in delivering customer experiences.§ § § §Able to distil a brief to focus on outputs that will add the most value to the customer.§ § §Nice to have:§ § § §Previous Voice of Customer insight experience a plus.§ § § §Use of Maritz CX or similar tool would be advantageous.§ § § §Market research experience§ § § § §About us:§ §As part of our stated commitment to diversity and inclusion, we cultivate a flexible and supportive work environment that meets the needs of our people and our business. We welcome applications for this role from candidates seeking flexible working arrangements.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50784923.txt	§Communications Creator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications Creator§§Advertiser: §United Fire Brigades' Association§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§Newly established opportunity §Fast paced, challenging, and rewarding environment§Part-time (0.5FTE) fixed-term opportunity to June 2021§Salary range $65K - $80K (FTE) depending on experience§ §About the role§The United Fire Brigades’ Association (UFBA) offers the opportunity of a part-time fixed term contract for an experienced communications professional. You will work alongside our Marketing and Communications Manager while we embed our new website and database. If you can present information in an accessible and straightforward way through several channels, then we’d like to hear from you. §Communications are a key enabler for the UFBA, helping us achieve our goals by engaging with our members and stakeholders effectively and efficiently. §You’ll be working with a small team who are passionate about supporting fire and emergency personnel throughout New Zealand. You will need to be people focused and have a proactive approach to delivering best practice communication to a time poor audience.§To be successful in this role, you will need to:§Have a minimum of three years' communications and engagement experience.§Ideally have previous experience working in member communications.§Have a passion for storytelling and content creation and the ability to engage with individuals to tell their stories.§Be a strong self-starter with experience in pulling together material for regular communications including a website.§Be able to demonstrate strategic thinking to engage and connect with a variety of audiences.§Be able to work with multiple demands on time.§Be able to translate technical jargon into plain English.§Demonstrate experience on providing customer focused solutions and services.§Set priorities and manage time effectively§If this role sounds like you and you would like to join an organisation that works to support those in the fire and emergency sector, then contact us.§Why work for us?§Based in Tawa, Wellington, we are a small not-for-profit organisation providing services that directly support firefighters out in their communities across New Zealand. As a small organisation that promotes volunteerism and resilience in communities, your contribution makes a difference.§We enjoy a trusting environment with flexible working, 3% Kiwisaver contributions and a holiday on your birthday if it falls within the term of the contract.  Days and times of work to be agreed upon with the successful applicant.§About UFBA:§The United Fire Brigades’ Association (UFBA) represents over 13,500 brigade members from urban, rural, career, volunteer, industry, airport and defence brigades. Established in 1878 we are a trusted partner of Fire and Emergency supporting change management in an evolving sector. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Are you experienced with copy writing and content creation?§Which of the following content management systems (CMS) do you have experience with?§§§

jobText: TXT/50791350.txt	§Digital Marketing / Social Media / Content TXT§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing / Social Media / Content TXT§§Advertiser: §The Creative Store§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§The Creative Store§ §Great TXT. Great People.§ §www.thecreativestore.co.nz§ § § § § §Freelancers.§  We have a wide range of freelance and contract roles.  Ranging from 1 week to 3 – 6 months – offering you flexibility to pick and choose when you want to work.  You have the option to invoice or to have your paye done for you.  Easy As.§ § § §Digital Marketing / Content Creation / Campaign Creatives – Freelance – New Zealand Wide § §Are you looking for digital marketing, social, content creative assignments? Are you based in New Zealand, and seeking contract and freelance assignments? Are you a confident owning end to end campaigns for clients across SEO, PPC, Google Adwords and Paid Social? We have numerous agency and inhouse clients who are looking to utilise freelancers – anywhere from a couple of hours, to 1 – 4 days per week. Acting as a ‘plug and play’ resource, you will become a trusted extension of their team, helping to service the digital marketing needs of clients. Reference #27092.§ §Marketing Manager.§ §This Christchurch based online retailer is looking for a Marketing Manager with strong copywriting skills. They are a small busy team, and this is an important role. They have been NZ Retailer of the year – people’s choice for the past 2 years. You will be a skilled copywriter, writing fun and engaging copy for EDMs, blogs, product descriptions, social media and digital advertising. Overseeing the social media account, you will be responsible for growing their following, building an engaged customer community and liaising with various SMIs/brand ambassadors. You will have the ability to maintain the website by publishing new content, uploading products and updating existing pages and analyse campaigns and produce reports. Reference #27319.§ §Digital Marketing Coordinator.§ §Are you looking to join an amazing, strategic and award-winning brand agency based in Christchurch? Our client is looking for an intermediate level Digital Marketing Coordinator with strong communication and client service skills. As the ideal candidate, you will have experience running campaigns from planning and implementation to reporting and prior experience in food and beverage brands would be beneficial. You will be a strategic thinker and have the ability to take a brief and run with it, with confidence and without supervision. Reference #27095.§ §Marketing Coordinator.§ §Our client is a strategic and award-winning brand agency based in Christchurch, looking for a super star Marketing Coordinator to work along side their key client to manage workflow into the agency. As the ideal candidate, you will have 2-3 years’ experience in a marketing coordinator or project management role, either agency or client side. You will live and breathe planning and timelines and have the ability to take a marketing strategy and break it down into clear briefs for delivery. You will be working alongside their client’s marketing lead, and will be helping them manage the day to day marketing calendars and ensuring all information is clearly communicated within the agency. Reference #27154.§ §Account Manager / New Business.§ §Our client is an Auckland indie agency who work across advertising, brand, digital and motion. They have an excellent range of clients and looking to expand their offering to the South Island, specifically Christchurch. This role is perfect for a smart senior level Client Account Manager with strong new business skills, who is hungry and has the drive to help this agency continue their growth. You will be well connected and have prior agency experience behind you. Working across the new business drive, you will be confident and articulate, able to develop and nurture long standing relationships, generate leads and successfully lead the pitch process. Reference #26679.§ §Digital Marketing Strategist – Auckland.§ §This is your opportunity to work with a small, yet fast-growing agency, with the focus on Pacifica – the people, the culture and their environment. Our client is looking for a Digital Marketing Strategist to help develop and deliver online initiatives. The projects will be varied and immensely interesting, with clients including community, council and government. Due to the nature of some of the clients, exceptional analytical nous and reporting capabilities are essential, along with strong stakeholder management and an ability to guide clients through opportunities within the digital landscape. Reference #27381.§ § § §To apply – email your cv to Ginnaya Turner at The Creative Store, §ginnaya@thecreativestore.co.nz§.  If you would like further details on any of the above roles, visit our website §www.thecreativestore.co.nz§ or call us at The Creative Store on §(09) 365 1077§.§ § § §We will only review candidates who have a valid work permit / working rights for New Zealand.§ § § §www.thecreativestore.co.nz§ §Great TXT. Great People.§§§§
