jobText: TXT/50787296.txt	§Public Relations Manager §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Public Relations Manager §§Advertiser: §Tourism New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Public Relations & Corporate Affairs§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Public Relations Manager §      §      §    §    §      §        §New Zealand is the ultimate destination. Tourism New Zealand's role is to attract people to visit multiple parts of our beautiful country. This helps make sure that tourism benefits New Zealand and the wellbeing of New Zealanders today and tomorrow.§        §What will you be doing?§        §This role is responsible for increasing preference for New Zealand as an international and domestic visitor destination by leading and managing our global PR-led storytelling.  Your role is to seek, create and share the best New Zealand destination stories to increase brand fame, love and appeal around the world. You are a hunter and hustler who knows how to earn attention and coverage with advocates sharing our stories for us. You know how to leverage relationships with high profile influencers, TV and film productions, major events, strategic partnerships and you are also the ultimate newshacker, taking advantage of breaking news or piggybacking on trending news topics to get us noticed. You love creative thinking and your eyes and ears are tapped into what's happening in the world.§        §You'll lead a team of two including a writer and content producer as well as have access to world-class agencies and a network of contributors. You'll also work with a team of incredible PR superstars in our offshore offices. You are creative, innovative, brave and keen to act as a challenger brand to take our place to New Zealand and the world.§        §What we need from you?§        §We need someone with a tertiary qualification in PR communications or another relevant discipline, with a minimum of 8 years' experience in a PR communications role, preferably in an international environment where you have been responsible for strategy and the delivery of complex multidisciplinary and integrated projects.  You will have experience creating and delivering multimedia content, a solid understanding of media channels including traditional, owned and social, and thrive managing a team or network of content creators to deliver fast turnaround news content.§        §Sound like you?§        §If you are a PR star with creativity, innovation and relationship building at your core, with a strong appetite for hustle and driving opportunities, then this could be the leadership role for you.§        §We're committed to doing extraordinary things so we seek to create a diverse workforce and foster an inclusive work environment where people feel 100% welcome.§        §Hono mai ki a mātou§ (Come join us!)§        §Closing date: Wednesday 4th November§      §      §      §    §    §For more information visit§      §www.tourismnewzealand.com/about/careers§    §  §§§New Zealand is the ultimate destination. Tourism New Zealand's role is to attract people to visit multiple parts of our beautiful country. This helps make sure that tourism benefits New Zealand and the wellbeing of New Zealanders today and tomorrow.§What will you be doing?§This role is responsible for increasing preference for New Zealand as an international and domestic visitor destination by leading and managing our global PR-led storytelling.  Your role is to seek, create and share the best New Zealand destination stories to increase brand fame, love and appeal around the world. You are a hunter and hustler who knows how to earn attention and coverage with advocates sharing our stories for us. You know how to leverage relationships with high profile influencers, TV and film productions, major events, strategic partnerships and you are also the ultimate newshacker, taking advantage of breaking news or piggybacking on trending news topics to get us noticed. You love creative thinking and your eyes and ears are tapped into what's happening in the world.§You'll lead a team of two including a writer and content producer as well as have access to world-class agencies and a network of contributors. You'll also work with a team of incredible PR superstars in our offshore offices. You are creative, innovative, brave and keen to act as a challenger brand to take our place to New Zealand and the world.§What we need from you?§We need someone with a tertiary qualification in PR communications or another relevant discipline, with a minimum of 8 years' experience in a PR communications role, preferably in an international environment where you have been responsible for strategy and the delivery of complex multidisciplinary and integrated projects.  You will have experience creating and delivering multimedia content, a solid understanding of media channels including traditional, owned and social, and thrive managing a team or network of content creators to deliver fast turnaround news content.§Sound like you?§If you are a PR star with creativity, innovation and relationship building at your core, with a strong appetite for hustle and driving opportunities, then this could be the leadership role for you.§We're committed to doing extraordinary things so we seek to create a diverse workforce and foster an inclusive work environment where people feel 100% welcome.§Hono mai ki a mātou§ (Come join us!)§Closing date: Wednesday 4th November§§§§

jobText: TXT/50777868.txt	§Senior Communications Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Communications Advisor§§Advertiser: §Southern District Health Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§New Dunedin Hospital Project Management Office, Dunedin§§Be on the frontline of the once in a lifetime New Dunedin Hospital project§Manage communications on a range of infrastructure projects§Utilise your skills across a diverse range of media from online and digital to traditional print§As Senior Communications Advisor in the New Dunedin Hospital Project Management Office team you really will be at the leading edge of a development which will improve healthcare for the wider Southern region for generations to come. Bring your media, marketing and public relations skills to a role that will be challenging and hugely rewarding.§About the team§The New Dunedin Hospital Project Management Office team are at the heart of the future of our region's healthcare; driving forward the brand new facilities and ensuring that they meet the needs of not only today's communities but also the needs of future generations. We are a diverse and supportive team bringing experience and expertise from a range of backgrounds, both clinical and commercial.§About the role§As Senior Communications Advisor, you will be responsible for providing communications advice and expertise to the Southern DHB across a range of infrastructure projects with a particular focus on the New Dunedin Hospital Development.§The main focus areas of your role will be (but are not limited to):§planning, overseeing and implementing the communications with key internal and external stakeholders§working closely with the Ministry of Health Communications team to develop cohesive engagement strategies for the New Dunedin Hospital Development and its work streams§contributing to the strong values-based internal culture of the Southern DHB§participating in face to face promotion and engagement activities, including workshops, roadshows and meetings§implementing communications strategies across a range of channels; online (internal and external), print, external media, websites, social media etc.§building positive working relationships with key media agencies and key stakeholders.§About you§We are looking for a positive, proactive and motivated individual to step into this varied and busy role.§You will ideally bring the following skills and experience with you:§A relevant communications, journalism, marketing or public relations tertiary qualification§Solid experience within a communications, media, marketing or public relations field§Photography and/or video skills, while not essential, would definitely be beneficial§Strong focus on customers and the desire to produce accurate and high quality communications§The ability to build strong working relationships with people from diverse backgrounds and experiences§It goes without saying that you will also need to be an excellent communicator with the ability to successfully get your ideas across in both written and spoken form. You'll enjoy being at the frontline in a sometimes pressured and often fast-moving environment.§If you think you have the skills we need and are looking for an opportunity to shine in the communications space we would love to hear from you!§About the Southern DHB§The SDHB has the largest regional coverage of all the New Zealand health boards, providing services to over 315,000 people. We take pride in the services we provide and our aim is to improve, promote and protect the health of our population. Our customers - patients, staff and communities - are at the heart of everything we do.§Why Southern?§Now is a great time to relocate to Southern if you were considering a move! The Southern district offers the benefits of excellent amenities, first class primary through to tertiary education, and outstanding recreational opportunities. Whether it is surfing, kayaking or sailing; skiing, hunting or fishing; theatre, live-music or art - there's literally something for everyone. Check out §https://southernhealthcareers.nz/§ for what the region and we can offer you and your whanau.§Closing date: Tuesday, 3 November 2020.§For further information please contact Sarah Burgess, Recruitment Advisor - Corporate Directorate on §(03) 470 9021§.§Pre-Employment Occupational Health Assessment§In the interests of protecting our people and our patients, all appointments will be subject to an Occupational Health Assessment to confirm suitability and fitness to work in the role you are being considered for.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50783747.txt	§Senior Product Manager, Business Lending§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Product Manager, Business Lending§§Advertiser: §Westpac§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Product Management & Development§§§§§§ §Full time, permanent role§Based in Britomart, Auckland§Start date - Jan 2021§Westpac is a strong and trusted brand in the New Zealand market. We provide great, innovative banking products and continue to enhance our customers experience with next generation banking. §  §About the role:§ §Business Lending is an important strategic area of the business for us, with significant potential to grow revenue, strengthen product design, processes and improve customer experiences.  Due to expanding remit, internal movements and specific business outcomes there are several product management opportunities. The Business Lending squad is accountable for ensuring Westpac NZ has the right products, pricing framework, processes and management information to maximise best customer outcomes.§  §You will formulate and support the development of strategies, ensure strong end-to-end product management is imbedded, look for opportunities to remove pain points and strive to continually improve the product experience for our staff and customers. §   §What you will need to be successful:§ §This role will suit someone who is passionate about understanding the market, our customers, our competitors, and how Westpac can identify potential business opportunities and then develop and deliver profitable outcomes. §  §Although it is not essential for you to be a numbers person, you’ll need a good understanding of the banking products, process and be comfortable with product analysis, market comparisons and risk management concepts. You will also bring experience in managing complex issues and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements. § §Strong end-to-end Product Management experience§Understanding of commercial banking products (preferable)§Experience developing product strategies and roadmaps§Strong analysis and interpretation skills§Confident and articulate written and oral communication skills§Strong stakeholder management and engagement.§ §What is great about working for Westpac?§ §We are passionate about people and take pride in building teams that reflect the diversity in our communities. From day one, we'll invest in your growth and empower you to take ownership of your development. You can also enrol in our industry-leading superannuation programme and fantastic staff banking package.§  §Next Steps§ §If you are keen to help our customers and clients achieve their financial goals and work in a progressive organisation with an enviable culture, then apply today with your CV and cover letter via the link on this page.  § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50786414.txt	§Lead CX Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lead CX Designer§§Advertiser: §Tribe (New Zealand) Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Market Research & Analysis§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Lead CX Designer §      §About the Role: §  § As the Lead CX Designer you will build and champion the human-centred design capabilities, creating innovative, consistent and engaging brand experiences. You will be responsible for CX design excellence across all customer touchpoints from discovery to evaluation to product departure and continuous improvement of experience.§  § You will leverage insights, data, thoughtful design and creative problem-solving to optimise customer experience and brand growth opportunities. In this role, you’ll be responsible for creating satisfying and compelling experiences for users across products, services and customer interactions. You will champion the actionability of game changing insights that help win the hearts and minds of consumers.§  § Some key accountabilities:§  §          §Development and ongoing implementation of a best in class CX Design capability across the business, effectively leveraging internal talent and external agency / contractor support.§          §Facilitating CX Design processes across key strategic initiatives and across product portfolios, engaging cross functional stakeholders to get the best results for our customers and our brands§          §Joined at the hip with digital and product deliver teams to ensure CX requirements and guidance is reflected across product development planning through to in-market execution and continuous improvement§        §  §        §About You: §  § You’ll need to be an evangelistic CX professional, with proven track record in digital product delivery. You’ll have the ability to research, analyse, journey map, design and problem-solve, working in close collaboration with Marketing, Digital & Product teams to deliver amazing new Branded experiences for customers. A CX designer and keen researcher, you’ll engage in the most current methodologies, design practices and technology trends. You’ll have a creative passion for delivering unique brand experiences, combined with a strong commercial acumen and excellent stakeholder relationship skills.§  §        §About the Company: §  § This is a well-known kiwi services business redefining the boundaries where they operate and challenging themselves to do better. They are moving fast, listening to their customers, creating solutions and taking calculated risks.§  §  §        §Apply Now!§  §        §Here at Tribe, we are currently experiencing an incredibly high volume of applications and it may take us longer than usual to get back to you. It’s outside our normal service levels and we’re sorry for that.§  §        §In order for us to focus on servicing candidates and clients to the highest possible standards, we encourage all expressions of interest to be made via this advert. This will ensure your information reaches the correct consultant in a timely manner and we will respond to you as quickly as possible. Thanks so much for your patience during this time.§  § Caitlin Menzies – §caitlin@tribegroup.com§  §        §To apply for this vacancy you MUST be a New Zealand citizen, resident, or have already secured the right to work in New Zealand and therefore hold a valid visa.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About the Role: § §As the Lead CX Designer you will build and champion the human-centred design capabilities, creating innovative, consistent and engaging brand experiences. You will be responsible for CX design excellence across all customer touchpoints from discovery to evaluation to product departure and continuous improvement of experience.§ §You will leverage insights, data, thoughtful design and creative problem-solving to optimise customer experience and brand growth opportunities. In this role, you’ll be responsible for creating satisfying and compelling experiences for users across products, services and customer interactions. You will champion the actionability of game changing insights that help win the hearts and minds of consumers.§ §Some key accountabilities:§ §Development and ongoing implementation of a best in class CX Design capability across the business, effectively leveraging internal talent and external agency / contractor support.§Facilitating CX Design processes across key strategic initiatives and across product portfolios, engaging cross functional stakeholders to get the best results for our customers and our brands§Joined at the hip with digital and product deliver teams to ensure CX requirements and guidance is reflected across product development planning through to in-market execution and continuous improvement§ §About You: § §You’ll need to be an evangelistic CX professional, with proven track record in digital product delivery. You’ll have the ability to research, analyse, journey map, design and problem-solve, working in close collaboration with Marketing, Digital & Product teams to deliver amazing new Branded experiences for customers. A CX designer and keen researcher, you’ll engage in the most current methodologies, design practices and technology trends. You’ll have a creative passion for delivering unique brand experiences, combined with a strong commercial acumen and excellent stakeholder relationship skills.§ §About the Company: § §This is a well-known kiwi services business redefining the boundaries where they operate and challenging themselves to do better. They are moving fast, listening to their customers, creating solutions and taking calculated risks.§ § §Apply Now!§ §Here at Tribe, we are currently experiencing an incredibly high volume of applications and it may take us longer than usual to get back to you. It’s outside our normal service levels and we’re sorry for that.§ §In order for us to focus on servicing candidates and clients to the highest possible standards, we encourage all expressions of interest to be made via this advert. This will ensure your information reaches the correct consultant in a timely manner and we will respond to you as quickly as possible. Thanks so much for your patience during this time.§ §Caitlin Menzies – §caitlin@tribegroup.com§ §To apply for this vacancy you MUST be a New Zealand citizen, resident, or have already secured the right to work in New Zealand and therefore hold a valid visa.§§§§

jobTitle: Bid Writer / Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50783891.txt	§Bid Writer / Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Bid Writer / Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Emergent & Co Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Bid Writer / Coordinator §      §One of New Zealand’s largest employers is on the hunt for a content writer with great coordination skills to join their innovative and high performing team. You will be part of a diverse, well respected business who have created and exceptional working environment that encourages growth and development.§  §This is a huge opportunity for someone with a passion for writing, who is inquisitive with an exceptional eye for detail. You will be part of a project team who are passionate about executing amazing proposals and winning large projects so the opportunity for learning is huge!§Working with a bid team you will be writing content and managing the communications for all new tender processes. You can expect to be spending 70% of your time writing, clear, succinct and accurate tender documents, in collaboration with subject matter experts. §  §Ultimately this a chance for you to use your research, writing and communication skills to present well refined, polished documents on new tenders for some of New Zealand’s most exciting projects.§  §The successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to work in a fast paced, deadline driven environment. You will need to be a self-starter who can work autonomously and have effective coordinating skills, strong business acumen and the ability to work under pressure.§While having experience in a bids role is advantageous we are open to hearing from you if you have had experience in journalism, marketing, communications, policy, project coordination.§  §The key duties include:§        §          §Manage and collate information for tender submissions§          §Writing clear and accurate copy for tender submissions§          §Proof documentation and make relevant changes§          §Organising meetings and presentations for the Tender team§          §Participate in post tender submission reviews and feedback§          §Participate in wider project meetings§          §Liaise with internal and external stakeholders§        § §To be successful in this role you ideally have the following:§        §          §Advantageous if experience in a relevant role ie: bids/proposal, communications or other relevant role§          §Previous project coordination experience§          §Strong writing and excellent communication skills§          §Demonstrate strategic thinking, planning and coordinating ability§          §A good eye for detail is a MUST§          §Exceptional organisational skills and the ability to work to tight deadlines§          §A natural and enthusiastic team player with a positive attitude and willingness to work collaboratively to deliver outstanding results§        § Emergent Business Support & Legal specialises in providing experienced and skilled temporary and permanent staff to a wide variety of businesses. We recruit for some of New Zealand's leading organisations, across New Zealand. Our team are a long-standing, well-established team of recruitment professionals. We offer a fresh approach to recruitment and we are passionate about what we do. Our brand is synonymous with quality and professionalism.§   §We will take the time to listen to individual requirements, ensuring that we understand you - in order to match you to a great role, one that fits with your requirements in as many ways as possible.  §   §For more information on this role and other opportunities, please visit www.emergent.co.nz. Please follow and like our Emergent Business Support & Legal page on LinkedIn and Facebook for news and regular updates on available roles. §    §Please note: It is a requirement that you must already hold a NZ Passport or valid working visa to apply for this role.§      §      §Kate Corkery §    §  §§§One of New Zealand’s largest employers is on the hunt for a content writer with great coordination skills to join their innovative and high performing team. You will be part of a diverse, well respected business who have created and exceptional working environment that encourages growth and development.§  §This is a huge opportunity for someone with a passion for writing, who is inquisitive with an exceptional eye for detail. You will be part of a project team who are passionate about executing amazing proposals and winning large projects so the opportunity for learning is huge!§Working with a bid team you will be writing content and managing the communications for all new tender processes. You can expect to be spending 70% of your time writing, clear, succinct and accurate tender documents, in collaboration with subject matter experts. §  §Ultimately this a chance for you to use your research, writing and communication skills to present well refined, polished documents on new tenders for some of New Zealand’s most exciting projects.§  §The successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to work in a fast paced, deadline driven environment. You will need to be a self-starter who can work autonomously and have effective coordinating skills, strong business acumen and the ability to work under pressure.§While having experience in a bids role is advantageous we are open to hearing from you if you have had experience in journalism, marketing, communications, policy, project coordination.§  §The key duties include:§ § §Manage and collate information for tender submissions§ §Writing clear and accurate copy for tender submissions§ §Proof documentation and make relevant changes§ §Organising meetings and presentations for the Tender team§ §Participate in post tender submission reviews and feedback§ §Participate in wider project meetings§ §Liaise with internal and external stakeholders§ § §To be successful in this role you ideally have the following:§ § §Advantageous if experience in a relevant role ie: bids/proposal, communications or other relevant role§ §Previous project coordination experience§ §Strong writing and excellent communication skills§ §Demonstrate strategic thinking, planning and coordinating ability§ §A good eye for detail is a MUST§ §Exceptional organisational skills and the ability to work to tight deadlines§ §A natural and enthusiastic team player with a positive attitude and willingness to work collaboratively to deliver outstanding results§ § Emergent Business Support & Legal specialises in providing experienced and skilled temporary and permanent staff to a wide variety of businesses. We recruit for some of New Zealand's leading organisations, across New Zealand. Our team are a long-standing, well-established team of recruitment professionals. We offer a fresh approach to recruitment and we are passionate about what we do. Our brand is synonymous with quality and professionalism.§   §We will take the time to listen to individual requirements, ensuring that we understand you - in order to match you to a great role, one that fits with your requirements in as many ways as possible.  §   §For more information on this role and other opportunities, please visit www.emergent.co.nz. Please follow and like our Emergent Business Support & Legal page on LinkedIn and Facebook for news and regular updates on available roles. §    §Please note: It is a requirement that you must already hold a NZ Passport or valid working visa to apply for this role.§§§§

Additionally, 20-30% of your time will be spent working with the General Manager of their property business on their marketing activity - property management, project management and investment. § §Our client has developed the brand and marketing plans, but now we're after someone who can execute the plan, while also coming up with new initiatives in the future. § §Responsibilities include:§ § §Develop along side the management team and consultants the strategic marketing plan§ §Execute the companies strategic marketing plan§ §Plan, manage and execute centre and company events § §Act as the liaison between external marketing companies and management § §Manage the marketing and communications budget§ §Coordinate social media activities and accounts, and develop and implement an online brand strategy§ §Develop brand strategies and oversee content creation§ §Prepare proposals and client communication § §Deal with outside stakeholders and their integration into the brand § §Support management in other tasks as required§ §Our client has a social and fun office environment that will suit someone who is keen to have a varied role across multiple commercial activities. They don't take themselves too seriously, so the culture fit will be one of the deciding factors when choosing the right candidate. § §NO POINT APPLYING IF YOU DON'T HAVE A VALID NZ WORK VISA :).§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a project coordinator?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: External Communications Advisor Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50791367.txt	§External Communications Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§External Communications Advisor§§Advertiser: §Fullers Group Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Public Relations & Corporate Affairs§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §External Communications Advisor §      §        §About us: §        §Sometimes we feel the need to pinch ourselves. Because that’s us, out there. On the Gulf. And getting paid for it. §Fullers360 was born of a love for the Hauraki Gulf in 1981. 35 years downwind, our network unifies the entire Gulf. Through a reliable network and the passion of 350 crew and staff, Fullers360 ferries nearly 6 million people every year, getting commuters to work and visitors to play. §        § §        §Our Purpose:§ §        §Unifying the Hauraki Gulf by bringing together friends and whanau, supporting communities and businesses, opening up treasured destinations and sharing our local taonga.§        § §        §About the role:§        §Reporting to the Communications and Content Manager, the principal role of our External Communications Advisor is to take the lead in external communications activity. You will also naturally support internal communications.§        §As the first point of contact for media relations and PR, you will support the Communications and Content Manager to promote a positive public image and build on existing partnerships to form meaningful PR scenarios.  §        §Get ready, for the role is filled with variety and brimming with PR opportunities to tell our special story.§        §You are encouraged to contribute and influence the exciting direction we’re heading in, from this highly visible role. §        §If you are passionate about making an impact through driving external comms, then this role is for you!§        §Essential Skills:§        §Essential to your success in this role:§        §          §You will be tertiary qualified in a relevant field§          §Have a minimum of 5 years work experience in a relevant communications discipline, with experience in external PR§        §        §          §Be an expert in NZ media landscape and use of owned, earned and paid channels for maximum reach§          §Demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills with strong attention to detail§          §Be passionate about storytelling and driving proactive engagement§          §Have a talent for issues management and problem solving§          §Demonstrate the ability to develop meaningful relationships both with internal and external stakeholders§          §Knack for storytelling§          §Strong media contacts§          §Agency experience preferred but not required §        §        § §        §Benefits:§        §Fullers offer many benefits including:§        §          §Discounted gym membership§          §Discounted healthcare§          §Free ferry travel for commuting§          §Special ferry benefits for leisure§        §        § §        §Our Company Values:§        §Welcoming - There’s nothing we love more than being able to call the Hauraki Gulf home. But sharing it with others comes pretty close.§        §Restless - We’re hungry for innovation and excellence and always on the look-out for The Better Way.§        §Safe & Shipshape - Our operations run like clockwork, so we can look after those on board.§        §Straight up - We say what we mean, and we do what we say.§        §Owning it - We’re an efficient team and rely on each other. And people rely on us for a seamless experience. Let’s not let them down.§        §Company Culture:§        §As an organisation, we encourage our people to always treat others with respect, to act with integrity, to be open and trustworthy, and to use good judgment. Our people work hard, approach problems as challenges and learn from their successes as well as their failures. We’re friendly and welcoming, and the pride of being a part of our Fullers360 team radiates through our people and shows in their enthusiasm for everything they do!§        §Please note: Any information you provide will be used to evaluate your suitability to this position. We will hold onto your details for any future opportunities unless asked otherwis§      §      §      §    §  §§§About us: § §Sometimes we feel the need to pinch ourselves. Because that’s us, out there. On the Gulf. And getting paid for it. §Fullers360 was born of a love for the Hauraki Gulf in 1981. 35 years downwind, our network unifies the entire Gulf. Through a reliable network and the passion of 350 crew and staff, Fullers360 ferries nearly 6 million people every year, getting commuters to work and visitors to play. § § § §Our Purpose:§ § §Unifying the Hauraki Gulf by bringing together friends and whanau, supporting communities and businesses, opening up treasured destinations and sharing our local taonga.§ § § §About the role:§ §Reporting to the Communications and Content Manager, the principal role of our External Communications Advisor is to take the lead in external communications activity. You will also naturally support internal communications.§ §As the first point of contact for media relations and PR, you will support the Communications and Content Manager to promote a positive public image and build on existing partnerships to form meaningful PR scenarios.  § §Get ready, for the role is filled with variety and brimming with PR opportunities to tell our special story.§ §You are encouraged to contribute and influence the exciting direction we’re heading in, from this highly visible role. § §If you are passionate about making an impact through driving external comms, then this role is for you!§ §Essential Skills:§ §Essential to your success in this role:§ § §You will be tertiary qualified in a relevant field§ §Have a minimum of 5 years work experience in a relevant communications discipline, with experience in external PR§ §Be an expert in NZ media landscape and use of owned, earned and paid channels for maximum reach§ §Demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills with strong attention to detail§ §Be passionate about storytelling and driving proactive engagement§ §Have a talent for issues management and problem solving§ §Demonstrate the ability to develop meaningful relationships both with internal and external stakeholders§ §Knack for storytelling§ §Strong media contacts§ §Agency experience preferred but not required § § § §Benefits:§ §Fullers offer many benefits including:§ § §Discounted gym membership§ §Discounted healthcare§ §Free ferry travel for commuting§ §Special ferry benefits for leisure§ § § §Our Company Values:§ §Welcoming - There’s nothing we love more than being able to call the Hauraki Gulf home. But sharing it with others comes pretty close.§ §Restless - We’re hungry for innovation and excellence and always on the look-out for The Better Way.§ §Safe & Shipshape - Our operations run like clockwork, so we can look after those on board.§ §Straight up - We say what we mean, and we do what we say.§ §Owning it - We’re an efficient team and rely on each other. And people rely on us for a seamless experience. Let’s not let them down.§ §Company Culture:§ §As an organisation, we encourage our people to always treat others with respect, to act with integrity, to be open and trustworthy, and to use good judgment. Our people work hard, approach problems as challenges and learn from their successes as well as their failures. We’re friendly and welcoming, and the pride of being a part of our Fullers360 team radiates through our people and shows in their enthusiasm for everything they do!§ §Please note: Any information you provide will be used to evaluate your suitability to this position. We will hold onto your details for any future opportunities unless asked otherwis§§§§

jobText: TXT/50791222.txt	§Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Consult Recruitment Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Marketing Manager §      §Beneficial Insurance Limited was established in 2002 and is 100% New Zealand owned and operated, and is dedicated to providing insurance products designed to meet your Insurance needs and insure what is important to you.§   § You’ll probably recognise us for being the largest speciality insurer for your pets; Pet-n-Sur; offering peace of mind and easy to use protection for some of your most valuable and vulnerable assets, your pets! §   § In this newly created role, you’ll get to work with a massive database of petlovers, and motorheads to deliver targeted and effective marketing campaigns using a full range of your marketing knowledge and toolbox. §   § Reporting to the CEO, and as part of the senior management team, you will also be responsible for working with a large team of telesales professionals who are dedicated to working with our customer base to make insurance simple, affordable and there when you need it. §   §        §          §Review, develop and implement a short, mid and long-term marketing framework and strategy.§          §Manage the CRM system for maximum efficiency, generating leads, and specific content using segmentation marketing strategies for effective and highly targeted digital campaigns and newsletters.§          §Work in partnership with key clients (Vets, Breeders) to conceptualise and execute campaigns that target both our existing client base and prospective clients§          §Develop creative briefs and guide creative direction to meet objectives for all advertising and public-­facing communications, including print, digital, and media assets.§          §Website content and design.§          §Collaborate with the sales team to inform marketing strategies, increase client conversions, and generate more qualified leads§          §Develop thought leadership / industry engagement campaigns and manage events programs.§        § Ideally you’ll come from a demonstrated base marketing background, where you have designed innovative and effective customer acquisition and retention strategies, with a close eye for ROI per campaigns. You’ll be expected to be digitally savvy, with a keen eye for integration with traditional marketing activities that generate high customer awareness and brand effectiveness. Experience with subscription marketing and or insurance/ banking would be highly desirable. §   § This is an exciting and autonomous role, based in the heart of Auckland city (with a carpark) where you can take total responsibility for a marketing strategy and work for a market leading brand with pets at the forefront of it!§      §      §Richard Gray-Smith§021303665§ §    §    §  §§§Beneficial Insurance Limited was established in 2002 and is 100% New Zealand owned and operated, and is dedicated to providing insurance products designed to meet your Insurance needs and insure what is important to you.§   § You’ll probably recognise us for being the largest speciality insurer for your pets; Pet-n-Sur; offering peace of mind and easy to use protection for some of your most valuable and vulnerable assets, your pets! §   § In this newly created role, you’ll get to work with a massive database of petlovers, and motorheads to deliver targeted and effective marketing campaigns using a full range of your marketing knowledge and toolbox. §   § Reporting to the CEO, and as part of the senior management team, you will also be responsible for working with a large team of telesales professionals who are dedicated to working with our customer base to make insurance simple, affordable and there when you need it. §   § § §Review, develop and implement a short, mid and long-term marketing framework and strategy.§ §Manage the CRM system for maximum efficiency, generating leads, and specific content using segmentation marketing strategies for effective and highly targeted digital campaigns and newsletters.§ §Work in partnership with key clients (Vets, Breeders) to conceptualise and execute campaigns that target both our existing client base and prospective clients§ §Develop creative briefs and guide creative direction to meet objectives for all advertising and public-­facing communications, including print, digital, and media assets.§ §Website content and design.§ §Collaborate with the sales team to inform marketing strategies, increase client conversions, and generate more qualified leads§ §Develop thought leadership / industry engagement campaigns and manage events programs.§ § Ideally you’ll come from a demonstrated base marketing background, where you have designed innovative and effective customer acquisition and retention strategies, with a close eye for ROI per campaigns. You’ll be expected to be digitally savvy, with a keen eye for integration with traditional marketing activities that generate high customer awareness and brand effectiveness. Experience with subscription marketing and or insurance/ banking would be highly desirable. §   § This is an exciting and autonomous role, based in the heart of Auckland city (with a carpark) where you can take total responsibility for a marketing strategy and work for a market leading brand with pets at the forefront of it!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing manager?§§§

experience: A proven track record of experience (5 years

jobText: TXT/50785561.txt	§Principal Advisor Marketing Communications§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Advisor Marketing Communications§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Principal Advisor Marketing Communications §      §        §          §Do you enjoy starting in on the ground of an initiative and being part of the success and enabling it to grow?§          §Do you enjoy working in a flexible working environment within a group recognised for having one of the highest engagement scores in the public sector§          §Do you have deep experience leading the design, development and delivery of integrated communications programmes?§          §Permanent fulltime role.  Wellington based§          §Salary range $110K - $135K depending on experience§        §        § §        §About the role§        §The Principal Advisor Marketing and Communications is responsible for leading the design, development and delivery of an integrated communications programme to increase engagement with varied audiences, raise awareness and encourage adoption of e-Invoicing in New Zealand. They will be responsible for identifying key communications issues and risks to the programme as well as identifying creative ways to grow interest among businesses (large and small) and key stakeholders. .§        §This role requires an experienced communications professional who has knowledge and experience utilising the full range of communication skills and has the ability to identify the appropriate channels and medium to engage with stakeholders, partners and customers to grow adoption of e-Invoicing.§        §The role requires the Principal Advisor Marketing and Communications to provide strategic communications and engagement advice to the Manager Operations & Promotion and Director e-Invoicing. The Principal Advisor will also be responsible for developing and implementing an effective integrated communications programme recognising the different audiences and their communications needs. The role is supported by a Promotions Support Advisor to deliver the plans.§        §The role will ideally suit a Marketing Communications professional who is a quick study - someone who is comfortable with breaking new ground and uncertainty with changing plans. As new information and knowledge is gained it may require the team to pivot quickly. Ideally you will have experience using communications to encourage the uptake of products, services, or initiatives in the public or private sector.§        §The role involves:§        §          §Design, develop and deliver an integrated communications programme for e-Invoicing that recognises the broad mix of audiences§          §Provide strategic advice and high level input into e-Invoicing planning and strategies.§          §Work collaboratively with the Engagement, Communications and Ministerial Services (ECOMs) Branch to ensure consistency in messaging and develop and deliver internal and external customer engagement strategies and tools.§          §Builds and maintains effective relationships and partnerships with internal and external stakeholders and customers, as necessary, in order to promote e-Invoicing.§          §Approve all marketing and creative briefs and the creative development process. Initial sign-off on all creative materials before submitting to the business owner.§          §Undertaking proactive internal and external communications planning; and risk and issues management.§          §Quality-assured budget setting rationale, KPI setting and outcome measurement across all programme initiatives and activities.§        §        § §        §Skills and experience required§        §          §Substantial experience in marketing and communications having delivered innovative high impact communications across multi-media channels. This will include traditional marketing as well as digital and social media.§          §Demonstrated experience in developing and maintaining an environment focused on continuous improvement to enhance organisational performance.§          §Demonstrated experience in controlling, monitoring and evaluating the content of communication products to ensure quality, consistency and accessibility of messages.§          §Proven ability to use, and provide advice on, a mix of engagement, digital and marketing systems and tools to provide effective engagement solutions.§          §Proven ability to work closely with delivery staff to ensure that the customer experience is understood and reflected in communications development and implementation.§          §A proven track record of experience (5 years or more) achieving  uptake of products, services, initiatives and / or behaviour change through effective communications strategy and implementation.§          §Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, and the ability to present information and ideas in a way that is effective and engaging to a wide range of audiences;§          §Must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand§        §        § §        §Why work for us?§        §This is a rare opportunity to lead the design, development and delivery of the communications strategy within the e-Invoicing team - an initiative that is new to Australasia so you will be instrumental fostering the environment to encourage uptake of e-Invoicing in NZ.§        §The Finance & Performance Group of MBIE has the highest staff engagement score within MBIE and one of the highest engagement scores in the Public Sector. We also take the time to create a work environment that is enjoyable for all.  This means we like to have fun but at the same time we take responsibility for our actions, encourage excellence and proactively support development through on-the-job learning, training courses, conferences and seminars, development programmes, secondments and study opportunities.§        § §        § About MBIE§        §The purpose of the Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment (MBIE) is to Grow New Zealand for All.  Our goal is to create a strong and high-performing economy by creating an environment that supports businesses to become more productive and internationally competitive.§        §The e-Invoicing programme sits within the Finance and Performance branch, and reports to the Chief Financial Officer. The Principal Advisor will also be responsible for developing and implementing an effective integrated communications programme recognising the different audiences and their communications needs. The role is supported by a Promotions Support Advisor to deliver the plans.§The role will ideally suit a Marketing Communications professional who is a quick study - someone who is comfortable with breaking new ground and uncertainty with changing plans. As new information and knowledge is gained it may require the team to pivot quickly. Ideally you will have experience using communications to encourage the uptake of products, services, or initiatives in the public or private sector.§The role involves:§§Design, develop and deliver an integrated communications programme for e-Invoicing that recognises the broad mix of audiences§Provide strategic advice and high level input into e-Invoicing planning and strategies.§Work collaboratively with the Engagement, Communications and Ministerial Services (ECOMs) Branch to ensure consistency in messaging and develop and deliver internal and external customer engagement strategies and tools.§Builds and maintains effective relationships and partnerships with internal and external stakeholders and customers, as necessary, in order to promote e-Invoicing.§Approve all marketing and creative briefs and the creative development process. Initial sign-off on all creative materials before submitting to the business owner.§Undertaking proactive internal and external communications planning; and risk and issues management.§Quality-assured budget setting rationale, KPI setting and outcome measurement across all programme initiatives and activities.§§ §Skills and experience required§§Substantial experience in marketing and communications having delivered innovative high impact communications across multi-media channels. jobText: TXT/50786649.txt	§Marketing Manager - Growth and Performance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Manager - Growth and Performance§§Advertiser: §The PCOS Nutritionist Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Do you want to be part of a team that improves women's health outcomes? We work with women with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) to help them understand their bodies and manage their condition.   We’re building a digital-first, holistic healthcare service to change the way PCOS is managed. §We are committed to changing health outcomes for people with PCOS, globally and at the same time, fostering a team that’s compassionate, bold, innovative and diverse. We’re an evidence based organisation that cares a ridiculous amount about our customers. We love nothing more than firing off a virtual glitter cannon whenever our customers see their symptoms improve.  §This Marketing Manager - Growth and Performance role is a new role that will be responsible for co-designing and driving the strategic marketing direction. Reporting to the CEO this role will be focused on delivering results through the use of digitally led channels to achieve our growth objectives. Some of your main responsibilities will include;§Design and implement paid digital marketing campaigns §Optimisation of our websites to ensure the best outcomes for our customers§Develop and execute the overall digital marketing strategy, to best align with our goals and show up where our customers are hanging out§Build brand awareness and convert leads to drive growth and impact§Work with our content and community manager to create and oversee compelling content creation that adds value to our customers and is aligned to our business goals §Develop, drive and maintain key performance metric reporting and overall marketing budgets§About you§We are looking for someone who has proven technical marketing experience and can demonstrate their ability to grow brands and top line performance.  You’ll have a highly technical skill-set, with experience in conversion rate optimisation, A/B testing landing pages, project managing and overseeing site re-builds, and smashing digital sales targets.§You’ll be passionate about women’s health and using the most relevant platforms to get our content in front of the women who need it the most. You’ll be commercially savvy and have at least 7 years of marketing experience.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing manager?§§§

That's why we work so hard to look after our region and the people who live and work in the Waikato region.§ §Customers sit at the heart of everything we do, and all staff have an important role to play in the delivery of exceptional customer service. §Our work is as diverse as the region we care for; from the tip of the Coromandel Peninsula to the slopes of Ruapehu. We've got ambitious goals and there are some tricky issues, but that's what makes it so interesting.§        §We are seeking an exceptional and highly credible leader who can demonstrate experience developing and successfully implementing communications, engagement, and customer-focused strategies in an organisation with complex accountabilities and a diverse range of stakeholders.§        §We're looking for someone who…§        §          §Has proven experience of achieving challenging outcomes through the successful leadership of team leaders, and multi-disciplinary teams§          §Has a strong focus and commitment to understand and meet the needs of customers§          §Has a strategic mindset and a proven ability to turn strategy into action§          §Is passionate about shaping meaningful engagement and communications strategies for our communities§          §Has a track record of success in marketing, communications, stakeholder engagement, internal communications and working with the media§          §Is highly self-aware, confident, resilient, and capable of building relationships at all levels in an organisation§          §Possesses a relevant qualification in communications, media, public relations, or similar§        §        §The Communications and Engagement Section consists of the Communications, Customer, Partnership, and Education teams. Its primary purpose is to inform and raise awareness of the council's role in the Waikato region, and to enhance councils' relationships with the community and stakeholders.§        §The Manager, Communications and Engagement reports to the Director Community and Services and holds primary responsibility for developing, implementing, and monitoring communication strategies that align with, and support Council's strategic direction and corporate plan. The role also leads the customer and stakeholder centre of excellence through the development and implementation of strategic frameworks, and tools that enable effective Iwi, customer, partnership, and stakeholder engagement.§        §This is a senior role with significant complexity. Applicants will possess a relevant tertiary qualification in marketing, communications, public relations or similar and have at least 5 years' experience leading teams, developing, and implementing effective communications and/or stakeholder engagement strategies.§        §The successful candidate will be innovative, efficient, and effective in the development and delivery of the services and programmes that the communications and engagement team are accountable for. The role is responsible for a large team (approx. 30). Ideally, candidates will also have experience working with Iwi and Council organisations.§        §As a leader of community and stakeholder relationships, candidates will need to demonstrate success building strategically important relationships including with iwi and resolving issues with internal and external stakeholders so excellent verbal and written communication skills are vital.§        §If this role sounds, like you then we would like to hear from you§        §Check out some of the awesome people we work with and apply online via §waikatoregion.govt.nz§/careers§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§We want more good people to come and do great things with us. §We love where we live. We've got ambitious goals and there are some tricky issues, but that's what makes it so interesting.§ §We are seeking an exceptional and highly credible leader who can demonstrate experience developing and successfully implementing communications, engagement, and customer-focused strategies in an organisation with complex accountabilities and a diverse range of stakeholders.§ §We're looking for someone who…§ § §Has proven experience of achieving challenging outcomes through the successful leadership of team leaders, and multi-disciplinary teams§ §Has a strong focus and commitment to understand and meet the needs of customers§ §Has a strategic mindset and a proven ability to turn strategy into action§ §Is passionate about shaping meaningful engagement and communications strategies for our communities§ §Has a track record of success in marketing, communications, stakeholder engagement, internal communications and working with the media§ §Is highly self-aware, confident, resilient, and capable of building relationships at all levels in an organisation§ §Possesses a relevant qualification in communications, media, public relations, or similar§ §The Communications and Engagement Section consists of the Communications, Customer, Partnership, and Education teams. Its primary purpose is to inform and raise awareness of the council's role in the Waikato region, and to enhance councils' relationships with the community and stakeholders.§ §The Manager, Communications and Engagement reports to the Director Community and Services and holds primary responsibility for developing, implementing, and monitoring communication strategies that align with, and support Council's strategic direction and corporate plan. The role also leads the customer and stakeholder centre of excellence through the development and implementation of strategic frameworks, and tools that enable effective Iwi, customer, partnership, and stakeholder engagement.§ §This is a senior role with significant complexity. Applicants will possess a relevant tertiary qualification in marketing, communications, public relations or similar and have at least 5 years' experience leading teams, developing, and implementing effective communications and/or stakeholder engagement strategies.§ §The successful candidate will be innovative, efficient, and effective in the development and delivery of the services and programmes that the communications and engagement team are accountable for. The role is responsible for a large team (approx. 30). Proven leadership of team leaders is essential to succeed in this position, as well as experience working with environmentally or culturally sensitive and confidential issues. Ideally, candidates will also have experience working with Iwi and Council organisations.§ §As a leader of community and stakeholder relationships, candidates will need to demonstrate success building strategically important relationships including with iwi and resolving issues with internal and external stakeholders so excellent verbal and written communication skills are vital.§ §If this role sounds, like you then we would like to hear from you§ §Check out some of the awesome people we work with and apply online via §waikatoregion.govt.nz§/careers§§§§

update teams with information on upcoming promotions/campaigns, seasonal menu changes, non-profit activations, and marketing events.§ § § §Sponsorship requests: vet, manage and fulfill incoming donation and/or sponsorship requests from potential partners that fit within the brand’s budget and overall strategy.§ § § §Proactively recommend new events & activations to continue to grow our community partnerships & relationships with our guests.§ § § §Track sales data for each promotion/event; analyze trends; make recommendations to increase sales/attendance§ § § §Develop marketing collateral for venues as per branding guidelines§ § § §Maintain relationships with current clients and database§ § § §Manage digital asset management for online platforms§ § § §Assist external branding agency with new venue openings and strengthening current brands§ § § §Assist with tactical responsibilities leading up to, during, and after a new restaurant opening, including competitive pricing analysis, assisting in local PR strategy execution, and digital channel updates.§ § § §Manage invite process for VIP events held.§ § § §Ensure across all digital platforms, both internal (website and online ordering platforms) and external (Trip advisor, Open Table, Google), are updated with accurate information and relevant promotional messaging.§ § § §Media Alerts: Distribute earned media coverage to appropriate parties and record coverage for internal use.§ § § §Ownership of social media channels for paid and non-paid activity, including social media calendar development, content/copy creation, photography and posting - including graphic design.§ § § §Community management, including engagement with online communities, responding to guest comments/questions, repost and like similar accounts.§ § § §Working in the office, some day to day administrative tasks will also required§ § §Requirements § § § §A degree, ideally in Communications, Marketing or Business.§ § § §1-2 years of professional work experience, agency or in-house experience preferred. § § § §Passion for the restaurant industry and a keen understanding of traditional and digital marketing.§ § § §Strong attention to detail with excellent organizational and time management capabilities.§ § § §Ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment and be  flexible when it comes to re-prioritizing tasks due to business demands.§ § § §Ability to work well both cross-functionally and collaboratively as a team player and as a self-starter.§ § § §A proactive planner who asks probing questions for project clarity, anticipates potential roadblocks, and escalates project issues appropriately.§ § § § Experience with GSuite, Squarespace, Silverstream, Adobe Suite (Illustrator and Photoshop as a minimum), Google Ads, Google Analytics, and Facebook Business Manager. § § § § §If you’re ready to take the bull by its horns and throw yourself into this rewarding role and to really make it your own, you’ll really fit into our team and we want to hear from you!§If you tick some but not all of the requirements, we’d still love to hear from you. § § § §Applications must include a cover letter. Bonus points for design work or portfolios submitted. § § § §Whilst we are flexible with working hours, ideally this role would be 35-40 hours per week, but given our industries nature, some weekend or after hours work may be required from time to time,§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50801057.txt	§Marketing Guru§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Guru§§Advertiser: §Blick§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§$70,000 - $100,000 pro rata§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Product Management & Development§§§§§§About Blick§ §We are a market leader that has been supplying the Drilling Industry in New Zealand for the last 15 years and steadily growing in Australia for the last five years - we love what we do. We recognise that the world is changing and we have spent the last couple of years changing nearly everything about our business to put the pieces in place to help us build a great business.§  §Our core customer values are the same - we focus on what is important and that’s making our customers successful by ensuring we put everything in place to make it easy to work with us.  We are all about helping our customers to be successful rather than just trying to sell them more products.§  §We have a clear vision of where the business is going but we still have a long way to go so you will have to be resilient to change and have a fire in the belly to be part of making Blick great. Even though we have been successful we don’t even feel like we have got anywhere near our potential. We have got here without having someone who is dedicated to marketing what we do but it is time to have someone join to lead that.§  §We are creating an environment that supports you having true balance in your life - we want to support you in what is important to you outside work as much as inside work.§  §This is an exciting time for our company and this may be that opportunity you look back on as the one that got away - don’t be that person.§  §Who are we looking for you will:§ §like to bring creativity but also fun and personality to the team, our products and the way they are marketed § §have a proven background in marketing across a wide range of marketing disciplines§ §drive the development of markets to enable the sale team to follow through opportunities you create § §are willing to push boundaries, willing to fail and learn and grow quickly with what will work with our products and customers§ §put the customers best interest at the heart of what you do - you do what you say, follow up when you say you will and you create great relationships§ §be excited to learn how all these products and tools work - you will want to get onsite with some of customers to really understand the in’s and out’s§ §have the ability to use a range of platforms to achieve your goals§ §Be Willing to do whatever needs to be done to help make the boat go faster§ §You’ll be able to create a strategy around social media engagement, be part of the delivery and help the team to understand their role§ §You’ll help us maximise our current relationships by creating a playful, innovative and engaging product information and ideas in front of customers § §believe in the power of a team - there is a team behind you making sure you are successful - your job is to make them successful too by doing all the little things that set them up for success§ §appreciate that your job doesn’t finish at the end of the meeting but when you have ensured you have got the outcomes and next steps documented§ §embrace change and always be looking to innovate§ §Forthcoming with your two cents in - we don’t believe in a hierarchy we believe in great outcomes - no matter where they come from§ §want to have some fun at work - it’s not all about the benjamins§ §What can you expect§ §This is a part-time role (20 hours a week) and we can be flexible about timing. You will have a fair salary and all the tools to do your job.§  §A business going to the next level looking for people to be at the forefront of that change§  §Support from our small team in a complex and interesting environment§  §An environment where we want you to challenge and be a part of shaping the future§  §A business focused on making you successful inside and outside work - we want this to be a great place to work and you will be part of making it great§  §We aren't going to promise it is going to be easy working in a small business, it will mean you have to wear lots of hats (not literally) at times and we expect whoever comes in will be a big part of driving the business forward.§§§§

This newly created role is an opportunity to work across prestigious brands in beauty and luxury goods, specifically Guerlain; Montblanc and other incoming new brands.§ §Your goal will be to increase sales and brand awareness through the management of effective marketing plans and campaigns. Reporting to the NZ Business Manager, you will assist with§ § §Development of brands and marketing strategies for brand awareness§ §Optimising marketing and promotional campaigns with a focus on the digital landscape§ §Production of marketing, promotional and POS materials§ §Analysing brand performance, campaigns, competitors’ activities, and consumer trends to provide recommendations for brand development§ §Tracking budgets, pricing and forecasting, product and range optimisation§ §Presentation and execution of creative ideas for marketing activities pertaining to brand building§ §Liaise with retailers to ensure the plans are articulated according to brand standards and complete submissions for their marketing campaigns§ §Reporting to brand holders/suppliers with appropriate analysis§ § § §About You:§ §As a creative marketer, you can help develop strategies, plans & execute marketing campaigns.  You are a digital specialist and have a passion for online marketing and social media.   Your confident, positive manner, energetic, and “can do” attitude are a given. You will need to be extremely focused and have an eye for detail, with exemplary Microsoft Suite skills as you will work inside Excel and PowerPoint daily.§ §An analytical mind and research skills are essential to this job. If you are also an excellent communicator and team player, we would like to meet you.§ §Key Experience we are looking for:§ § §Business, Commerce or Marketing degree§ §3-5 years’ Marketing experience (beauty and luxury goods industry preferred but not essential)§ §Strong commercial awareness and acumen – passionate about analysing numbers and being able to understand business financials§ §Strong PowerPoint and Excel skills, along with digital media experience including social media (essential), experience with SAP (desirable)§ §Experience in marketing products across digital and social media (desirable)§ §Excellent interpersonal and top notch written & verbal communication skills§ §Strong organisation and multi-tasking skills§ § § §This is an excellent opportunity to join a dynamic NZ company with a diverse and exciting portfolio of luxury, beauty and fragrance brands.§ §If you have the skills and creativity we need then please apply in confidence with your current resume by the closing date of Sunday, 8th November 2020.§ § § §Only applicants with the right to legally live and work in NZ are eligible to apply for this role.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Are you experienced with copy writing and content creation?§Which of the following online advertising methods do you have experience with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

This role is an exciting opportunity to contribute to company strategy and have a key role in our expansion and success.§  §Buzz Channel is one of New Zealand's leading customer research and engagement consultancies. We help our clients know their customers and bring their stakeholders' voices into the heart of their organisation. We believe the more an organisation can listen to and understand its customers and communities, and work alongside them to co-create solutions that work, the more that organisation will succeed.§  §Our services cross the spectrum of qualitative and quantitative techniques, with a particular focus on ongoing Customer Experience Management programmes.§  §The client base covers local government, healthcare providers, insurers, financial services, advertising agencies, education and others.§  §In 2020 we started working with a large UK healthcare organisation and expect growth in our patient experience work through the next 12-24 months, particularly in the UK and Australia.§  §Buzz Channel is at the beginning of a growth phase. In the past 12 months we have restructured the company, focusing on the core services and sectors we feel most passionate about, and divesting distractions.§  §This senior position will be exciting and demanding. The successful candidate will contribute to company strategy and have a key role in our expansion and success. Commensurate with these demands a profit share will be available after 12 months of employment, for a candidate showing their impact on business growth.§  §Role Overview§  §The role will take the lead on a range of clients, initially supported by the Buzz Channel operations team and analyst. Over time as the business grows, the Research Director will build a team of direct reports to manage these and new clients.§  §The boutique size of the company means we need people who enjoy and have skills across qualitative and quantitative methods. interpersonal skills, an ability to engage with people from all levels of organisations, outstanding written and spoken communication skills, and a passion for thinking how technology and research can come together to meet the needs of clients.§  §Skills§  §The successful applicant will be able to demonstrate the following skills and qualifications:§ § §Experience in quantitative and qualitative research techniques§ §Strong statistical understanding and ability to derive robust, numbers-based strategies and recommendations.§ §Excellent English grammar, written and verbal communication with strong presentation skills and ability to deal effectively with people at all levels of management§ §Ability to develop and maintain close, positive and effective relationships with clients§ §A flair for creating attractive and engaging presentations and reports displaying key insights in a clear, concise and professional format§ §Good technology skills including high proficiency with Microsoft Office software and experience with statistical analysis software§ §A demonstrable interest in Customer Experience management, including customer journey mapping, driver analysis and best-practice approaches to use customer experiences for organisational improvement.§ §Ability to work well in a team, showing flexibility to help when other teams in the company are under pressure§ §A positive, hard-working, can-do attitude so that we can seize opportunities to meet current and future client needs and grow Buzz Channel’s reputation in the industry.§ §The position reports to the Buzz Channel General Manager.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in market research?§§§
