jobText: TXT/50800790.txt	§Marketing Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Marketing Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Eva Systems Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§A great full-time opportunity to take the next step in your Marketing career.§  §Buildlink Group Limited  is a building supplies Co-Operative buying group comprising 3 brands:  BuildLink, HandiLink and Trowel Trades. With 40 member stores nationally their strength is in their community and rural connections up and down the country and the relationships they have fostered with some of the industries key suppliers.§  §The BuildLink Support Office is a small tight-knit team comprising: General Manager, Financial Manager and Marketing Coordinator based in Westgate, Auckland. This is a hands-on role with the main priority being Marketing but you'll be expected to help in other areas as well. Find out more at www.buildlink.co.nz§  §About the Role:§  §To become a better known national brand we are looking to appoint someone with marketing experience to develop and implement effective brand-building strategies and digital marketing activities.§  §Your goal will be to increase brand awareness through effective brand and marketing campaigns. Reporting to the GM and FM you will assist with:§ § §Development of brands and marketing strategies for brand awareness§ §Work with inhouse graphic designers developing marketing content for: websites, social media, email marketing, promotions, events and catalogues§ §Optimising marketing and promotional campaigns with a focus on the digital landscape§ §Analysing brand performance, campaigns, competitors’ activities, and consumer trends to provide recommendations for brand development§ §Liaise with Suppliers to secure commitment across marketing activities and events§ §Liaise with Members to ensure plans are articulated according to brand standards and to inform them on all marketing activities and events§ §Organising and managing annual conference§ §Assisting with the organisation of the annual event alongside travel agency§ §Assist with national Fieldays§ §Other ad hoc duties as required from time to time§ §Essential key experience and attributes:§ § §3-5 years’ as a Marketing assistant with the view to taking the next step in developing your career§ §Tertiary Qualifications in business and/or marketing§ §Commercial Acumen – you need to know if your actions will improve the bottom line§ §Great communication skills with both members and suppliers via phone and email to encourage marketing support for the Group§ §Strong writing skills and experience in writing marketing content for websites and social media§ §Strong organisation and multi-tasking skills§ §Strong attention to detail§ §A genuine respectful person who enjoys talking with people and building relationships§ §Passionate about what they do with a high work ethic§ §Cool calm and collected§ § §  §In a nutshell§  §You already have good marketing understanding but you are also an all-rounder that thrives in variety and loves to help others and make a difference.§  §Someone that is respectful and enjoys building relationships with people.§  §You'll be working with a lot of stakeholders (members, suppliers and others) and managing/coordinating the annual conference and event so you are relaxed and calm under pressure.§  §You are someone that prefers working in a very small team environment and is capable of self managing and getting on with things.§  § §  §If this sounds like you and you have a positive mindset, please apply by the closing date of Friday 6th of November 2020.§  §Planned start date is January 11th 2021§  §Please email your cv to §greg@buildlink.co.nz§  §Only applicants with the right to legally live and work in NZ are eligible to apply for this role.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How would you rate your English language skills?§§§

jobTitle: Social Media & Content Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50794075.txt	§Social Media & Content Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Media & Content Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Kester Black§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$20 - $29.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§A bit about us:§  §Would you like the opportunity to really make a difference and have a great time doing it? At Kester Black, our success comes from our highly motivated team who are intelligent, ambitious and determined. §  §Kester Black exists to lead a change for the better in the global beauty industry. To create ethical, cruelty-free products that don’t just help people feel good, but also do good for the world. (vegan) brownie points for all.§  §A bit about the role:§  §We are currently seeking a Social Media and Content Coordinator to join our team. You will be responsible for sharing and expressing our brand in an authentic and engaging way, connecting with customers and encouraging them to fall in love with and share what we’re about. Ultimately to grow our social following, organise search and support our overall conversions when people check us out they believe what we’re about. Primarily for instagram, facebook and email, the content must be our unique take on the world and be on point for each channel. This position is for 30 hours a week. §  §What you will do at Kester Black:§ § §Be on the pulse of what our customers are thinking, feeling, doing§ §Create relevant and engaging content for Kester Black's socials using your photography and graphic design skills§ §Create engagements not posts, using polls, questions, live videos to connect§ §Integrate the latest trends, topics and styles our community are all about§ §Respond to comments, queries and encourage reviews§ §Monitor our channels daily, and be the first to spot a new opportunity to engage§ §Connect with mega and micro influencers § §Work with marketing, ecommerce and creative team members to improve all aspects of our marketing§ §Publish content on our website to maximise conversion and customer experience§ §Create social and email content, working with our designer and existing assets§ §A bit about you: §  §You’re highly motivated, love all things beauty and social media, have first-class communication skills and love nothing more than coming up with amazing content ideas. You're authentic and fun, and have a keen eye for design.§ § §Simply put, you're a delight§ §You’ve made real friends on social media before § §You have an eye for design and an understanding of how to visually communicate brand messaging§ §You're a whizz at taking excellent photos and know how to style them to perfection§ §You have some graphic design skills and are familiar with Adobe suite.§ §You’re a naturally hilarious content maker with TONS of ideas§ §People will want to come to our social pages JUST so they can speak with you§ §You have a secret love of Tech and are hungry to be part of a fast-growing amazing beauty brand§ §You play hard and fast: § § §You’re highly organised and detail orientated§ §You know how to stay nimble in order to react to great content, and you share your insights with the team to keep us all informed and accountable§ §You keep up with latest trends and social media news and you’ll be the first to jump on a viral trend and make it on-brand§ §You’re a super strategiser: § § §You’re an expert in what makes social audiences tick § §You know how to meld industry best practice with our brand to create and implement a kick-butt social strategy§ §You’re a self-learner, and you ensure that we’re asking the right questions about our content, the way it performs, and the way it represents our brand § §You can take learnings from past posts and apply them to inform and guide future decisions§ §Why you should work with us§  §Working at Kester Black you'll be part of a fast start-up culture and of a new movement to disrupt the e-commerce beauty industry. Working with like-minded problem solvers who love what they do. The Kester Black values are:§  §We play as a team.§  §Driven by our shared values, we’re stronger together, so we work as one: pooling our ideas and passions, and sharing our challenges, opportunities and snacks.§  §We’re better every day.§  §We’re proud of where we’ve been, but we’re even prouder of where we’re going – whether that’s an improvement to a formula, a new course to enrol in, or a new flexible way of working. We never stop learning, never stop tinkering, never stop improving our products, our brand, our workplace and ourselves. §  §We consider others.§  §Before we’re a brand or a business, we’re a bunch of people, and we like to think we’re pretty nice ones. That means we do the right thing, behaving in a way that would make our mums proud: with integrity, honesty and empathy for each other, our customers, our environment and ourselves. (Insert back-patting here.)§  §Some extra goodies:§ § §Work from home§ §Work alongside an experienced team who will challenge you every day (and expect you to challenge them back)§ §Generous staff discounts§ §At Kester Black, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and our culture of personal achievement and wellbeing provides the opportunity for a fulfilling career.§  §If you feel as though you meet all of the criteria above and are keen to join the team, please send your CV and cover letter to §hello@kesterblack.com§, before the 1st November 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§§§

It's small enough to feel like you're part of a community, but big enough to ensure that there's always something going on. From the great outdoors to arts, culture and education, all within 10 minutes of the city centre. Dunedin has so much to offer, so why not come and feel just how special it is?§      §Events Advisor (Civic and Community) §      §        §Full-time, permanent role (37.5 hours per week)§        §If you’re looking for a fulfilling role with a great team, you’re an experienced events practitioner and you’re prepared to be flexible, and work on some key public holidays, read on.§        §The Events Advisor role will lead coordination of the city’s New Year’s Eve, ANZAC Day and other Civic events as part of the city’s annual events programme. The Events Advisor will assess grant applications for the events sector and work with stakeholders to create long-lasting positive relationships.§        §The successful candidate will be both process and customer focused to assist event organisers through Council processes. This is a role for someone who wants to work in a busy, caring and can-do team, and can work within regulations to deliver safe and vibrant events for the city.§        §To be short-listed you will have at least five years’ experience running events and events budgets. You will be a self-starter but able to work collaboratively, have an eye for detail and a solutions approach to risks and problems. You must have undertaken Health & Safety training. You will be an exceptional verbal and written communicator. §        §If this sounds like you, please apply by Sunday, 8 November 2020.  §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Full-time, permanent role (37.5 hours per week)§ §If you’re looking for a fulfilling role with a great team, you’re an experienced events practitioner and you’re prepared to be flexible, and work on some key public holidays, read on.§ §The Events Advisor role will lead coordination of the city’s New Year’s Eve, ANZAC Day and other Civic events as part of the city’s annual events programme. The Events Advisor will assess grant applications for the events sector and work with stakeholders to create long-lasting positive relationships.§ §The successful candidate will be both process and customer focused to assist event organisers through Council processes. This is a role for someone who wants to work in a busy, caring and can-do team, and can work within regulations to deliver safe and vibrant events for the city.§ §To be short-listed you will have at least five years’ experience running events and events budgets. You will be a self-starter but able to work collaboratively, have an eye for detail and a solutions approach to risks and problems. jobText: TXT/50791557.txt	§Digital Marketing Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Actionstep New Zealand Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Other§§§§§§Actionstep is a fast growing, dynamic Saas business with a global customer base and team. We specialise in the delivery of Legal Practice Management software to ambitious law firms around the globe. §We are looking for a super-star §Digital Marketing Coordinator§ to run our social media, events and email marketing activities within our Marketing team. This role is a fantastic opportunity for an ambitious digital marketer to join a growing technology business and carve out a crucial position in this NZ founded company, as we continue to expand our footprint in international markets.§Our people have a passion for innovating, the courage to break new ground, and a fundamental belief in delivering unquestionable value to our clients. If that sounds like you, read on...§§What you will be doing...§Working closely with other members of the global marketing team, you will coordinate and execute content marketing campaigns via email, social media and publishing partners. You will work closely with our digital marketing manager on the delivery of campaigns via search and other paid channels.  You will also drive and coordinate our community building activity via virtual and in-person events, sponsorships, social media engagement & published communications. You will be laser focused on building awareness of Actionstep and driving lead generation.§This will all be achieved by...§Email/Direct Marketing§: Work with product team and marketing manager to plan content for schedule of regular product emails for customers and prospects.§Social media§: Build and maintain social media presence and engagement through a schedule of weekly communications and by increasing community engagement through social channels. §Content Publishing: §Coordinate publishing calendar and content requirements for 3rd party publishing, sponsorships and blog articles. Work to ensure deadlines and criteria are met. Collaborate inter-departmentally on product related content creation.§Events:§ Coordinate webinar, event & tradeshow schedules, work cross-departmentally to coordinate content & speaker requirements. Manage RSVPs and attendee communications.§Campaign landing pages§: Use landing page builder tools to create event & campaign landing pages based on criteria.§Experiments§: Execute, and measure A/B and multivariate experiments and conversion tests on landing page, email & social content. Pivot tactics based on results. Maintain a growth mindset - learn and iterate.§Reporting systems§: Measure, interpret and report (in plain language) on the performance of these marketing campaigns against campaign goals (ROI and KPIs).§Digital Champion§: Over time, become an internal coach for staff using digital channels and tools to promote our products and interpret results. Brainstorm new and creative growth strategies with colleagues§What you need to know and what will make you successful...§3-4 years' prior experience in a similar role - ideally in a Saas or product business§BS/MS degree in marketing or a related field§Experience using Hubspot or a similar inbound marketing, CRM and/or email marketing system is required.§Demonstrable written communication skills - ability to tailor style to audience.§Willingness to learn how to use new marketing technology tools such as landing page & email design tools, editing suites, analytics tools§Familiarity with creation & optimization of landing pages.§Experience with event coordination§Analytical and data-driven thinking skills§Experience with A/B and multivariate experiments§We have a fantastic and inspirational working environment!§Flexible working§Wear what you like to work.§Take your birthday off.§Friday afternoon socials and frequent team building events.§Outstanding offices in great locations being close to the Viaduct, Britomart, Commercial Bay, and the city centre.§Relaxed and friendly team who genuinely care about each other§Fantastic training and development opportunities.§About Actionstep§Actionstep is an award-winning, SaaS tech company, whose mission is to deliver the world's most advanced Legal Practice Management solution. We help our clients build thriving legal practices by creating awesome user experiences that lawyers love. We have teams of highly talented people across New Zealand, Australia, UK and USA working to delight thousands of lawyers worldwide who are running highly successful legal practices.§Actionstep prides itself on being an Equal Employment Opportunity business.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many weeks' notice are you required to give your current employer?§What is your expected annual salary?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50802235.txt	§Digital content intern§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital content intern§§Advertiser: §Think Green Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§We are Haakaa! A 100% family-owned and New Zealand-run company. It is our mission to enable mums to lead simpler, easier and greener lives – and we do this every day with our innovative, unique and game-changing products that are used and loved by mothers, babies and their families all around the world.§ §Haakaa is in a phase of rapid expansion, and our Marketing Team has opened up an opportunity for an enthusiastic intern to come on board over the summer months to learn the ins and outs of content creation within a growing global business. This is a full-time, unpaid position that is ideal for someone who is currently studying towards a career in marketing, media and content.  § § § §This internship is based out of our New Zealand HQ in Albany, Auckland where you will be assisting our Marketing Team to plan and produce content for a range of platforms.§ § § §Responsibilities:§ § §Assist Marketing Manager with day-to-day tasks such as content planning, prop sourcing and scripting.§ §Liaise with our Marketing Executives and Social Media Team to provide content as required.  § §Review competitors and stay up-to-date with the latest social media and content trends.§ §Assist with small videography and photography tasks§ §Appear in visual content as “talent” on occasion.§ §Source talent for content if needed.§ §Assist Marketing Team with administrative support among other ad-hoc tasks as required.§ § § §What we’re looking for:§ § §A good understanding of our target audience, or a willingness to learn (if you’re a parent or have experience with mums or babies, this is a bonus!).§ §A minimum of one year studying towards a relevant qualification.§ §Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.§ §Confidence – you’ll be comfortable sharing your ideas and appearing on camera!§ §Ability to follow instructions.§ §A good eye for detail – you know what looks great, and what doesn’t.§ §Knowledge of/experience with social media, videography ad photography would be an advantage.  § §A clean driver’s license is essential.§ §Commitment to learn and grow – you will find learning opportunities in every challenge and find genuine excitement within this.§ §A keen interest in social media platforms including TikTok and YouTube will be a bonus.§ § § §In return, we offer flexibility, a great team culture, the chance to gain real-life experience working for a fast-growing company, and plenty of opportunities for training and learning – particularly in the content and social media space! We would be more than happy to provide written and verbal references at the completion of the internship.§ §This is a three month unpaid internship, but there is the potential that the successful intern may be able to transfer to an employed role within the company should the need for one arise. § §Only people with the legal right to work in New Zealand will be considered for this position.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Digital Executive Job in Auckland - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50793818.txt	§Digital Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Executive§§Advertiser: §Canterbury of New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Salary§§Salary, great buying benefits, flexible working§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§About Us§ §Canterbury of New Zealand was established back in 1904 when John Lane, Pringle Walker and Alfred Rudkin began producing woollen garments deep in the Canterbury Province of New Zealand.  Before long, they were making uniforms for the army during the First World War, and they earned themselves a reputation for manufacturing tough, durable kit.  So much so, the legendary All Blacks rugby team approached them to produce rugby attire in which they could play. § §The rest as they say is history; Canterbury of New Zealand outfitted the All Blacks team for over 75 years and is now the largest dedicated rugby brand in the world.  Canterbury currently supplies kit to numerous high-profile national teams; England Rugby, Ireland Rugby, British & Irish Lions, Australian Rugby league as well as leading clubs such as NZ Vodafone Warriors, NSW State of Origin, Leinster and Bath Rugby including a number of NPC sides.§ §About the Role§ §Are you our next Digital star?§ §Canterbury ANZ are looking for an entrepreneurial, creative and social savvy Digital Executive to join our fast-paced marketing team based in Avondale. § §You have your finger on the pulse for all things digital and will be strong in identifying trends and delivering creative solutions to reactively capitalise on opportunities and leverage data to help drive business decisions. § §You will play a pivotal role in supporting the Digital Marketing Manager and will manage the creative production, implementation, tracking and measurement of the eCommerce websites and campaigns you’re working on.§ §You will own and manage campaign assets for online platforms including promotional product imagery and product copy for new product launches and campaigns to ensure we deliver a best in class social & digital brand experience.§ §You will also be responsible for driving sales growth through onsite merchandising and working alongside our Customer Operations team to ensure we are providing a best in class eCommerce experience for our customers.§ §As the Digital Executive, you will report into the Digital Marketing Manager but will be required to work with cross functional teams autonomously across multiple campaigns and projects, as directed.§ §About You§ §You will have 2-3 years post qualification experience in marketing / digital with strong skills in ecommerce, social and copy writing.§ §A natural communicator with the ability to build relationships with key stakeholders internally and externally you will also have a keen interest in fashion, sports and a passion for digital marketing.§ §Other skills include§ § §Copy writing§ §Photography§ §Experience using content management software§ §Email marketing§ §You will also be well organised, pay close attention to details and able to work with analytical data.§ §What’s on Offer§ §Canterbury are a passionate bunch, whether a sports fan or not, we are focused on the development and delivery of a quality product that we have been known for over 100 years.§ §We offer a competitive salary, uniform allowance, discounted purchasing across our own and sister brands, discounted health insurance the odd free game day ticket (well when we are out of Covid at least!).§ §Bring your passion, attitude and willingness to learn and we’ll provide coaching & training from our experienced marketing team.§ §How to apply§ §Please apply via Seek with your current CV.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50792817.txt	§Digital Campaign Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Campaign Manager§§Advertiser: §krunch.co§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Here at krunch.co, we mix data, analysis and technology with creativity and a lot of agility, to match the right message with the right audience, in the right place at the right time. That’s our pitch-in-a-tweet! Five years young and already 25+ employees strong, we’re in the midst of a major growth phase and we’re looking for a like-minded individual who demonstrates the curiosity and drive required to thrive and grow in our awesome Britomart office space.§ §Reporting to the Director of Advertising Technology, the successful candidate will work closely with a talented team of experts across marketing automation, digital media, search and analytics, design and creative. § §Your role will be to:§ § §Develop world-class digital and social media solutions that meet customer business objectives§ §Implement and manage digital campaigns, media buying, on-going analysis and optimisation of campaigns§ §Ensure accurate and timely post campaign analysis and reporting against pre-established KPIs§ §Support and work in partnership with all krunch.co departments to ensure great client outcomes are achieved§ §The skills required:§ § §Minimum 2 years experience in campaign management in the Google Ads ecosystem. § §Experience in campaign building and planning across other key platforms like Facebook, Snapchat, LinkedIn, Spotify would be highly welcomed. § §Knowledge of People Based Attribution and attribution models preferred.§ §Current Google Ads certifications a plus.§ §Ability to manage multiple projects while maintaining strict attention to detail§ §Be a great communicator with the ability to collaborate with and influence clients and team members to generate outstanding results§ §The ability to confidently present to small and large audiences, concepts, case studies and results that are clear and precise§ §Understand, scope and integrate complex technology and data into simple client solutions§ §Offline media experience would be an advantage but not a pre-requisite§ §Have the ability to strategically add value and insights for clients across a range of industries and business models§ §An immediate start is on offer, so if you would like to join in our mission to change the way the world thinks about marketing, apply via Seek here.§ §Apologies but only shortlisted candidates will receive a reply.§ §No recruitment agencies please.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following online advertising methods do you have experience with?§How many years' experience do you have in digital marketing?§§§

jobText: TXT/50803300.txt	§Casual Research Assistants - Visitor and Market Research x 4§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Casual Research Assistants - Visitor and Market Research x 4§§Advertiser: §Auckland Museum§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Market Research & Analysis§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Casual Research Assistants - Visitor and Market Research x 4 §      §        §Tāmaki Paenga Hira: Tui tui hono tangata, whenua me te moana.§        §Auckland War Memorial Museum: Connecting through sharing stories of people, lands and seas§        §Auckland Museum is a much-loved culture and heritage organisation at the heart of Auckland's identity, committed to developing and sharing engaging content through its galleries, exhibition, events and educational programmes. We are Auckland's home of commemoration as well as the country's oldest research institution and a major tourist destination.§        §We're looking for a number of (up to 4) Research Assistants to join the Museum's Visitor and Market Research (VMR) team on a casual basis. This role will see you out in the Museum undertaking field work that will help our VMR team deliver their research and evaluation programme. The role typically involves working a few days per month, primarily onsite at Auckland Museum in Parnell.§        §If you love talking to people of all backgrounds and are looking for a flexible role then read on.§        §To be successful in this role, you will have:§        §          §Experience and confidence in approaching and speaking with members of the public.§          §The ability to engage with a wide variety of individuals and groups.§          §Experience working independently with minimal supervision.§          §Highly developed and effective oral and written communication.§          §Strong attention to detail.§          §Experience and confidence using mobile technology.§          §The ability to work flexible hours, including holidays and weekends.§          §An awareness of the Treaty of Waitangi and its principles.§        §        §Also desirable for this role:§        §          §Interested in museums / cultural heritage and / or social research.§          §Experience undertaking market / social research fieldwork.§          §Experience using digital survey software.§          §Additional language skills - Te Reo / Samoan / Mandarin particularly advantageous.§        §        §Closing Date: 5pm Tuesday 3rd November 2020§        §You must be eligible to work in New Zealand to apply for this position.§        §Auckland Museum offers a rich and fulfilling work life where we embrace diversity and nurture our bicultural capability as demonstrated in our Teu le Va and He Korahi Maori strategies.§        §This is a great opportunity for someone looking to be part of a fabulous New Zealand organisation committed to telling our national and Auckland stories, reflecting our unique place in the South Pacific.§        §He Oranga Tangata ka ao§        §Enriching lives: Inspiring discoveries§      §      §      §    §    §careers.aucklandmuseum.com§    §  §§§Tāmaki Paenga Hira: Tui tui hono tangata, whenua me te moana.§  §Auckland War Memorial Museum: Connecting through sharing stories of people, lands and seas§  §Auckland Museum is a much-loved culture and heritage organisation at the heart of Auckland's identity, committed to developing and sharing engaging content through its galleries, exhibition, events and educational programmes. We are Auckland's home of commemoration as well as the country's oldest research institution and a major tourist destination.§  §We're looking for a number of (up to 4) Research Assistants to join the Museum's Visitor and Market Research (VMR) team on a casual basis. This role will see you out in the Museum undertaking field work that will help our VMR team deliver their research and evaluation programme. The role typically involves working a few days per month, primarily onsite at Auckland Museum in Parnell.§  §If you love talking to people of all backgrounds and are looking for a flexible role then read on.§  §To be successful in this role, you will have:§ § §Experience and confidence in approaching and speaking with members of the public.§ §The ability to engage with a wide variety of individuals and groups.§ §Experience working independently with minimal supervision.§ §Highly developed and effective oral and written communication.§ §Strong attention to detail.§ §Experience and confidence using mobile technology.§ §The ability to work flexible hours, including holidays and weekends.§ §An awareness of the Treaty of Waitangi and its principles.§ §Also desirable for this role:§ § §Interested in museums / cultural heritage and / or social research.§ §Experience undertaking market / social research fieldwork.§ §Experience using digital survey software.§ §Additional language skills - Te Reo / Samoan / Mandarin particularly advantageous.§ §Closing Date: 5pm Tuesday 3rd November 2020§  §You must be eligible to work in New Zealand to apply for this position.§  §Auckland Museum offers a rich and fulfilling work life where we embrace diversity and nurture our bicultural capability as demonstrated in our Teu le Va and He Korahi Maori strategies.§  §This is a great opportunity for someone looking to be part of a fabulous New Zealand organisation committed to telling our national and Auckland stories, reflecting our unique place in the South Pacific.§  §He Oranga Tangata ka ao§  §Enriching lives: Inspiring discoveries§§§§

jobText: TXT/50789101.txt	§Relationship Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Relationship Manager§§Advertiser: §Child Rescue§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Direct Marketing & CRM§§§§§§§Relationship Manager for an extraordinary mission organisation§  § §  §Child Rescue is a special Christian-based charity operating in NZ, while funding overseas operations. Our workplace is based on our Christian mission of rescuing children from sexual exploitation and human trafficking and helping them stay free.§  § §  §We want to find an experienced Relationship Manager quickly. If you have the skills and experience we need please apply By Friday 30 October.§  § §  §The role is a unique blend of relationship development, effective contribution to digital marketing, volunteer leadership and production of clear outputs, all underpinned by daily CRM activity.§  § §  §We seek an experienced person, who can handle pressure and work within a busy Penrose, Auckland office. We have a strong focus on internal face to face communication. This is not an entry level or remote working position.  §  § §  §Satisfaction from fuelling our international colleagues to change the lives of children and young people, while building the Child Rescue support base is what drives us, not high salaries.  §  § §  §Well directed passion will be a great attribute to bring, but passion alone will not sustain you. You’ll need emotional resilience, flexibility to engage with a small close-knit team, strong and nimble IT skills, persistence and the ability to communicate sensitively about a raw subject while growing the audience.§  §As an organisation our job is to reach people who feel called to support our rescue and freedom operations and to commit financially.§  § §  §So, our ideal person will have solid experience in charitable fund raising, be skilled in networking and familiar with NZ church landscapes. Evidence of building constructive and professional relationships with churches, community groups, businesses and the general public resulting in revenue and supporter growth will be highly regarded.§  § §  §Reporting to the National Manager your duties and responsibilities will include:§  § §  §Raising awareness and financial support through various fundraising channels and campaigns§  §Establishing and cultivating key donor and supporter relationships§  §Mobilising people to support Child Rescue’s mission§  §Progressing multiple projects supported by good project planning§  §Attending and hosting events, delivering presentations and managing volunteers§  § §  §MUST HAVES§  § §  §Full NZ Residency or Citizenship§  §Proficiency with Apple systems and Google drive software§  §Current full driver’s license§  §The ability to write well and present confidently in public§  §A high degree of motivation, self-direction and organisation§  §Availability for occasional weekend or evening work§  §At least 3 years’ experience in a non-profit fundraising role§  §Outgoing and energetic personality§  § §  §Other important attributes§  § §  §Ability to communicate with and persuade a wide range of people to action§  §The ability to develop networks to contribute to fundraising targets (highly regarded)§  §Results-driven goal orientation§  §Reliability and an excellent work ethic§  §Calmness under pressure and the ability to respond well to shifting priorities§  § §  §You should show a willingness to identify with, support and uphold Child Rescue’s values.§  § §  §Sounds like you? Then please submit your up-to-date CV, plus a cover letter. Your letter should describe your relevant experience, skills and achievements in depth, and outline why the position attracts you.§  §NB. We will acknowledge short listed candidates, but may not be able to write to all other applicants, much as we would like to.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a relationship manager?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§Do you have any leave planned in the next 6 months?§§§

Ready to join us on our journey to pioneer natural beauty and help everyone feel their best? Passion for connecting with consumers in a digital environment?§ § § §Experience in leading the digital communications channel is essential§Masterbrand champion ensuring the branding guidelines are updated and followed across all markets.§Consumer insights lead – we are passionate about putting the consumer first and do the majority of our research in house. You’ll get to lead this to ensure consistency of our process and the insights they generate.§ §We’re a fast-paced, agile team so you’ll be working across digital communications, consumer insights, and leading NPD or special projects as required.§ §•           12-month maternity contract§ §•           Experience in FMCG and NPD development is preferred § §•           Proudly NZ made & NZ owned, help us take essano to the world§ §Primary objective of the job:§ §The role of the Senior Brand Manager is to lead digital marketing communications as well as the brand strategy and communication across e-commerce.  The prime objective is to drive brand awareness in the digital space working closely with the Head of Digital to convert awareness through to purchase.§ § § §You should have a strong grasp of current marketing tools and strategies and be able to lead integrated digital marketing campaigns from concept to execution. The Senior Brand Manager will also work across the marketing team, supporting the team with driving awareness of sub-brands and new product launches, delivering agreed campaigns on time and on budget.§ § § §In this role you will:§ §be accountable for campaign strategy, budget management, and performance monitoring across all owned channels§have responsibility for Masterbrand continuity across all channels and lead our consumer insights§lead and mentor our Social and Digital Coordinator to deliver agreed metrics§lead NPD projects when required as part of an agile team§ § § §The Senior Brand Manager will be a strong communicator with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional team members while providing insights of latest developments across the digital communication platforms and new industry technologies.§ § § §Required Competencies:§ §•       Strong knowledge of marketing principles, practices, and procedures§ §•       2+ years’ experience executing marketing strategy across digital platforms to connect with consumers§ §•       Experience with digital marketing tools – re-marketing, loyalty, subscription (Klaviyo would be an advantage)§ §•       Experience interacting/managing online platforms such as Shopify (preferred)§ §•       Highly creative with experience in identifying target audiences and devising digital campaigns that engage, inform, and motivate§ §•       Capacity to work autonomously as well as collaboratively in a team environment§ §•       Goal-oriented with a "can do" attitude§ §•       Experience in NPD in an FMCG environment, preferably gained within the NZ or AU market. We are a multi-functional team and there is always a wide range of NPD projects on the go§ §•       Consumer insights-driven§ §•       Strong creatively but balanced with solid commercial and financial acumen§ §•       Very detail-oriented with strong project management skills§ §•       Continually looking to innovate, and learn new technology§ §Please email §jobs@essano.co.nz§ to find out more or submit your CV§§§§

jobText: TXT/50804294.txt	§Principal Advisor - Engagement§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Advisor - Engagement§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Internal Communications§§§§§§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa, and welcome.§Permanent, full-time§Are you ready for your next career move/ step up?§Strategic engagement role§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§About us§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, the largest payroll in the country, and transportation of over 100,000 students to and from school each day.§Our vision for school property is that all schools have quality learning environments as part of a well-managed and sustainable portfolio that helps deliver equitable and excellent outcomes for every child.§About the role§The Principal Advisor works closely with the Manager - Engagement to successfully embed EIS's Engagement and Communication Strategy and to offer a high level of engagement service to the Head of Education Infrastructure Service.§You will also lead the planning and implementation of engagement support for Te Rautaki Rawa Kura - the School Property Strategy. §This position will provide mentorship of other members of the Engagement team to ensure delivery of the highest quality of work as well as taking the lead on EIS's priority projects. §This a new role that will suit an experienced generalist who can work independently, progress current thinking, and deliver high quality work on time. §Please note there is more information in the job description attached.§About you§We are looking for an experienced Senior Advisor with significant corporate communications experience covering internal and external engagement advice and implementation support. You will be adept at managing stakeholder risks, issues and opportunities, and contributing to the development and implementation of plans to ensure risks are mitigated, and will be able to think strategically to communicate effectively and with impact §You will also offer the following: §Exceptional writing skills, driven to produce work of a high standard, and with energy to deliver high volumes of work for extended periods of time§Strength as a writer is a pre-requisite and you will have experience developing and managing content for a range of channels, including media§The ability to provide best practice engagement advice and support using a variety of methods and approaches to support delivery§Strong interpersonal skills will help you partner with the business, ensuring early engagement and the ability to provide proactive engagement support§The ability to deal effectively with pressure and multiple deadlines through good time management and prioritisation§In this role you will also have the opportunity to act in the Manager's role, as required§If you'd like to bring your skills to a challenging but rewarding role within an organisation that's continuously reaching goals and striving for a better future for New Zealand, we'd love to hear from you.§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§Please review the job description and if this opportunity interests you, and you meet the requirements, apply now using the ‘Apply Online' button. §For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at §eis.recruitment@education.govt.nz§§ Applications close midnight on Wednesday, 4 November 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50791667.txt	§Campaign Planner §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Campaign Planner §§Advertiser: §Chorus§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Market Research & Analysis§§§§§§Contract:§ §Perm full time§ § §Where:§ §Auckland§ §We’re all about endless potential…§We’re the team empowering New Zealand’s digital future. A future few can imagine. It started with the roll-out of our once in a hundred year network. But there’s much more to come as we keep pushing what’s possible, providing unlimited access to an ever-evolving range of innovative products and services. Technology that’ll support, inspire and connect people and businesses for generations.§ § To that end, we need more curious, collaborative and forward-thinking people. Because while we’re busy improving our national network, we’ll need more of the best to join our truly inclusive workforce, one where you’ll be made to feel you belong, and that everything you do is valued (because you do, and it is).§ § As for our culture. Our people say it’s one of the best around. We’re proud of that. And with our Chorus Care package benefits behind you too, you’ll have everything you need to seize this opportunity and make it your own.§ §Work your way.§9-5 not working for you? That’s ok. We encourage you to find ways to work flexibly. If it suits your circumstances and delivers great outcomes for Chorus - that’s when you know you’ve found the Flex@Chorus Sweet Spot!§ §What you’ll be doing§Demonstrate your expertise, passion and skills as you operate as part of a high performing §Consumer Demand Stimulation Team§. This role of the §Campaign Planner§ is to support our direct initiatives within our consumer segment; for uptake of our broadband services; and for the Migration Programme, that reaches out to consumers to upgrade their homes to fibre. You will need to play a key role with cross functional virtual teams to deliver campaigns to support consumer and other segment outcomes, within Product Sales and Marketing (PSM), within set timeframes.§ §To be successful in this role, you will be required to demonstrate your experience in developing campaigns by gathering geographic, network and market data to form effective campaigns that support door to door activity§You will need to manage and coordinate the schedule of campaigns and related timeframes to optimize the activity and eliminate campaign conflicts§You will be required to manage data to ensure systems and stakeholders are updated in a timely manner and to coordinates campaign slots to ensure effective use of door to door and field resources and be responsible for maintaining all campaign databases and resources for on-going planning purposes§You will be required to support the Campaign Delivery Manager/Lead with campaign related and field delivery activities as required and to contribute to the development of the campaign roadmap§You will be responsible for ensuring all field preparation is completed ahead of scheduled fibre installations and monitor activities and performance of live campaigns to manage issues§You will also be required to support the Campaign Manager/Planning & Performance Manager to ensure that reporting is in place to track campaign performance or to keep stakeholders informed, includes post campaign analysis and reporting§What you’ll bring to the table§Having a real passion for what you do is a great start. But it’ll take more than that to succeed in this role. If the above sounds like you, then you will need:§ §A background of experience in the delivery of campaign planning and outcome delivery in challenging, fluid environments that require ongoing strategic and tactical management§To have strong data knowledge, including the ability to manipulate and manage data to deliver insights required for a successful campaign§To display a strong reporting capability in using applications like Tableau, OBIEE, Power BI, Alteryx and to also be proficient using Excel, with an ability to manage ROI, be results focused and action orientated and a desire for continuous improvement§To have a strong understanding of operational environments, in particular field services, delivery and resource mobilisation, backed with your strong analytical and problem solving skills, you will be able to understand and break down operational processes and systems to determine optimal improvement opportunities to transform the overall fibre experience§To have excellent writing and communication skills§Have a sound understanding of telco and technology trends§Keen?§If this role is something you’re interested in and you’d like to join a network that matters, apply online today.§ § But before you do, we’d strongly advise you to visit www.chorus.co.nz and discover more about who we are, what we value, and where we’re headed.§ §Important legal stuff§Only§ §applicants with Citizenship, Residency or a valid work visa will be considered for this role. To apply, submit your CV a§nd a§ §Cover Letter that outlines your skills and experience as§ §they§ §relate to this role.§ § §Internal Only CL:§ §5§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50804370.txt	§Lead Advisor - Engagement - Regional§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lead Advisor - Engagement - Regional§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Internal Communications§§§§§§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa, and welcome.§Fixed-term, full-time - two years§Provide school property engagement support on school major redevelopments and new school builds§Broad communication and engagement role including leading the day to day work of the other regional Senior Engagement Advisors§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§About us§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, the largest payroll in the country, and transportation of over 100,000 students to and from school each day.§Our vision for school property is that all schools have quality learning environments as part of a well-managed and sustainable portfolio that helps deliver equitable and excellent outcomes for every child.§About the role§You will provide school property, project-specific, external and internal engagement support on all school major redevelopments and new school builds.§This will be done through development of stakeholder engagement plans, talking points for school visits/community huis, support on media enquiries, proactive story/event opportunities, school website and community content, review correspondence to schools and stakeholders.§This an exciting new role for the right person to grow and define to increase engagement support to our frontline staff and contribute to shaping an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§The successful candidate will also have a role in providing day-to-day operational mentoring, motivation and support for our newly created regional engagement team that fosters high performance standards and quality of service.§You will report to the Team Leader - Service Delivery and will help support the other regionally based Senior Engagement Advisors. The successful applicant must be able to confidently contribute to driving forward the EIS engagement and communications strategy.§Please note there is more information in the job description attached.§About you§We are looking for an experienced Advisor with significant corporate communications experience covering internal and external engagement advice and implementation support. You will also have experience in mentoring colleagues and be adept at managing stakeholder risks, issues and opportunities, and contributing to the development and implementation of plans to ensure risks are mitigated.§You will also offer the following:§Strong writer and proof-reading skills§Experience working with the media§Proven stakeholder engagement experience§Ability to spot good news stories and share them through the media and other communication channels§The ability to build trust and confidence quickly§Coaching and mentoring skills§A strong risk radar§The want to be part of the delivery of quality learning environments for tomorrow's learners§Note. Travel will be required.§If you'd like to bring your skills to a challenging but rewarding new role within an organisation that's continuously reaching goals and striving for a better future for New Zealand, we'd love to hear from you.§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§Please review the job description and if this opportunity interests you, and you meet the requirements, apply now using the 'Apply Online' button.§For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at §eis.recruitment@education.govt.nz§§ Applications close midnight on Wednesday, 4 November 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Events Volunteer & Logistics Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50801378.txt	§Events Volunteer & Logistics Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Events Volunteer & Logistics Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Oxfam New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$53,581+ per annum pro-rated (for right candidate)§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Event Management§§§§§§§Join us at Oxfam, where we’re ending the injustice of poverty. §  §For everyone. For good. §  §Want to take that step up in your career with an organisation dedicated to challenging inequality? § §  §The role § §We have an opening in our Events Team for an enthusiastic and people-focused team member. Join us as part of the Oxfam global movement, where we work together for a future without poverty, to create positive change that lasts. §This role is an opportunity to work on Oxfam’s award-winning flagship fundraising event – Oxfam Trailwalker 2021. If you’re looking to gain some events volunteer coordination & logistics experience, this is the perfect job to get experience in a range of areas.§  §You know the qualities we are after – organized, flexible, people focused, IT savvy, a team player with great communication skills.  A great sense of humour will also go a long way when the pressure comes on, while a demonstrated commitment to the values and principles of our work is essential.§  §The Events Volunteer & Logistics Coordinator is a dual-purpose role. As the Volunteer Coordinator, they are responsible for the organisation and coordination of all aspects of volunteer involvement in Oxfam Trailwalker. As the Logistics Coordinator, they will provide logistical planning and event preparation support to the Events Operations & Logistics Executive as required, supporting all operations functions for Oxfam Trailwalker.§ §  §Our ideal candidate§ §Previous experience of coordinating volunteers§ §Experience or involvement in large scale, mass participation events§ §Good knowledge of and commitment to health and safety effectiveness and protocols§ §Good experience of Microsoft Office applications, especially Excel§ §Previous experience of database software management§ §Good level of general fitness/ an interest in outdoor pursuits would be useful§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including a confident phone manner and a disciplined approach to maintaining high levels of communication§ §Strong relationship management skills§ §Strong planning and good project management skills§ §Full NZ driving license§  § §Apply now!§ §Please apply below & we'll email you a link to quick-apply through our job portal, which includes the full job description.§  §In return, we offer flexibility, a great work culture and an amazing global Oxfam network. You will have the opportunity to build your career in the non profit sector and to make a tangible difference to those living in poverty. §Based in central Auckland or home-based in New Plymouth§, the post is §24 hours per week in December 2020, changing to 40 hours per week from 11 January - 16 April 2021, fixed term contract, and attracts a starting salary of $53,581+ per annum pro-rated§ (or potentially higher depending on your experience). §  §Applications closing date§ Monday 2 November, 9:00am. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted after this date.§ §  § §  §Who are we?§At Oxfam we work alongside people impacted by disasters, and help them rebuild afterwards. We confront the causes that keep people poor, like extreme inequality, discrimination against women, climate change, and the eviction of people from their land. We work alongside people living in less wealthy countries to build better lives for themselves. For Oxfam staff this work gets us out of bed with the certainty that our work day is making a difference. At Oxfam New Zealand we work alongside those in the Pacific Islands and South East Asia.§Note: §Only candidates currently living in NZ with the right to work in New Zealand need apply. All offers of employment will be subject to satisfactory references and may also be subject to additional screening checks, which can include criminal record and medical checks.§  §We are committed to: preventing any type of unwanted behaviour at work including sexual harassment, exploitation and abuse, lack of integrity and financial misconduct; and promoting the welfare of children, young people and adults.  Oxfam expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment through our Code of Conduct. We place a high priority on ensuring that we recruit only those who share and demonstrate our values.§  §Oxfam New Zealand is an equal opportunities employer and encourages diversity in the workplace.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50825556.txt	§Digital Marketing Coordinator and Customer Service§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing Coordinator and Customer Service§§Advertiser: §Liquid Brands Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Assistants/Coordinators§§§§§§Liquid Brands is a family-owned wholesale distributor working with leading fashion, footwear and lifestyle brands from around the world. We are looking to recruit a dynamic e-commerce coordinator to champion our product across all digital channels. There has been no better time to join this team as Liquid Brands digital space continues to grow with many exciting projects on the horizon.§  §In this role, you will report into and provide support to the Brand Manager to develop and execute our digital vision across multiple brands. §  §The role is dynamic and variable however the primary functions of the role are:§ § §Devise strategies to enhance existing online channels, drive traffic and sales.§ §Build and develop new and existing e-commerce channels. This includes; uploading photos, writing product copy and merchandising.§ §Developing and managing brand marketing plans including campaigns, social media strategies and EDM activities.§ §Develop and implement a creative content calendar and strategy.§ §Lead our online marketplace production across brands. (TheMarket, TradeMe, The Iconic)§ §Help execute the introduction of our new B2B platform.§ §Improving the usability, design, content and conversion of the brand websites.§ §Support our wholesale customers with media packs and resources and other administrative support.§ §Review new technologies and keep the company at the forefront of developments in digital marketing and online strategy.§ §Providing excellent customer service.§ §Administrative support for wholesale customers including taking customer enquiries, communicating the weekly stock position, processing orders and documenting sales, answering queries and follow up§ §Master our sales/inventory platform to accurately process orders, support sales and maintain customer relationships§ §Website logistics and online customer support§ § §  §This role is an existing opportunity to utilize your skills to in a variety of areas to really stamp your mark making it your own. The business is going through regular growth change and we are looking for a person who is happy to get stuck in, as there are times when it’s all hands to the pump, is creative, enthusiastic and is motivated by a sense of achievement.§  § §  §To be successful in the role you will have§ § §2+ years’ experience with trading an e-commerce business, preferably retail and fashion-focused or similar.§ §Experience using Adobe Creative Suite including Photoshop, In-Design and Full MS Office suite§ §Sound understanding and experience with Ecommerce platforms (Shopify, Cin7 and Mailchimp preferred).§ §Ability to self-learn new platforms and systems, then help train to upskill other team members.§ §Familiar with the Google product suite – Ad Words, Analytics, SEO and email marketing.§ §Strong understanding of current online marketing concepts, strategy, and best practice.§ §High level of customer service experience, willingness to go the ‘extra mile’ for every customer.§ §Can work at speed and with accuracy, in a fast-paced /high-pressure environment.§ §Adaptable and flexible. A great multi-tasker and to be able to look at the business from a big-picture view. § §A team player can work with a variety of people and ideas.§ §Self-starter/ Problem solver – who knows or finds out what needs to be done and makes it happen.§ §More than anything the right attitude, an eagerness to learn and be flexible with challenges the role can bring.§ §The role is full time. § §Adaptable and flexible. A great multi-tasker and to be able to look at the business from a big-picture view. § §Retail Experience incorporating store Design for maximum sale and designing of sale product to attract customers.§ §Stock Control incorporating stock replenishment for two retail Stores§ §Advertising project management § §If this sounds like your perfect role apply now.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing coordinator?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience with Search Engine Optimisation (SEO)?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§§§

In this role you will help boost our communications with our Retailers in a tailored, data driven, and timely way, to help them get more value from Vend!  § §Who we are and what we do:§ §Vend is an award-winning SaaS company winning on a global scale. We have over 250 talented people across 5 major markets (US, CA, UK, NZ, AU) working to delight approximately 25,000 awesome retailers worldwide.§ §💚  Our mission: help our retailers build thriving businesses, live more fulfilling lives and create experiences that people love.§ §What you’ll be doing:§ §You will be part of a team that is ‘doubling down’ on its understanding of adoption and strengthening our focus on Adoption success. By working closely with the teams’ Product Marketing Manager and Data Scientist, you will develop customer adoption strategies, executed through nurture campaigns and other marketing and customer contact activities.  § § §Create campaigns that engage, nurture, and grow our retailer base from signup all the way through to product expansion and adoption;§ §Leverage multiple sources of data to monitor how retailers are using Vend, including key habits and success metrics that form their experience, and how we can drive activation, engagement and retention;§ §Use email and in-app notifications to serve content that will retain and educate users, convert them to plans that match their changing retail business, and help them discover new features and value;§ §Produce tailored campaigns based on our user segments and use cases;§ §Develop new segments based on observations of our users and where we can deliver focused messages;§ §Partner closely with other teams — content and product marketing, design, support, and sales — to serve the most effective content possible, share and respond to feedback, and strengthen our customer touchpoints across the board;§ §Deliver top class, regular product marketing to boost Vend adoption (communicating our powerful features and benefits to customers, new go-to-market strategies and campaign execution…);§ §Use your Marketing prowess and savvy to be a great translator of the technical to Retailers, so it is clear and easy to understand the steps to take to Retail success!§ §What you need to bring:§ § §2+ years previous experience in technology marketing, product marketing or customer facing and communications experience, ideally in a subscription business (or similar);§ §Successful record in executing customer facing marketing campaigns using modern and effective customer contact tools;§ §Experience launching new features, measuring and articulating their impact;§ §Familiarity with sales & marketing tech stack would be a bonus - eg. Marketo, Intercom, Salesforce, Zendesk.§ §Why do you want to work at Vend?§ § §You will be offered a competitive salary§ §We will provide you with opportunities to develop your career§ §You can help build an amazing product in a company big enough for growth but lean enough to make a genuine impact§ §Plus, we have a range of benefits that’ll keep you happy, healthy and (not) hungry:§ § §Secure, full-time carpark§ §Dog-friendly environment§ §Free fresh fruits, snacks and drinks (and cake for your birthday!)§ §Paid leave and assistance for new parents§ §Travel insurance for you and your family§ §Vend Share Options scheme§ §Four weeks annual leave + extra day over the Christmas holidays§ §Where to from here?§ §Obviously, we’re looking to ensure it’s a solid fit from both sides: we want you to step into a role you love, and we want to offer you a place you’re proud to come to every day. For a glimpse into our world, feel free to check out our Instagram.§ §Vend is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50826140.txt	§Digital Marketing Co-ordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing Co-ordinator§§Advertiser: §Active Components NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§About the Company§ §The business is a well-established distributor and supplier of electronic components, custom solutions and wire & cable products with offices in Auckland, HK and soon opening in Taiwan. The business operates from a new purpose-built facility on Auckland’s North Shore. We distribute our products throughout Australasia, Asia, Europe and the US.  § § § §With the business performing strongly, we are looking to lift overall marketing activity to further capitalise on opportunities to grow our brand profiles and overall marketing communications within existing and new markets that we wish to enter.§ § § §To support this need, it has been decided to increase our marketing presence and therefore there is an opportunity to introduce a new role, that of a Digital Marketing Co-ordinator to take the business to a new level of market and customer expansion.§ § § §The role provides the rare opportunity to combine your marketing, communications, digital and design skills and experiences.§ § § §Working closely with our Sales and Product teams, the successful applicant will be able to confidently multi-task across marketing, graphic design, event coordination and customer support.§ § § §Your ability to prioritise effectively while providing great communication and being able to efficiently co-ordinate activities across the business is essential.§ § § §About the Role§ §As a Digital Marketing Co-ordinator, you will be responsible for:§ § § § §Management and execution of the online marketing calendar and content plans – in collaboration with the Sales and Product teams.§ §Management and execution of monthly newsletters, LinkedIn posts and other digital marketing campaigns. Tracking results and implementing winning strategies based on key learnings is essential.§ §Creating engaging content for the company’s LinkedIn page and keeping channels up to date on brands.§ §Additionally, you will have the initiatives and insights to seek out new marketing avenues and other ways for connecting with our customers and clients.§ §Responsible for monthly website analytics.§ §Be highly motivated, collaborative and organised – working seamlessly with the Sales and Product teams to implement online campaigns.§ §Manage, execute and measure success of email campaigns.§ §Create content including copy writing, video, newsletters and other visual marketing material for the website and print collateral.§ §Produce brand compliant appealing graphic design of product artwork, catalogues and product campaign collateral.§ §Support MD and Sales Manager to increase sales revenue and profitability.§ §Online budget planning, forecasting and management.§ §Overseeing the timely reporting of marketing activity.§ § § §Skills and Experience§ §We are keen to talk to experienced marketing professionals with the following attributes:§ § § § §2-3 years or more working in a similar role.§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills.§ §Experience in using digital marketing technology.§ §Proficient in the Google suite of applications.§ §Proficient in MS Office.§ §Creative design skill and image re-touching ability to produce high quality artwork.§ §Experience with Google AdWords, Analytics and SEO optimisation.§ §Experience with LinkedIn Sales Navigator and LinkedIn Campaign Manager.§ §Posses a “Can-do” attitude and can work well under pressure to meet deadlines.§ §Initiative to think across brands, to look at the big picture and offer input and ideas to the business.§ §Can conceptualise and take to market promotional activity to support sales growth.§ §Can demonstrate an experience in developing brand strategy and market activation.§ §Analytical thinker who is competent with analysing data in decision making process.§ §Demonstrate a high level of work productivity, exhibited self-starter, a commitment to reduce unproductive time, taking the initiative and a display of leadership in getting on with the job.§ §A formal qualification would be preferred.§ § § §Benefits§ §A competitive salary in on offer for this role. The business is also committed to continual development of the markets in which we operate across both locally and internationally; therefore, there will be plenty of training and exciting opportunities to influence the future direction of our business.§ § § §How to Apply§ §If you believe you have the skills and attitude for this newly created role and are looking for your next career challenge, we would like to hear from you. Please send your CV and cover letter highlighting your skills pertinent to this role to Noor Al-Kattan (§noora@activecomponents.com§) or call 09-441 8759 for further information.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§How many years of graphic design experience do you have?§Are you experienced with copy writing and content creation?§Do you have experience with Search Engine Optimisation (SEO)?§§§

jobText: TXT/50823223.txt	§Content Creator and Marketer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Content Creator and Marketer§§Advertiser: §Kate Ivey Fitness§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Salary§§$50,000 - $64,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Digital & Search Marketing§§§§§§Kate Ivey Fitness is an online fitness platform accessible online and as an app, focused on delivering the best health and well being experience in New Zealand. We help thousands of women to make healthy living a sustainable part of their lives through fun, achievable workouts for all fitness levels, nutrition advice and expertise, recipes, running and fitness plans, and fun, varied and engaging challenges.§We design programmes for busy women juggling life, family, work and social commitments so that they can maintain these busy lives – without sacrificing their health and well being. §Workouts range from stretching and low impact for the likes of post-partum Mums, to High Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) and resistance training workouts to really optimise health and well being results. We also have nutrition, Yoga, Pilates and amazing community. Not only that we’re growing our offer every month!§We are determined to become the best online fitness offering in New Zealand, and we’re well on our way, picking up the 2021 Rural Health and Wellbeing Excellence award in the NZI Rural Women NZ Business Awards. We’re just getting started! §As a result of some exciting growth, we need someone to take our marketing to even greater heights. Running campaigns, organising Social Media schedules and creating content will be a breeze for you. You’ll love it, and be driven by the analytics. Crucially you’ll be experienced with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, InDesign Illustrator and Premier especially). As a keen marketer you’ll know how important content creation is, and video editing will be something you are experienced at. §Skills and attributes we’ll need you to demonstrate: §Self-motivated§Organised§Creative§Creating video content to a high standard§Skills that are extremely beneficial, but not essential§Experience in social media marketing§Experience is video script writing§Experience in content writing for blogs and websites§Photography§You will be responsible for:§Creating promotional videos to a high standard§Creating day-to-day videos for social media§Creating marketing material such as online promo images and pdf training plans§Designing and planning of online marketing content§ §Training on the non-essential skills will be provided for the right person. This role has the potential to turn into a leadership position as the company grows for the right person. §Located in Twizel, the centre of the stunning Mackenzie Country (the successful applicant will need to be based in Twizel), we offer a flexible working environment where approximately 50% of your time can be completed from home. This is an awesome opportunity to work in an exciting high-growth company, in a fantastic industry surrounded by a supportive team. §Living in one of the world’s most stunning places, makes for one really incredible opportunity. §Please email in your Cover Letter, CV and some examples of your work to Kate by Friday 20th November to §kate@kateiveyfitness.co.nz§§§§
