jobText: TXT/50822661.txt	§Digital Content Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Content Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §riders and elephants§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$50,000 - $59,999§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Marketing Communications§§§§§§If you're passionate about curating and telling stories about people, then we want you! If you're curious about the role emotions plays in the workplace and leadership, then we want you! If you're intrigued by cards games, then this role is for you! § §Last year our business grew 396%. Now we're looking for someone to join our team as a content marketing manager to help us take our business to another level!§ §For the past four years, I've personally done all the marketing and content management. So this is the first time we'll be contracting someone to come on board and help manage this part of our business. § §You'll be part of the next phase of growth and development of our business. Plus we'll work closely together to design the Marketing and Content Strategy for 2021.§ §You'll also have a lot of freedom and autonomy to then implement the strategy!§ §Here are the high-level details:§ § §The role will be a part-time contractor role§ §20 hours per week § §$25-30k per annum contract§ §The role will start on Feb 01, 2021.§ §But we'd like to spend two days in December doing some high-level planning for 2021.§ §You can work from anywhere in New Zealand (or world)!§ §But you would need to be available two days per quarter for in-person face-to-face planning meetings.§ §Here are the responsibilities in the role:§ § §Design and implement creative marketing strategies to disseminate content.§ §Writing, editing and proofreading content.§ §Formulating a cross-platform content strategy.§ §Manage and develop a blogging strategy§ §Brainstorm with team members to create new ideas.§ §Build a following on social media.§ §Provide editorial, creative and technical support to team members.§ §Track web analytics to ascertain content engagement levels.§ §Manage content across all platforms, including, website, email and social media§ §Source and collate worldwide Emotional Culture Deck Success Stories and turn into engaging pieces of content§ §Interview existing customers and our community to collate success stories to share with the world§ §Work with designers, product marketing, sales, and external influencers and other industry experts§ §Help us tell our product development stories and share with prospective customers and our community.§ §Here is R&E half of the social contract / how we'll work together:§ § §You can work from anywhere in the world§ §You'll work closely in a 1:2:1 manner with me (the Founder & Director of the business)§ §You'll have an extremely high level of autonomy and freedom over how you design the way you work§ §You can structure your working week (your 20 hours) to best suit your schedule – there are no set work times – as long as you work over a minimum of three days per week (you choose which days and how many hours each day).§ §Skills you'll need in this role:§ § §Above all, you must have strong, solid §writing§ skills. ...§ §Strong, creative writer and researcher.§ §Excellent Communicator.§ §Tech-Savvy – you'll need to be able to run our Kajabi platform.§ §Highly organised and assertive – with lots of autonomy you need to be organised, self-sufficient, a natural problem solver and hold your self to account§ §Focused on Big-Picture Results.§ §We need you to have basic Adobe Indesign and Premiere Pro experience (or some other video editing software).§ §Type of person we're looking for: § § §Generous and gracious §– you must strive for and enjoy going above and beyond what's expected and asked of you. It's crucial your kind, caring, and courteous because our job at R&E is to build and serve our community, and this demands generosity and graciousness.§ §Humble but confident§ – we're looking for a humble but confident person who's not afraid of admitting their mistakes but also quickly learns from failures and setbacks. You may also battle with imposter syndrome like I do – but deep down know that you've got skills that people value.§ §Vulnerable and open – §you're not afraid of sharing your inner world and full self with others. The more open and vulnerable we are with each other and our community, the more reciprocity we invite in return§ §Clear and concise – §you're driven to simplify everything we do continually.§ §Impatient and restless – §you'll be naturally impatient and restless BUT in a good way. Never satisfied with the status quo, you'll always be coming up with ideas to do thing differently and better than we have before. You'll want to move faster than our resources and operations allow us too. But you'll use constraints to your advantage – not bemoan them like most people!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing manager?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§§§

We are looking for an Digital Channels Advisor, based in Wellington. Our Internal Communications Team sits at the heart of our people focused Organisational Development unit. §This is a fixed term role for 24 months.§          §Part of a fabulous and fun team of eight customer-focused, internal communications professionals; you are responsible for communicating the organisation's priorities through our intranet - your expertise keep our internal audiences engaged in out platform.  You are a problem solver, quick to become an expert in the intricacies of our platform. You will have a passion for detail and accuracy, and will help drive development of future channels to influence our people across the organisation.§          §Te Papa Atawhai is on an important journey with a strong ambition to ensure Papatūānuku Thrives, through a rich relationship and partnership with our Treaty Partner and in collaboration with others.§          §If you see yourself on this journey with us, come and join our whanau - we'd love to have you.§§          § §          §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§          §Essential Skills and Experience:§          §            §A passion for conservation focused digital internal story-telling§            §Experience editing web copy with an eye for detail§            §Experience with web publishing platforms (eg. Episerver / Sharepoint)§            §A strong spirit of customer service§            §A great attitude and willingness to contribute to a lively team atmosphere§            §A good fit for the values of Te Papa Atawhai (Department of Conservation)§          §          §Knowledge of web accessibility standards is also highly advantageous.§          § §          §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§          §A fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§          §We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§          §The chance to join a large organisation that's still growing. DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives brought into the organisation. This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§          § §          §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.§          §Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §          §For any enquiry, please contact Helen Clifton on §hclifton@doc.govt.nz§ or 027 349 2932§          §Applications close at 5pm on Monday, 2 November §2020.§          §DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. §        §        §        §      §    §  §§§Telling the stories of Te Papa Atawhai helps us see the connections in our work and live our purpose through Te Kaupapa a Te Papa Atawhai; Papatūānuku Thrives.§ §He angitūtanga: About the Role§We have an exciting opportunity at Te Papa Atawhai! We are looking for an Digital Channels Advisor, based in Wellington. Our Internal Communications Team sits at the heart of our people focused Organisational Development unit. §This is a fixed term role for 24 months.§Part of a fabulous and fun team of eight customer-focused, internal communications professionals; you are responsible for communicating the organisation's priorities through our intranet - your expertise keep our internal audiences engaged in out platform.  You are a problem solver, quick to become an expert in the intricacies of our platform. You will have a passion for detail and accuracy, and will help drive development of future channels to influence our people across the organisation.§Te Papa Atawhai is on an important journey with a strong ambition to ensure Papatūānuku Thrives, through a rich relationship and partnership with our Treaty Partner and in collaboration with others.§If you see yourself on this journey with us, come and join our whanau - we'd love to have you.§§ §§He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§§Essential Skills and Experience:§§A passion for conservation focused digital internal story-telling§Experience editing web copy with an eye for detail§Experience with web publishing platforms (eg. Episerver / Sharepoint)§A strong spirit of customer service§A great attitude and willingness to contribute to a lively team atmosphere§A good fit for the values of Te Papa Atawhai (Department of Conservation)§§Knowledge of web accessibility standards is also highly advantageous.§ §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§A fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§The chance to join a large organisation that's still growing. DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives brought into the organisation. This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§ §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.§Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §For any enquiry, please contact Helen Clifton on §hclifton@doc.govt.nz§ or 027 349 2932§Applications close at 5pm on Monday, 2 November §2020.§DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. §§§§

jobTitle: Social Media Advisor - ATEED Job in Auckland - SEEK
advertiser: Auckland Tourism Events and Economic Development (ATEED)
jobText: TXT/50830493.txt	§Social Media Advisor - ATEED§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Media Advisor - ATEED§§Advertiser: §Auckland Tourism Events and Economic Development (ATEED)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Brand Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Social Media Advisor - ATEED §      §        § §        §          §Play a key role in bringing ATEED brands to life! §          §Create inspiring stories and great content §          §6 month FTC, asap start § §        §        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity §        §This is a challenging and exciting time for Auckland and Auckland Tourism, Events and Economic Development (ATEED) as we look towards economic recovery and all that this entails. With the Auckland brand front and centre, we need someone who can take the initiative, and manage the balance between being in the detail and seeing the big picture.  § §        §Our purpose is to tell the story of Tamaki Makaurau far and wide and to inspire people to visit Auckland and stay for longer. We love what we do and enjoy making a difference to Aucklanders as we support the Destination AKL 2025 strategy.  We need you to hit the ground running, get stuck in to do whatever is required to ensure that Auckland leverages 2021 and beyond, as we seek to enhance our reputation as one of the best places in the world to visit, work, invest, study and do business, and in doing so, drive economic growth and prosperity for all Aucklanders.§ §        §As the Social Media Specialist, you are responsible for managing §@VisitAuckland§ and §@StudyAuckland§ social media channels. This will include day-to-day monitoring of social media accounts on Instagram, Facebook and YouTube and inspiring people to explore our region and it’s hidden gems. §You will design and implement platform-specific marketing strategies that align with overall goals and own our social media content publishing calendar. Engaging with our audience on our social channels you will also provide insights and reporting of channel performance.    §        §This is an exciting role where you will ensure that ATEED’s social media marketing delivery is relevant and accessible, driving visitation to Auckland, increasing exposure of our tourism partners and operators. §        § §He kōrero mōu: About you § §        §We are looking for social media and customer service/community engagement guru! You will be  §fully knowledgeable with the tools, techniques and philosophies of social media.  You will have excellent visual, brand content-marketing and really understand the customer journey.  § §Alongside excellent time-management and organisational skills, you’ll need to be strategic and pragmatic, unafraid of admin and process required, with enthusiastic attention to detail. Experience in basic photography and videography editing is expected. You will have attention to detail and a strategic mindset, with an organised and patient approach to producing and managing logos, brand kits, templates, video clips and photography – all with the end-user in mind. § §As a natural collaborator, you enjoy managing agency and customer relationships and can work effectively across all internal and external stakeholder relationships.  You are proactive and take the initiative to ensure that your projects and workstreams are managed and on track. You are tenacious and enjoy working on long-term projects - maintaining focus, attention and enthusiasm throughout. §        § §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer §        §As part of a passionate high-performing team, this is your opportunity to make a huge impact to Tāmaki Makaurau. Our team has a growing focus on destination management - proactively managing the impact of our visitor economy in such a way that Auckland is better off not just economically, but also socially and environmentally as well.  §        §If you feel you can contribute to this outcome through your experience, passion and ingenuity please take up our invitation to apply. Come join us and have the satisfaction of knowing you’re contributing to Auckland’s economic growth. §Life at ATEED is best described as fast-paced, energetic and closely connected with our partners and customers. This is your opportunity to be part of a dynamic team! §For a confidential discussion or a detailed PD please contact Rennie Sharma, Talent Acquisition Consultant §rennie.sharma@aucklandcouncil.govt.nz§ § §Applications close Wednesday 4th November 2020. § §Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §      §    §    §      §aucklandnz.com/ateed§    §    §  §§§ § §Play a key role in bringing ATEED brands to life! § §Create inspiring stories and great content § §6 month FTC, asap start § § §He angitūtanga: The opportunity §This is a challenging and exciting time for Auckland and Auckland Tourism, Events and Economic Development (ATEED) as we look towards economic recovery and all that this entails. With the Auckland brand front and centre, we need someone who can take the initiative, and manage the balance between being in the detail and seeing the big picture.  § §Our purpose is to tell the story of Tamaki Makaurau far and wide and to inspire people to visit Auckland and stay for longer. We love what we do and enjoy making a difference to Aucklanders as we support the Destination AKL 2025 strategy.  We need you to hit the ground running, get stuck in to do whatever is required to ensure that Auckland leverages 2021 and beyond, as we seek to enhance our reputation as one of the best places in the world to visit, work, invest, study and do business, and in doing so, drive economic growth and prosperity for all Aucklanders.§ §As the Social Media Specialist, you are responsible for managing §@VisitAuckland§ and §@StudyAuckland§ social media channels. This will include day-to-day monitoring of social media accounts on Instagram, Facebook and YouTube and inspiring people to explore our region and it’s hidden gems. §You will design and implement platform-specific marketing strategies that align with overall goals and own our social media content publishing calendar. Engaging with our audience on our social channels you will also provide insights and reporting of channel performance.    §This is an exciting role where you will ensure that ATEED’s social media marketing delivery is relevant and accessible, driving visitation to Auckland, increasing exposure of our tourism partners and operators. § §He kōrero mōu: About you § §We are looking for social media and customer service/community engagement guru! You will be  §fully knowledgeable with the tools, techniques and philosophies of social media.  You will have excellent visual, brand content-marketing and really understand the customer journey.  § §Alongside excellent time-management and organisational skills, you’ll need to be strategic and pragmatic, unafraid of admin and process required, with enthusiastic attention to detail. Experience in basic photography and videography editing is expected. You will have attention to detail and a strategic mindset, with an organised and patient approach to producing and managing logos, brand kits, templates, video clips and photography – all with the end-user in mind. § §As a natural collaborator, you enjoy managing agency and customer relationships and can work effectively across all internal and external stakeholder relationships.  You are proactive and take the initiative to ensure that your projects and workstreams are managed and on track. You are tenacious and enjoy working on long-term projects - maintaining focus, attention and enthusiasm throughout. § §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer §As part of a passionate high-performing team, this is your opportunity to make a huge impact to Tāmaki Makaurau. Our team has a growing focus on destination management - proactively managing the impact of our visitor economy in such a way that Auckland is better off not just economically, but also socially and environmentally as well.  §If you feel you can contribute to this outcome through your experience, passion and ingenuity please take up our invitation to apply. Come join us and have the satisfaction of knowing you’re contributing to Auckland’s economic growth. §Life at ATEED is best described as fast-paced, energetic and closely connected with our partners and customers. This is your opportunity to be part of a dynamic team! §For a confidential discussion or a detailed PD please contact Rennie Sharma, Talent Acquisition Consultant §rennie.sharma@aucklandcouncil.govt.nz§ § §Applications close Wednesday 4th November 2020. § §Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50822126.txt	§Customer Experience and Collaboration Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Experience and Collaboration Manager§§Advertiser: §DOWNER NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Salary§§+ benefits §§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Market Research & Analysis§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Customer Experience and Collaboration Manager §      §        §§        §Our Transport Services Strategy & Development (S&D) team is continuing to grow from strength to strength, and as such, we are looking for someone who puts our clients at the heart of all they do. Join us in a newly created role of Customer Experience & Collaboration Manager.§About the role§Working as a vital member of the S&D team and reporting to the Marketing & Communications Manager, you’ll be responsible for the design, development and implementation of our Customer Experience Strategy.§Our team have a national footprint and work out our offices around NZ.  They work in a virtual collaborative environment, as such you can work from any of our main offices as well (Auckland, Hamilton, Tauranga, Palmerston North, Wellington, Christchurch or Dunedin). §This will include working with key clients in Transport Services to understand their Customer Experience (CX) journey and that of their customers, ensuring that the operational service delivery of Transport Service supports those aspirations.§You’ll also collaborate with our customers to co-develop our operational response to ensure that our actions are aligned with their CX needs.  You’ll be involved in the development and overseeing of operational initiatives that upskill our staff operational to understand better the CX impact of the work they perform.§As part of this, you’ll champion a cultural paradigm shift that moves the business from focusing on customer service to concentrate on the customer experience outcomes.  We also want someone to drive the ISO44001 Collaborative Business Relationship Management System (CBRMS) processes, tools and system into our key client contracts, therefore having knowledge of this programme and what it can deliver will be advantageous.§About you§You’ll be passionate about the customer experience and bring with you a solid background of Customer and Stakeholder experience along with business change.§You’ll have a fresh and innovative approach and couple this with the following:§        §          §Exceptional organisation and programme management skills§          §Display an understanding of our client’s world and their businesses§          §Understanding of business change processes and collaboration§          §Great client and internal relationship skills§          §Excellent communicator – both written and verbal§          §Understanding of TS business and our key clients§        §        §You’ll also be technically savvy and know your way confidentially around the MS Suite.§This role can enable you to develop and enhance your skills and experience.  It’s an excellent opportunity for you to join our diverse and inclusive culture and be part of a great team thriving in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.  We will reward you with a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, excellent training and ongoing development, and the opportunity to advance your career within our organisation. §How to apply§If you want to work for an organisation doing good things with good people then apply online at §www.downercareers.co.nz quote reference§ #§573785§Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a Pre-Employment drug test and medical.  §Due to the jobText: TXT/50827284.txt	§Senior Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §KOHLER NEW ZEALAND LIMITED§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Product Management & Development§§§§§§KOHLER is a company where you can dare, dream and do!§ § §Headquartered in Wisconsin USA, KOHLER is one of the largest privately held companies in America. KOHLER is a global leader, specialising in the manufacture and distribution of luxury bathroom ware and is committed to producing innovative products that 'live on the leading edge of design and technology'.§ §Reporting to the Managing Director for Kohler ANZ, in this role you will be the recognised central authority on all product & marketing matters, across all brands and channels. This includes Product Marketing, Marketing Communication, Showrooms and New Market Development. § § §Responsibilities§ § § § §Drive strategic business analysis, planning and execution of product line initiatives. § § §Manage the total product portfolio from creation of new products through their life cycle.§ § §Develop and implement objectives related to product line development with both short- and long-term marketing objectives.§ § §Develop, execute and implement creative marketing strategies and plans throughout the respective product portfolios in New Zealand and Australia. Manage, measure and report on marketing campaign results.§ § §Play a key role in the setting of marketing policies and guidelines.§ § §Gather data and analysis generated, and recommendations made by the business, to determine product strategies.§ § §Ensure all marketing collateral, promotional activities, advertising and display is planned, implemented and executed in a timely manner, within budget and meeting the brand identity guidelines.§ § § § § §What you need in this role§ §Marketing Degree, Business Degree or equivalent§At least 5 Years at Brand Manager/Product Manager/Category Manager level§A minimum of 3 Years of People Management§Proven success in the digital domain§Budget and Cost analysis experience§Excellent communication and networking skills§Strong attention to detail§Good organisation and planning skills as well as project management skills with experience in cross-departmental coordination §Commercial awareness and the ability to handle and analyse large and complex amounts of data§Advanced Excel skills§Skills in market research practices and techniques§ § §Interested?§ § §Please send your §CV and cover letter §to §nz.humanresources@kohler.com§.§ §If you would like to know more about KOHLER please visit our website: www.kohler.co.nz and watch the video below. § §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing manager?§How many years' experience do you have in market research?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

You'll join our team of data-driven marketing specialists to support with our expanding business requirements. § §Reporting to the Head of CRM & Marketing Automation, this key role will provide support by delivering solutions that meet the organisational KPIs to keep our business growing as well as continue building depth with our existing customers. You will be hands on, not afraid to take on new tools and have a great track record in post implementation reporting to demonstrate business value. § §Key Responsibilities:§ §Email marketing including some marketing automation§Front end HTML design & development §Utilisation of customer data to deliver high performing marketing campaigns §Identifying opportunities and continuously optimising our journeys and marketing campaigns§Analysing data and producing insights§Supporting a highly active marketing and customer communications programme §Delivering data-driven marketing campaigns; email, SMS and direct§Customer journey & campaign reporting§Supporting customer segmentation executions§Post campaign implementation reporting§Supporting BETA testing and continuous improvement initiatives§First port of call in the business for email related changes, improvements and trouble- shooting§ § §What is it like to work here?§ § §Beyond a welcoming atmosphere, our team works together to create an extremely positive and inspiring culture that brings in top talent, keeps drive and motivation high, and makes everyone excited to come to work each day.  We have a flexible and agile working approach and provide opportunities for our people grow and develop.§ §And did we mention we are carbonZero§ § §Skills and experience§ § §We are looking for someone who has:§ §Bachelor in Business, IT or similar undergraduate degree§At least 4-5 years experience in a similar role. §Ideal industry backgrounds: energy, telecoms, insurance, banking,§Exposure to Google Analytics advantageous but not mandatory§Experience with Litmus testing §Attention to detail mandatory§Master in Excel and proficient in Power- Point§ §If you are up for a challenge and keen to get involved then please apply now!§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50826838.txt	§Digital Marketing Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Marketing Director§§Advertiser: §Map Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Management§§§§§§ §Covering Digital and Traditional§ §Bring all the brands together§ §Lead the Strategy for the whole business§ §You’ll know Winger as a successful and well established network of car dealerships.  From Suzuki, Subaru, Jeep, BMW Mini, all the way to Maserati with brands in between, we have been around cars all our lives.  We love the industry, the characters, the customers but most of all the cars. § §We are gearing up for growth post Covid and need all your talents to join us and lead the delivery of our complete marketing strategy.§ §From strategy to plan to delivery, your role is all about bringing the brands together under the one umbrella and then driving the team that drives the business.§ §Your experience in both traditional and digital marketing in a competitive market means you know exactly what to expect. You love the challenge and you understand exactly what brands need to shine in a crowded online market.  § §Having worked in, or at least with, a competitive sales team before, you are strongly results focused.  Robust, determined and driven, you are a brilliant multi tasker, with a good understanding of systems and attention to detail.  You love challenges of digital and traditional marketing, but it’s the online world that you really excel in.  From WhatsApp, to WeChat, from our website to YouTube, from Google Ads to Messenger-  you know to reach as many people as possible and engage in a meaningful way.  § §Straight up and tenacious you have the interpersonal skills to get on and get things done.  You just get on with the job.  You deliver what you say you will and you love supporting and leading others.  You’re easy to get along with and your easy manner belies your determination and strength.  You can hold your own with anyone.  You own your role and your project management skills mean you don’t miss a beat.§ §From sponsorship, to events, to distributor relationship management you are all over it.  From the Maserati to Suzuki and everywhere in between, you love the industry, and understand the passion that drives it.  Even better you know how to share that passion across the team and excite the customer base.§ §With your innovative approach you can “make magic without much” and your commercial savvy means you understand that generating sales opportunities is key.  It’s all about the end game, the results, not the fluff.§ §You will have to hit the ground running, but there is lots of opportunity to add value and your passion and optimism means you will see the potential and eliminate the roadblocks.  While we need you for your experience, reporting to our General Manager there is lots to learn and with at least one direct report, you’ll get to coach and lead while growing your own skill base.§ §Ideally you tick the obvious boxes – a relevant marketing degree, solid experience in competitive fast paced online marketing and a real can do attitude but just ticking the boxes is not what we are about.  We are interested in you, all of you, your ability to connect with people, to understand brands and to try new things  You ooze credibility and you instil confidence and most importantly, you deliver results. § §A great package, a great team and a business that is in an industry you love - sound like you?  Then don’t hesitate contact our consultant Jo Malcolm on 021 685 631 during normal office hours or apply via the Seek website.§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Do you have experience with Search Engine Optimisation (SEO)?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50828700.txt	§Associate Product Manager /  Digital Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate Product Manager /  Digital Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Fisher and Paykel Healthcare§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Product Management & Development§§§§§§Associate Product Manager/ Digital Coordinator (Marketing) - six-month fixed term contract§§About the company§Fisher & Paykel Healthcare is a world leader in the design, manufacturing and marketing of medical devices, exporting to over 120 countries globally. Our market is growing and this presents a great opportunity for our business.§This role is a fantastic opportunity to support our OSA product marketing team and digital marketing activity to help differentiate F&P and drive growth in a highly competitive market.§§About the role§This is a six month fixed term contract, located within the OSA Marketing team. jobText: TXT/50831156.txt	§Senior Advisor Social Media§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Advisor Social Media§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Marketing & Communications§, §Other§§§§§§Kaitihu Tuakana - Senior Advisor Social Media§Fixed-term (10 Months), full-time role§Wellington§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa and welcome.§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§The communications team is critical to the Ministry. We lead communications and engagement around the biggest changes to New Zealand education in decades. We are responsible for ensuring that we listen and respond to the views of the tens of thousands of New Zealanders who are contributing to these changes through the Kōrero Mātauranga - Education Conversation. We lead all engagement with the media, and manage all the Ministry's internal and external communications channels, publications, branding and communications design. This is an exciting, fast paced and dynamic working environment.§About this role§This role of Kaitihu Tuakana - Senior Advisor Social Media contributes to the development of our social media strategy and manages key social media accounts. You will also provide expertise and advice on the use of social media across the communications group and the Ministry.§The position sits within a new Online and Digital team and as part of an increased focus on communicating with our audiences via our several social media platforms. This includes proactively engaging with key audiences in Māori, Pacific, learning support, parental and student communities.§Key accountabilities are as follows:§Provide trusted advice and expertise to the communications group and business leaders on social media strategies, services, and content to ensure joined up internal and external communications§Manage, continuously improve and innovate key social media channels§Demonstrate professional leadership with online and digital communications in the group and across the Ministry as a proactive partner with the sector§Contribute to the social media and communications strategies§Work closely across the communications team and wider Ministry to ensure delivery of proactive, timely advice and plans within the wider sector context§Contribute to operational planning and seek feedback to continuously improve delivery§Actively engage with the public and educators at events in a highly professional manner in order to create and promote content and Ministry engagement with the sector§About you§We are looking for a Senior Advisor with proven experience in leading with influence, strong relationship management and communications skills both strategically and in delivery.§You will have well developed experience and networks in online and digital sectors and a strong understanding of Māori, Pacific, learning support, parental student and other key audiences in education. You will bring a knowledgeable, proactive and calm approach.§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to keeping to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§There is more information in the position description attached. Please take a look, and if this opportunity sounds like you, please apply now using the 'apply online' button.§Click here to view the role description§§Applications close midnight on Sunday, 15 November 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
